title: Spiced Hot Chocolate
text: Heat milk in a saucepan over medium-low heat until lukewarm; stir cocoa powder and sugar into warmed milk until dissolved. Add vanilla, cinnamon, chili powder, nutmeg, and cloves. Heat for 5 more minutes, stirring occasionally. 6 cups skim milk 3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder 3 tablespoons white sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 teaspoon cinnamon 0.5 teaspoon chili powder 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.25 teaspoon ground cloves This spiced hot chocolate is slightly sweet and flavored with vanilla, cinnamon, chili powder, nutmeg, and cloves for a soothing homemade beverage.

title: Cosmopolitan Cocktail
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine vodka, lime juice, triple sec, and cranberry juice in a cocktail shaker. Add ice, cover and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wedge. 1.5 fluid ounces vodka 0.25 fluid ounce lime juice 0.25 fluid ounce triple sec 0.25 fluid ounce cranberry juice 1 cup ice 1 lime wedge for garnish This is a classic cosmopolitan cocktail, or 'cosmo', made with vodka, orange liqueur, lime, and a splash of cranberry juice for that touch of pink.

title: Strawberry Shortcake Drink
text: Place thawed frozen strawberries, amaretto liqueur, vanilla ice cream, vanilla extract, crushed ice, and vanilla vodka into a blender. Cover and blend until smooth. Pour into a glass and garnish with whipped cream and a fresh strawberry. 0.25 cup frozen strawberries, thawed 1.25 fluid ounces amaretto liqueur 2 (1/2 cup) scoops vanilla ice cream 1 dash vanilla extract 0.5 cup crushed ice 0.25 fluid ounce vanilla-flavored vodka 1 tablespoon whipped cream 1 fresh strawberry This yummy pink ice cream-based cocktail blends the flavors of amaretto liqueur, vanilla ice cream, and strawberries.

title: Beet Smoothie
text: Juice beets and green apples, including peels, in an electric juicer. Combine apple-beet juice, avocado, pineapple, banana, and ice in a high-speed blender; blend until smooth. 2 medium beets, scrubbed 1 green apple 1 avocado, peeled and pitted 0.75 cup fresh pineapple chunks 1 banana, peeled ice cubes This beet smoothie is a delicious blend of avocado, banana, fresh pineapple, apple, and beets for a naturally sweet, colorful, and refreshing drink.

title: Apple Jack Shot
text: Pour whiskey and sour apple schnapps into a shot glass and serve. 1 fluid ounce whiskey 1 fluid ounce sour apple schnapps Think you can handle this sour shot?

title: Mulled Wine with Honey
text: Pour water into a large pot over medium heat. Add honey, cinnamon sticks, allspice, nutmeg, and coriander. Stir until honey is dissolved. Push 2 cloves into the skin of each orange wedge. Add to the pot. Pour in red wine. Increase heat and simmer gently, about 45 minutes. Make sure mixture does not boil. Discard orange wedges and cinnamon sticks. Divide mulled wine among coffee mugs and serve hot. 0.5 cup water 0.25 cup honey 2 cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon ground allspice 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg 1 teaspoon ground coriander 16 whole cloves 1 orange, cut into 8 wedges 4.25 cups red wine Red wine is flavored with oranges, honey, and fragrant spices in this recipe for mulled wine you'll crave on cold winter evenings.

title: Citrus Blueberry Slush
text: In a blender, combine orange juice concentrate, water, blueberries and ice cubes. Blend until slushy. Pour into glasses and serve. 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 6 fluid ounces water 1 cup fresh blueberries 4 cubes ice This recipe is super easy to make. Frozen orange juice and fresh blueberries are blended with ice to create a refreshing slush.

title: Home-Made Coffee Liqueur
text: Stir the water, sugar, and instant coffee together in a saucepan over high heat until the sugar dissolves and the mixture boils. Remove from the heat, and cool 30 to 45 minutes. Stir in the rum and vanilla. Using a funnel, pour into 3 clean wine bottles. Seal, and store in a dark, cool place at least 2 weeks before drinking. 5 cups water 3 cups white sugar 0.25 cup instant coffee granules 1 (750 milliliter) bottle rum (dark or light) 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Brew your own coffee-flavored liqueur using water, sugar, instant coffee, rum, and vanilla.

title: Saints and Strangers Cocktail
text: Place vodka, grapefruit juice, pomegranate juice, vermouth, cream of balsamic, cranberry juice, and peppercorns in a cocktail shaker. Fill shaker with ice and shake well; strain into a martini glass. Sprinkle with orange zest. 2 fluid ounces vodka 2 fluid ounces freshly squeezed grapefruit juice 1.5 fluid ounces freshly squeezed pomegranate juice 0.5 fluid ounce sweet French vermouth 0.5 ounce cream of balsamic (balsamic glaze) 0.25 fluid ounce cold-pressed cranberry juice 0.125 teaspoon freshly ground pink peppercorns ice cubes 1 pinch freshly grated orange zest This elegant ruby-red cocktail gets its color from a blend of grapefruit, cranberry, and pomegranate juices and a rich balsamic glaze.

title: Hot Cinnamon Apple Brandy Cider
text: Combine apple cider, apple brandy, 1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon brown sugar, honey, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, pepper, and salt in a pot over medium-high heat. Simmer until flavors combine, about 10 minutes. Pour apple cider mixture into heat-proof mugs. Twist orange zest strips between your fingers to release the essential oils; drop 1 into each mug. Add 1 cinnamon stick to each mug. 0.5 gallon fresh apple cider 1 cup apple brandy 0.25 cup brown sugar 1 tablespoon brown sugar 0.25 cup honey 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.75 teaspoon ground ginger 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.5 teaspoon ground cloves 0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper 1 pinch salt 10 thin strips orange zest 10 small cinnamon sticks This sweet, delightful hot apple cider is spiced with cloves, nutmeg, ginger, cinnamon, and orange zest. Spike it with apple brandy, if desired.

title: Homemade White Hot Chocolate
text: Combine white chocolate chips and half-and-half in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir continuously until chocolate has completely melted, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in milk and vanilla extract until heated through, 3 to 4 minutes more. Pour into mugs and serve. 6 ounces white chocolate chips 1 cup half-and-half 3 cups 1% milk 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract This quick and easy homemade white hot chocolate recipe uses just 4 ingredients to make a warm, comforting drink that's perfect for winter nights.

title: Dirty Martini
text: Gather all ingredients. Stir together vodka, dry vermouth, brine, and olives in a mixing glass. Pour into a glass or shaker with ice. Serve on the rocks, or strain into chilled cocktail glasses. Enjoy! 6 fluid ounces vodka 1 dash dry vermouth 1 fluid ounce brine from olive jar 4 stuffed green olives A dirty martini is the perfect cocktail for olive lovers. It's made with vodka, vermouth, olive brine, and stuffed olives. Serve up or on the rocks.

title: Homemade Blackberry Lemonade
text: Heat 3/4 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until sugar has dissolved, about 2 minutes. Let cool. Place blackberries and remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar in a blender. Blend until smooth. Combine simple syrup, blended blackberries, remaining 4 cups of water, and lemon juice. Place a fine-mesh sieve over a pitcher and pour lemonade into the pitcher; discard solids. Serve over ice. 0.75 cup white sugar 4.5 cups water, divided 1 cup blackberries 2 tablespoons white sugar 1 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice ice cubes This light and refreshing lemonade is easy to make from scratch and gets a beautiful flavor and color boost from blackberries.

title: Citrus, Turmeric, and Ginger Juice
text: Process apples, orange, lemon, and ginger through a juicer; stir in turmeric until evenly incorporated. 2 Fuji apples, cored and sliced 1 orange, peeled and sectioned 0.5 lemon, peeled 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger 0.5 teaspoon ground turmeric Give your morning an extra boost with this turmeric and ginger juice recipe including apples, orange, and lemon.

title: Onion Tea (Home Remedy for Cough)
text: Bring water and onions to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 1 hour. Strain hot liquid through a sieve. Pour into cups and sweeten with honey. 4 cups water 2 organic onions, quartered with skin left on 4 teaspoons honey, or to taste Onion tea (zwiebeltee) is a natural home remedy in Germany made with organic onions that people often drink when they have a persistent cough.

title: Spiked Strawberry Lemonade
text: Combine strawberries, lemon juice, and 1 cup water in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into a pitcher and add remaining 2 cups water. Taste; add sugar as desired. Fill each glass with ice, add 2 ounces vodka per glass, and top off with strawberry lemonade. 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries 1/2 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice 3 cups water, divided sugar, optional, to taste 1 cup vodka, divided ice as needed Spiked strawberry lemonade, made from a puree of fresh strawberries and lemon juice, is a delicious drink to cool you down on hot summer days.

title: Simple Syrup
text: Combine sugar and water in a medium saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil, stirring, until sugar has dissolved. Allow to cool. Pour into a clean jar and seal with a tight-fitting lid; store in the refrigerator for up to one month. 1 cup white sugar 1 cup water Learn how to make simple syrup with just 2 ingredients: sugar and water. Use as a sweetener in homemade cocktails and drinks, or as a glaze for cakes.

title: Banana-Oat Protein Shake
text: Combine bananas, dates, water, ice, oats, and protein powder in an electric blender. Blend until mixed. Serve. 2.5 frozen bananas 2 pitted dates, or more to taste 2 cups water 1.5 cups ice cubes 0.25 cup rolled oats 1.5 scoops peanut butter-flavored protein powder Peanut butter-flavored protein powder joins frozen bananas, dates, and oats in this shake that's great for an on-the-go breakfast, or post-workout snack.

title: Raspberry Rose Wine Slushie
text: Combine raspberries, rose wine, ice cubes, and triple sec in a blender; blend until smooth. 3 cups frozen raspberries 16 fluid ounces chilled rose wine 1 cup ice cubes 0.25 cup triple sec Rose wine and triple sec are blended with frozen raspberries in this colorful wine slushie recipe that is perfect for hot summer days.

title: Polar Express Hot Chocolate
text: Combine milk, sweetened condensed milk, cream, chocolate chips, vanilla extract, and salt together in a large pot over low heat; cook, stirring constantly, until chocolate is melted, 30 to 40 minutes. Taste and add more milk to adjust flavor if desired. 6 cups milk 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1.5 cups heavy whipping cream 1.5 cups bittersweet chocolate chips 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.125 teaspoon salt Warm up this winter with a rich cup of hot chocolate made with cream, sweetened condensed milk, and chocolate chips.

title: The Best Lemon Iced Tea
text: Place green tea bags and black tea bags in a 1-gallon glass jar or pitcher. Pour boiling water over tea bags; steep for 30 minutes. Remove tea bags; stir in sugar and lemonade concentrate until dissolved. Stir in lemon juice. Fill jar to the top with cold water. Chill in the refrigerator until cold. Serve over ice. 4 green tea bags 4 orange pekoe tea bags 6 cups boiling water 1 cup white sugar 1 (12 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 0.5 lemon, juiced 10 cups cold water, or as needed This is the best lemon iced tea ever. It comes very close to the Good Host brand Canadians are used to.

title: Holiday Coffee Liquor
text: Stir water, sugar, vodka, coffee, and vanilla extract together in a large bowl or pitcher until sugar is completely dissolved. Cool. 4 cups boiling water 4 cups white sugar 2 cups vodka 0.66666668653488 cup instant coffee powder 3 tablespoons vanilla extract This holiday coffee liqueur made with vodka, coffee, and vanilla has been a town favorite for over 70 years!

title: Hot Pink Lemonade
text: Boil one cup of water with the sugar in a saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring until the liquid becomes clear. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice. Pour 7 cups of cool water and ice into a serving pitcher. Add the lemon syrup and blueberries; stir until you get a 'hot pink' color. 1 cup water 2 cups white sugar 2.25 cups fresh lemon juice 7 cups cool water 2 cups ice 0.75 cup blueberries Refreshing, fun recipe for blueberry lemonade! Tart and sweet from the blueberries. The finished drink is hot pink, almost purple. Garnish with a slice of lemon.

title: Polynesian Watermelon Drink ('Otai)
text: Grate watermelon with a fork from the rind into a large bowl, leaving no large chunks. Stir water, pineapple, evaporated milk, and coconut into the grated watermelon. Add sugar; stir until dissolved. Squeeze lime juice into the watermelon mixture. 1 seedless watermelon, halved and sliced 3 cups water 1 (15.25 ounce) can crushed pineapple 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 0.5 cup shredded coconut 2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste 0.5 lime, juiced Grate a fresh watermelon and mix it with canned crushed pineapple, flaked coconut, and evaporated milk for a refreshing taste of Polynesia.

title: Kahlúa Homemade
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine water and instant coffee in a medium pot; bring to a boil. Stir both brown sugars into coffee and reduce the heat. Simmer, stirring every 15 minutes, for 3 hours. Remove from the heat and cool completely. Pour coffee mixture into a clean, large glass jar. Add grain alcohol, vanilla extract, and vanilla bean. Cover with a tight-fitting lid. Let sit in a dark place, shaking occasionally, for 4 weeks. Divide into bottles, leaving a piece of vanilla bean in each. 4 cups water 1 cup instant coffee crystals (such as Folgers® Classic Roast) 2 cups light brown sugar 2 cups lightly packed dark brown sugar 1 (750 milliliter) bottle 190 proof grain alcohol (such as Everclear®) 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 1 vanilla bean, split lengthwise and halved This homemade Kahlúa recipe is a coffee-based liqueur easily made with coffee, brown sugar, vanilla, and grain alcohol for a tasty holiday cocktail.

title: Red Slush Punch
text: In a large bowl, whisk together the strawberry gelatin mix and 9 cups of boiling water. Set aside. In a large pot, bring the remaining 9 cups of water to a boil. Stir in the sugar until dissolved. Pour the sugar water into the gelatin water, then stir in the pineapple juice and lemon juice, mixing well. Pour into four 1-gallon size resealable freezer bags, or pretty Bundt pans to freeze. To make punch, place one of the frozen portions into a punch bowl, and pour 1 bottle of ginger ale over. 3 (3 ounce) packages strawberry flavored Jell-O® mix 9 cups boiling water 4 cups sugar 9 cups water 2 (46 fluid ounce) cans pineapple juice 2 cups lemon juice 4 (2 liter) bottles ginger ale This Red Slush Punch is a party MUST! It is sooo delicious, I make it for almost every occasion!

title: Breakfast Zinger Juice
text: Press lemons, carrots, apples, and beets through a juicer and into a large glass. 2 lemons - peeled, seeded, and quartered 2 carrots, chopped 2 apples, quartered 2 beets, trimmed and chopped This is a delicious, cleansing juice uses lemons, beets, carrots, and apples. It is a great way to kick start your day, while getting necessary vitamins.

title: Mulled Wine (Vin Chaud)
text: Stir red wine, apple juice, honey, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, cloves, and anise together in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Simmer until flavors blend, at least 10 minutes. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine (such as Cabernet Sauvignon, Beaujolais, or Burgundy) 2 cups apple juice 3 tablespoons honey 3 cinnamon sticks 10 pods cardamom pods 8 whole cloves 0.5 teaspoon anise seed Make this quick, easy vin chaud recipe, or hot spiced wine, and fill your home with a heavenly aroma. Perfect for cozy nights in or holiday parties.

title: Icy Banana Milkshake
text: Combine bananas, ice cubes, milk, and sugar in a blender. Cover and blend for 2 minutes, or until ice is finely crushed. 2 bananas, peeled and sliced 6 ice cubes 5 cups milk 0.5 cup sugar Sliced bananas, milk, sugar, and some ice cubes are blended until smooth to make a kid-pleasing banana milkshake in mere minutes.

title: Melon Smoothie
text: In a blender, combine cantaloupe, honeydew, lime juice and sugar. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. 0.25 cantaloupe - peeled, seeded and cubed 0.25 honeydew melon - peeled, seeded and cubed 1 lime, juiced 2 tablespoons sugar Cantaloupe and honeydew melon is blended with lime juice and sugar. This one is great when melons are in season.

title: Cozy Mulled Wine
text: Combine red wine, orange slices, honey, brandy, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and ginger in a slow cooker. Cook on Low until wine is steaming, 20 to 25 minutes. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine (such as Cabernet Sauvignon, Zinfandel, or Merlot) 1 orange, peeled and sliced 0.66666668653488 cup honey 0.25 cup brandy 3 cinnamon sticks 8 whole cloves, or more to taste 1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger Feel all warm and cozy with a mug of this delicious mulled red wine that's quick and easy to make. Perfect for sharing during the festive season!

title: Strawberry-Mint Soda
text: Squeeze lime quarters into a sturdy glass pitcher. Toss juiced limes into the pitcher along with mint, strawberries, and sugar. Crush fruits together with a muddler to release juices from strawberries and oil from mint leaves. Stir in club soda until sugar has dissolved. Pour into the sugared glasses over ice cubes to serve. 2 large limes, quartered 0.5 bunch mint leaves 7 strawberries, quartered 1 cup white sugar 3 cups carbonated water This refreshing strawberry-mint soda is the perfect beverage to sip on during a hot summer's day. It's sure to be a hit with all of your friends.

title: Strawberry-Banana-Peanut Butter Smoothie
text: Place yogurt, peanut butter, banana, strawberries, and ice cubes into a blender. Puree until smooth. 0.5 cup nonfat plain yogurt 2 tablespoons peanut butter 1 banana 4 fresh strawberries, hulled 10 ice cubes This creamy treat has protein and no added sugar for a yummy breakfast or dessert!

title: Chocolate-y Iced Mocha
text: Heat 1/4 cup coffee in microwave in a mug until warmed, about 30 seconds. Stir cocoa mix into the coffee until dissolved. Fill a large glass with ice cubes. Pour 1 cup cold coffee and almond milk over the ice cubes; stir the cocoa mixture and chocolate syrup into the coffee and almond milk. 1.25 cups cold coffee, divided 1 envelope low-calorie hot cocoa mix ice cubes, or as needed 0.5 cup unsweetened almond milk 2 tablespoons sugar-free chocolate syrup, or more to taste Use coffee, almond milk, cocoa mix, and chocolate syrup to make your own iced mocha at home.

title: Thai Coffee
text: Place coffee and cardamom in the filter of your coffee machine. Place enough water to make 2 cups of coffee in the machine. Turn on the coffee machine. Pour brewed coffee into 2 coffee cups, and stir 1 tablespoon sweetened condensed milk into each cup. Serve. 2 tablespoons ground coffee beans 0.25 teaspoon ground cardamom water 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk Thai coffee, as is served in Thai restaurants.

title: Peach Cosmo
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add cranberry juice, vodka, schnapps, and lime juice. Cover and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled martini glass to serve. ice 3 fluid ounces cranberry juice 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger citron vodka 1 tablespoon peach schnapps 1 teaspoon fresh lime juice I was making a peach cosmopolitan and didn't have any triple sec, so I used peach schnapps and loved it.

title: White Wine and Apple Sangria
text: Stir together apple juice and sugar in a pitcher until sugar dissolves. Add wine, apples, peaches, lemon slices, and brandy. Cover and chill until ready to serve, 1 to 24 hours. Gently stir in club soda before serving over ice. Garnish with fresh thyme sprigs. 0.5 cup apple juice 3 tablespoons white sugar 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry white wine 1 cup apple slices 0.5 cup sliced peaches 2 medium lemons, sliced 0.25 cup brandy 1.5 cups club soda 3 cups ice, or as needed 8 sprigs fresh thyme This sangria recipe, featuring white wine, apples, peaches, and lemon, is easy to customize with different wines, fruit, and herbs. Perfect for summer entertaining!

title: Cold Brew and Tonic
text: Fill a glass with ice cubes. Pour in tonic water, then cold brew coffee. ice cubes as needed 1 cup tonic water 0.5 cup cold brew coffee Refreshing in the morning, or any time of day, this easy cold brew and tonic drink is sure to pep you up!

title: Chocolate Banana Peanut Butter Protein Shake
text: Blend ice cubes, milk, banana, protein powder, peanut butter, honey, and cocoa powder together in a blender until smooth. 6 ice cubes 1 cup milk 1 banana 1 scoop chocolate-flavored protein powder 2 tablespoons peanut butter 1 tablespoon honey 1 teaspoon unsweetened cocoa powder, or more to taste This chocolate protein shake is creamy, filling, and quickly made in a blender with banana, protein powder, peanut butter, cocoa powder, and honey.

title: Peppermint Schnapps Liqueur
text: In a 2 quart pan over medium heat, combine sugar and corn syrup. Heat until sugar dissolves, stirring regularly, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vodka. Cover and allow to cool. Stir in peppermint extract. Pour into a sealable bottle. 0.33300000429153 cup white sugar 1 (16 ounce) jar light corn syrup 2 cups vodka 2 teaspoons peppermint extract An easy recipe for homemade peppermint liqueur. It goes great with hot chocolate!

title: Coffee Liqueur I
text: Mix coffee and sugar. Add boiling water and stir until dissolved. Cool. Add Vodka and pour into two 26 ounce empty bottles. Split vanilla into 4 pieces and add to bottles. Close bottles tightly and keep in a cool dark place for one month. 1 (2 ounce) jar instant espresso coffee powder 3.5 cups white sugar 2 cups boiling water 1 pint vodka 1 whole vanilla bean Rich and yummy! This liqueur needs to be made 1 month ahead of giving or drinking! Makes great gifts when poured into separate smaller bottles and tied with ribbon!

title: Easy Mango Banana Smoothie
text: Combine mangos, banana, vanilla yogurt, and milk in a blender; blend until smooth. 2 mangos - peeled, seeded, and sliced 2 bananas 2 cups vanilla yogurt 2 cups milk This fresh mango banana smoothie made with milk and vanilla yogurt makes a quick, easy, and deliciously creamy breakfast or mid-afternoon snack.

title: Wine Slushie
text: Place ice in a blender; add red wine, fruit punch, and confectioners' sugar. Blend mixture until ice is evenly chopped and mixture is slushie-consistency, adding more ice if desired. 1 cup ice, or as needed 0.5 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine (such as Red Cat®) 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen concentrated fruit punch 0.25 cup confectioners' sugar Red wine is blended with fruit punch and confectioners' sugar creating a sweet wine slushie similar to slushies found at state fairs.

title: Bourbon Lemonade
text: Combine hot water and brown sugar in a cocktail shaker. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add lemon juice, bourbon, triple sec, and 1 cup of ice. Cover and shake until chilled, 15 to 20 seconds. Fill a highball glass with ice. Strain cocktail over ice and top with club soda. Stir to combine. Garnish with a lemon slice. 0.25 cup hot water 2 tablespoons brown sugar 1.5 fluid ounces freshly squeezed lemon juice 1.5 fluid ounces bourbon whiskey 0.5 fluid ounce triple sec 3 cups ice, divided, or as needed 2 fluid ounces club soda 1 lemon slice Bourbon and brown sugar give a comforting, boozy twist to this summer-ready lemonade recipe that's easy to make ahead and serve at parties.

title: Hot Spiced Cider
text: Gather all ingredients. Place a filter in the basket of an automatic coffee maker. Add brown sugar, cinnamon stick, cloves, allspice, salt, and nutmeg to the basket; top with orange wedges. Pour apple cider into the water reservoir. Brew and serve hot. 0.25 cup packed brown sugar 1 cinnamon stick 1 teaspoon whole cloves 0.5 teaspoon whole allspice 0.25 teaspoon salt 1 pinch ground nutmeg 1 large orange, quartered with peel 2 quarts apple cider Spiced apple cider with cinnamon, cloves, allspice, and nutmeg sweetened with brown sugar. A perfect drink to warm you through on chilly evenings!

title: Pumpkin Spice White Hot Chocolate
text: Combine milk, chocolate chips, and cocoa powder in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring a simmer, stirring constantly until chips are melted, about 5 minutes. Add pumpkin puree, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla extract, and cinnamon; whisk until well combined and heated through, 2 to 3 minutes. 1 cup milk 0.25 cup white chocolate chips 1 teaspoon unsweetened cocoa powder 0.25 cup pumpkin puree 0.5 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon This pumpkin spice white hot chocolate is a chocolaty, pumpkiny, and creamy fall drink best enjoyed with whipped cream and a cinnamon stick.

title: Simple Cantaloupe Smoothie
text: Process yogurt, orange juice, cantaloupe, and ice cubes in a blender until smooth, about 30 seconds. 1 cup vanilla yogurt (such as Dannon® Light and Fit®) 0.5 cup orange juice 0.5 cup sliced cantaloupe 4 ice cubes, crushed, or as needed This cantaloupe smoothie recipe uses vanilla yogurt blended with fresh cantaloupe and orange juice for a creamy and delicious way to start your day.

title: Banana Split Shake
text: Combine ice cream, banana, strawberries, pineapple and chocolate syrup in a blender. Blend until smooth. Divide shake between 2 large (or 4 smaller) glasses. Squirt a generous amount of coconut whipped cream on top. Garnish with additional chocolate syrup and a cherry (if using). Serve immediately. 4 large scoops vanilla ice cream 1 banana 0.5 cup frozen sliced strawberries 0.5 cup crushed pineapple with juice 0.25 cup chocolate syrup, or as needed Gay Lea Real Coconut Whipped Cream 4 Maraschino cherries One of our favourite foodie trends is taking a beloved recipe or dish and giving it a new twist. This recipe takes all the flavours of a classic banana split (strawberry, pineapple, banana, coconut and chocolate) blended into a luscious, retro milkshake.

title: Cape Codder Cocktail
text: Pour vodka and cranberry juice into a highball glass filled with ice; stir well. Garnish with a lime wedge. 1.5 fluid ounces vodka 5 fluid ounces cranberry juice 1 cup ice cubes 1 lime wedge for garnish This combination of vodka and cranberry juice makes a simple and refreshing drink.

title: Rosemary Simple Syrup
text: Combine water, sugar, and rosemary leaves in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves. Simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat and let syrup steep for 30 minutes. Pour syrup into a sterilized glass jar through a mesh strainer to remove rosemary leaves; let cool. 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 0.25 cup rosemary leaves This rosemary simple syrup is made by steeping fresh rosemary leaves in sugar and water to create an herbal syrup for cocktails, sorbets, or cakes.

title: Fuzzy Navel Slush
text: Combine water and sugar in a large freezer container. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Mix in peach schnapps, orange juice concentrate, and lemonade concentrate. Cover and freeze for 4 hours or overnight. Fill glasses 3/4 of the way full with slush, then top off with lemon-lime soda, and stir to serve. 9 cups water 1.5 cups white sugar 1 pint peach schnapps 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime carbonated beverage, chilled and divided This frozen fuzzy navel recipe mixes orange juice, lemonade and peach schnapps into a frozen slush. Add lemon-lime soda and this cocktail is ready.

title: Easy Vegan Hot Chocolate
text: Bring water, sugar, and cocoa to a boil in a small saucepan. Pour in soy milk and stir until combined and heated through, about 3 minutes. 1 cup water 0.25 cup white sugar 0.25 cup unsweetened cocoa powder 3 cups soy milk This easy vegan hot chocolate recipe made with soy milk has only four ingredients and can be put together in less than ten minutes.

title: Watermelon Sangria
text: Place 9 cups of watermelon cubes in a blender; blend on high until very smooth. Strain juice through a mesh strainer into a large pitcher. Pour wine, vodka, triple sec, and simple syrup into the pitcher; stir to combine. Add remaining 3 cups of watermelon cubes, orange sections, blueberries, and lime quarters; chill sangria for 4 hours before serving. 12 cups cubed watermelon, divided 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry white wine 1 cup vodka 0.5 cup triple sec 0.5 cup simple syrup 1 orange, cut into wedges 1 cup fresh blueberries 1 medium lime, quartered This watermelon sangria with white wine, vodka, orange liquor, simple syrup, lime, and fresh fruit tastes just like summertime in a glass!

title: Copycat Strawberry Milkshake
text: Combine ice cream, milk, and strawberry syrup in a tall glass. Stir with a spoon until smooth. Add whipped topping. 4 scoops vanilla ice cream 0.25 cup milk 3 tablespoons strawberry syrup 0.5 cup frozen whipped topping (Cool Whip®), thawed Enjoy a Chick-fil-A® copycat strawberry milkshake at home with just 4 ingredients and a little bit of stirring!

title: Mocha Coffee Mix
text: In a large bowl, mix together instant coffee, milk powder, chocolate drink mix, confectioners' sugar and powdered creamer. Store in an airtight container. To serve, place 4 tablespoons of mixture into a coffee mug. Stir in 1 cup boiling water. 1.25 cups instant coffee granules 7 cups dry milk powder 5.75 cups powdered chocolate drink mix 0.25 cup confectioners' sugar 1.75 cups powdered non-dairy creamer Wonderful to have on hand, or put into pretty containers and give as gifts.

title: Chocolate Cake Shot
text: Combine hazelnut liqueur and vodka in a shot glass. Coat a wedge of lemon with sugar. Suck lemon wedge, then with juice still in your mouth, drink shot. 1 fluid ounce hazelnut liqueur 0.5 fluid ounce vodka 1 lemon, cut into wedges 1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste A chocolate cake shot made with hazelnut liqueur and vodka that magically tastes like chocolate cake when shot down with a sugared wedge of lemon.

title: Hibiscus Syrup
text: Bring water, white sugar, hibiscus, brown sugar, ginger, and lemon zest to a boil. Reduce heat and let simmer until sugars dissolve and flowers soften, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and steep syrup until flavors combine, about 5 minutes. Strain syrup into a container through a fine-mesh strainer, pressing solids with a spoon to extract as much liquid as possible. Discard solids. Store syrup in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. 2 cups water 0.5 cup white sugar 0.33333331346512 cup dried hibiscus flowers 0.25 cup brown sugar 1 (1/2 inch) piece fresh ginger root, thinly sliced 1 lemon, zested This ruby red hibiscus syrup has sweet, tart, and floral accents that will add extra zing and beautiful color to your homemade drinks and cocktails.

title: Good Ol' Alabama Sweet Tea
text: Pour the sugar into a large pitcher. Bring water to a boil in a large pan. When the water begins to boil, remove from the heat, and place the teabags in. Let steep for 5 to 6 minutes. Remove tea bags, and return tea to the heat. Bring just to a boil, then pour into the pitcher, and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Fill the pitcher half way with ice, and stir until most of it melts. Then fill the pitcher the rest of the way with cold water, and stir until blended. 2 cups sugar 0.5 gallon water 1 tray ice cubes 3 family sized teabags of orange pekoe tea 3 cups cold water, or as needed This sweet tea is found in houses, churches, and cafes all over the great state of Alabama. If you're north of the Mason-Dixon, you've NEVER had tea this good! Fresh-squeezed lemon, lime, or orange juice can be added for an extra flavor.

title: Slow Cooker Chai
text: Combine water, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, ginger, cloves, and peppercorns in a slow cooker. Cook on High for 8 hours. Add tea bags to the slow cooker and steep for 5 minutes. Strain liquid into a clean container; stir in condensed milk. Serve hot. 3.5 quarts water 3 cinnamon sticks 15 green cardamom pods, split open and seeded 15 slices fresh ginger, peeled 25 whole cloves 3 whole black peppercorns 8 black tea bags 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk This crockpot chai made with whole spices, black tea, and condensed milk is spicy, creamy, and sweet. It's so easy to make with the help of your slow cooker.

title: Stoli Doli
text: Place the pineapple pieces into a large container, and pour the vodka over them. Cover, and refrigerate for 3 to 4 days. Strain out pineapple, and serve vodka over ice with a pineapple garnish. 1 fresh pineapple, cut into pieces 1 (750 milliliter) bottle good quality vodka Quick and easy martini made with pineapple infused vodka that is sure to please!

title: Chocolate Mint Milkshake
text: Combine ice cream, milk, chocolate syrup, and peppermint extract in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into 2 glasses and serve. 4 scoops vanilla ice cream 0.25 cup milk 0.25 cup chocolate syrup 1 drop peppermint extract A cool, refreshing mint milkshake that will have you craving for more. All you need is milk, vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup, and a few drops of peppermint extract.

title: Pineapple Margarita
text: Fill a cocktail shaker half-full with ice. Add pineapple juice, tequila, triple sec, and lime juice to the shaker. Seal and shake vigorously until outside is frosted, 10 to 15 seconds. Sprinkle salt onto a plate. Moisten the rim of a glass with a lime wedge. Press the moistened rim into the salt. Fill glass with ice. Strain margarita into the glass and garnish with pineapple and lime wedge, if desired. 2 cups ice, or as needed 3 fluid ounces pineapple juice 2 fluid ounces silver tequila 0.75 fluid ounce triple sec 0.75 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lime juice 1 tablespoon coarse salt, or as needed 2 lime wedges pineapple wedge for garnish (optional) Try this pineapple margarita made with pineapple juice, silver tequila, triple sec, and lime juice for a refreshing cocktail with a tropical twist!

title: Easy Brazilian Lemonade
text: Wash limes thoroughly. Cut ends off and discard, then slice into about 8 pieces. Place limes, water, sugar, and sweetened condensed milk in a blender. Pulse 5 times. Strain mixture through a sieve into a large pitcher. Serve over ice. 2 limes 3 cups water 0.5 cup white sugar 3 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk 1 cup ice cubes This creamy lemonade drink is sweet limeade mixed with sweetened condensed milk to make a creamy, cold drink perfect for a sunny day. Easy and breezy!

title: Shandy
text: Pour beer into a pint glass. Slowly add lemonade; stir gently. 1 (12 ounce) bottle lager-style beer 0.5 cup prepared lemonade This easy shandy recipe makes for a luscious beer with a hint of lemon. All you need to make this refreshing beverage is a lager and lemonade.

title: Strawberry Soda Syrup
text: Place strawberries into a heavy saucepan, add water, and bring to a boil. Stir, reduce heat to low, and simmer until strawberries soften, about 15 minutes. Strain juice into a separate saucepan, using a fine mesh strainer; discard strawberry pulp. Stir in sugar until dissolves. Bring strawberry juice back to a boil a second time. Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 5 minutes. Skim any foam from the top of the syrup. Turn off heat and let cool to room temperature. Pour syrup into a lidded container and refrigerate. 2 pounds very ripe strawberries, hulled and cut into chunks 3 cups cold water 2 cups white sugar It's so easy to make homemade strawberry syrup to flavor iced tea, lemonade, or make into your own strawberry soda.

title: Delicious Homemade Iced Coffee
text: Place 2 cups of ice cubes into a 2-quart pitcher; slowly pour coffee over ice and stir until ice is melted. Stir sugar into coffee and mix thoroughly until sugar is completely dissolved. Add milk, stirring just until combined. Stir in remaining 2 cups ice, adding more as needed; refrigerate until well chilled, about 30 minutes. Stir before serving. Pour over ice in tall glasses or into recycled serving-size glass bottles or insulated tumblers. 4 cups ice cubes, or as needed 8 cups strong freshly brewed coffee 1 cup white sugar, or to taste 4 cups whole milk Skip the line and expense at the coffee shop and make this easy, delicious homemade iced coffee instead.

title: Lusty Lime Virgin
text: Combine the limeade concentrate, carbonated beverage, orange juice, water and ice in the container of a blender. Cover, and blend until slushy. If you want to add liquor, add it last, and just blend for a few seconds more. 1 (6 ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate 1 cup diet cola flavored carbonated beverage 1 cup orange juice 1 cup water 10 cubes ice Use cheap diet cola when making this drink. The sweetener makes the drink taste like it has alcohol in it, but it doesn't. Of course, you could always add some later! Delicious either way!

title: Classic Spanish Sangria
text: Have orange, lemon, lime, rum, wine, and orange juice well chilled. Slice orange, lemon, and lime into thin rounds; place in a large glass pitcher. Pour in rum and 1/2 cup sugar. Chill in the refrigerator until flavors blend, about 2 hours. Crush fruit lightly with a wooden spoon; stir in wine and orange juice. Adjust sweetness as desired. 1 orange 1 lemon 1 lime 1.5 cups rum 0.5 cup white sugar, or to taste 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry red wine 1 cup orange juice This authentic sangria recipe is a fruity and refreshing Spanish cocktail made with red wine and rum flavored with fresh orange, lemon, and lime.

title: Mulled Cranberry Juice
text: Combine cranberry juice cocktail, granulated sugar, whole cloves, cinnamon stick, and orange slices in a 4-quart saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil; stir until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 to 20 minutes. Allow to cool slightly, and ladle into punch cups. Float one orange slice in each cup and garnish with a cinnamon stick. Serve warm. 4 cups cranberry juice cocktail 1/4 cup granulated sugar, or to taste, see note 3 whole cloves 1 cinnamon stick, plus more for serving 1 to 2 small navel oranges, sliced into thin slices, plus more for serving Serve this mulled cranberry juice at your next gathering—this lovely treat will put your guests in a holiday mood. If you like, you may leave out the sugar and add some orange liqueur, like Cointreau, for the grown-up party crowd.

title: Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie
text: Gather ingredients. Blend soy milk, oats, strawberries, and banana in a blender until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla and blend again until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. 1 cup soy milk 0.5 cup rolled oats 14 frozen strawberries 1 banana, broken into chunks 1.5 teaspoons white sugar 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract This oatmeal smoothie has a deep pink color and a rich, creamy texture. It's fast, filling, and delicious — perfect for a quick on-the-go breakfast!

title: "Egg Not" (Eggless Eggnog)
text: Blend 2 cups milk, sugar, pudding mix, rum-flavored extract, nutmeg, allspice, and ginger in a blender on medium-high speed until smooth; pour into a pitcher. Stir remaining 3 cups milk into mixture. Refrigerate eggnog until thickened, at least 1 hour. Stir well before serving. 5 cups milk, divided 0.5 cup white sugar 1 (3.4 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix 1.5 teaspoons rum-flavored extract 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.25 teaspoon ground allspice 0.25 teaspoon ground ginger Milk, vanilla pudding mix, and spices are blended together creating an eggless eggnog for a festive holiday drink!

title: Ginger-Hibiscus Sparkler
text: Steep hibiscus flowers in boiling water for 5 minutes; strain into a heatproof bowl set in a bowl of ice to speed cooling. Cool completely. Transfer to a small pitcher. Stir in lime juice and ginger liqueur. Pour into ice-filled Collins glasses (about 5 oz. per glass) and top each with 1 oz. ginger beer. Garnish with mint sprigs and ginger slices. 0.25 cup dried hibiscus petals 1.5 cups boiling water 0.5 cup fresh lime juice 0.5 cup ginger liqueur (such as Domaine de Canton®) 0.5 cup ginger beer 4 sprigs fresh mint for garnish fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced Spicy ginger liqueur, nonalcoholic ginger beer, and sweet-tart hibiscus provide all the buzz you need.

title: Christmas Rum Punch
text: In a punch bowl, combine sugar, orange juice, and lemon juice; stir until sugar dissolves. Add cherries, triple sec, light rum, orange slices, lemon slices, and pineapple chunks. Refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours to allow flavors to blend. Just before serving, pour in carbonated water and add ice. 0.5 cup white sugar 2 cups orange juice 0.66666698455811 cup lemon juice 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries, with juice 1 fluid ounce triple sec liqueur 1 (750 milliliter) bottle light rum 1 orange, sliced into rounds 1 lemon, sliced into rounds 1 (8 ounce) can pineapple chunks 1 liter carbonated water ice This Christmas, make a delicious rum punch to serve the adult guests. With fruit slices floating in the serving bowl, it's quite a nice presentation!

title: Frozen Mudslide
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine crushed ice, vodka, coffee liqueur, and Irish cream liqueur in a blender. Drizzle in chocolate syrup. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and garnish with whipped cream. 4 cups crushed ice 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers vodka 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers coffee flavored liqueur 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers Irish cream liqueur 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup 0.5 cup whipped cream This mudslide recipe with ice cream is a frozen alcoholic drink made with vodka, coffee liqueur, and Irish cream blended with ice and chocolate syrup.

title: Brain Hemorrhage (Halloween Alcohol Drink)
text: Pour Schnapps into a shot glass. Very gently pour Bailey's over top; let sit until it begins to clump and curdle. Gently pour in grenadine. 1 fluid ounce chilled peach schnapps 1 teaspoon chilled Irish cream liqueur (such as Bailey's®) 1 splash chilled grenadine syrup Serve spooky looking brain hemorrhage shots at your next Halloween party. The curdled Irish cream liqueur will make quite an impact on your guests!

title: B-52 Cocktail
text: Pour coffee liqueur into a shot glass. Slowly pour in Irish cream liqueur, so it floats on top. Slowly pour in triple sec to create a 3-layer drink. 0.5 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) 0.5 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur (such as Bailey's®) 0.5 fluid ounce triple sec This B-52 cocktail is made with equal parts coffee liqueur, Irish cream, and triple sec for an eye-catching, layered shot that is sweet and strong.

title: Strawberry Banana Protein Smoothie
text: Place strawberries, banana, almonds, and water into a blender; blend to combine. Add ice cubes and puree until smooth. Add protein powder and mix until evenly incorporated, about 30 seconds. 1.25 cups sliced fresh strawberries 1 banana 10 whole almonds 2 tablespoons water 1 cup ice cubes 3 tablespoons chocolate flavored protein powder This balanced strawberry banana protein smoothie is easy to make with banana, strawberries, almonds, and protein powder; great for after a workout.

title: Agua de Jamaica (Iced Hibiscus Tea)
text: Place 6 cups of water in a large saucepan; bring to a boil. Stir in the hibiscus petals, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and allspice. Reduce heat to medium-low, and gently simmer until the water has turned a deep red, 30 to 45 minutes. Stir the chopped piloncillo into the hibiscus water until dissolved, then set aside to cool 15 minutes. After cooling, strain the warm liquid into a 1 gallon pitcher through a wire mesh strainer. Squeeze as much liquid from the petals as you can, then discard the petals. Stir in the white sugar until dissolved, then pour in enough cold water to fill the pitcher. Serve immediately or let stand overnight for best taste. 6 cups water 2 cups dried hibiscus petals 1 cinnamon stick 1 pinch ground cloves 1 pinch ground nutmeg 1 pinch ground allspice 0.5 cup chopped piloncillo (Mexican brown sugar cones) 1.5 cups white sugar This iced hibiscus tea is an agua fresca served throughout Mexico. Made with hibiscus flowers, the flavor of agua de jamaica is tart and refreshing.

title: Mom's Best Spiced Eggnog
text: Combine sugar, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, nutmeg, and allspice in a bowl. Whip egg whites with an electric mixer on high speed until soft peaks form. Reduce speed to medium and beat, gradually adding 1/2 of sugar mixture, until stiff peaks form. Beat egg yolks in a separate bowl until thick and lemon colored. Mix remaining sugar mixture into the yolks. Fold yolk mixture into the egg whites. Add milk and half-and-half; combine gently. Garnish with remaining cinnamon. 1 cup white sugar 0.75 teaspoon ground cinnamon, divided 0.125 teaspoon ground nutmeg 1 pinch ground allspice 3 eggs, separated 2 cups milk 1 cup half-and-half A traditional eggnog is spiced with cinnamon, nutmeg, and allspice for an upgrade on everyone's favorite holiday drink.

title: RumChata Pudding Shots
text: Gather all ingredients. Mix milk, rum cream liqueur, and pudding mix together in a bowl until thickened. Gently stir whipped topping into the pudding mixture. Spoon into disposable shot cups and place on a plate. Freeze until chilled and set, at least 3 hours. 1 cup milk 1 cup rum cream liqueur (such as RumChata®) 1 (4 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed These RumChata pudding shots are made with rum cream liqueur and chocolate pudding mix and are delicious to serve after dinner as an adult dessert.

title: Shirley Temple Drink
text: Combine orange juice and lemon-lime soda in a tall glass. Pour grenadine in and let it sink to the bottom. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a straw for stirring. 0.5 cup orange juice 0.5 cup lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 1 tablespoon grenadine syrup 1 maraschino cherry This Shirley Temple drink lets kids join in the fun with a classic mocktail of orange juice, grenadine, and soda, garnished with a maraschino cherry.

title: Spanish Sangria
text: Mix wine with sugar in a bowl to dissolve. Add vodka, gin, rum, and tequila. Cut orange and lemon in half, then into slices. Stir into sangria. Refrigerate for 8 hours, or overnight. Add ginger ale. Serve over a lot of ice. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Shiraz red wine 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup vodka 0.5 cup gin 0.5 cup rum 0.5 cup tequila 1 medium orange, halved and sliced 1 medium lemon, juiced 1 liter ginger ale This big batch Spanish sangria is simple to mix together, just give it at least 8 hours to chill before serving.

title: White Sangria with Kiwi
text: Mix Chardonnay wine, club soda, orange-flavored liqueur, sugar, grapes, kiwis, and pear in a large pitcher. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Pour wine mixture into wine glasses filled with ice, making sure each glass has some fruit. Garnish with mint sprigs. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Chardonnay wine 1 liter club soda 3 tablespoons orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®) 2 tablespoons white sugar 1 cup seedless green grapes 2 kiwis, peeled and sliced 1 large pear, thinly sliced ice cubes 8 sprigs mint Slices of kiwi fruit add a tropical flavor and color to this not-too-sweet white wine sangria.

title: Bubble Gum
text: Combine the blue curacao, Irish cream and banana liqueur in a pitcher with ice cubes. Stir and pour into small glasses to serve. 1 cup blue curacao 2 cups Irish cream liqueur 1 cup banana liqueur 2 cups ice cubes Three liqueurs combine to make a shot that tastes just like bubble gum.

title: Flax Seed Smoothie
text: Place soy milk, strawberries, banana, and flaxseed meal into a blender; blend until smooth. 1 cup low-fat vanilla soy milk 1 cup frozen strawberries 0.5 frozen banana, peeled and cut into chunks 2 tablespoons flaxseed meal This flaxseed smoothie combines frozen strawberries, banana, soy milk, and flaxseed meal to create a dairy-free smoothie that's perfect for on-the-go.

title: Heavenly Honeydew Juice
text: Scrape flesh from honeydew melon quarters into a blender; add ice cubes, water, and sugar. Blend until smooth and sugar has dissolved. Serve immediately. 1 (5 pound) honeydew melon, quartered and seeded 2 cups ice cubes 1 cup water 3 tablespoons white sugar Sweet honeydew melon, sugar, and water are blended to make this fresh and fruity juice that goes great with Mexican dishes!

title: Homemade Coffee Creamer
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine sweetened condensed milk, skim milk, and vanilla in an airtight container; shake well to blend. Label the container with the expiration date of the milk used. 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1.75 cups skim milk 2 teaspoons vanilla extract This homemade coffee creamer recipe uses sweetened condensed milk, skim milk, and vanilla extract to make the easiest, quickest cream for your coffee.

title: Spiced Orange Cider Mix
text: Combine sugar, orange flavored drink mix, tea powder, cinnamon, and cloves in a large bowl. Store in a sealed container. To serve, mix 2 to 3 tablespoons of the mixture with a cup of hot water. 1 cup white sugar 1 cup orange flavored drink mix (such as Tang®) 0.5 cup instant tea powder 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.5 teaspoon ground cloves There is nothing more soothing than a hot cup of spiced orange cider on a cold winter's night. Just add hot water!

title: Spiked Caramel Apple Cider
text: Stir together apple cider and 4 tablespoons caramel ice cream topping in a 4-quart slow cooker until smooth. Cover and cook on Low for 3 to 4 hours, or on High for 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Mix together sugar, salt, and apple pie spice in a small shallow bowl. Pour remaining 2 tablespoons caramel topping into a small saucer. Dip the rims of 8 mugs or heatproof glasses into caramel topping, evenly coating the rim; then dip into spice mixture. Ladle hot cider into mugs. Add 3 tablespoons spiced rum to each mug and garnish with a cinnamon stick. 8 cups apple cider 6 tablespoons caramel ice cream topping, divided 1 tablespoon turbinado sugar 1 teaspoon kosher salt 0.125 teaspoon apple pie spice 1.5 cups spiced rum 8 cinnamon sticks This caramel apple cider cocktail mixes spiced rum with a caramel topping to bring new life to this classic. It's perfect for chilly fall evenings.

title: Tom and Jerry Mix
text: Beat the butter and sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth. Add the egg yolks one at a time, allowing each egg to blend into the butter mixture before adding the next. Beat egg whites until foamy in a large glass or metal mixing bowl, continuing to beat until soft peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whites will form soft mounds rather than a sharp peak. Mix the egg whites into the egg yolk mixture. Stir in the rum, salt, mace, allspice, cloves, nutmeg, and cardamom. To use the mix, combine 1 ounce rum and 1 cup hot milk in a mug. Stir in 1 tablespoon of the Tom and Jerry mixture. 0.5 pound butter 1.5 pounds confectioners' sugar 6 eggs, separated 0.5 teaspoon salt 0.25 teaspoon ground mace 0.25 teaspoon ground allspice 0.25 teaspoon ground cloves 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.25 teaspoon ground cardamom Eggs, sugar, and butter with a handful of spices make a batter to be stirred into hot milk and rum to make this winter-time favorite.

title: Radler
text: Combine beer and lemonade in a gallon-sized pitcher. 6 (12 ounce) cans pilsner-style beer, or to taste 2 quarts prepared lemonade, or to taste This German lemonade-beer refresher is made simply with beer and lemonade. It's an easy summer drink recipe you can adjust to your personal taste.

title: Lemonade
text: In a 2 quart pitcher, combine the lemon juice, water and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Chill in refrigerator. 4 lemons, juiced 1 quart water 0.5 cup white sugar A cool refreshing summer drink that can be made at any time you have lemons... or limes!

title: Watermelon Milkshake
text: Process the watermelon and milk together in a blender until smooth. Add the sugar and blend another 10 seconds to incorporate. Serve immediately. 1.5 cups diced watermelon 2.25 cups milk 2 teaspoons white sugar A cold refreshing drink of watermelon, milk, and sugar is perfect on a hot summer day.

title: Gold Rush
text: In a small saucepan, combine honey and water over medium heat. Bring to a simmer, stirring, until honey is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool completely. To account for evaporation, add a splash of water to bring the total volume of syrup up to 3 fluid ounces, if necessary. Add 1 cup of ice to a cocktail shaker. Add bourbon, honey syrup and lemon juice. Cover and shake until chilled, 15 to 20 seconds. Fill a rocks glass with remaining ice cubes or 1 large ice sphere and strain cocktail over the ice. Garnish with lemon twist. 2 cups ice 2 fluid ounces bourbon 3/4 fluid ounces honey syrup 3/4 fluid ounces fresh lemon juice lemon twist, for garnish A Gold Rush cocktail is a riff on a whiskey sour using honey syrup instead of simple syrup.

title: Iced Peach Tea Lemonade
text: Stir together 1 1/2 cups water, sugar, and sliced peaches in a large pot. Bring to a simmer, and simmer until sugar is dissolved, the mixture is syrupy, and syrup is infused with peach flavor, about 10 minutes. Set syrup aside to cool, then strain off peaches; reserve peaches for another use. Meanwhile, in another pot bring remaining 4 cups water to a boil. Turn heat off. Add tea bags; steep 4 to 6 minutes. Remove tea bags and discard. Add lemon juice to syrup. To each glass add ice and 6 ounces brewed tea. Sweeten each glass to taste with 1 to 2 ounces lemon-peach syrup. 5 1/2 cups water, divided 1 1/2 cups white sugar 4 peaches - peeled, pitted, and sliced 1 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice 4 peach flavor tea bags (such as Celestial Seasonings Country Peach Passion®) This peach-infused iced tea lemonade is a riff on the familiar Arnold Palmer, which is a blend of tea and lemonade.

title: Summer Beer I
text: In a blender crush the ice. Pour in the lemonade concentrate, beer and vodka. Blend until smooth. Pour into frozen glasses. 4 cups ice cubes 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer 12 fluid ounces vodka Ice cold lemonade gets a kick from beer and vodka.

title: Old-Fashioned Root Beer Slushy
text: Pour 1 bottle root beer into a standard-sized ice cube tray. Carefully transfer to the freezer until frozen, 3 to 4 hours. Whisk cold cream and vanilla in a small bowl until slightly thickened. Cover and place in the refrigerator until needed. Transfer root beer ice cubes into a blender. Add 1 1/2 cups cold root beer and blend until a smooth, thick slush forms, stopping and shaking the blender as needed. Pour into 2 frozen mugs, leaving about 1 inch of room at the top. Spoon vanilla cream over top and serve. 1 (16 ounce) bottle root beer 3 tablespoons cold heavy cream 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract 1.5 cups root beer, cold This delicious and refreshing concoction is very close to a root beer float but uses only a fraction of the dairy.

title: Chia Fresca
text: Stir water, lemon juice, and sugar together in a glass until sugar is completely dissolved; add chia seeds. Let stand until a gel forms around the chia seeds, about 10 minutes; stir. 1.5 cups water 3 tablespoons lemon juice 2.5 teaspoons white sugar 1 teaspoon chia seeds Chia fresca is a refreshing lemonade-style drink with an added bonus of chia seeds for a little extra chew with your sips.

title: Eggnog
text: In a large bowl, blend the milk, cream, egg yolks, vanilla and whiskey using a hand mixer until smooth and creamy. In a separate bowl, whip egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually sprinkle in the sugar while continuing to whip until stiff. Fold the egg whites into the egg yolk mixture, and pour into a punch bowl or large pitcher. Serve in mugs or cups garnished with a sprinkle of nutmeg. 1 quart milk 1 pint heavy cream 12 egg yolks 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 pint whiskey 12 egg whites 1 cup white sugar 1 pinch ground nutmeg This family tradition involved even the kids at New Year's Eve. They got to help make it even if they didn't get to drink it. The beauty of this recipe is that every ingredient is one measure, which makes it easy to remember. Everybody from the great-grandparents to fraternity brothers have loved this one. I prefer Bourbon, but any whiskey, rum, brandy could be substituted. (If you use vodka, please don't tell me!) The old folks claimed the original recipe called for a Quart of Whiskey, but a pint is perfect.

title: Coffee Flavored Liqueur II
text: In a saucepan, combine sugar, water and instant coffee. Bring to a boil, then let simmer gently for 1 hour. Remove from heat, and cool completely. When mixture is cool, Stir in vodka. Place vanilla bean in bottle and fill with coffee/vodka mixture. Allow liqueur to set for 4 to 6 weeks after preparation. 3 cups white sugar 4 cups water 0.25 cup instant coffee granules 1 (750 milliliter) bottle vodka 1 vanilla bean Wonderful tasting coffee liqueur, great with cream, milk, coffee or over ice cream.

title: Chocolate Cream Cold Brew
text: Add heavy whipping cream, milk, chocolate syrup, cocoa powder and vanilla into a tall glass. Whip with a milk frother until until desired consistency is reached. Serve over cold brew coffee. 2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream 1 tablespoon milk 1 1/2 teaspoons chocolate syrup (such as Torani® Sugar Free Syrup) 1 1/2 teaspoons cocoa powder 1/2 tsp vanilla cold brew coffee This cold brew coffee with chocolate cream foam is ready in under 5 minutes, and tastes just like the one the pros make.

title: Hot Cocoa Mix
text: Gather all ingredients. In a large mixing bowl, combine milk powder, confectioner's sugar, cocoa powder, and creamer. Stir till thoroughly combined. Store cocoa mixture in an airtight container. Makes about 15 cups mix, or enough for about 45 servings. For 1 serving, place 1/3 cup cocoa mixture in a coffee cup or mug, and add 3/4 cup boiling water. Stir to dissolve. Top with dollop of whipped cream or a few marshmallows, if desired. 10 cups dry milk powder 4.75 cups sifted confectioners' sugar 1.75 cups unsweetened cocoa powder 1.75 cups powdered non-dairy creamer I make this at the beginning of the cold weather, and have it ready all winter. Vary the flavor of your mix by trying flavored nondairy creamer; I like the cinnamon.

title: Honey-Lemon Ginger Tea
text: Stir water, brown sugar, and grated ginger root together in a saucepan; bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer for 20 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and add tea bags; steep tea to desired strength, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove and discard tea bags. Stir lemon juice and honey into the tea; strain into a pitcher. 4 cups water 0.75 cup brown sugar 0.25 cup grated ginger root 3 tea bags 2 lemons, juiced 3 tablespoons honey Use fresh ginger, brown sugar, honey, and lemon juice to add zing to your tea this winter using this simple recipe.

title: Corona Sunrise
text: Open the beer bottle and drink until beer is level with the top of the label. Pour in tequila, orange juice, grenadine, and lime juice. Place thumb over the top of the bottle, turn upside-down, and back up to combine. 1 (12 ounce) bottle lager beer (such as Corona®) 1 fluid ounce tequila 1 fluid ounce orange juice 2 teaspoons grenadine syrup 1 teaspoon lime juice This Corona sunrise recipe adds tequila, orange juice, grenadine, and lime directly into a bottle of Corona for a refereshing and pretty summer drink.

title: Door County Cherry Bounce
text: Put cherries in a clean, 1-quart glass jar; add sugar. Fill the rest of the jar with vodka. Place lid on jar and shake. Store jar in a cool, dark area for 1 to 4 months, shaking jar occasionally. 2 cups pitted tart cherries (such as Door County cherries) 0.33333334326744 cup white sugar, or to taste 1 cup vodka, or as needed Tart cherries are soaked in vodka creating a fun, cherry-infused liquor, also known as a cherry bounce.

title: Whiskey Slush
text: In a large plastic container combine lemonade concentrate, orange juice concentrate, tea, sugar, whiskey and water. Mix well and freeze for 24 hours. Scoop into a tall glass, 3/4 full, and pour ginger ale to fill the glass. Stir and garnish with lemon wedges. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 2 cups strong brewed black tea 1 cup white sugar 2 cups whiskey 7 cups water 1 liter ginger ale soda 2 lemons - cut into wedges, for garnish A frozen whiskey-lemonade slush topped with ginger ale. Perfect for hot weather.

title: Gluehwein
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine water, sugar, and cinnamon stick in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cut one orange in half; squeeze orange halves over the sugar mixture to release their juice. Push 5 cloves into the outside of each orange peel; place peels into the simmering mixture. Continue to simmer over the lowest heat until thick and syrupy, 20 to 30 minutes. While the mixture is simmering, slice remaining orange and set aside for serving. When the mixture is finished simmering, stir in wine and heat until steaming but not simmering, 3 to 5 minutes. Discard orange peels and cinnamon stick. Ladle into mugs and garnish with orange slices. 0.75 cup water 0.75 cup white sugar 1 (3 inch) cinnamon stick 2 medium oranges, divided 10 whole cloves 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine This glühwein recipe for hot spiced red wine is made with cinnamon, orange, and cloves for an easy, warming beverage that makes you feel cozy all over.

title: Apple Banana Smoothie
text: Combine apple, frozen banana, orange juice, and milk in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into glasses to serve. 1 Gala apple, peeled, cored and chopped 1 frozen bananas, peeled and chopped 0.5 cup orange juice 0.25 cup milk This apple and banana smoothie is simple to make in a blender with orange juice and milk for a refreshing 4-ingredient healthy and creamy beverage.

title: Best Slow Cooker Hot Chocolate
text: Combine milk, chocolate chips, cream, condensed milk, and vanilla in a slow cooker. Cover and cook on Low, stirring occasionally, until chocolate chips are melted and mixture is smooth, about 2 hours. 6 cups milk 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips 1.5 cups heavy whipping cream 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract This crockpot hot chocolate is easy to make with milk, cream, and chocolate chips; simply simmer in your slow cooker for a rich, chocolaty treat!

title: Conchi's Sangria
text: In a large pitcher, combine red wine, sugar, apples, peaches, bananas and cinnamon sticks. Refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight. When you're ready to serve, stir in the lemon-lime soda. 4 (750 milliliter) bottles red wine 1.25 cups white sugar 2 Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and sliced 4 sliced fresh peaches 2 bananas, peeled and sliced 2 cinnamon sticks, crushed 3 liters lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage This is the sangria that my friends taught me to make in Spain. It's quick and easy and makes a great drink to mix up for a summer party.

title: Cinnamon Dolce Latte Syrup
text: Place a saucepan over medium-high heat; add water, brown sugar, and white sugar. Whisk until sugar dissolves, 3 to 5 minutes. Whisk cinnamon into sugar mixture until incorporated. Continue whisking mixture until just before boiling and syrup-consistency, 3 to 5 more minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and stir in vanilla extract. Cool syrup completely, at least 1 hour. Pour syrup into a glass container and seal; store in refrigerator for up to 10 days. 1 cup water 0.75 cup packed light brown sugar 0.25 cup white sugar 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 tablespoon pure vanilla extract Make your own cinnamon dolce syrup during the holiday season to make a latte or apple cider extra special and rich.

title: Oatmeal Cookie
text: In a shot glass, layer butterscotch schnapps, Irish cream and Jagermeister. Float cinnamon schnapps on top. 0.5 fluid ounce butterscotch schnapps 0.5 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur 0.5 fluid ounce jagermeister liqueur 0.5 fluid ounce cinnamon schnapps This alcoholic beverage is a tasty shooter that will remind you of oatmeal cookies with raisins.

title: Top Shelf Sparkling Margarita Jell-O
text: Stir lime gelatin, lemon gelatin, and boiling water together in a bowl until fully dissolved. Chill in refrigerator for 15 minutes. Stir tequila, triple sec, orange liqueur, and sweetened lime juice into gelatin mixture. Gently stir in sparkling water. Ladle mixture into 24 small cups. Sprinkle each serving with lime zest. Refrigerate until set, at least 4 hours. Sprinkle each serving with margarita salt before serving. 3 (3 ounce) packages lime-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) 1 (3 ounce) package lemon-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) 2.5 cups boiling water 1.6666667461395 cups premium tequila 0.66666668653488 cup triple sec 0.66666668653488 cup brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®) 0.5 cup sweetened lime juice 2 cups sparkling water 1 lime, zested 1 pinch margarita salt, or as needed All the ingredients and flavors of a cold margarita are combined in a lemon-lime gelatin-based treat. For grown-ups only!

title: Slow Cooker Cranberry-Pear Cider
text: Push cloves into the orange rind. Cut orange into quarters and place in a large slow cooker. Cut pears into quarters, leaving peels and cores. Place in the slow cooker, along with cranberries, cinnamon sticks, and whole nutmeg. Pour in water, cover, and cook on Low for 4 hours. Mash all ingredients with a whisk or potato masher. Continue to cook for 1 more hour. Strain all solids with a fine mesh sieve. Rinse out the slow cooker. Return the strained cider to the slow cooker. Pour in maple syrup and stir to combine. Add orange and pear slices, cranberries, and cinnamon sticks for garnish. 16 whole cloves 1 medium orange 10 medium pears 2 cups cranberries 4 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks 1 whole nutmeg 0.33333334326744 cup pure maple syrup 8 cups water Garnish: 1 medium orange, sliced 1 medium pear, sliced 0.25 cup fresh cranberries 2 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks Holiday spices, pears, and cranberries simmer away in your slow cooker, filling your whole house with festive fragrance as you prepare this homemade Christmas cider.

title: Watermelon Vodka Slush
text: In a food processor, puree the watermelon flesh. Pour the pureed watermelon into empty ice cube trays and freeze for at least 4 hours. Also, freeze 4 martini glasses. In a blender combine the frozen watermelon cubes, simple syrup, lemon juice, vodka, and melon liqueur; blend until smooth. Pour into 4 frozen martini glasses and garnish each with a lemon twist. 4 cups watermelon flesh, seeds removed 2 fluid ounces simple syrup 2 tablespoons lemon juice 1 cup vodka 2 fluid ounces melon liqueur 4 twists lemon zest, garnish Watermelon puree is frozen, then blended with vodka, melon liqueur, lemon juice and simple syrup.

title: Betty's Famous Eggnog
text: Beat the eggs and sugar together in a very large bowl until thick and light-colored. Stir in the bourbon and rum, mixing until sugar has dissolved. Let stand about 1 hour. Meanwhile, whip the egg whites in a separate bowl until stiff peaks form. Stir the whipping cream and half and half into the egg yolk mixture until thoroughly blended. Slowly stir in the brandy. Fold in the egg whites, blending evenly. Cover and refrigerate two hours before serving. May be stored in the refrigerator up to one week. Serve in small cups or glasses dusted with a pinch of nutmeg. 12 eggs, separated 4.5 cups white sugar 1 (750 milliliter) bottle bourbon 0.5 (750 milliliter) bottle dark rum 1.5 quarts whipping cream 2 cups half-and-half (or whole milk) 1.5 cups brandy 1 tablespoon ground nutmeg, for garnish This rich eggnog is made the old-fashioned way by blending beaten egg yolks, whipped egg whites, sugar, and heavy cream with bourbon, rum and brandy. A dusting of nutmeg accents the creamy flavors.

title: Buttery Nipple
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in the vodka, Irish cream, butterscotch schnapps and coffee liqueur. Shake well. Strain into shot glasses and serve. 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vodka 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger butterscotch schnapps 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coffee flavored liqueur Equal parts vodka, Irish cream, butterscotch schnapps and coffee liqueur. Shaken with ice and served in shot glasses.

title: Baby Blue Punch
text: In a large punch bowl, stir together the drink mix, lemon-lime soda, and white cranberry juice. Taste, and stir in sugar to your liking. (I like to add the whole cup.) Float scoops of ice cream on the top. The ice cream melts somewhat and turns the punch a beautiful baby blue color with frothy white clouds floating on the top. 1 (0.13 ounce) package blue, berry flavored unsweetened drink mix 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle white cranberry juice 8 scoops vanilla ice cream 1 cup white sugar, or to taste I created this punch recipe when I went looking for a punch recipe for my Baby Shower. I really wanted blue punch because I was having a boy this time. The ice cream melts somewhat and turns the punch a beautiful baby blue color leaving frothy blue and white clouds floating on top. Everyone thought it tasted great and asked for the recipe. Its also very adaptable to your taste. The sky's the limit. Try any flavor or color of unsweetened drink mix in place of the blue.

title: Pineapple Lemonade Spritzers
text: To make the pineapple lemon syrup: In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine pineapple juice, lemon juice, sugar and honey. Bring to a boil, and cook for 1 minute. Allow to cool, then refrigerate overnight. Fill 6 glasses with ice. Place a slice of lemon in each glass. Pour in 2 fluid ounces pineapple lemon syrup. Fill glasses to the top with carbonated water; stir. 3 cups pineapple juice 3 lemons, juiced 1 cup white sugar 0.5 cup honey 6 slices lemon 1 (2 liter) bottle carbonated water A refreshing and light alternative to lemonade. A syrup made with pineapple juice and lemon juice is mixed with carbonated water over ice.

title: Homemade Apple Cider
text: Place apples in a large stockpot; cover with water by at least 2 inches. Stir in sugar, cinnamon, and allspice. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil, uncovered, for 1 hour. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer for 2 hours. Strain apple mixture through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids. Drain cider again through a cheesecloth-lined sieve. Serve warm or refrigerate cider until cold. 10 large apples, quartered water, to cover 0.75 cup white sugar 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon 1 tablespoon ground allspice This apple cider recipe is simple to make at home by slow-cooking apples, sugar, cinnamon, and allspice on the stovetop until soft, then straining.

title: Chocolate Eggnog Milkshake
text: Combine ice cream, eggnog, and 2 tablespoons of chocolate syrup in a blender, and process until well-combined. Drizzle some chocolate syrup down the sides of the glass in a random pattern, and pour in the milkshake. Top with whipped cream, if desired. 1.5 cups low-fat vanilla ice cream 0.75 cup low-fat eggnog 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup, plus more for garnish whipped cream (optional) The holidays are a time for indulgence so why not sip this delicious chocolate eggnog milkshake? You can easily turn it into an adult beverage by adding a dash of vodka or rum.

title: Spiced Orange-Cinnamon Cider
text: Combine orange juice, apple cider, orange slices, lime slices, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and star anise in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove cinnamon sticks, cloves, and star anise. Stir in honey and keep warm. Pour warm cider into cups and garnish with a cinnamon stick for stirring and several orange and lime slices. 3 cups freshly squeezed orange juice 3 cups apple cider 2 oranges, thinly sliced 1 lime, thinly sliced 4 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks 8 whole cloves 1 star anise 2 tablespoons honey This is the perfect drink for holiday entertaining or family get-togethers. It's sweet and spicy, and can be spiked with a healthy shot of your favorite whiskey.

title: Homemade Caramel Latte
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine milk and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Heat until frothy and close to simmering, about 3 minutes. Reduce heat to low; whisk in caramel sauce and vanilla. Stir in coffee. 0.5 cup milk 1 tablespoon brown sugar 1 tablespoon sugar-free caramel topping 1 tablespoon caramel sauce 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 cup coffee This caramel coffee latte recipe is tastier than Starbucks and simple to make on the stovetop with milk, brown sugar, caramel sauce, and vanilla.

title: New Year's Champagne Punch
text: Place sherbet block in the center of a large punch bowl. Pour orange juice over top, followed by ginger ale and Champagne. Stir gently to mix liquids until top of punch begins to foam. Serve immediately. 1 quart orange sherbet 2 quarts fresh orange juice, chilled 1 (2 liter) bottle ginger ale, chilled 2 (750 milliliter) bottles champagne, chilled This holiday Champagne punch made with sherbet, orange juice, ginger ale, and Champagne is colorful, delicious, and will really get a party going!

title: Hot Chocolate - South American Style
text: In a saucepan over low heat, stir together the sugar, cocoa powder and chili powder. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Add water and bell pepper strips, and mix well. Bring to a simmer, and stir in milk. When the mixture is heated to your liking, remove the pepper strips with a slotted spoon. Add cherry brandy if using, and serve. 0.25 cup white sugar 0.25 cup Dutch process cocoa powder 2 tablespoons chili powder 1 cup water 1 red bell pepper, seeded and sliced into strips 2 cups milk 2 tablespoons cherry brandy This is a traditional South American chocolate drink, but to market it well I made it hot chocolate, even though in the old days South Americans didn't drink it hot. The recipe uses chili powder, and I used red bell pepper to match the sweetness of the chocolate. This is a good way to bring an old recipe into today.

title: Coronarita
text: Pour lemon-lime soda, Mexican beer, and frozen limeade concentrate into a large pitcher. Use the empty limeade can to measure tequila; pour it into the pitcher. Mix well to combine. Serve over ice garnished with chopped mint. 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles lemon-lime soda, or more to taste 1 (12 ounce) bottle Mexican beer (such as Corona®) 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate 12 fluid ounces tequila ice 2 leaves mint, chopped, or more to taste This refreshing Coronarita recipe blends beer, limeade, lemon-lime soda, and tequila into a margarita-like drink perfect for a hot summer day.

title: Rose Hip Iced Tea
text: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add rosehips to boiling water, cover, reduce heat, and simmer gently for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in sugar until dissolved. Leave covered to steep for 5 minutes. Strain tea through a fine sieve. Cool to room temperature, then transfer to the fridge to chill. 4 cups water 4 tablespoons dried rosehips 1 tablespoon sugar, or to taste Rose hip iced tea is refreshingly tart and naturally high in Vitamin C and antioxidants. Try making this easy drink at home.

title: Sous Vide "Cold Brew" Coffee
text: Place 1/4 cup coffee grounds into each jar, then top with water. Screw on the lids until just barely tightened; do not overtighten. Fill a large pot with enough water to cover the jars completely and place a sous vide immersion cooker into the water. Set temperature to 150 degrees F (65 degrees C) according to manufacturer's directions. Submerge mason jars into the water bath and set timer for 2 hours. Remove jars to a cooling rack and let cool until easily handled. Strain the mixture through a coffee filter to stop the steeping process. Pour over ice and serve, or return to rinsed-out jars and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. 1 cup coarsely ground coffee 4 (16-ounce) Mason jars 8 cups water Use your sous vide immersion cooker to speed up the time it takes to make cold brew coffee to just 2 hours instead of 24.

title: Quick Brazilian Lemonade
text: Stir water and sugar together in a bowl until sugar dissolves; chill in refrigerator. Cut ends off of each lime and cut each lime into 8 segments. Working in batches, pulse sugar-water and lime wedges together in a blender several times. Pour mixture through a strainer into a pitcher. Stir cream of coconut into lime mixture. 6 cups cold water 1 cup white sugar 4 limes 6 tablespoons cream of coconut This tasty Brazilian 'lemonade' is made with limes and cream of coconut for a refreshing treat.

title: Zucchini Smoothie
text: Combine ice cubes, zucchini, banana, and orange juice in a blender. Blend until smooth. 0.5 cup ice cubes, or as needed 0.5 zucchini, shredded 0.5 frozen banana 0.5 cup orange juice This zucchini smoothie is a delicious blend of orange juice and fresh zucchini, naturally sweetened with banana. A great way to use summer zucchini!

title: Vitamix Eggnog
text: Whip eggs, sugar, and rum in high-powered blender on High until a thick custard forms, about 4 minutes. Pour milk and add nutmeg to custard; blend on Medium until well-mixed, about 2 minutes. Increase the speed to High for 1 minute. Chill for 4 hours before serving. 4 eggs 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup rum, or to taste 4 cups milk 1 tablespoon ground nutmeg This blender-eggnog recipe whips up a five-ingredient eggnog to help you get in the holiday spirit. Works best with high-performance blenders.

title: Icy Blender Lemonade
text: Place lemon, sugar, cold water, and ice cubes into the container of a blender. Blend until smooth, and serve immediately. 1 large lemon, peeled and seeded 0.5 cup white sugar, or to taste 3 cups cold water 6 ice cubes A cross between a slushy and old-fashioned lemonade. Blend up this refreshing lemon drink perfect for a hot summer day. We love this!

title: Skip Starbucks—Here’s How To Make That Pumpkin Chai at Home
text: Gather all ingredients. Prepare the Iced Chai Latte: Bring chai concentrate to a boil in a small saucepan over medium-high. Cook, undisturbed, until reduced by half, about 5 minutes. Pour into a small heatproof bowl or measuring cup and refrigerate until cooled to room temperature, about 30 minutes. Pour cooled concentrate into a 16 ounce glass and top with ice and milk, leaving 1-inch at the top of the glass. Stir together until combined. Prepare the Pumpkin Cream Cold Foam: Place all ingredients in a small measuring cup or jug. Using a handheld milk frother, froth until thick and creamy, about 1 minute. Pour desired amount of Pumpkin Cream Cold Foam over the Iced Chai Latte and dust with additional pumpkin pie spice. Serve immediately. Iced Chai Latte 1 cup chai concentrate (such as Tazo Classic Chai Latte)  1 cup ice cubes 2/3 cup 2% reduced-fat milk Pumpkin Cream Cold Foam 1/4 cup heavy whipping cream 2 Tbsp. 2% reduced-fat milk 2 Tbsp. vanilla syrup 1 Tbsp. pumpkin puree (from 1 (15-oz.) can)  1/8 tsp. pumpkin pie spice, plus more for dusting Starbucks released an already fan-favorite Iced Chai Latte with Pumpkin Cream Cold Foam this year. We loved it but thought we could make it even better at home. After a lot of testing, we came up with the perfect copycat recipe. Here's how to make it.

title: Party Punch V
text: In a punch bowl, combine orange juice, water and pineapple juice; chill.
