Stir in ginger ale just before serving. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 3 cups water 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 1 liter ginger ale Pineapple juice, orange juice and ginger ale. This is fast and easy and good!

title: Tamarind Agua Fresca
text: Fill six glasses with ice. Combine water, tamarind concentrate, and sugar in a pitcher; stir until sugar dissolves. Pour over ice and garnish each glass with an orange and lime slice. 6 cups ice, or as needed 6 cups water 0.33333334326744 cup tamarind concentrate 0.33333334326744 cup white sugar 6 slices orange 6 slices lime This tamarindo recipe makes six refreshing glasses of tamarind agua fresca. It's both sweet and sour in flavor, and is delicious served over ice with fresh orange and lime slices.

title: Coquito
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine evaporated milk and egg yolks in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Cook over the simmering water, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, and reaches a temperature of 160 degrees F (71 degrees C). Transfer mixture to a blender. Add cream of coconut, sweetened condensed milk, rum, water, vanilla, cinnamon, and cloves; blend until combined, about 30 seconds. Pour into sterilized glass bottles and store in the refrigerator; serve cold or over ice, if desired. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 2 large egg yolks, beaten 1 (14 ounce) can cream of coconut 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 0.5 cup white rum 0.5 cup water 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.25 teaspoon ground cloves Coquito is a coconut-flavored, eggnog-like drink from Puerto Rico that's spiked with rum for a deliciously rich and creamy tropical treat at Christmas!

title: Sesame Seed Juice
text: Cook sesame seeds in a large saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until seeds are toasted and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and cover with a lid. Place sugar in a blender and pour in enough water to fill halfway; add seeds. Blend sugar-seed mixture until smooth; pour through a fine-mesh strainer into a pitcher. Repeat blending and straining if a thinner drink is desired, adding more water as desired. Refrigerate juice until cooled, about 1 hour. 16 ounces sesame seeds 2 cups white sugar 1 gallon water, or as needed Sesame seed juice, made from blending toasted sesame seeds, water, and sugar, is a refreshing and toasty drink served over ice.

title: Copycat Wendy’s Chocolate Frosty
text: Pour chocolate milk into ice cube trays and freeze until solid, at least 4 hours and up to 24.   Process frozen milk cubes, frozen whipped topping, whole milk, and sweetened condensed milk in a food processor until smooth. Serve immediately or freeze in an airtight container up to 1 week. 2 cups chocolate milk 1 cup frozen whipped topping (do not thaw) 1/4 cup whole milk 1 tablespoon sweetened condensed milk Wendy’s Frosty fans, look no further. We tried a viral DIY version of the frozen favorite, and it’s well worth giving a spin—no ice cream machine needed.

title: Chocolate Surprise Milkshake
text: In a blender, combine milk, ice cream, chocolate syrup, chocolate drink mix, ice cubes, and chocolate chips. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. 2 teaspoons milk 3 scoops chocolate ice cream 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup 5 tablespoons powdered chocolate drink mix 5 cubes ice 0.25 cup chocolate chips This milkshake is fantabulous! Chocolate ice cream, chocolate syrup, chocolate drink mix, and chocolate chips are all whirled together with milk to produce a concoction so delicious that it is sure to make you tingle.

title: Perfect Peach White Sangria
text: Pour white wine, peach nectar, triple sec, orange juice, pineapple juice, and peach schnapps into a 2-quart pitcher and stir to mix. Chill for 3 to 4 hours, if possible. Pour over ice in tall glasses and top with club soda. Garnish with fresh peach slices and pineapple. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry white wine, such as Pinot Grigio 1 (11 ounce) can peach nectar 1 cup triple sec 1 cup orange juice 1 cup pineapple juice 0.5 cup peach schnapps ice as needed 2 cups club soda, or as needed 1 fresh peach, sliced, or to taste 1 cup chopped fresh pineapple, or to taste Refreshing and perfect for summer entertaining, this peach white wine sangria is full of sweet, fruity flavor.

title: Peach-Basil Sangria
text: In a saucepan, combine the sugar, basil leaves, half of the peach nectar and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer, crushing the basil leaves with the back of a spoon to release their flavor. Simmer just long enough to melt the sugar, then remove from the heat and allow to cool. Strain the basil mixture into a pitcher filled with ice cubes. Pour in wine and remaining peach nectar. Stir briefly and serve. 0.75 cup white sugar 1 cup loosely packed fresh basil leaves 3.5 cups peach nectar 0.25 cup fresh lemon juice 1 (750 milliliter) bottle white wine such as Pinot Grigio The best, easiest Sangria!! The basil seems strange, but is the perfect touch. You'll love this guaranteed!

title: White Wine Sangria
text: Combine the white wine, watermelon, honeydew, strawberries, and raspberries in a large pitcher. Chill in refrigerator at least 1 hour to allow flavors to combine. Ladle wine and fruit into wine goblets; top each with a splash of ginger ale to serve. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle white wine 0.5 cup cubed watermelon 0.5 cup cubed honeydew 0.5 cup sliced strawberries 0.5 cup fresh raspberries 6 splashes ginger ale, or to taste Raspberries, strawberries, honeydew, and watermelon soak in white wine for this refreshing summer beverage.

title: Simple Summer Smoothie
text: Place the banana, strawberries, blueberries, cherries, and ice cubes into a blender. Pour in the orange juice, vanilla yogurt, and honey. Puree until smooth. 1 banana 1 cup frozen strawberries 1 cup frozen blueberries 1 cup frozen cherries 4 ice cubes 0.5 cup orange juice 0.75 cup vanilla yogurt 0.5 teaspoon honey Banana, strawberries, blueberries, and cherries with a touch of honey are my favorite ingredients for this smoothie.

title: Classic White Wine Spritzer
text: Pour wine into glasses, and top off with club soda. Serve immediately. 0.5 cup club soda 1 cup white wine A simple no-frills classic and refreshing wine spritzer! For more flavor in this perfect summer cocktail, you can add peach schnapps or flavored soda.

title: Maple Syrup Hot Chocolate
text: Bring milk to a boil in a small saucepan. Add maple syrup and cocoa powder, stirring occasionally, until completely dissolved. 1 cup fat-free milk 2 teaspoons maple syrup 1.5 teaspoons cocoa powder Fat-free hot chocolate made with maple syrup is a delicious, guilt-free treat on a cold autumn or winter afternoon; double it for a friend.

title: Best Hot Chocolate Mix
text: Sift together the powdered milk, non-dairy creamer, powdered sugar and instant chocolate drink mix. Store in air tight containers or glass jars for gift giving. To use: Add 3 to 4 tablespoons of mix to 1 cup of water. Add a dash of cinnamon if desired. 11 cups dry milk powder 1 (8 ounce) container powdered non-dairy creamer 2.5 cups confectioners' sugar 1 (16 ounce) container instant chocolate drink mix Hot chocolate mix is great for gift giving and is very fast and simple to make.

title: Lemon Berry Slushy
text: In a blender, blend lemon juice, water, and strawberries with juice, sugar, and ice cubes until slushy. Serve in a tall glass with a straw. 0.33333334326744 cup lemon juice 1 cup water 1 cup frozen strawberries, thawed, with juice 0.25 cup sugar 1 tray ice cubes This is a great summertime drink!

title: Grandma's Wassail
text: Gather all ingredients. Stir apple cider, orange juice, sugar, lemon juice, and pineapple juice together in a large pot over medium-low heat. Place cinnamon and cloves in a tea ball and add to apple cider mixture; simmer until warmed through, about 15 minutes. Serve from the pot with a large ladle. 2 gallons apple cider 2 cups fresh orange juice 1 cup white sugar 1 cup lemon juice 1 cup pineapple juice 1 cinnamon stick, broken into pieces 1 teaspoon whole cloves This warm wassail recipe is easy to make with apple cider, orange and pineapple juices, lemon, and warm spices for a traditional holiday drink.

title: Fruit Punch Slushy
text: Layer pineapple chunks, fruit punch, and orange juice in a blender. Fill the rest of blender with ice. Blend on medium to high speed until ice is crushed and mixture is slushy. 1 (20 ounce) can pineapple chunks, drained 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen concentrated fruit punch 1 cup orange juice (such as SunnyD®), or more to taste 0.5 cup ice cubes, or as desired Fruit punch concentrate, pineapple chunks, and orange juice are blended together creating a sweet fruit punch slushy.

title: Homemade Coffee Creamer (Pumpkin Spice)
text: Whisk 4 ounces cream, maple syrup, pumpkin puree, pumpkin pie spice, and vanilla extract together in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat pumpkin mixture in the microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between intervals, until heated through and completely blended, 1 to 3 minutes. Pour sweetened condensed milk, remaining 10 ounces cream, and pumpkin mixture into a container, cover the container with a lid, and shake until completely mixed. Store in the refrigerator. 14 ounces heavy whipping cream, divided 0.25 cup maple syrup 3 tablespoons pumpkin puree 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk Brighten up your morning coffee with your own delicious homemade pumpkin spice coffee creamer.

title: B and L's Strawberry Smoothie
text: Combine strawberries, milk, yogurt, sugar, and vanilla in a blender. Add ice and blend until smooth and creamy. Pour into glasses and serve immediately. 8 strawberries, hulled 0.5 cup skim milk 0.5 cup plain yogurt 3 tablespoons white sugar 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 6 cubes ice, crushed This strawberry smoothie recipe blends fresh strawberries, milk, yogurt, sugar, and vanilla for a tasty, icy treat. Great for breakfast, or anytime.

title: Peach Banana Smoothie
text: Blend yogurt, peaches, bananas, orange juice, sugar, and ice in a blender on high until the ice is crushed and the smoothie is to your desired consistency. 1 cup plain yogurt 1 (15.25 ounce) can peaches 2 bananas, sliced 0.25 cup orange juice 0.25 cup white sugar, or to taste 2 cubes ice Canned peaches, bananas, yogurt, and orange juice deliver a delicious smoothie in mere minutes.

title: Easy Dirty Banana
text: Combine banana, milk, coffee-flavored liqueur, rum, and cinnamon in a blender; blend until smooth. 1 medium banana, frozen 2 fluid ounces milk 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) 1 fluid ounce rum 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon This dirty banana cocktail tastes like a milkshake, an adult milkshake! Made with only 4 ingredients it features a frozen banana instead of ice to cool and thicken the cocktail.

title: Banana Mango Milkshake
text: Place mango, banana, and ice cream into a blender; sprinkle with sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Pour in milk and place the lid on the blender. Blend until smooth, then pour into cups to serve. 0.5 small mango - peeled, seeded and diced 1 banana, cut in chunks 1 scoop vanilla ice cream 1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste 0.125 teaspoon ground cinnamon, or to taste 1 pinch ground nutmeg, or to taste 2 cups milk This mango milkshake made with milk, vanilla ice cream, and a banana is lightly flavored with cinnamon and nutmeg for a cold, dreamy beverage.

title: Mimosa
text: Divide orange juice evenly into two flute glasses; top with chilled Champagne and serve. 0.25 cup orange juice 0.75 cup champagne, chilled A mimosa cocktail is made with Champagne (or sparkling wine) and chilled orange juice served in a tall glass. Perfect for any special occasion brunch!

title: Southern Coffee Punch
text: Stir boiling water, sugar, and instant coffee together in a bowl until dissolved; cool in refrigerator, 30 minutes to overnight. Pour coffee mixture into a punch bowl; add milk, vanilla ice cream, and chocolate ice cream. Stir until ice cream begins to melt. 2 cups boiling water 1 cup white sugar 1 (2 ounce) jar instant coffee granules (such as Nescafe®) 1 gallon 2% milk 0.5 gallon vanilla ice cream 0.5 gallon chocolate ice cream Coffee and ice cream are mixed together forming a Southern coffee punch that is a coffee lover's dream come true.

title: Spinach and Kale Smoothie
text: Combine spinach, almond milk, kale, peanut butter, and chia seeds in a blender; blend until smooth. Add banana and blend until smooth. 2 cups fresh spinach 1 cup almond milk 1 leaf kale 1 tablespoon peanut butter 1 tablespoon chia seeds 1 sliced frozen banana This vibrant spinach and kale smoothie gives you an extra boost of energy thanks to the addition of peanut butter, banana, and chia seeds.

title: Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
text: Combine strawberries, sugar, lemon-lime soda, and lemon juice in the container of a blender. Add ice and blend until smooth. Pour into a fancy glass to serve. 2 large strawberries, hulled 0.25 cup white sugar 0.75 cup chilled lemon-lime soda 1 tablespoon lemon juice 4 cubes ice This virgin strawberry daiquiri is the best drink to serve and enjoy at parties or on a hot day — no alcohol involved. Easy to make in the blender.

title: Juice Cooler
text: Pour juice and carbonated water over ice. Garnish with a wedge of lime. 6 fluid ounces cranberry juice 1 fluid ounce carbonated water 1 wedge lime A splash of soda gives this non-alcoholic fruit-juice cocktail just the right fizz.

title: Mason Jar Lemonade
text: Roll lemon on a flat surface, cut in half, and squeeze juice and pulp into mason jar. Pour 12 ounces water into the jar. Stir sugar and remaining 2 tablespoons water together in a small saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Pour sugar mixture and ice into mason jar and stir. 1 small lemon 1 1 quart mason jar 14 ounces cold water, divided, or to taste 1.5 tablespoons white sugar 5 ice cubes, or as needed You don't need to be a hipster to prepare and drink your lemonade from a mason jar using this recipe for the classic summertime beverage.

title: Pineapple Cleanser Smoothie
text: Gather all ingredients. Blend coconut water, pineapple, celery, cucumber, lemon, parsley, and ginger together in a blender until smooth. 1 cup coconut water, or to taste 1 cup chopped fresh pineapple 1 stalk celery 0.5 cucumber, peeled 0.5 lemon, peeled 0.33333334326744 bunch fresh parsley 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root This vibrant cucumber and pineapple smoothie with celery, ginger, parsley, lemon, and coconut water is a very refreshing way to start the day!

title: Strawberry Slushy (Smoothie) with a Kick
text: Blend strawberries, coconut water, ice, rum, sugar, and vanilla extract together in a blender until frozen and slushy. 1 pound fresh strawberries, hulled and halved 1 (17.5 ounce) can coconut water 2 cups ice 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers rum, or more to taste 1 tablespoon white sugar, or more to taste 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Blend rum into a traditional strawberry smoothie with coconut water to create a slushy with a kick.

title: White Chocolate Mocha
text: Pour milk into a steaming pitcher and heat to 145 degrees F to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand. Measure the white chocolate syrup into a large coffee mug. Brew espresso, then add to mug. Pour the steamed milk into the mug, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Top with whipped cream and serve. 1.25 cups 2% milk 2 tablespoons white chocolate flavored syrup 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brewed espresso 1 tablespoon sweetened whipped cream This is a white chocolate version of a classic mocha. No reason to head to the cafe--stay in and use your home espresso machine to brew up this delicious espresso drink.

title: Peach-Ginger Slushie
text: Combine peaches, ice cubes, sugar, and ginger in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into a glass and freeze for about 1 hour. 2 small fresh peaches - peeled, pitted, and sliced 6 ice cubes 1 teaspoon white sugar 0.125 teaspoon minced fresh ginger root Slushies are a wonderful refreshing drink and a great way to use up ripe fruit. Ripe peaches are delicious in a slushie and taste great with a little bit of ginger.

title: Orange Drink
text: Empty frozen orange juice into a large pitcher. VERY SLOWLY pour in the ginger ale. It is extremely important that you pour slowly because the soda will foam up and lose its carbonation if poured fast. Gently stir until all of orange juice is melted. Toss in all but 4 of the orange slices. Cut reserved orange slices in half. Pour beverage into 8 glasses and garnish with half slice of orange and a cherry. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 2 liters ginger ale soda 1 orange, sliced into rounds 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries Orange juice and ginger ale garnished with orange slices and maraschino cherries.

title: White Peachy Sangria
text: Stir Moscato wine, lemon-lime soda, brandy, peach schnapps, peaches, strawberries, mangos, pineapple chunks, and raspberries together in a large container and chill 8 hours or overnight. 4 (750 milliliter) bottles moscato wine 4 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®) 1 cup brandy 1 cup peach schnapps 2 fresh peaches, pitted and sliced 1 (16 ounce) package fresh strawberries, sliced 2 mangos - peeled, seeded, and sliced 0.5 fresh pineapple - peeled, cored, and cut into chunks 1 (6 ounce) container fresh raspberries Sweet dessert wine teams up with peaches, strawberries, mango, and pineapple chunks for a light-colored sangria with a tropical taste. Make it the day before--it's great on a hot day.

title: Easy Mexican Hot Chocolate
text: In a large mug, mix the hot chocolate mix, chocolate syrup, cinnamon, and chili powder. Pour in the milk. Add the boiling water and stir.nn 3 tablespoons instant hot chocolate mix 1 tablespoon chocolate syrup 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 pinch chili powder 0.25 cup milk 0.75 cup boiling water This rich hot chocolate is spiced up with a pinch of chili powder.

title: Apple Pie in a Jar Drink
text: Place apple cider, apple juice, sugar, and cinnamon sticks into a large pot. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and discard cinnamon sticks. Allow mixture to cool to room temperature, then stir in grain alcohol. Pour into sterilized quart-sized canning jars; seal with clean lids and rings and refrigerate until ready to serve. 1 gallon apple cider 1 gallon apple juice 1.5 cups white sugar, or to taste 6 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks 1 (1 liter) bottle 190 proof grain alcohol (such as Everclear™) This adult apple pie drink is made with apple cider, apple juice, grain alcohol, cinnamon sticks, and sugar. Great in the autumn around a campfire!

title: Golden Wedding Punch
text: In a 2 gallon punch bowl, combine orange juice concentrate, pineapple juice, lemon juice and sugar. Stir in water. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (46 fluid ounce) can sweetened pineapple juice 1.75 cups lemon juice 2 cups white sugar 1 gallon water A citrus and pineapple juice punch. This is decidedly different from your usual punch.

title: Apple Pie Moonshine
text: Combine apple juice, apple cider, white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, and apple pie spice in a large pot; bring to almost a boil. Cover the pot with a lid, reduce heat, and simmer for about 1 hour. Remove from heat and cool completely. Stir grain alcohol and vodka into apple syrup; remove cinnamon sticks. Pour apple pie moonshine into clean glass jars or bottles. Store in the refrigerator. 1 gallon apple juice 1 gallon apple cider 2 cups white sugar 2 cups brown sugar 4 cinnamon sticks, or more to taste 1 pinch apple pie spice 1 (750 milliliter) bottle 190 proof grain alcohol 1 (750 milliliter) bottle vodka This apple pie moonshine made with grain alcohol, vodka, apple cider, sugar, and spices, tastes like apple pie and is great for sipping after dinner.

title: Virgin Cucumber Mojito
text: Dissolve beverage mix into cold water in a pitcher; add cucumber slices and ice cubes. 1 individual packet Mojito-flavored dry beverage mix (such as Crystal Light®) 8 cups cold water 1 cucumber, peeled and sliced 3 cups ice cubes Use an instant Mojito powder and sliced cucumbers to make a pitcher full of summertime refreshment.

title: Frozen Summer Slush
text: Put 7 cups water in large saucepan, and heat on high until boiling. Add sugar and stir until dissolved; set aside to cool. Place tea bags in 2 cups boiling water, and let steep until desired strength is acquired. In a large bowl, mix together sugar water, tea, lemonade concentrate and orange juice concentrate. Stir in gin. Place in freezer container and freeze overnight. To serve, Place several scoops into a tall glass, and fill with any clear carbonated beverage. 2 cups white sugar 7 cups water 4 tea bags 2 cups boiling water 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 2 cups gin This is a great frozen summer drink that is very thirst quenching! Sweetened tea is mixed with lemonade, orange juice and vodka or gin, then frozen into a slush.

title: Rich Spiced Hot Chocolate
text: Whisk sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, and salt together in a small bowl. Bring milk to a boil in a saucepan, whisking constantly. Whisk in cocoa mixture until dissolved, reduce heat to low, and simmer until flavors combine, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract. Stir cream into hot chocolate and pour into mugs. 0.66666668653488 cup white sugar 0.33333334326744 cup cocoa powder 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper 1 pinch salt 4 cups whole milk 1 tablespoon vanilla extract 0.5 cup heavy whipping cream Warm up after Christmas caroling with this delicious, rich, homemade spiced hot chocolate!

title: Boulevardier Cocktail
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add whiskey, sweet vermouth, and Campari. Stir and strain into a chilled martini glass; garnish with lemon twist. ice 1.5 fluid ounces bourbon whiskey 1 fluid ounce sweet vermouth 1 fluid ounce bitter orange aperitif (such as Campari®) 1 twist lemon Bourbon, orange apertif, and sweet vermouth are stirred together to make the Boulevardier cocktail, perfect for fans of whiskey and Negroni.

title: Virgin Sunset
text: Fill a glass with ice. Pour orange juice, pineapple juice, and cranberry juice over the ice and stir. Float a splash of grenadine syrup atop the mixture and serve. ice cubes 0.25 cup orange juice 0.25 cup pineapple juice 0.25 cup cranberry juice 1 splash grenadine syrup Grenadine syrup slowly floats through this mixture of orange, pineapple, and cranberry juices to give a visual effect of a sunset in a glass.

title: Friendship Tea
text: In a large bowl, combine instant tea, lemonade powder, orange drink mix, cinnamon and clove. Mix well and store in an airtight container. To serve, Put 2 to 3 teaspoons of mix in a mug. Stir in 1 cup of boiling water. Adjust to taste. 0.5 cup instant tea powder 1 cup sweetened lemonade powder 1 cup orange-flavored drink mix (e.g. Tang) 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.5 teaspoon ground cloves This is a lemony spiced tea mix with cinnamon and clove that makes great gifts during the holidays, or any time!

title: Cranberry Liqueur
text: Combine cranberries, sugar, gin, and vanilla extract in a large sterilized jar with a tight-fitting lid. Let stand at room temperature for 6 weeks, shaking at least once a week. Pour mixture through a sieve and discard solids. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 months. 4 cups cranberries, coarsely chopped 3 cups white sugar 2 cups gin 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Cranberries and sugar are soaked in gin for six weeks creating a festive cranberry liqueur for the holiday season.

title: Iced Mocha Frappé
text: Pour coffee into an ice cube tray. Freeze until solid, 3 to 4 hours. Place frozen coffee cubes in a blender. Add milk, chocolate syrup, and sugar; blend until smooth. Pour coffee mixture into 2 glasses and top with whipped cream. 1.5 cups cold coffee 2 cups whole milk 0.25 cup chocolate syrup 0.25 cup white sugar 1 tablespoon whipped cream Blend up sweet, homemade iced mocha frappés that taste like those at McDonald's with this quick-and-easy five-ingredient recipe.

title: B-52 Bomber
text: Carefully pour coffee liqueur, Grand Marnier, and Irish cream liqueur into a cordial glass so that they do not mix. 1 tablespoon Kahlua or other coffee flavored liqueur 1 tablespoon brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®) 1 tablespoon Irish cream liqueur I used to work as a bartender, and this was a popular drink. A subtle blend of coffee, orange, and Irish cream create a memorable and festive cordial.

title: Nutella® Coffee Shake
text: Blend ice, milk, sugar, chocolate-hazelnut spread, instant coffee, and vanilla extract together in a blender until desired consistency is reached, about 30 seconds. 2 cups ice cubes 1.5 cups milk 3 tablespoons white sugar 2 tablespoons chocolate-hazelnut spread (such as Nutella®) 4 teaspoons instant coffee granules 1 tablespoon vanilla extract Nutella® and instant coffee are blended with milk and vanilla extract creating a creamy and rich milkshake.

title: Finnish Long Drink
text: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add lemon juice, grapefruit juice, gin, and grapefruit soda; stir to combine. Top with club soda, lightly stir again, and garnish with grapefruit slice. 1 cup ice, or as needed 0.5 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lemon juice 2 fluid ounces white grapefruit juice 2 fluid ounces gin 3 ounces grapefruit flavored soda (such as Fresca®) 1 splash club soda, or as needed 1 slice grapefruit for garnish Also know as a Lonkero, Finnish Long Drink is a popular highball with gin and grapefruit juice.

title: Watermelon and Cucumber Juice with a Spritz of Lime
text: Run watermelon and cucumber pieces through a juicer following the manufacturer's instructions, and place the juice into a pitcher. Stir in lime juice, and serve. 0.5 (4 pound) watermelon, seeded and cubed 4 cucumbers, trimmed and cut into chunks 2 limes, juiced A cool, refreshing juice — this is a mellow cucumber and watermelon juice recipe with a touch of tartness from the lime. This slightly sweet drink is perfect for a hot afternoon.

title: Spiked Eggnog
text: Beat eggs in a bowl using an electric mixer on medium speed until very frothy, 2 to 3 minutes. Add 1 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar, vanilla extract, and nutmeg gradually while beating. Turn the mixer off and manually stir in whipping cream, milk, brandy, and spiced rum. Chill before serving. 6 cold eggs 1 cup white sugar 1 tablespoon white sugar 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg 2 cups cold whipping cream 2 cups cold milk 0.75 cup cold brandy 0.33333334326744 cup cold spiced rum Eggnog is spiked with brandy and spiced rum. Bring to every family gathering this festive season for some extra holiday cheer!

title: Matcha Frappe
text: Combine matcha, vanilla syrup, Almond Breeze Original Almondmilk, Almond Breeze Sweet Crème Almondmilk Creamer, and ice cubes in a blender. Blend until smooth and frothy. 1 1/2 cups Almond Breeze Original Almondmilk 1 Tbsp. Almond Breeze Sweet Crème Almondmilk Creamer 2 tsp. matcha 2 Tbsp. vanilla syrup 2 cups ice cubes If you can’t get enough of matcha - this frappe will be a perfect kick to your craving!

title: Amanda's Sangria
text: In a large jar or pitcher combine wine and rum with sliced lemon, orange, lime, and strawberry. Push cloves into apples slices and add to mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight (the longer the better). To serve, pour a tall glass half-full of wine mixture. Fill the rest of the glass with soda and stir gently. Remove cloves from apple slices and garnish drinks by spooning some marinated fruit into glass. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine 0.5 cup rum 1 lemon, sliced 1 orange, sliced in rounds 1 lime, sliced 1 pint strawberries, hulled and sliced 1 apple, cored and sliced 9 whole cloves 1 liter lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage Red wine punch marinated with fruit and flavored with cloves. Mix with lemon-lime soda and serve.

title: Filipino Avocado Milkshake
text: Combine avocado, milk, ice cream, ice, sugar, and lemon juice in a blender. Purée until smooth. 1 medium avocado - peeled, pitted, and cubed 1.3333333730698 cups milk 1 scoop vanilla ice cream 5 cubes ice 3 tablespoons white sugar 1 teaspoon fresh lemon or lime juice This avocado milkshake made with milk, sugar, vanilla ice cream, and a whole avocado is a rich and creamy treat and an interesting use of this green fruit!

title: Fresh Peaches and Cream Cocktail
text: Place ice in a blender and crush for 15 to 20 seconds. Add fresh peaches, peach schnapps, and whipped vodka. Blend until smooth. Rim glass with frozen whipped topping. Pour cocktail into glass and serve garnished with peach slice. 1 ½ cups freshly peeled and chopped peaches ¼ cup peach schnapps ¼ cup whipped vodka 1 cup ice cool whip for rim peach slice for garnish This fresh peaches and cream cocktail screams summer. Peaches, peach schnapps, and vodka combine in this simple yet tasty frozen drink.

title: Soothing Hot Ginger Tea
text: Pour ginger ale into a microwave-safe mug. Heat in the microwave for 1 to 2 minutes. Steep tea bag in the hot ginger ale for 3 to 5 minutes. 1 (12 fl oz) can ginger ale (such as Canada Dry®) 1 black tea bag (such as Lipton®) A hot mug of black tea and ginger ale is a soothing drink when you have an upset stomach or need a warming treat on a chilly evening.

title: Tahini-Pina Colada Shake
text: Place coconut in a blender; blend to a fine powder. Add frozen pineapple, coconut milk, tahini, and coconut extract and blend until smooth. 0.25 cup shredded coconut 1 cup fresh pineapple, chopped into chunks and frozen 1 cup coconut milk beverage (such as Silk®) 2 tablespoons tahini 0.5 teaspoon coconut extract This tahini shake is great non-alcoholic twist on a classic pina colada with fresh frozen pineapple, coconut milk, coconut extract, and tahini.

title: Lemonade Plus
text: Into a gallon pitcher, empty both cans of lemonade concentrate. Place the sliced lemon, lime, grapefruit and orange in the pitcher. Stir in water until pitcher is full. Chill in refrigerator. 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans frozen lemonade concentrate 1 lemon, sliced 1 lime, sliced 1 grapefruit, sliced 1 orange, sliced This uses lemonade concentrate plus real fruit - lemons, limes, oranges, and grapefruit. It is soooo good.

title: Grandma's Russian Tea
text: Steep tea bags in boiling water until tea is of desired strength, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove and discard tea bags. Combine 1 1/2 quarts water, cinnamon stick, and cloves in a large pot; bring to a boil. Add brewed tea, pineapple juice, sugar, orange juice and lemonade concentrates, and allspice to the boiling water; stir until sugar dissolves. Serve immediately, or reduce heat to low and keep at a simmer until ready to serve. 2 family-sized tea bags 1 quart boiling water 1.5 quarts water 1 cinnamon stick 6 whole cloves 1 (12 ounce) can pineapple juice 1 cup white sugar 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 1 teaspoon ground allspice This Russian tea recipe with pineapple juice, orange and lemonade concentrates, and warm spices is a perfect treat when you're feeling under the weather.

title: Fresh Pineapple-Cucumber Juice
text: Process pineapple, cucumbers, and lemon through a juicer. Chill, or serve over ice. 1 large fresh pineapple, peeled and cut into cubes 2 medium cucumbers 1 lemon, peeled This refreshing juice with pineapple and cucumber is not only healthy, it's delicious too! For best results, use a centrifugal juicer.

title: 2-Ingredient Frozen Fruit Smoothie
text: Pour coconut water into a Vitamix blender. Add frozen fruit. Slowly turn the blender to Variable 10, then to High 10. Blend for 45 seconds. Pour smoothie into glass; garnish with strawberry and blackberry if desired. 9 oz frozen mixed fruit (strawberries, peaches, pineapple and mango) 8 oz coconut water 1 blackberry, optional 1 strawberry, optional This frozen fruit smoothie has two ingredients, frozen fruit and coconut water, and is both refreshing and hydrating.

title: Rosemary Peach Frosty
text: Combine club soda, peaches, sugar, lemon juice, and rosemary leaves in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve with rosemary sprigs. 24 fluid ounces club soda 1 (16 ounce) package frozen sliced peaches 1 cup white sugar lemon, juiced 1 sprig fresh rosemary, leaves removed and chopped 4 sprigs fresh rosemary Frozen peaches get a minty flavor when blended with fresh rosemary in this 5-minute mocktail recipe that's a perfect warm-weather offering for guests of any age.

title: Rhubarb Lemonade
text: Combine rhubarb, sugar, and grated lemon peel in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until sugar has dissolved and rhubarb releases its juice and starts to break up, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in lemon juice. Pour rhubarb mixture through a fine sieve, pressing out as much liquid as possible. 8 cups chopped rhubarb 3 cups white sugar 3 tablespoons grated lemon peel 1.5 cups lemon juice Adding rhubarb to your lemonade gives it an extra tangy flavor and a beautiful pink color.

title: Secret Simple Hot Chocolate
text: Stir milk and sugar together in a microwave-safe glass or mug. Microwave until hot, about 2 minutes. Stir in chocolate syrup until completely incorporated. 0.66666668653488 cup milk 0.25 cup white sugar 2 teaspoons chocolate syrup It doesn't get more simple than milk, sugar, and chocolate syrup to make this recipe for homemade hot chocolate.

title: Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster
text: Place sugar cube on a small vessel. Drop bitters on top; let soak to produce an Algolian suntiger tooth. Fuse salt and water together in a concave apparatus until dissolved to yield Santraginus V sea water. Combine the Santraginus V sea water, Arcturan Mega-gin (gin), and O'l Janx Spirit (tequila) in a serving vessel. Release Fallian marsh gas (effervescent tablet) into the solution. Decant Qualactin Hypermint extract (schnapps) over the back of a spoon held just above the liquid's surface. Transfer the Algolian Suntiger tooth into the concoction; let dissolve. Stir in Zamphuor (ice) to decrease the temperature to 32 degrees F (0 degrees C). Funnel an olive into the final product. 'Drink... but... very carefully...' 1 sugar cube 1 drop bitters 0.25 teaspoon salt 1.75 teaspoons warm water 3 fluid ounces gin 2 fluid ounces tequila 1 lemon-lime-flavored immune support effervescent tablet (such as Emergen-C®) 1 fluid ounce peppermint schnapps crushed ice, as desired 1 olive Prepare to be blasted in the cosmos with the force of a thousand asteroids by the unstable, universally feared Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster.

title: Tasty Lemonade
text: In a large pitcher, combine fresh lemon juice and water. Stir in brown sugar until it dissolves. Stir in ice cubes. 6 lemons, juiced 1.5 cups water 0.5 cup brown sugar 0.5 cup ice cubes This lemonade made with brown sugar is good on hot days, and very successful at lemonade stands served with a twist of lemon.

title: Blueberry Smoothie
text: Blend blueberries, yogurt, milk, sugar, vanilla, and nutmeg in a blender until frothy, scraping down the sides of the blender if needed. Divide between 2 glasses and serve immediately. 1 cup blueberries (frozen or fresh) 1 (8 ounce) container plain yogurt 0.75 cup 2% reduced-fat milk 2 tablespoons white sugar 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.125 teaspoon ground nutmeg Blueberry smoothie recipes are a favorite way to enjoy fresh or frozen berries, and this one's a winner! Tangy yogurt and a touch of sugar balance it.

title: Orange Creamsicle® Protein Shake
text: Combine orange segments, zest, soy milk, yogurt, protein powder, ice, and vanilla extract in a blender. Blend until smooth. 1 orange, zested and peeled 1 cup soy milk 1 (5.3 ounce) container plain Greek yogurt 1 scoop vanilla protein powder 5 ice cubes 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Blend a whole orange with Greek yogurt, protein powder, and soy milk into this healthier shake version of a Creamsicle® you can enjoy for breakfast.

title: Creamy Mango Smoothie
text: Blend the milk, yogurt, vanilla extract, mango, and ice cubes in a blender until smooth and creamy. 0.75 cup cold milk 0.25 cup vanilla yogurt 0.75 teaspoon vanilla extract 1.5 cups chopped fresh mango 3 ice cubes This smoothie recipe combines the flavors of mango and vanilla.

title: Iced Tea I
text: Put tea bags in a 2 quart pitcher. Add hot water. Let sit at least 15 minutes. Add cold water and remove tea bags. refrigerate and serve over ice. 8 tea bags 0.5 cup hot water 7.5 cups cold water Like real iced tea, but do you hate boiling the water and then waiting for the tea to cool? Try making it with hot tap water.

title: Refreshing Peach Sangria
text: Mix wine, lemon-lime soda, peach schnapps, and pineapple juice in a cocktail shaker; add ice. Stir until wine mixture is chilled. Place frozen peach, red grapes, and green grapes in a martini glass; strain wine mixture into martini glass. 3 fluid ounces white Zinfandel wine 3 fluid ounces lemon-lime flavored soda 1 fluid ounce peach schnapps 1 fluid ounce pineapple juice 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed 1 slice frozen peach 3 red seedless grapes, frozen 3 seedless green grapes, frozen A twist on traditional sangria uses peach schnapps, white Zinfandel wine, and pineapple juice poured over frozen peaches and grapes creating a refreshing peach sangria.

title: Country Margaritas
text: In a large jug or pitcher, mix together the lemonade concentrate, vodka and beer. Stir, and serve over ice. 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans frozen lemonade concentrate 1.5 cups vodka 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans beer ice cubes Not really a margarita, but it looks pretty close!!

title: Swedish Glogg
text: Bring water to a boil in a pot with cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, and orange zest; stir in sugar until dissolved. Remove from heat and allow to steep 8 hours to overnight. Place raisins and almonds into a large saucepan. Strain sugar water into raisins, then pour in Muscatel, port, and brandy. Place over medium-high heat and cook until hot but not simmering. Serve warm in a mug with some fruit and almonds in each cup. 2 cups water 12 cardamom seeds 2 cinnamon sticks 12 whole cloves 0.5 orange, zested 1 cup white sugar 1 cup raisins 1 cup blanched almonds 4 cups Muscatel wine, or orange Muscat 4 cups port wine (or Burgundy) 2 cups brandy This is an authentic Swedish spiced wine. This Swedish glogg recipe is from Great Aunt Freda, brought from Sweden in the early 1900s.

title: Chai Tea Concentrate
text: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan; add cloves and boil for 1 minute. Add cinnamon sticks, ginger, cardamom pods, peppercorns, and tea. Allow tea to steep for 6 minutes; strain into a container. Stir brown sugar and vanilla extract into tea and refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour. 4 cups water 15 whole cloves 3 cinnamon sticks 8 (1/4 inch thick) slices unpeeled fresh ginger 15 cardamom pods, split 15 whole black peppercorns 10 black tea bags 0.33333334326744 cup brown sugar 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Homemade chia tea concentrate is simple to prepare using a variety of spices steeped with black tea and brown sugar.

title: Spanish Coffee
text: Pour sugar into a shallow dish. Wet the rim of a wine glass or Irish coffee mug and dip in sugar to coat. Add rum and triple sec. Use a long match or lighter to carefully ignite the mixture. Turn glass slowly until sugar begins to caramelize. Pour in coffee liqueur to put out the flame. Top with hot coffee. 1.5 teaspoons superfine sugar 1 fluid ounce 151-proof rum 0.75 fluid ounce triple sec (such as Bols®) 2.5 fluid ounces coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) 0.5 cup freshly brewed coffee This Spanish coffee cocktail spiked with overproof rum, triple sec, and coffee liqueur is lit on fire for dramatic effect.

title: Smooth Sweet Tea
text: Gather ingredients. Sprinkle a pinch of baking soda into a 64-ounce, heat-proof glass pitcher. Pour in boiling water and add tea bags. Cover and allow to steep for 15 minutes. Remove tea bags and discard; stir in sugar until dissolved. Pour in cool water; refrigerate until cold, about 3 hours. Enjoy! 1 pinch baking soda 2 cups boiling water 6 tea bags 0.75 cup white sugar 6 cups cool water This sweet tea is a classic Southern drink served chilled and easily made with tea bags and sugar for a great way to cool down on a hot summer day.

title: Rompope (Mexican Eggnog)
text: Bring milk, sugar, and cinnamon sticks to a boil in a large saucepan over low heat. Continue to boil, stirring constantly, until milk has reduced by a little more than one-third, about 20 minutes. Remove from the heat. Leave in the saucepan and allow to cool slightly, about 10 minutes. Beat egg yolks with an electric mixer until thick and pale. Mix in a little of the warm milk mixture. Pour egg yolk mixture into the saucepan with the remaining milk mixture. Stir to combine and bring to a boil over low heat. Stir constantly, scraping the bottom and sides, until mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the heat, remove cinnamon sticks, and cool to lukewarm, 15 to 30 minutes. Stir in rum and cool completely, about 2 hours. 3 pints whole milk 2.5 cups white sugar 2 cinnamon sticks 15 egg yolks 1 cup rum Mexican rompope is an eggnog-like drink made with milk, egg yolks, sugar, rum, and cinnamon. It's easy to make — just be patient with all the stirring!

title: Sheila's Perfect Sangria
text: Place the oranges, lemons, limes, pear, kiwi, strawberries, pineapple chunks and juice, and white sugar into a large bowl. Pour the Cointreau, white rum, coconut-flavored rum, and orange juice over the fruit. Stir gently to dissolve the sugar. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Add the red wine, pink lemonade concentrate, lemon juice, and lime juice. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours, or overnight. Before serving, add the chilled lemon-lime soda. Serve over ice, spooning the fruit into the glass with the liquid. Garnish with an orange slice or maraschino cherries. 2 navel oranges, thinly sliced 2 lemons, thinly sliced 2 limes, thinly sliced 1 pear, cored and chopped 1 kiwi, peeled and sliced 1 cup fresh strawberries, sliced 1 (20 ounce) can pineapple chunks in juice 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup Cointreau or other orange liqueur 1 cup white rum 0.33333334326744 cup coconut-flavored rum 2 cups orange juice 2 (750 milliliter) bottles dry red wine, chilled 0.5 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen pink lemonade concentrate, thawed 0.25 cup lemon juice 2 tablespoons lime juice 1 cup lemon-lime soda, chilled This tropical-tasting sangria is enhanced with Cointreau, coconut rum, pineapple, and plenty of citrus.

title: Creme de Vie
text: In a saucepan, combine water and sugar. Bring to a boil and cook for 3 minutes. Place egg yolks in a blender and process on high speed. Slowly pour in the hot sugar water while blending (pouring too fast might curdle the yolks.) Add condensed milk, rum and vanilla. Blend until smooth. Chill in refrigerator. 1 cup water 1 cup sugar 6 egg yolks 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 cup rum 1 teaspoon vanilla extract A yummy drink that is perfect for the holidays. Egg yolks are blended with sugar syrup and evaporated milk, then flavored with rum and vanilla. One sip and you'll be hooked.

title: Matcha Frappé
text: Blend milk, ice, vanilla syrup, and green tea powder in a blender to desired consistency. Serve with whipped cream on top. 1 cup milk 5 ice cubes, or as needed 1 tablespoon vanilla-flavored syrup (such as Torani®) 1 teaspoon matcha green tea powder, or more to taste 1 tablespoon whipped cream, or to taste This matcha frappé is a delicious blend of matcha green tea powder, milk, vanilla syrup, and ice. It's a refreshing cold drink for a hot summer day.

title: Raspberry Iced Tea
text: Bring water to a boil in a large pot; stir in tea bags, raspberries, and sugar until sugar has dissolved. Allow mixture to steep until the desired level of tea flavor is reached, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove tea bags and stir in lemonade mix until dissolved. Pour tea into pitchers and add ice to cool. 1 gallon water 3 (3 ounce) gallon-size tea bags 1 cup fresh raspberries 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup powdered lemonade mix (such as Country Time®) ice cubes This raspberry iced tea recipe is made with fresh raspberries and lemonade mix for a lightly sweetened, pretty pink beverage perfect for hot weather.

title: Hawaiian Iced Tea
text: Pour the barely boiling hot water into a large pitcher, and add the tea bags. Steep the tea, 2 to 4 minutes. Remove the tea bags and pour in the ice water. Pour in the pineapple juice. Refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, about 1 1/2 hours. Pour the tea over ice, garnish with pineapple spears, and serve. 1 quart barely boiling hot water 4 orange pekoe tea bags 1 quart ice cold water 1 (16 ounce) can pineapple juice 0.5 cup simple syrup 1 fresh pineapple - peeled, cored, and cut into spears Iced black tea accented with pineapple juice shows off its Hawaiian roots and makes a refreshing party drink.

title: Michigan Fizz
text: Measure concentrated cherry juice into a tall glass. Fill glass with ginger ale and stir gently. 3 tablespoons frozen cherry juice concentrate 1 cup ginger ale soda A non-alcoholic drink made with cherry juice and ginger ale.

title: Iced Caramel Macchiato
text: Pour vanilla syrup into a drinking glass. Add ice cubes, then pour in milk. Slowly pour in cold brew concentrate. Drizzle drink with caramel sauce. 1 tablespoon vanilla-flavored syrup 0.33333331346512 cup ice cubes 0.75 cup milk 4 ounces Gevalia® Cold Brew Concentrate - House Blend 1 tablespoon caramel sauce This iced caramel macchiato is made with cold brew coffee and milk, vanilla syrup, and a drizzle of caramel sauce for a sweet and creamy summer drink.

title: Fall Sangria
text: Add all ingredients except soda water into a large pitcher and stir to combine. Allow to sit in the refrigerator for 3 to 24 hours. Pour sangria and fruit into glasses with ice. Top with soda water. 0.5 cup DeKuyper® Triple Sec 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry white wine 3 cups apple cider 2 medium apples, cored and diced 2 medium oranges, cut into wedges 2 medium lemons, cut into wedges 3 cinnamon sticks Ice Soda water Mix fruits, apple cider, cinnamon, triple sec, white wine, and soda water together for a delicious fall sangria cocktail.

title: Easy Raspberry Lemonade
text: In a large punch bowl, combine raspberry lemonade concentrate, water and lime juice. Stir in lemon-lime soda and crushed ice. Garnish each glass with a fresh raspberry and a mint leaf. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen raspberry lemonade concentrate 3 cups water 0.75 teaspoon lime juice 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 1 cup crushed ice 1 cup fresh raspberries, garnish 18 Mint leaves, for garnish We came up with this recipe for my brother's wedding reception. We wanted to serve something that was easy and quick to fix, yet good at the same time. After a few tries, we ended up with this recipe...and a lot of compliments.

title: Bethy's Cucumber Basil Lemonade
text: Combine 1 cup water and sugar together in a small saucepan; bring to a boil. Cook and stir until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and cool syrup to room temperature. Stir syrup, remaining water, lemon juice, cucumber, and basil together in a pitcher; chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. 8 cups cold water, divided 1 cup white sugar 1.5 cups lemon juice 0.5 cucumber, thinly sliced 10 fresh basil leaves, torn Cucumber and basil lemonade is a refreshing twist on the traditional summertime beverage.

title: Hot Spiced Cranberry Cider
text: Combine apple cider, cranberry juice, lemon slices, brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, and cloves in a large pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to remove lemon slices, cinnamon, and cloves. Serve hot. 2 quarts apple cider 6 cups cranberry juice 1 lemon, thinly sliced 0.25 cup packed brown sugar 4 cinnamon sticks 1.5 teaspoons whole cloves Make some memories with the aromas of cinnamon, clove, and lemon mingled with hot apple-cranberry cider. If desired, float a fresh lemon slice in each cup.

title: Tangy Plum Liqueur
text: Layer half the plums into the bottom of a very large jar with a lid, pressing the plums down as tightly as possible. Pour half the sugar over the plums, then half the vodka over the sugar. Sprinkle on half the vanilla extract, and place about half the orange peel pieces into the jar. Layer the rest of the plums into the jar, pressing them down, and top them with the remaining sugar, vodka, vanilla extract, and orange peel pieces. Screw on the jar lid. Using an unscented candle, drip a coating of wax around the jar lid to prevent leaking. Cover the jar with a dark-colored towel. Place the jar on its side in a dark, cool place, and turn the jar every day for 21 days, replacing the towel to keep out light. After 21 days, strain out the liqueur from the plums and peel with a fine strainer lined with cheesecloth, and bottle the liqueur in attractive bottles with tight-fitting caps. 16 cups black or red plums, pitted and cut into eighths 3.25 cups white sugar, divided 3 cups 100 proof vodka 1.5 tablespoons vanilla extract, divided 1 orange peel in pieces, divided That tree full of ripe plums yields a sweet and luscious homemade plum liqueur that's easy to make by steeping plums in vodka with sugar and orange peel for 21 days. Vanilla helps smooth it out. You need a big jar to make it in. Great for gifts, too. You can use tangerine peel instead of orange peel. Save and eat the plums!

title: Banana Ice Cream Shake
text: In a blender, combine banana, ice cream, milk, egg white and vanilla extract. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. 1 banana, peeled and chopped 2 scoops vanilla ice cream 1 cup milk 2 egg white 1 teaspoon vanilla extract A delightful blend of bananas and your favorite flavor of ice cream.

title: Coconut Milk Hot Chocolate
text: Heat coconut milk in a saucepan over medium-low heat until warm, 3 to 5 minutes. Add chocolate and sugar; whisk until incorporated and chocolate is melted. Pour mixture into a blender and add curry powder. Cover and hold lid down with a potholder; blend until smooth, about 15 seconds. 1 cup light coconut milk 1 (1 ounce) square dark chocolate, chopped 1.5 teaspoons white sugar 0.125 teaspoon curry powder If you use coconut milk and dark chocolate to make hot chocolate, it is naturally vegan; you can use other sweeteners instead of sugar.

title: Cold-Brewed Coffee
text: Put coffee grounds in a large container. Slowly pour water over grounds. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and steep at room temperature for 18 to 24 hours. Line a strainer with several layers of cheesecloth and place atop a pitcher; strain coffee through the cheesecloth into the pitcher. Discard the grounds. To get a clearer brew, strain coffee again through coffee filters. Store in refrigerator. 0.5 pound coarsely ground coffee beans 4.5 cups cold water cheesecloth coffee filters Once you try cold-brewing your coffee, you may never go back to your coffee maker! Coarsely ground coffee, cold water, and a bit of time and patience delivers a less-acidic brew you'll love.

title: Swedish Christmas Glogg
text: Gently simmer the red wine, port wine, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves, and orange peel in a large pot set over medium-low heat. Stir in the sugar, rum, and brandy. Continue simmering 5 minutes more, stirring to completely dissolve the sugar, and the mixture is steaming but not boiling. Mix the raisins and almonds together in a bowl. To serve, ladle into coffee cups or Swedish-style small glass or ceramic mugs. Garnish each cup with a spoonful of the raisin and almond mixture. 2 (750 milliliter) bottles fruity red wine, such as Beaujolais 1 (750 milliliter) bottle port wine 3 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks 14 whole cloves 1 orange, peel cut into thin strips 1 cup white sugar, or to taste 0.75 cup rum, or to taste 0.25 cup brandy, or to taste 1 cup raisins 1 cup slivered almonds Scandinavians warm chilly nights around Christmastime and after skiing with steaming glasses or cups of glogg, a spiced, red wine-based hot punch seasoned with cinnamon sticks and whole cloves.

title: Easy Mulled Wine
text: Combine red wine, cinnamon sticks, cloves, allspice, lemon peel, and orange peel in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Heat gently, but don't boil. Stir in 2 tablespoons of sugar, and once dissolved, taste to see if you'd like to add more. Keep hot on medium to low heat for 20 minutes to let the flavors infuse the wine. Serve your mulled wine hot in glasses or mugs. 4 cups dry red wine 2 (2 inch) pieces cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon whole cloves 1 teaspoon whole allspice berries 1 large strip of lemon peel 1 large strip of orange peel 2 tablespoons sugar, or more to taste This mulled wine recipe couldn't be easier to do. Don't bother with expensive wine - a cheap red will work beautifully and no one will ever know the difference!

title: Just-Right Pineapple Lemonade from Scratch
text: Combine 1 cup water and sugar in a saucepan and bring to a gentle simmer over medium-high heat, stirring often. Simmer until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and allow simple syrup to cool. Cut off pineapple crown and remove the outer skin. Cut pineapple flesh into chunks and add to a high-capacity blender (such as Vitamix). Pour in 2 cups water and blend until liquefied. Pour liquefied pineapple juice into a pitcher. Add remaining water, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Stir before serving. 8 cups water, divided 0.75 cup white sugar 1 fresh pineapple 1.5 cups fresh squeezed lemon juice This homemade pineapple lemonade is made from scratch and has just the right flavor balance between sweet and tart.

title: Iced Lemon Coffee
text: Combine coffee, ice cubes, lemon juice, and stevia in a glass. Stir. Garnish with a slice of lemon. 1 cup cold-brewed coffee 0.25 cup ice cubes 0.25 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice 1 teaspoon stevia powder, or to taste 1 slice lemon, for garnish Iced lemon coffee is great refreshing drink on a hot summer day. Just store your leftover coffee in the fridge so you can make this little pick-me-up in a jiffy.

title: Homemade Hot Apple Cider
text: Pour apple cider and maple syrup into a large stainless steel saucepan. Place cinnamon sticks, cloves, allspice berries, orange peel, and lemon peel in the center of a square of washed cheesecloth; fold up the sides of the cheesecloth to enclose the bundle, then tie it up with a length of kitchen string. Drop the spice bundle into the cider mixture. Place the saucepan over moderate heat and cook until cider is very hot but not boiling, about 5 to 10 minutes. Remove cider from the heat. Discard the spice bundle. Ladle cider into big cups or mugs, adding a fresh cinnamon stick to each serving if desired. 6 cups apple cider 0.25 cup real maple syrup 2 cinnamon sticks 6 whole cloves 6 whole allspice berries 1 orange peel, cut into strips 1 lemon peel, cut into strips Enjoy a mug of this hot apple cider seasoned with spices and sweetened with pure maple syrup for a perfect treat on a cold winter day. Nothing beats it!

title: Basic Fruit Smoothie
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine strawberries, peaches, and banana in a blender; blend until smooth. Add ice and pour in juice; blend again to desired consistency. Enjoy! 1 quart strawberries, hulled 2 fresh peaches - peeled, pitted, and sliced 1 banana, broken into chunks 2 cups ice 1 cup orange-peach-mango juice A tasty fruit smoothie recipe with strawberries, banana, peaches, fruit juice, and ice. Feel free to experiment with your favorite fruits!

title: Black Tea Lemonade
text: Bring 5 cups of water and the sugar to a boil in a saucepan, then remove from the heat and add the tea bags. Allow tea to steep while you mix the lemonade concentrate and remaining water in a large pitcher. Pour the tea mixture into the lemonade, discarding tea bags. Stir and refrigerate until cold before serving. 5 cups water 0.5 cup white sugar 3 orange pekoe tea bags 1 (12 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 5 cups water A very strong, sweet black tea and lemonade mix is sweetened and chilled to make a refreshing summer drink.

title: Hot Chocolate Bombs
text: Combine chocolate chips, cream, and sugar in a microwave-safe dish and cook in the microwave for 1 minute. Stir, then cook for 30-second intervals until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Mix in vanilla and salt until well incorporated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Scoop chocolate mixture onto a parchment-lined baking sheet using a large cookie scoop. Freeze until solid, 8 hours to overnight. Shape frozen scoops into balls and roll in cocoa powder. Store in a freezer-safe container until ready to use. 2.5 cups semisweet chocolate chips 1 cup heavy whipping cream 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.25 teaspoon salt 2 tablespoons cocoa powder, or as needed Place a frozen chocolate bomb in a cup of steaming hot milk, stir, you'll have homemade hot chocolate in just a few minutes!

title: Shamrock Shakes
text: Blend together ice cream, milk, mint extract, and food coloring in a blender until smooth. Drizzle chocolate syrup around the inside of 2 tall glasses; pour shake into the glasses. Top with whipped cream and green sugar. 2 cups vanilla ice cream 1.25 cups milk 0.25 teaspoon mint extract, or more to taste 9 drops green food coloring 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup, or to taste 2 tablespoons whipped cream, or to taste 0.5 teaspoon green decorator sugar, or to taste Learn how to make a shamrock shake on St. Patrick's Day with this easy recipe for a green, mint-flavored milkshake sweetened with chocolate syrup.

title: Chilton Cocktail
text: Sprinkle salt onto a plate. Moisten the rim of a highball glass with lemon wedge. Press the moistened rim into salt. Fill the glass with ice. Pour lemon juice and vodka over ice and gently stir. Top with sparkling water and serve with lemon wedge. 1 tablespoon coarse salt, or as needed 1 lemon wedge 1 1/2 fluid ounces fresh lemon juice 1 1/2 fluid ounces vodka 4 fluid ounces sparkling mineral water (such as Topo Chico®), or as needed The Chilton cocktail, said to have originated in Lubbock, Texas, is a tangy and refreshing summer cocktail, perfect for those who don't like overly sweet drinks.

title: Fake Cod Holiday Mocktail
text: Place 1 teaspoon pomegranate seeds in 8 of the wells in a 16-cube ice tray; drop red currants in remaining 8 wells. Fill wells with water. Freeze into ice cubes, 8 hours to overnight. Combine chopped cranberries, water, and sugar in a saucepan over low heat. Simmer, stirring frequently, until cranberries have completely softened, about 15 minutes. Strain cranberries through a fine mesh sieve, gently pressing the pulp to extract the liquid. Let syrup cool before covering, then refrigerate 8 hours to overnight. Use a clean needle to thread popcorn and dried cranberries onto one long food-grade thread. Cut into 8 equal strings. Add 1 pomegranate ice cube and 1 red currant ice cube to each serving glass. Pour 2 tablespoons syrup into each and top with 3/4 cup tonic water. Garnish with a lime wedge and a string of popcorn and cranberries. 8 teaspoons pomegranate seeds 8 teaspoons fresh red currants 1 cup chopped cranberries 0.5 cup water 0.5 cup white sugar 3 cups popped unsalted popcorn 0.5 cup dried cranberries 6 cups tonic water (such as Fentimans), chilled 1 lime, cut into 8 wedges The whole family can enjoy this fun holiday cocktail that combines from-scratch cranberry syrup, tonic water, and ice cubes infused with pomegranate.

title: Snow Flake Cocoa
text: Stir together the whipping cream, milk, vanilla, and white chocolate chips in a slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 2 to 2 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally, until mixture is hot and chocolate chips are melted. Stir again before serving. Garnish with whipped cream and candy canes, as desired. 2 cups whipping cream 6 cups milk 1 teaspoon vanilla 1 (12 ounce) package white chocolate chips Whipped cream Candy canes White chocolate cocoa heats in a slow cooker and is garnished with whipped cream and candy canes. The slow cooker is a great way to keep the cocoa warm for a crowd.

title: White Sangria with Apples
text: Pour Riesling wine into a serving pitcher; add sugar and stir until dissolved. Stir in club soda and brandy. Add grapes, apple slices, lime slices, and lemon slices. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle chilled Riesling 0.25 cup white sugar 0.5 cup club soda 0.25 cup brandy 0.25 cup seedless green grapes 4 slices Granny Smith apple 4 slices lime 2 slices lemon This easy white sangria is made with apple slices, grapes, lemon, and lime for a refreshing, summer-ready drink that your guests will love.

title: Knifton Christmas Eggnog
text: Place orange juice concentrate, lemon juice, sugar, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, nutmeg, and eggs in a blender; blend until smooth. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Pour egg mixture into a large punch bowl. Stir in water. Drop ice cream and sherbet in then top with the ginger ale. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 0.5 cup lemon juice 0.25 cup white sugar 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.25 teaspoon ground ginger 0.25 teaspoon ground cloves 1 pinch ground nutmeg 6 eggs 1.5 cups water 1 quart vanilla ice cream 1 quart orange sherbet 2 liters ginger ale Eggnog and ice cream punch come together in this deliciously creamy dessert drink!

title: Mint Julep Iced Tea
text: Bring sugar and 1 cup water to a boil in a small saucepan, stirring until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes. Add tea bags and mint to sugar mixture; let steep for 10 minutes. Strain mixture and discard tea bags and mint. Combine tea mixture, cold water, orange juice, and lemon juice in a pitcher. 1 cup white sugar 1 cup water 4 tea bags 0.5 cup chopped fresh mint 2 quarts cold water 1 cup orange juice 6 tablespoons lemon juice Grandma's recipe for citrus tea using homemade simple syrup and mint is a refreshing non-alcoholic version of a mint julep iced tea.

title: Glogi
text: In a large pot, combine the water, sugar, cloves, cinnamon, and raisins. Bring to a boil, then remove from the heat and stir in the wine, lemon juice, and orange juice. Heat through, but do not boil. Remove the cinnamon stick. Ladle into cups, and serve with sliced almonds and the boiled raisins. 1.5 cups water 1.5 cups white sugar 4 whole cloves 1 (3 inch) cinnamon stick 0.5 cup raisins 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine 2 lemons, juiced 1 orange, juiced 0.25 cup sliced almonds A spicy Christmas drink from Scandinavia made with wine and spices and a blend of citrus juice.

title: Iced Mochas
text: Pour coffee into ice cube tray. Freeze until solid, or overnight. In a blender, combine coffee ice cubes, milk, chocolate syrup and sugar. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. 1.5 cups cold coffee 2 cups milk 0.25 cup chocolate syrup 0.25 cup white sugar First, make some coffee ice cubes, then blend them together with milk and chocolate syrup for a frosty treat!

title: Carrot and Orange Juice
text: Press carrots and oranges through a juicer and into a large glass. 2 pounds organic carrots, trimmed and scrubbed 8 organic oranges, peeled This quick, fresh, and delicious juice is loaded with carrots and oranges, and is a great way to start off your day!

title: Hot Chai Latte
text: Combine the milk and water in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Once this mixture has warmed, place the orange peel, cloves, cinnamon stick, peppercorns, nutmeg, sugar and tea leaves into the pan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the color deepens to your liking. Strain out spices, and pour into cups. 1 cup milk 1 cup water 1 large strip of orange peel 3 whole cloves 1 (3 inch) cinnamon stick 3 whole black peppercorns 1 pinch ground nutmeg 4 teaspoons white sugar 2 teaspoons black tea leaves A delicious, warm, old-fashioned style Chai Tea. With yummy spices, and authentic flavors, it's bound to be a hit with the whole family!

title: Karkadeh (Egyptian Hibiscus Iced Tea)
text: Place the hibiscus flowers in a pot and cover with boiling water. Sweeten to taste and allow to cool. Strain and pour into a pitcher. Refrigerate until well chilled. 0.25 cup dried hibiscus petals 1.5 quarts boiling water 2 tablespoons white sugar, or more to taste This traditional Egyptian hibiscus tea is made with loose dried hibiscus flowers and is a great sweet drink to break the fast during Ramadan.

title: Homemade Slow Cooker Hot Chocolate
text: Combine milk, chocolate chips, condensed milk, cream, and vanilla extract in a large slow cooker. Cover and cook on Low, stirring occasionally, until all ingredients are mixed entirely and hot chocolate has a smooth, creamy consistency, about 1 hour. 6 cups 2% milk 16 ounces milk chocolate chips 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1.5 cups heavy cream 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Simple ingredients combine in a slow cooker to produce this creamy, delicious hot chocolate that makes enough to serve a crowd at parties or potlucks.

title: Chocolate Banana Milkshake
text: Place the frozen banana chunks, powdered drink mix, milk, and vanilla ice cream into a blender, and blend until smooth and creamy. Pour into large glasses. 1 banana, frozen and chunked 6 tablespoons powdered chocolate-flavored malt drink mix (such as Ovaltine®) 1 cup milk 2 cups vanilla ice cream A chocolate-flavored creamy milkshake is made with a frozen banana for extra flavor.

title: Billy's Favorite Gingerbread Spiced Coffee Syrup
text: In a saucepan over medium-high heat, combine water, sugar, and honey. Stir in ginger, cinnamon stick, cloves, allspice, peppercorns, and nutmeg; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool for 20 minutes, then strain through a fine mesh sieve, or double layer cheesecloth. 1 cup water 1 cup sugar 1 tablespoon honey 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root, sliced 1 cinnamon stick, broken into large pieces 8 whole cloves 0.5 teaspoon whole allspice berries 0.5 teaspoon whole peppercorns 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg This is a delightful spicy syrup that you can use to spice up coffee, tea, apple cider, you name it, it's all good!

title: Allie's Espresso Kahlua® Liqueur
text: Stir brown sugar into espresso in a bowl or container with a spout until dissolved; stir in rum. Pour mixture into a clean, dark bottle; add vanilla bean. Seal bottle tightly with a lid and let sit for 1 month before drinking. 2 cups dark brown sugar 2 cups hot brewed espresso 2 cups dark rum (such as Bacardi®) 1 vanilla bean Homemade coffee-liqueur made with espresso is a perfect drink for the holiday season. Make a month in advance for best results!

title: Amazing Peach Sangria
text: Combine triple sec, sugar, and lemon juice in a bowl and stir to dissolve; add peaches. Put in the refrigerator for 8 hours, or overnight. Pour peach mixture into a pitcher, top with Prosecco, and serve immediately. Garnish each glass with a few frozen grapes and strawberries. 0.5 cup triple sec 2 tablespoons white sugar 1 lemon, juiced 4 fresh peaches - peeled, pitted, and diced 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Prosecco, chilled 1 cup frozen seedless grapes 1 cup frozen strawberries Light, refreshing, and super easy to make and chill ahead for parties, this peach white wine sangria is sure to be a hit.

title: Avocado Milkshake
text: Blend milk, avocado, and sugar together in a blender until smooth. 3 cups milk 1 avocado, peeled and pitted 3 tablespoons white sugar Avocado, milk, and sugar are blended together in this creamy avocado milkshake that kids and adults love.

title: Dairy-Free Hot Chocolate
text: Combine rice milk, chocolate chips, and vanilla extract in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk until the chocolate chips are melted and the mixture is hot, about 5 minutes. 2 cups rice milk 0.5 cup vegan chocolate chips 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Put together this quick and easy dairy-free, vegan hot chocolate recipe with rice milk, vanilla extract, and semisweet chocolate chips.

title: Caramel Apple Martini Pudding Shots
text: Beat milk and pudding mix together in a bowl until smooth; add apple schnapps, butterscotch schnapps, and vodka and stir until blended. Fold whipped topping into pudding mixture until incorporated. Spoon the pudding mixture into shot glasses or disposable 'party shot' cups. 0.75 cup milk 1 (3.4 ounce) package butterscotch instant pudding mix 0.5 cup sour apple schnapps (such as DeKuyper® Sour Apple Pucker ®) 2 tablespoons butterscotch schnapps (such as DeKuyper® Buttershots®) 2 tablespoons vodka 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed Inspired by Jell-O® shots, these caramel apple pudding shots pack a wallop and are not for the kids!

title: Orange Milkshake
text: Combine orange juice, ice cream, milk, and sugar in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour milkshake into a glass. 1.5 cups orange juice 2 scoops vanilla ice cream 0.5 cup milk 2 teaspoons white sugar Orange juice gives a traditional vanilla milkshake an extra citrusy kick in this quick and easy orange milkshake recipe everyone loves.

title: Honey Limeade
text: In a pitcher, combine lime juice, water, sugar and honey. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Chill in refrigerator. 1 cup lime juice 5 cups water 0.66666698455811 cup white sugar 2 tablespoons honey A refreshing drink on a hot day. Lime juice and water, sweetened with sugar and honey.

title: Strawberry Cheesecake Jell-O Shots
text: Crush graham crackers in a blender or food processor; add melted butter and sugar and blend until evenly combined. Gently press graham cracker mixture into 12 tall shot glasses. Mix unflavored gelatin and 1/4 cup boiling water together in a bowl until well mixed. Combine cream cheese, confectioners' sugar, vanilla extract, and gelatin mixture in a blender; pulse a few times. Add 1 cup vodka; blend until smooth. Taste mixture and adjust confectioners' sugar if necessary. Pour cream cheese mixture over graham cracker layer, leaving about 1 inch on the top. Chill for at least 1 hour. Mix strawberry gelatin and 1/4 cup boiling water together in a bowl; stir well and add remaining 1/2 cup vodka and ice cubes. Stir until ice melts and mixture starts to thicken; pour over cream cheese mixture layer. Chill shots for at least 30 minutes. 6 graham crackers 2 tablespoons melted butter 1 teaspoon white sugar 1 (.25 ounce) package unflavored gelatin 0.25 boiling water 1 (12 ounce) container whipped cream cheese 0.33333334326744 cup confectioners' sugar, or more to taste 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 1.5 cups vodka, divided 0.5 (3 ounce) package strawberry flavored gelatin (such as Jell-O®) 0.25 cup boiling water 3 ice cubes Graham cracker crust is layered with vodka-infused cheesecake and strawberry gelatin in these adorable strawberry cheesecake Jell-O shots.

title: Italian Cream Soda
text: Fill a tall glass half full with ice. Fill to 2/3 with carbonated water. Pour in watermelon and passion fruit flavored syrups, then float the half-and-half cream on top. Stir when ready to drink. 8 fluid ounces carbonated water 0.75 fluid ounce passion fruit flavored syrup 0.75 fluid ounce watermelon flavored syrup 1 fluid ounce half-and-half cream A watermelon and passion fruit flavored Italian cream soda.

title: Whipped Hot Chocolate
text: Heat milk in a small saucepan over low heat until milk begins to steam. Whisk sugar, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, and salt into steamed milk until dissolved. Stir in chocolate until melted. Remove saucepan from heat; allow to cool slightly. Beat heavy cream in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Gently fold whipped cream into hot chocolate. Serve immediately. 1 cup milk 0.33333334326744 cup white sugar 2 tablespoons sweetened cocoa powder 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 pinch salt 2 (1 ounce) squares semisweet baking chocolate, broken into pieces 1 cup heavy cream Make whipped hot chocolate by gently folding fresh whipped cream into rich hot chocolate, perfect for a winter's night.

title: Hot Cider Punch
text: Stir the apple juice, pineapple juice, and cranberry juice together with the brown sugar in a large pan. Place the cinnamon sticks, cloves, and ground allspice into a large teaball or cheesecloth bag. Place the spice bag into the pan with the juice mixture. Heat the juice mixture over medium-high heat about 10 minutes. Serve hot. 3 cups apple juice 2.5 cups unsweetened pineapple juice 2 cups cranberry juice 0.25 cup brown sugar 2 cinnamon sticks 2 teaspoons whole cloves 2 teaspoons ground allspice A spicy blend of apple, pineapple, and cranberry juices, this hot punch seasoned with cinnamon sticks, cloves, and allspice makes a perfect holiday beverage.

title: Peppermint Hot Chocolate
text: Stir 2 tablespoons milk, cocoa powder, sugar, cinnamon, vanilla extract together in a mug until well blended. Microwave 3/4 cup milk on high for 2 1/2 minutes in a microwave-safe mug. Pour the hot milk over the cocoa mixture; stir with candy cane. 2 tablespoons milk 1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 pinch ground cinnamon 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.75 cup milk 1 peppermint candy cane Put together this easy peppermint hot chocolate recipe with flavors of cocoa, cinnamon, and vanilla to warm yourself on a chilly morning.

title: Beermosa
text: Pour beer into a glass and top with orange juice. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer 4 fluid ounces orange juice Beer and orange juice come together in this two-ingredient beermosa recipe, an excellent alternative to the traditional mimosa.

title: Orangemade
text: Pour the orange juice, lemon juice, and sugar into the bowl of a blender. Blend for 2 minutes to dissolve the sugar. Add the ice cubes, and blend until smooth and slushy. 2 cups orange juice 0.5 cup lemon juice 1.5 cups white sugar 2 cups ice cubes A slushy citrus drink that's a refreshing mix of orange juice and lemon juice. This recipe was created by kids, but is enjoyed by everyone!

title: Chocolate Pudding Shots
text: Beat cold milk and pudding mix in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and beginning to thicken, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in Irish cream liqueur and vodka, then fold in whipped topping until smooth. Spoon into 16 small cups. Serve immediately, or refrigerate or freeze until ready to serve. 0.75 cup cold milk 1 (3.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix 0.5 cup Irish cream liqueur 0.25 cup vodka 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed These chocolate pudding shots made with pudding mix, milk, vodka, and Irish cream liqueur are a fun alternative to Jell-O shots at your next party.

title: Spicy Orange-Mint Mocktail
text: Peel oranges, removing threads and seeds. Cut roughly into cubes. Transfer oranges into a blender with water, 3 mint leaves, lemon juice, black salt, and powdered sugar. Blend until smooth. Strain into a large glass over ice. Add jalapeno. Taste and adjust salt and sugar as needed. Stir continuously, 10 to 15 times. Add remaining mint leaves as garnish. 2 medium oranges 1 cup water 5 leaves fresh mint, or more to taste 1 lemon, juiced 0.125 teaspoon black salt (kala namak), or more to taste 0.125 teaspoon powdered sugar, or to taste 0.5 cup ice as needed 2 slices jalapeno pepper, or more to taste Jalapeno brings a spicy kick to this refreshing orange-mint mocktail that's perfect for summer entertaining.

title: Eggnog Milkshake
text: Combine eggnog, ice cream, and milk in a blender. Blend on high until incorporated. Pour into a glass, garnish with whipped cream, and dust with cinnamon if desired. 0.25 cup eggnog 1.75 cups butter pecan ice cream 0.25 cup 1% milk whipped cream as topping (optional) cinnamon A seasonal milkshake made with eggnog and butter pecan ice cream. Top with whipped cream and dust with cinnamon to be extra festive.

title: Iced Dirty Chai Latte
text: In a small saucepan over high heat, combine water, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger, allspice, and cardamom. Bring to a boil, then turn off heat and add tea bags. Allow to steep for about 5 minutes. Remove tea bags and allow to cool completely. Strain tea mixture into 2 ice filled glasses, then add espresso shots. Pour Almond Breeze Extra Creamy Almondmilk, and Almond Breeze Vanilla Almondmilk Creamer into glasses. 1 cup Almond Breeze Extra Creamy Almondmilk 2 Tbsp. Almond Breeze Vanilla Almondmilk Creamer 1 cup water ¼ cup brown sugar ½ tsp. ground cinnamon ½ tsp. ground ginger ¼ tsp. ground allspice ¼ tsp. ground cardamom 2 black tea bags Ice cubes 2 shots espresso, cooled The rich blend of spices in this chai latte make a wonderful aroma to pair with Almond Breeze Almondmilk and your favorite shots of espresso.

title: The Perfect Margarita
text: Gather all ingredients. Moisten the rim of a glass with a lime wedge. Sprinkle salt onto a plate. Lightly dip the moistened rim into the salt. Place a large ice cube in the glass and freeze the prepared glass until ready to serve. Fill a cocktail shaker with fresh ice. Add tequila, triple sec, and lime juice. Cover and shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain margarita into the chilled glass and garnish with a slice of lime. 1 wedge lime 1 teaspoon coarse sea salt, or as needed 1 large ice cube 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed 2 fluid ounces white tequila 1.5 fluid ounces triple sec 1 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lime juice 1 slice lime This margarita recipe uses fresh limes, white tequila, and high-quality triple sec. With the right ratios, you can easily make the perfect margarita!

title: Very Berry Tea Smoothie
text: Combine tea, berries, pineapple, banana, lemon juice, mint, and honey in a blender. Blend until smooth. 1 cup brewed black tea (such as Gold Peak®), chilled 1 cup frozen mixed berries 1 cup frozen pineapple chunks 1 banana, broken into chunks and frozen 0.5 lemon, juiced 3 fresh mint leaves, or more to taste 1 teaspoon honey Frozen berries are blended with banana, pineapple, and unsweetened tea creating a very berry smoothie perfect for on-the-go breakfast.

title: Negroni Sbagliato
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add Campari, vermouth, and agave. Shake well. Fill champagne glass 1/2 way with mixture and top it off with sparkling white wine or Prosecco. Stir and serve with an orange twist. ice as needed 1 fluid ounce Campari 1 fluid ounce dry vermouth 0.5 teaspoon agave nectar sparkling wine or Prosecco 2 orange twists A Negroni sbagliato ("mistaken Negroni") is made with sparkling wine instead of gin.

title: Jamaican Rum Punch
text: Gather all ingredients. Stir pineapple juice, orange juice, 151 proof rum, dark rum, coconut-flavored rum, lime juice, and grenadine syrup together in a punch bowl. Float orange slices, lime slices, and lemon slices in the punch.
