Ladle the punch into ice filled glasses, or chill the punch in the refrigerator until ready to serve. 2.5 cups pineapple juice 2.5 cups orange juice 1 cup 151 proof rum (such as Bacardi®) 0.5 cup dark rum (such as Meyer's®) 0.25 cup coconut-flavored rum (such as Malibu®) 0.25 cup fresh lime juice 3 tablespoons grenadine syrup 1 orange, sliced 1 lime, sliced 1 lemon, sliced A tropical rum punch made with three varieties of rum, pineapple juice, lime juice, and orange juice for a refreshingly fruity Caribbean cocktail.

title: Christmas Wassail
text: Pour apple cider, pineapple juice, and cranberry juice into a stockpot. Place orange slices, cinnamon sticks, allspice berries, and cloves in a muslin pouch or directly into the apple cider mixture. Bring apple cider mixture to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until flavors have blended, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove orange slices and spices before serving. 0.5 gallon apple cider 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 46 fluid ounces cranberry juice cocktail 1 orange, thinly sliced 5 cinnamon sticks 1 tablespoon whole allspice berries 1 tablespoon whole cloves A warm cup of Christmas wassail has plenty of spices and citrus and will fill you with joy from head to toe.

title: Citrus Lemonade
text: Pour the sugar, lemon juice, lime juice, and orange juice into a gallon-sized container; stir until the sugar has dissolved. Serve over ice with a slice of lime if desired. 1 cup white sugar, or to taste 4 lemons, juiced 4 limes, juiced 4 oranges, juiced 3 quarts cold water 1 lime, sliced into rounds 12 cups ice cubes Lemons, limes, and oranges combine to make this simple, refreshing cooler.

title: Healthy Chocolate Smoothie
text: Combine bananas, milk, ice cubes, cocoa powder, peanut butter, and vanilla in a blender; blend on high speed until smooth. Pour into 2 glasses. 2 very ripe bananas 1 cup milk 6 ice cubes 1.5 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder 1 tablespoon peanut butter 1 teaspoon vanilla extract This chocolate smoothie uses bananas, peanut butter, milk, vanilla, and cocoa for a healthy, kid-friendly beverage perfect for breakfast or a snack.

title: Homemade Hot Chocolate Stirrers
text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Spread crushed candy canes and marshmallows on 2 plates. Melt chocolate chips in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 15-second intervals, stirring after each interval, 1 to 3 minutes. Dip plastic spoons into the melted chocolate, covering the base completely, then cover with candy cane bits or mini marshmallows. Arrange on the parchment paper and freeze until set, about 15 minutes. 6 peppermint candy canes, crushed 1 (10.5 ounce) package miniature marshmallows 1 (12 ounce) package semisweet chocolate chips 30 plastic spoons Make your own hot chocolate stirrers topped with crushed candy canes or mini marshmallows using this quick and easy recipe.

title: Chocolate Chocolate Milkshake
text: Combine ice cream, diced chocolate, and 1/2 cup whipped cream in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into 2 glasses; garnish with chocolate shavings and 1/4 cup whipped cream. 2 cups premium quality chocolate ice cream 2 (1.65 ounce) bars dark chocolate candy bars, diced 0.5 cup whipped cream 1 tablespoon chocolate shavings, for garnish 0.25 cup whipped cream Chocolate ice cream, chocolate candy bar pieces, and whipping cream make this extra creamy chocolate milkshake recipe a chocolate lover's dream. Drizzle with chocolate syrup for an even more sensational chocolate treat.

title: Lemon Drop Shots
text: Combine vodka and lemon juice in a shot glass. Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon sugar on top. Place remaining 2 teaspoons sugar on a small plate; dip lemon wedges in sugar. Suck on a sugared lemon after drinking the shot. 0.75 fluid ounce vodka (such as Absolut®) 0.75 fluid ounce lemon juice 2.5 teaspoons white sugar, divided, or more to taste 1 lemon, cut into wedges A lemon drop shot is made by combining vodka and lemon juice. It's topped with sugar for a sweet and sour party drink that tastes just like the candy.

title: Gingerade
text: In a large punch bowl, combine the ginger ale, sugar, lemonade and ice. Stir to blend well and serve. 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles ginger ale 1 cup granulated sugar 1.5 cups prepared lemonade 2 cups ice Ginger ale and lemonade punch is an easy drink to make an is great at any party!

title: Mint-Chocolate Leprechaun Shots
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Add chocolate liqueur and peppermint schnapps. Shake vigorously for 2 to 3 minutes. Pour into glasses. Beat heavy cream and vanilla extract in a chilled glass or metal bowl using an electric mixer until frothy. Add confectioners' sugar gradually, continuing to beat until soft peaks form. Beat in enough food coloring to reach desired shade of green. Place a dollop of green whipped cream on top of each shot and garnish with shaved chocolate. 0.5 cup ice cubes 4.5 ounces chocolate liqueur (such as Godiva®) 1.25 fluid ounces peppermint schnapps 0.5 cup heavy whipping cream 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar 3 drops green food coloring, or as desired 0.5 (1.5 ounce) bar Chocolate shavings A chocolaty-minty drink to celebrate St. Patrick's Day made with chocolate liqueur and peppermint schnapps garnished with green whipped cream.

title: Tajin® Michelada
text: Pour Tajin® onto a small plate. Run 1 lime wedge around the edge of a pint glass, then invert glass onto the plate to create a salt rim. Fill glass about halfway with ice. Squeeze the same lime wedge into the glass. Add Maggi® Jugo, hot sauce, and any remaining Tajin® from the plate and stir with a spoon. Pour in tomato and clam juice cocktail and top with beer. Garnish with remaining lime wedge and serve immediately. 1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®) 0.5 lime, cut into 2 wedges ice as needed 0.75 teaspoon soy-based liquid seasoning (such as Maggi® Jugo) 0.75 teaspoon Mexican-style hot sauce (such as Valentina®) 3 fluid ounces tomato and clam juice cocktail (such as Clamato®) 1 (12 fluid ounce) bottle light Mexican beer (such as Modelo®) There are many different versions of Mexican michelada - this recipe uses Tajin®, Maggi® Jugo, and of course, Mexican beer.

title: The Real Mojito
text: Place mint leaves and 1 lime wedge into a sturdy glass. Use a muddler and crush to release mint oils and lime juice. Add remaining lime wedges and 2 tablespoons sugar, and muddle again to release the lime juice. Do not strain the mixture. Fill the glass almost to the top with ice. Pour in rum and fill the glass with club soda. Stir, taste, and add more sugar if desired. 10 fresh mint leaves 0.5 medium lime, cut into 3 wedges, divided 2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed 1.5 fluid ounces white rum 0.5 cup club soda, or as needed Considered Cuba's national drink, this mojito cocktail is a favorite with pirates, swashbucklers, and colorful characters in the Caribbean and beyond.

title: Lime Sherbet Punch
text: Scoop lime sherbet into a punch bowl; pour in ginger ale and pineapple juice. Stir well. Stir in maraschino cherries and float lemon and lime slices in the punch. 2 quarts lime sherbet 2 (2 liter) bottles ginger ale 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries, drained 1 lemon, sliced 1 lime, sliced A festive, tangy lime sherbert punch made with green sherbet, pineapple juice, and ginger ale that you can make for your guests in just a few minutes.

title: Old-Fashioned Swedish Glögg
text: Heat port wine in a large stockpot with a lid over medium heat until just below the simmering point. Add bourbon and rum; heat until just below simmering. Save the bottles and their caps for storing leftover glögg. Meanwhile, place cinnamon stick, orange peel, cloves, and cardamom pods in the center of the cheesecloth square. Gather edges of the cheesecloth and tie with kitchen twine to secure; set aside. When wine mixture is very hot but not boiling, carefully light it with a long-handled match. Wearing a heatproof cooking mitt, carefully pour sugar into the flames; let mixture burn for 1 minute. Place the lid on the stockpot to extinguish the flames and turn off the heat. Let mixture cool, covered, about 10 minutes. Add the cheesecloth spice bundle, raisins, and almonds to warm wine mixture; let it cool to room temperature, about 1 hour. Strain cooled glögg and reserve the raisins and almonds. To serve: Pour glögg into a saucepan and warm over medium-low heat until hot but not simmering, about 5 minutes. Ladle 3 ounces of warmed glögg into a small coffee cup or a small Swedish-style glögg mug, and garnish each serving with a few reserved raisins and almonds. 5 (750 milliliter) bottles port wine 1 (750 milliliter) bottle 100 proof bourbon whiskey 1 (750 milliliter) bottle white rum 1 (3 inch) cinnamon stick 1 (3 inch) strip of orange peel 4 whole cloves 3 whole cardamom pods, cracked 1 (8 inch) square of cheesecloth 0.75 cup white sugar 1 (15 ounce) package dark raisins 1 (6 ounce) package blanched slivered almonds Glögg is a fragrant Swedish spiced wine punch spiked with whiskey and rum. You'll feel the heat when you serve this mulled wine for the holidays!

title: Refreshingly Tart Lemonade Slushie
text: Place lemons, ice cubes, water, and white sugar in a blender; blend until a slushie consistency is reached, about 1 minute. 3 large lemons, peeled and seeded 10 ice cubes 0.5 cup water 0.5 cup white sugar, or to taste Take 5 minutes on a hot day and treat yourself to a cold and, indeed, refreshingly tart frozen slushie beverage that is full of real lemons.

title: Orangeade
text: Bring 2 cups water and sugar to a boil in a small saucepan; cook at a boil for 3 minutes, stirring to dissolve sugar, and creating a simple syrup. Combine simple syrup, 6 cups water, orange juice, and lemon juice in a large pitcher; refrigerate until cold. 2 cups water 1.5 cups white sugar 6 cups water 1.5 cups freshly squeezed orange juice 0.33333334326744 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice A refreshing 'ade' made with fresh-squeezed orange juice as well as lemon.

title: Quick Banana Milkshake (Ice Cream Free)
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine ice, milk, banana, sugar, and cinnamon in a blender; blend until smooth. 3 ice cubes 1 cup milk 1 banana 1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste 1 pinch ground cinnamon This banana shake is perfect if you don't have a lot of time or ingredients! It makes a quick breakfast or snack your whole family will love.

title: Margarita Jell-O® Shots
text: Combine boiling water and gelatin mix in a bowl. Stir to dissolve. Add tequila, triple sec, and water. Stir again. Pour mixture into shot glasses. Refrigerate until set, about 5 hours. 1 cup boiling water 1 (3 ounce) package lime-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) 0.33333334326744 cup tequila 0.33333334326744 cup triple sec 0.33333334326744 cup water 15 plastic shot glasses, or as needed If you love margaritas and want a fun happy hour treat, try these Jell-O® shots flavored with real tequila and triple sec.

title: Sparkling Hibiscus Cooler
text: Combine water, hibiscus petals, cinnamon, clove, allspice, and nutmeg in a medium pot. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Remove from heat and stir in sugar until dissolved, about 1 minute. Cool syrup to room temperature, about 1 hour. Refrigerate until ready to use. Make hibiscus coolers by filling 10 glasses with ice. Pour 3 fluid ounces hibiscus syrup into each glass; top with 8 fluid ounces sparkling water. Squeeze 1 lime wedge into each glass. 10 cups water 1 cup dried hibiscus petals 1 cinnamon stick 1 whole clove 1 whole allspice berry 0.125 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg 1.5 cups raw sugar ice cubes 2.5 (32 ounce) bottles sparkling water 2 limes, cut into wedges Make a big batch of sweet hibiscus syrup ahead of your next party and you'll have these sparkling coolers ready in no time!

title: Hot Spiced Christmas Wine
text: Use a sharp knife or a vegetable peeler to remove the zest from the oranges in strips, being careful to remove only the orange part, leaving the pith behind. Then, juice the oranges into a large, heavy-bottomed pot. Pour the red wine and white wine into the pot with the orange juice. Place the strips of orange zest, ginger, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and brown sugar into the pot with the wine mixture; stir to dissolve the sugar. Cover and heat over medium-high until heated through, but not boiling, reduce the heat to medium-low and heat for an hour or longer to bring all of the flavors together. Adjust the sweetness by adding more brown sugar, as necessary. Strain and serve hot with a splash of brandy, if desired. 2 oranges 2 (750 milliliter) bottles red wine 1 (750 milliliter) bottle white wine 1 (3 inch) piece of fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced 3 cinnamon sticks 0.5 teaspoon ground cloves 0.33333334326744 cup brown sugar, or to taste 0.25 cup brandy Mulled or spiced wine is served in many Western and Northern European countries as a part of winter celebrations. Warm your guests this winter with this wine spiced with orange, ginger, and cinnamon

title: Corpse Reviver No. 2
text: Place ice in a cocktail shaker. Pour in gin, Lillet, Cointreau, and lemon juice. Spoon absinthe in a cocktail glass, and swirl to coat sides of glass. Shake cocktail, and then strain into the glass. Garnish with a Maraschino cherry. Ice 1 fluid ounce gin 1 fluid ounce Lillet blanc 1 fluid ounce Cointreau 1 fluid ounce fresh lemon juice 0.125 teaspoon absinthe Maraschino cherry, for garnish This gin cocktail will bring you back to life, no doubt. It dates back to the 19th century.

title: Peanut Butter Mango Smoothie
text: Blend yogurt, banana, mango, and peanut butter together in a blender until smooth. 1 cup vanilla yogurt 1 banana, broken into chunks 0.5 cup frozen mango chunks 2 tablespoons peanut butter, or to taste Mango and peanut butter blend together to form this recipe for a kid-pleasing smoothie that adults will enjoy, too!

title: Quince Liqueur
text: Rub quince with a kitchen towel really well until skin is smooth. Cut unpeeled quince into small cubes. Peel lemon zest into spirals with a thin peeler. Squeeze lemons and measure 3/4 cup lemon juice. Combine quince, lemon zest, lemon juice, vodka, and sugar in a large jar with a tight-fitting lid. All ingredients need to be completely covered with liquid. Keep in a warm place or on a sunny window sill for 4 weeks, shaking occasionally. Line a sieve with a damp cheesecloth and strain liquid. Use a wooden spoon to press as much liquid out of quince pieces as possible. Pour strained quince liqueur into sterilized bottles and seal. For best results, allow to mature for 6 weeks in a cool place. 2 pounds ripe quinces 2 organic lemons 1.5 quarts vodka 1 pound white sugar Quince can easily be turned into delicious quince liqueur with some sugar, lemon, and vodka. Make sure you use organic lemons in this recipe.

title: Basic Coquito
text: Add cinnamon to a large bottle or other container that can hold at least 8 cups using a funnel. Pour sweetened condensed milk, cream of coconut, coconut milk, evaporated milk, and rum through the funnel. Shake or stir well to combine. Refrigerate coquito until chilled, at least 1 hour. Shake or stir before serving. 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (14 ounce) can cream of coconut, shaken very well before opening 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk, shaken very well before opening 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 1.5 cups rum (such as Bacardi®), or to taste Coquito is often considered the eggnog of Puerto Rico. Thick and rich with a coconut-milk base and flavored with cinnamon, coquito is festive and tropical at the same time.

title: Creamy Limoncello
text: Combine lemon zest and vodka in an airtight container. Cover and place in a cool, dark space, shaking the container to redistribute the lemon zest once a day for 5 days. Pour milk and sugar into a large pot and bringing to a low boil, stirring often, until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and allow milk mixture to cool to room temperature. Slowly strain vodka mixture into the milk using a sieve. Discard the lemon zest. Pour limoncello into a capped bottle and place in the freezer to chill for 1 hour. Serve cold. 8 lemons, zested 3 cups vodka 2 quarts 2% reduced fat milk 2 cups white sugar A delicious, lemony treat without the bite of regular limoncello.

title: Cucumber-Lime Tonic
text: Cut two thin slices from cucumber and set aside for garnish. Chop remaining cucumber into large chunks and place in blender with lime juice and sugar. Blend until smooth. Strain the cucumber mixture through a fine strainer into a jar. You should have about 8 ounces. Fill two glasses with ice. Divide the mixture between the glasses, about 4 ounces each. Top each glass with 4 ounces of tonic water. Garnish with a cucumber and lime slice and serve. 1 English cucumber, peeled 2 fluid ounces fresh lime juice 1 1/2 tablespoons sugar 2 cups ice, or as needed 8 fluid ounces tonic water 2 slices lime, for garnish This refreshing cucumber-lime tonic is a non-alcoholic spritzer, perfect for those who prefer no alcohol, and a fun addition to your backyard BBQ.

title: Red Sangria with Truvia® Natural Sweetener
text: Spiced Simple Syrup: Place all of the ingredients in a medium saucepot, stir. Place on high heat, bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat, allow to cool completely. Pour syrup through a strainer to remove spices. Pour syrup into a jar with lid and store refrigerated. Shake before using. Sangria: Combine wine, 3/4 cup spiced simple syrup, sparkling water, orange juice, and fruit slices. Stir briskly. Serve over ice in large red wine glasses. 1 cup water 0.25 cup Truvia® natural sweetener spoonable** 6 whole cloves 6 whole black peppercorns, crushed 3 whole allspice berries, crushed 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine 3/4 cup spiced simple syrup (recipe above) 3 cups sparkling water 0.25 cup fresh orange juice 1 orange, thinly sliced 1 lemon, thinly sliced 1 lime, thinly sliced 2 cups ice cubes The flavor of this red sangria is brimming with fruit and a spicy twist. Enjoy it over lots of ice on a hot summer night. Sweetened with Truvia® natural sweetener, this refreshing drink contains only 80 calories per serving.

title: Strawberry Acai Lemonade
text: Combine strawberries, lemon juice, acai powder, and 1 cup water in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into a pitcher and add remaining 2 cups water and 1 tablespoon sweetener. Add more sweetener according to sweetness desired. Serve over ice. 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries 0.5 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice 2 teaspoons acai powder 1 tablespoon stevia sweetener (such as Truvia®), or more to taste 3 cups water, divided ice as needed Fresh strawberries and acai powder add color and flavor to classic homemade lemonade.

title: Lebanese White Coffee
text: Divide orange blossom water between 2 tea cups. Add 1/2 cup boiling water to each cup and stir. Stir 1/2 teaspoon honey into each cup. Float a piece of orange blossom in each cup. Serve hot. 1 teaspoon orange blossom water 1 cup boiling water 1 teaspoon acacia honey 2 orange blossoms This non-coffee after-meal drink called Lebanese white coffee isn't coffee at all. It is a simple mixture of hot water, orange blossom water, and flavored honey.

title: Super Berry Slush
text: In a blender, combine the mixed berries, milk, honey and almonds. Cover, and blend until somewhat smooth. Spoon into bowls, and enjoy! 2 cups frozen mixed berries 2 cups milk 1 tablespoon honey 0.25 cup crushed sliced almonds A yummy, easy to prepare dessert that tastes fab! Frozen mixed berries are blended with milk, honey and almonds to make a guilt-free treat.

title: Easy Ginger Water
text: Combine chopped candied ginger slices and hot water in a bowl. Allow to steep for at least 20 minutes; the longer it steeps, the more pronounced the ginger flavor will be. Stir water and drain to remove candied ginger slices, reserving water into another container. Serve water heated like tea or drink cold. 5 slices candied ginger, coarsely chopped 3 cups very hot, but not boiling, water This is a super-easy and slightly sweetened ginger-infused water that can be served hot or iced.

title: Biscoff® Latte
text: Heat milk and brown sugar in a small saucepan until frothy, close to simmering. Reduce heat to low. Whisk in cookie butter and cinnamon, then mix in coffee. 0.5 cup milk 1 tablespoon brown sugar 1 tablespoon cookie butter (such as Biscoff®) 0.125 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 cup coffee This recipe gives your morning latte a fun twist with Biscoff® cookie butter and just a pinch of cinnamon.

title: Mocha au Lait Mix
text: In a medium bowl, combine milk powder, instant coffee, brown sugar and mini chocolate chips. Mix well and store in an airtight container. Instructions per serving: In a blender, combine 2/3 cup boiling water with 1/4 cup mix. Blend until frothy and serve in a mug. 1.5 cups dry milk powder 0.5 cup instant coffee granules 0.33333334326744 cup brown sugar 0.66666668653488 cup miniature semisweet chocolate chips This Mocha au Lait mix makes a great holiday gift, presented in a decorative holiday container or mug! Just make sure you remember to include the directions on a gift tag!

title: Sangria (White)
text: Stir white wine, rum, orange juice, and sugar together in a large pitcher until sugar is dissolved; add apple, lemon, and lime slices. Gently stir lemon-lime soda into the wine mixture. Put frozen grapes into serving glasses and pour sangria over the grapes. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle white wine 0.75 cup rum 0.5 cup orange juice 0.33333334326744 cup white sugar 1 green apple, cored and sliced 1 lemon, sliced 1 lime, sliced 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lemon-lime soda 1 cup seedless green grapes, or to taste, frozen This white sangria recipe uses white wine, rum, orange juice, citrus fruit, and frozen grapes for a refreshing Spanish summertime punch.

title: Old Virginia Wassail Cider
text: Combine apple cider, orange juice, pineapple juice, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and honey in a large stockpot over medium heat. Bring to a boil, then simmer over low heat, or transfer to a slow cooker to keep warm while serving. Strain out cinnamon sticks and cloves before serving if desired. 2 quarts apple cider 2 cups orange juice 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 2 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks 1 tablespoon whole cloves 0.5 cup honey A quick and delicious hot cider drink that's great for cold-weather entertaining. This old-fashioned wassail recipe is always a big hit with young and old!

title: Watermelon Fizz
text: Blend coconut water, watermelon, and stevia together in a blender until smooth. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add watermelon mixture. Cover shaker and shake until chilled; pour into a poco grande glass. 1 cup coconut water 0.5 cup watermelon puree 1 teaspoon stevia 0.5 cup ice cubes, or as desired Fresh watermelon, coconut water, and stevia are blended together and poured over ice in this refreshing summer mocktail.

title: Amy's Lavender Lemonade
text: Place ice cubes into a 2 quart pitcher. Place the lavender into a bowl, and pour boiling water over it. Allow to steep for about 10 minutes, then strain out the lavender and discard. Mix the sugar into the hot lavender water, then pour into the pitcher with the ice. Squeeze the juice from the lemons into the pitcher, getting as much juice as you can. Top off the pitcher with cold water, and stir. Taste, and adjust lemon juice or sugar if desired. Pour into tall glasses, pull up a lawn chair and a good book, and relax! 1 tray ice cubes 0.25 cup dried lavender 2 cups boiling water 0.75 cup white sugar 8 lemons 5 cups cold water, or as needed This is a fabulous summer drink! Lavender soothes and refreshes on a hot day, and the scent brings back fond summer memories. I can't seem to make enough of it for my family.

title: Exotic Fruit Drink
text: Put the orange juice, cranberry juice and lemon juice in 3 separate cups. Without mixing the juices, pour them into ice cube trays and freeze. When frozen, place one of each juice cube into a tall glass and fill the glass with carbonated water. 1 cup orange juice 1 cup cranberry juice 0.5 cup lemon juice 1 (32 fluid ounce) bottle carbonated water Orange, cranberry and lemon juices frozen into fruity ice cubes, then splashed with carbonated water.

title: Ponche de Crème (Trinidad's Eggnog)
text: Beat eggs and lime zest in a large bowl using an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Gradually pour in condensed milk while continuing to mix, and then pour in evaporated milk. Stir in rum and bitters and sprinkle with nutmeg. Transfer to a bottle and chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve over crushed ice. 6 large eggs, beaten 2 teaspoons grated lime zest 3 (14 ounce) cans sweetened condensed milk 0.75 cup canned evaporated milk 1.5 cups rum 1 tablespoon aromatic bitters 1 pinch freshly grated nutmeg Ponche de crème is Trinidad's traditional Christmas drink that's rich, creamy, and generously spiked with rum for a festive drink similar to eggnog.

title: Eggnog I
text: Beat eggs; mix in condensed milk, vanilla, quart of milk and salt. Beat the whipping cream until soft peaks form. Fold in to egg and milk mixture and sprinkle with nutmeg. Serve chilled. 6 eggs 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 quart milk 0.33333334326744 pint heavy whipping cream 1 pinch ground nutmeg 1 pinch salt No Christmas is complete without eggnog! Now you can make your own with this recipe using eggs, cream, and sweetened condensed milk.

title: Magic Bullet® Banana Chocolate Milkshake
text: Combine chocolate ice cream, milk, banana, ice cubes, sugar, and vanilla extract in a Magic Bullet® party mug. Blend until smooth, 1 to 2 minutes. 5 scoops chocolate ice cream (such as Nestle® Real Dairy) 0.5 cup milk 0.5 banana 4 ice cubes 0.5 teaspoon white sugar 0.125 teaspoon vanilla extract This chocolate ice cream-based milkshake with a nice light banana flavor can be whipped up in your Magic Bullet® in five minutes or less.

title: Classic Old Fashioned
text: Pour simple syrup, water, and bitters into a whiskey glass; stir to combine. Add ice cubes and pour in bourbon. Garnish with orange slice and maraschino cherry. 2 teaspoons simple syrup 1 teaspoon water 2 dashes bitters 1 cup ice cubes 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger bourbon whiskey 1 slice orange 1 maraschino cherry The old fashioned cocktail can be made with bourbon, rye, or blended whiskey. Serve over ice and garnish with an orange slice and a maraschino cherry.

title: Blackberry Liqueur
text: Combine blackberry juice, sugar, cloves, cinnamon stick, and lemon zest in a large saucepan. Slowly bring to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Strain to remove spices and add rum. Pour liqueur into a sterilized bottle and seal. Store in a cool, dark place. 4 cups unsweetened blackberry juice 2.5 cups white sugar 10 whole cloves 0.5 cinnamon stick 1 lemon, zested 4 cups rum This spiced homemade blackberry liqueur, also called creme de mure, is ready in 20 minutes, unlike other fruit liqueurs that need to ripen for weeks.

title: Old-Fashioned Lemonade
text: Juice lemons; you should have 1 cup juice. Combine juice, sugar, and water in a 1/2-gallon pitcher. Stir until sugar dissolves. Taste and add more water if desired. Chill and serve over ice. 6 lemons 1 cup white sugar 6 cups water, or more as needed A classic lemonade recipe to make all summer long, or anytime life gives you lemons! Just three ingredients needed for this crowd-pleasing pitcher.

title: Cool Watermelon Slushes
text: Place the ice cubes into a blender. Cover, and pulse until crushed. Add the watermelon and blend for about 1 minute, until slushy. Add the honey, and blend for about 10 seconds. 6 ice cubes 2 cups cubed seeded watermelon 1 teaspoon honey A Thailand watermelon slushie that is sweetened with honey. You may use sugar if you wish though.

title: Cider-Bourbon Thermos Cocktail
text: Bring cider and maple syrup just to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat. Add tea bags, ginger, and cardamom. Let stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Remove and discard tea bags and spices. Stir in bourbon and lemon juice. Transfer to a warmed 32- to 40-ounce thermos. 2.75 cups apple cider 0.25 cup pure maple syrup 3 bags cinnamon-flavored black tea 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger, sliced 3 cardamom pods, split 6 ounces bourbon 0.25 cup lemon juice Whether served hot or cold, this easy thermos cocktail with apple cider, tea, and bourbon is perfect for chilly nights.

title: Berrylicious Frozen Sangria Slush
text: Combine red wine, ice cubes, blueberries, raspberries, strawberries, orange-flavored liqueur, orange juice, and sugar in a blender; process until smooth. Serve immediately or freeze. 1 cup red wine 1 cup ice cubes, crushed 0.33333334326744 cup frozen blueberries 0.33333334326744 cup fresh raspberries 0.33333334326744 cup frozen strawberries 0.25 cup orange-flavored liqueur 0.5 orange, juiced 1 tablespoon white sugar, or more to taste Red wine, blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries and blended together creating a berrylicious sangria slush perfect for summer drinking.

title: All Natural Strawberry Lemonade
text: Place strawberries in a blender; top with 2 tablespoons sugar. Pour 1 cup water over sugared strawberries; blend until completely smooth. Transfer strawberry juice into a large pitcher; stir in remaining 6 cups water, lemon juice, and 1 cup sugar until well blended. Chill before serving. 8 large strawberries, halved 2 tablespoons white sugar 7 cups water, divided 2 cups freshly squeezed lemon juice 1 cup white sugar This homemade strawberry lemonade is easily prepared in a blender with fresh strawberries, lemon juice, and sugar for a refreshing summer drink.

title: Brown Sugar Latte
text: Combine milk, caramel sauce, and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Froth mixture using a stick blender. Pour hot milk mixture into a mug, holding back the foam with the back of a spoon. Add coffee and pour foam on top. 0.5 cup milk 1 tablespoon caramel sauce 1 tablespoon brown sugar 1 cup strong brewed coffee This brown sugar latte is flavored with caramel sauce and is a sweet alternative to a regular coffee latte.

title: Banana Milk Coffee
text: Combine milk, banana, and simple syrup in a blender; blend until very smooth, about 1 minute. Fill two 16-ounce glasses with ice cubes. Divide coffee between the glasses. Pour banana milk on top, dividing it evenly between the glasses. 1 cup milk 1 very ripe banana 1 tablespoon simple syrup ice cubes 1 cup cold brew coffee Milk and banana are blended together until creamy and poured over cold brew coffee and ice in this naturally sweetened breakfast in a cup.

title: The REAL Long Island Iced Tea
text: Gather all ingredients. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour vodka, rum, gin, tequila, triple sec, and sour mix over ice; cover and shake. Pour cocktail into a Collins or hurricane glass; top with splash of cola for color. Garnish with a lemon slice. Garnish with lemon slices and mint leaves! 0.5 fluid ounce vodka 0.5 fluid ounce rum 0.5 fluid ounce gin 0.5 fluid ounce tequila 0.5 fluid ounce triple sec (orange-flavored liqueur) 1 fluid ounce sweet and sour mix 1 fluid ounce cola, or to taste 1 lemon slice Use this recipe to make the REAL Long Island iced tea cocktail. Garnish with a lemon slice before taking a refreshing sip.

title: Christmas Cheer
text: Tie cloves, cardamom pods, allspice berries, and star anise together in a cheesecloth sachet. Combine apple cider, cranberry juice, and brown sugar together in a pot; bring to a simmer. Add cinnamon sticks, ginger, and spice sachet to cider mixture and steep for 20 minutes. Pour 1 fluid ounce bourbon into each mug and top off with spiced cider. Rub the edge of each mug with orange peel and drop into the drink. 10 whole cloves 8 cardamom pods, lightly crushed 8 whole allspice berries 2 whole star anise pods 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle apple cider 16 fluid ounces cranberry juice cocktail 0.25 cup brown sugar 2 cinnamon sticks 4.125 inch piece fresh ginger, cut into thin slices 10 fluid ounces bourbon 10 2-inch strips orange peel Spiced apple cider with a hint of bourbon is a warm way to spend the Christmas season.

title: The Arnold Palmer
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine lemonade and iced tea in a highball or tall glass. Add ice and stir until chilled. 5 fluid ounces prepared lemonade 5 fluid ounces prepared iced tea 1 cup ice The Arnold Palmer mocktail, named after the famous golfer, is a deliciously simple combo of iced tea and lemonade that'll cool you down on a hot day!

title: Irish Coffee
text: Combine Irish cream liqueur and Irish whiskey in a glass mug; pour in hot brewed coffee. Top with whipped cream and a dash of nutmeg. 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish whiskey 1 cup hot brewed coffee 1 tablespoon whipped cream 1 dash ground nutmeg Irish coffee is a classic cocktail that's easy to make with Irish whiskey, coffee, and whipped cream. Irish cream liqueur makes it even more luxurious!

title: Champagne Punch
text: In a large punch bowl, combine cranberry juice concentrate, pink lemonade concentrate, limeade concentrate, white wine, club soda, and champagne. Garnish with lemon slices and fresh mint leaves. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen cranberry juice concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen pink lemonade concentrate 1 (6 ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate 1 (750 milliliter) bottle white wine, chilled 1 liter carbonated water, chilled 2 (750 milliliter) bottles champagne, chilled 1 lemon - sliced, for garnish 0.5 cup fresh mint, garnish A refreshing punch made with cranberry juice, lemonade, white wine, club soda and champagne. Fruity, but not too sweet.

title: Coquito Coconut Eggnog
text: Pour coconut milk, almond milk, cream of coconut, rum, eggs, sugar, honey, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves into a large bowl and whisk well to combine. Blend mixture in two batches in a blender on high speed until frothy, 3 to 4 minutes. Pour into a gallon-size glass container and chill overnight or serve over ice. 4 cups unsweetened coconut milk 4 cups unsweetened almond milk 2 (15 ounce) cans cream of coconut 2 cups Puerto Rican white rum, or more to taste 8 eggs 1 cup turbinado sugar 1 cup honey 2 tablespoons vanilla extract 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.5 teaspoon ground cloves Puerto Rican rum is blended with flavors of coconut, almond, cinnamon, and vanilla in this unique non-dairy version of classic eggnog.

title: Never Bitter Lemonade
text: In a pot combine water, sugar and salt. Bring to a boil and continue to boil for 2 minutes. Chill the sugar water for at least 60 minutes in the refrigerator. In a 2 quart pitcher mix cooled sugar water and lemon juice together. Pour over ice and serve. 6 cups water 1 cup white sugar 0.125 teaspoon salt 0.5 cup fresh lemon juice Fresh lemon juice, water, sugar and salt (to remove bitterness) - call the kids in for a glass!

title: White Russian Pudding Shot
text: Beat milk and pudding mix together in a bowl using an electric mixer until pudding is thickened. Stir vodka and coffee-flavored liqueur into pudding; fold in whipped topping. Pipe or spoon pudding mixture into shot glasses. Freeze until ready to serve. 0.75 cup milk 1 (3.4 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix 0.25 cup vodka 0.5 cup coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed Vanilla pudding, vodka, and coffee-flavored liqueur are the perfect trio in this recipe for White Russian pudding shots.

title: Tepache
text: Chop pineapple into small segments, including the rind. You can remove the woody core from the segments if you wish. Add to a large container, e.g. a Mason jar with only a flat lid. The container needs to be able to expel the gas that will build up during fermentation, but also needs to be somewhat airtight to prevent the formation of vinegar. Crush ginger slightly with the side of a knife to open it up. Add ginger, brown sugar, habanero peppers, cinnamon, and water to the container. Stir to combine, cover, and let stand for 2 days in a warm place until mixture slightly fizzy and warm to the touch. Strain mixture through a fine-meshed sieve into fermentation-grade bottles. Cover and store in your refrigerator. Enjoy for up to 1 week. Tepache may continue to carbonate in the bottles while stored and explode if left too long. 1 whole pineapple 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger 1 cup brown sugar 2 habanero peppers, halved 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 8 cups water at room temperature A sensational Mexican street food, tepache is a lightly fermented spicy pineapple drink you can easily make at home.

title: Dairy-Free Almond Joy® Hot Chocolate
text: Stir coconut-almond milk blend, cocoa powder, maple syrup, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and salt together in a saucepan over medium heat; stir with a whisk to dissolve solids while the mixture heats to your desired temperature. 1 cup coconut-almond milk blend 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder 1.5 teaspoons maple syrup 1.5 tablespoons brown sugar 1 splash vanilla extract 1 pinch salt This hot chocolate recipe uses milk substitute of coconut-almond milk blend to achieve a hot chocolate evocative of the Almond Joy® candy bar.

title: Cranberry Sangria
text: Place the sugar, tea bags, lemon slices, cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and water into a saucepan, and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let mixture cool. Strain out and discard the spices, lemon, and tea bags. Pour the white wine into a large jar or covered container, and mix with the tea mixture. Stir in apples and cranberries; mix in the apple brandy. Chill in refrigerator 24 to 48 hours. Serve cold. 1 cup white sugar 4 cranberry-flavored tea bags 4 slices fresh lemon 6 whole cloves 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.25 teaspoon ground ginger 1.5 cups water 2 (750 milliliter) bottles white wine 4 apples, cored and cut into chunks 1.5 cups dried cranberries 2 fluid ounces apple brandy A spiced cranberry-apple wine punch makes a festive drink to toast the winter holidays. Chill the sangria for a day or so to blend the flavors.

title: Apple Orchard Punch
text: In a large punch bowl, combine apple juice, cranberry juice concentrate and orange juice. Stir until dissolved, then slowly pour in the ginger ale. Thinly slice the apple vertically, forming whole apple slices. Float apple slices on top of punch. 1 (32 fluid ounce) bottle apple juice, chilled 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen cranberry juice concentrate 1 cup orange juice 1.5 liters ginger ale 1 apple A non-alcoholic punch combining apple, cranberry and orange juices with ginger ale.

title: Key Lime Pie Shake
text: Add ice cream, milk, key lime juice, 1 graham cracker square, and sweetened condensed milk to the jar of a blender. Blend on high until smooth. Pour milkshake into a glass; top with whipped cream and zest. To garnish, break remaining graham square in half, and place one graham into whipped cream, then crumble remaining graham over milkshake. Cut a lime wedge and tuck into whipped cream. 1 1/3 cup vanilla ice cream 1/4 cup 1% milk 2 tablespoons Key lime juice 2 squares graham crackers, divided 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk 2 tablespoons whipped cream 1/4 teaspoon zest and 1 wedge from 1 Key lime This scrumptious Key lime pie shake has all the elements of the famous pie. It sure is a tasty treat on a hot summer day.

title: Jill's Summer Sangria
text: In a large pitcher, mix the red wine, 2 cups rum, 2 cups orange juice, and sugar. Refrigerate 8 hours, or overnight. In a large bowl, mix the strawberries, pineapple chunks, and maraschino cherries. Cover with 2 cups rum and 2 cups orange juice. Refrigerate 8 hours, or overnight. Drain the fruit (reserve the liquid if desired). Mix the fruit into the pitcher with the sangria to serve. 2 (750 milliliter) bottles red wine 2 cups rum 2 cups orange juice 1 cup white sugar 1 pint fresh strawberries, sliced 1 (20 ounce) can pineapple chunks in juice 1 (10 ounce) jar maraschino cherries, drained 2 cups rum 2 cups orange juice Wonderful drink for the summer or for a holiday party!

title: French 75 Jell-O Shots
text: Pour boiling water over lemon-flavored gelatin in a glass measuring cup; stir to combine. Stir in gin. Pour mixture into sixteen 2-ounce cups. Arrange cups in muffin tins, tilted to one side. Refrigerate until set, about 4 hours. Combine 1 1/4 cup sparkling wine and unflavored gelatin in a small pot. Let sit, about 3 minutes. Heat over low heat, stirring constantly, until gelatin is dissolved, 3 to 5 minutes. Add remaining 1/2 cup wine and food coloring; stir to combine. Remove muffin tins from refrigerator. Set cups upright; pour wine mixture over lemon mixture. Return to the refrigerator and chill until set, about 4 hours. 1 cup boiling water 0.5 (3 ounce) package lemon-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) 0.25 cup gin 1.75 cups sparkling wine, divided 3 (.25 ounce) envelopes unflavored gelatin 1 drop red food coloring These red and yellow Jell-O shots inspired by the French 75 cocktail are an easy make-ahead treat for your Game Day party.

title: Overnight Eggnog
text: Combine milk, cinnamon, vanilla, and cloves in a medium pot over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring every so often, until spices become one with the milk, 3 to 5 minutes. Be sure to stir from the bottom of the pot so the milk doesn't burn. Meanwhile, whisk egg yolks and cane sugar together in a large mixing bowl until pale yellow, thick, and smooth. Remove milk mixture from the stove. Pour some of the hot milk into the egg yolk mixture, whisking quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs. Continue, pouring a little bit at a time and whisking, until all has been added. Pour the mixture back into the pot and place over medium heat. Stir constantly with a spatula until eggnog thickens and becomes light beige in color, about 5 minutes; it should leave a slight film on the spatula. Remove from the heat. Pour whipping cream and nutmeg into a pitcher. Pour eggnog mixture into the whipping cream and mix with the spatula to combine. Place in the refrigerator, 8 hours to overnight for best enjoyment. Stir before serving. 4 cups whole milk 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 1 teaspoon ground cloves 12 large egg yolks 1 cup cane sugar 1 pint whipping cream 1.5 teaspoons ground nutmeg Whether you enjoy your eggnog with or without alcohol, this easy overnight eggnog recipe is certainly one to try this holiday season.

title: Champurrado
text: Place water, cinnamon stick, clove, and star anise in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil. Remove from heat and allow spices to steep until water is fragrant, about 10 minutes; strain. Heat milk, chocolate, and pinole in a separate saucepan over medium heat, whisking until chocolate is dissolved and liquid is thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat; add piloncillo and let rest until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes more. Pour cinnamon water into chocolate mixture and stir to combine. 1.5 cups water 1 cinnamon stick 1 whole clove 1 pod star anise 4.25 cups milk 2 tablets Mexican chocolate (such as Chocolate Ibarra®) 0.75 cup pinole (coarse ground maize flour) 1 pinch crushed piloncillo (Mexican brown sugar cone), or more to taste Champurrado is a hot chocolate based drink made with Mexican chocolate, pinole (ground maize flour), and spices to create a deliciously rich festive drink.

title: Gin Slush
text: Stir together water and sugar in a large pot; bring to a boil. Boil for 15 minutes, remove from heat, and allow to cool. Stir in gin, orange juice concentrate, and lemonade concentrate. Pour into a plastic container and freeze for 8 hours to overnight. 9 cups water 2 cups white sugar 2 cups gin 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate A frozen citrus slushie with gin. Mix with lemon-lime soda to serve.

title: Christmas Poinsettia Punch
text: Combine cranberry juice, club soda, vodka, Champagne, and cranberries in a punch bowl. 48 fluid ounces cranberry juice, chilled 1 liter club soda, chilled 1 (750 milliliter) bottle orange-flavored vodka, chilled 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Champagne, or more to taste 0.5 cup fresh cranberries This poinsettia punch with vodka, cranberry juice, Champagne, club soda, and cranberries is a beautiful and delicious addition to your holiday table.

title: Vegetable and Fruit Juice
text: Place a collection container under the exit spout of a juicer; turn the juicer on. Place carrots into the feeding chute; insert the food pusher and gently guide carrots down the chute. Repeat with strawberries, tomato, bell pepper, apple, lime, and ginger. Turn off the juicer. Stir juice in the collection container and serve. 3 large carrots 8 large strawberries 1 large tomato 1 large red bell pepper, stemmed and seeded 1 medium apple 1 medium lime, sliced 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger Try this vegetable juice recipe when you need a tasty treat or pick-me-up. Carrots, tomato, and bell pepper are sweetened naturally with strawberries and apple.

title: Banana Milkshake
text: Mix banana and milk together in a cup or bowl until desired consistency is reached. 1 frozen banana, partially thawed and mashed 0.5 cup milk, or more to taste Skip the takeout window at Sonic for a banana milkshake, and use this recipe to make your own copycat version with milk and a frozen banana.

title: Coffee Slush
text: Mix cream, coffee, sugar, and vanilla extract together in a freezer-safe container. Cover container and freeze until coffee mixture is solid, at least 3 hours. Remove container from freezer and defrost in room temperature for 1 hour. Break coffee mixture apart with a fork creating a slush-like consistency. Transfer to a punch bowl or large pitcher. 3 pints half-and-half cream 3 cups cold brewed coffee 2 cups white sugar 2 tablespoons vanilla extract Impress your guests with homemade sweet coffee slushes with just the right amount of cream and sugar.

title: Coquito de Puerto Rico
text: Place cream of coconut, condensed milk, evaporated milk, coconut rum, water, ice cream, and vanilla extract in a blender. Blend until smooth and well-combined, about 3 minutes. Pour coconut mixture into two 20-ounce glass bottles or jars. Add 1 cinnamon stick and 1 clove to each container; shake well. Chill coquito 8 hours to overnight. Shake container before pouring coquito into shot glasses or small cups. Sprinkle cinnamon or nutmeg on top before serving. 1 (15 ounce) can cream of coconut 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk 1 cup coconut-flavored rum (such as Bacardi®) 0.25 cup water 1 scoop vanilla bean ice cream 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 cinnamon sticks 2 whole cloves 1 pinch ground cinnamon 1 pinch ground nutmeg This egg-free version of Coquito, a Puerto Rican coconut rum cocktail served at Christmas, is sure to be a hit at your next holiday party.

title: Tequila Orange Fizz
text: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Add orange juice and tequila and top with mineral water. Garnish with orange wedge. If desired, sprinkle a pinch of salt over top. 1 cup ice, or as needed 1 fluid ounce freshly-squeezed orange juice 1 1/2 fluid ounces anejo tequila 4 fluid ounces sparkling mineral water (such as Topo Chico®) 1 orange wedge flaked salt (optional) This tequila orange fizz, a spin on Ranch Water, elevates your anejo tequila, for those times when you want a little something more than tequila on the rocks. The orange is subtle but compliments the warm, oaky notes of a good aged tequila.

title: Tropical Matcha Cocktail
text: Pour vodka, pineapple juice, lime juice, and matcha powder into a cocktail shaker. Add ice, cover and shake until chilled. Strain into a coupe or rocks glass. Garnish with mint and lime. Serve immediately. 1 ounce vodka 2 ounces pineapple juice ½ ounce fresh lime juice ¼ teaspoon ceremonial-grade matcha powder 1 cup ice 1 mint sprig for garnish 1 lime wedge for garnish This verdant vodka-based cocktail packs a flavorful punch, thanks to the star ingredient, matcha powder.

title: Tito's Berry Lemonade
text: Lightly muddle berries into a glass. Add Tito's Handmade Vodka, lemonade, and ice. Stir and garnish with a strawberry or lemon slice. 1.5 ounces Tito's Handmade Vodka 4 ounces lemonade Fresh berries, sliced or whole A refreshing cocktail mixed with fresh berries, lemonade, and Tito's Handmade Vodka. Garnish with a lemon slice or add more strawberries.

title: Vanilla Apple Pie Moonshine
text: Combine apple juice, apple cider, white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, vanilla extract, and cloves together in a large pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until sugars are dissolved, about 20 minutes. Remove pot from heat and cool completely, about 1 hour. Stir grain alcohol and vodka into apple juice mixture. Remove cinnamon sticks and set aside. Pour moonshine into bottles; add 1 cinnamon stick per bottle and seal. Store moonshine in refrigerator. 1 gallon apple juice 1 gallon apple cider 3 cups white sugar 1 cup brown sugar 12 cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 whole cloves 1 (1 liter) bottle 151 proof grain alcohol (such as Everclear®) 2 cups cake-flavored vodka (such as UV®) Apple pie-flavored moonshine made with cake-flavored vodka is a tasty way to keep warm during the holiday months.

title: Pink Champagne Mocktail
text: Combine ginger ale, cranberry juice, pineapple juice, and orange juice concentrate in a large punch bowl. Stir in ice. 2 quarts ginger ale 1 (46 fluid ounce) bottle cranberry juice 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate ice cubes Pineapple juice, cranberry juice, orange juice concentrate, and ginger ale combine in this sweet and fizzy non-alcoholic Champagne mocktail.

title: Christmas Creamy Eggnog
text: In a large mixing bowl, beat egg yolks until they are thickened and light. Gradually stir in condensed milk, sugar, vanilla, and milk. Beat egg whites until stiff, then add them to milk mixture. Stir rum into mixture to taste. Garnish with nutmeg. 4 egg yolks 1 (5 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 4.5 cups milk 4 egg whites 1 fluid ounce rum 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg This rich and creamy drink was especially designed for cold Christmas nights.

title: Japanese Oyster Shooters
text: Whisk together mirin, sake, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, and wasabi powder in a bowl. Allow mixture to sit at room temperature until sediments sink to the bottom of the bowl, about 2 hours. Shuck oysters; place 2 oysters in each shooter glass. Ladle 2 tablespoons mirin mixture into each glass, without disturbing sediments at the bottom. Crack 1 quail egg into each glass. Top each with 1/8 teaspoon tobiko and garnish with lemon wedges. Serve immediately. 0.5 cup mirin (Japanese sweet wine) 3 tablespoons sake 2 tablespoons soy sauce 1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar 1 teaspoon wasabi powder 12 fresh oysters 6 quail eggs 0.75 teaspoon tobiko (flying fish roe) 6 lemon wedges Impress guests with Japanese oyster and quail egg shots, with sweet and salty flavors that come together in a taste explosion!

title: Easy Christmas Punch
text: Mix pineapple juice, orange juice, lemonade, and water in a large punch bowl. Stir in ginger ale and lemon-lime soda. 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 4 cups orange juice 1 (12 ounce) can lemonade 2 cups water 1 liter ginger ale 0.5 liter lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®) This fruity, sparkling punch will bring plenty of holiday cheer to your next gathering.

title: Orangey Pink Lemon Slush
text: Blend ice cubes, pink lemonade, clementine, lemon, and sugar in a blender until smooth. 12 ice cubes 1 cup pink lemonade 1 clementine, peeled and segmented 0.5 lemon, peeled 1.5 teaspoons white sugar Pink lemonade slushies are quick and easy to prepare with 5 simple ingredients and are perfect for hot summer afternoons.

title: Jungle Juice for a Crowd
text: Pour the rum, vodka, grain alcohol, cranberry juice, soda, and grape juice into a huge punch bowl or a clean ice chest. Add the strawberries, kiwis, oranges, grapes, and watermelon, and stir to mix. 2 (750 milliliter) bottles rum 1 (750 milliliter) bottle vodka 1 (750 milliliter) bottle 190 proof grain alcohol 1 gallon cranberry juice 1 (2 liter) bottle chilled lemon-lime soda 1 quart grape juice 4 cups halved fresh strawberries 12 kiwis, peeled and quartered 6 oranges, peeled and segmented 1 bunch grapes, separated and rinsed 1 large watermelon, cubed and seeded This crowd pleasing recipe for jungle juice, fruit-filled punch, includes kiwis, strawberries, watermelon, rum, vodka, and Everclear®.

title: Thick Chocolate Shake
text: In a blender, combine the ice cream, milk, chocolate drink mix and powdered egg whites. Cover, and blend until smooth. You may need to stop and stir once or twice to get it evenly mixed. The shake will be very thick. 2 cups vanilla ice cream 0.5 cup whole milk 0.25 cup powdered chocolate drink mix 1 teaspoon powdered egg whites This is something my mom use to make for us kids as a cool treat on a warm day. It is a rich chocolate treat.

title: Bananerberry Smoothie
text: In a blender combine strawberries, banana, peaches, apples, and ice cream. Blend until smooth. Add ice, pour in milk and blend again until smooth. Serve immediately. 1 cup fresh strawberries 1 banana, sliced 1 cup fresh peaches 1 cup apples 1.5 cups vanilla ice cream 1.5 cups ice cubes 0.5 cup milk Strawberries, bananas, peaches, and apples blended with vanilla ice cream for a delightful fruit smoothie.

title: Bourbon Slush
text: Mix together pineapple juice, tea, whiskey, sugar, lemonade concentrate, and orange juice concentrate in a large bowl or container. Pour into shallow bowls or dishes. Freeze for 8 hours to overnight. Remove frozen mixture from the freezer and let stand at room temperature for about 10 minutes. Chop with a wire whisk or potato masher to make a slushy consistency. Place scoops of frozen slush into glasses. Top each off with lemon-lime soda. 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 2 cups strong brewed black tea 2 cups bourbon whiskey 1.5 cups white sugar 1 (12 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage This bourbon slush is a frozen blend of pineapple juice, orange juice and lemonade concentrates, tea, sugar, and whiskey, topped with lemon-lime soda.

title: Luscious Slush Punch
text: Bring water, sugar, and strawberry-flavored gelatin to a boil in a large saucepan; boil for 3 minutes. Stir in pineapple juice, lemon juice, and orange juice. Divide mixture into two separate containers and freeze. Combine contents of 1 container frozen juice mixture with 1 bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage in a punch bowl; stir until slushy. Repeat with remaining portions as needed. 6 cups water 2.5 cups white sugar 2 (3 ounce) packages strawberry flavored Jell-O® mix 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 0.66666668653488 cup lemon juice 1 quart orange juice 2 (2 liter) bottles lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage A perfect punch for kids and adults alike. This fruity, fizzy, slushy pineapple-strawberry punch recipe makes enough to refresh a big crowd.

title: Hot Cocoa Mix in a Jar
text: Make two tags with the following instructions: "Hot Cocoa: Dissolve 1/3 cup cocoa mix in 1 cup boiling water." Whisk powdered milk, drink mix, pudding mix, powdered creamer, confectioners' sugar, and cocoa together in a large bowl. Divide mixture between two 1-quart jars. Seal the jars, decorate as desired, and attach the tags. 6.5 cups powdered milk 1 cup powdered chocolate drink mix 1 (5 ounce) package non-instant chocolate pudding mix 0.5 cup powdered non-dairy creamer 0.5 cup confectioners' sugar 0.5 cup unsweetened cocoa powder Dress up this hot cocoa mix in a jar for a fun holiday gift! We love to take these to holiday parties and on camping trips for a quick hot chocolate by the fire.

title: Jolly Rancher-Infused Vodka
text: Place candies in a container with a lid and add vodka. Seal the container and place in a cool, dark place, shaking vigorously 1 to 2 times per hour, until candy has dissolved, 3 to 4 hours. Stir sugar into vodka mixture until dissolved. Serve chilled. 20 pieces fruit-flavored hard candy (such as Jolly Rancher®) 1.25 cups vodka 1 tablespoon white sugar Jolly Rancher-infused vodka adds a fun color and flavor to any adult cocktail. Try different colors and flavors!

title: Flaming Doctor Pepper
text: Fill a pint glass half full with beer. Pour amaretto into a standard shot glass; pour rum on top so that it floats. Light the shot on fire; carefully drop the lit shot into the half-full glass of beer and drink. 1 cup beer 1 fluid ounce amaretto liqueur 0.25 fluid ounce 151 proof rum A Flaming Dr. Pepper is made with a shot of amaretto and high-proof rum, set alight, and dropped into a glass of beer for a sweet and fiery shooter.

title: Tamarind Margarita
text: Sprinkle chili-lime seasoning onto a plate. Moisten the rim of a glass with the lime wedge. Press the moistened rim into the seasoning. Fill glass with ice. Fill a cocktail shaker half-full with ice. Add tamarind paste, tequila, agave nectar, lime juice and triple sec to the shaker. Seal and shake vigorously until outside is frosted, 10 to 15 seconds. Strain mixture into the glass. Garnish with the lime wedge. 1 tablespoon chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®) 1 lime wedge 2 cups ice, or as needed 2 fluid ounces tamarind paste concentrate 1 1/2 fluid ounces silver tequila 1 fluid ounce agave nectar 1 fluid ounce lime juice 1/2 fluid ounce triple sec This tamarind margarita is a sweet-tart twist on a classic margarita made with tamarind paste.

title: Vodka Martini Cocktail
text: Gather ingredients. Combine vodka and dry vermouth in a cocktail mixing glass. Fill with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with three olives on a toothpick. 3 fluid ounces vodka 1 fluid ounce dry vermouth 1 cup ice cubes 3 small olives A vodka martini is a classic cocktail made with vodka and dry vermouth, served ice cold in a chilled martini glass, with green olives or a lemon twist.

title: Ginger-Turmeric Herbal Tea
text: Bring water to a boil in a small saucepan; add turmeric, ginger, and cinnamon. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes. Strain tea into a large glass; stir in honey and serve with lemon wedge. 2 cups water 0.5 teaspoon ground turmeric 0.5 teaspoon chopped fresh ginger 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 tablespoon honey 1 lemon wedge This ginger turmeric tea is a tasty way to add anti-inflammatory spices to your diet. Warm yourself up with this soothing drink sweetened with honey.

title: Wolf's Light Irish Cream
text: Stir sugar, 2 1/2 teaspoons water, cocoa powder, and salt in a small saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve sugar and salt. Let cool and stir in 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract.nn Whisk confectioners' sugar, both amounts of dry milk powder, and 1/2 cup water in a small saucepan, bring to a boil, and reduce heat to low. Simmer mixture until smooth and thick, stirring often, 15 to 20 minutes. Set aside to cool and stir cream of coconut into milk mixture.nn Combine chocolate syrup, milk mixture, Irish whiskey, half-and-half, instant coffee, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and almond extract in a blender; blend on high speed for 30 seconds. Bottle mixture and refrigerate. Liqueur will stay fresh in refrigerator at least 2 months. Shake bottle well before serving.nn 2.5 teaspoons white sugar 2.5 teaspoons water 1.5 teaspoons unsweetened cocoa powder 1 tiny pinch salt 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.75 cup confectioners' sugar 1 cup nonfat dry milk powder 2 teaspoons nonfat dry milk powder 0.5 cup water 1 tablespoon cream of coconut (such as Coco Lopez®) 1.6666667461395 cups Irish whiskey (such as Jameson®) 1 cup half-and-half 1 teaspoon instant coffee (such as Folgers®) 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 teaspoon almond extract Make your own Irish cream liqueur with this tasty recipe that includes whiskey, half-and-half, and a touch of coffee, chocolate, and vanilla flavors.

title: Mind Eraser
text: Fill an 8-ounce old-fashioned glass with ice. Pour coffee-flavored liqueur into the glass. Carefully pour soda over the back of a spoon into the glass so it layers on top. Repeat with vodka. 1 cup ice, or as needed 2 fluid ounces coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) 2 fluid ounces lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®) 2 fluid ounces vodka A layered mind eraser cocktail is equal parts Kahlua, Sprite, and vodka. Make it into a shot using 1/2 ounce of each of the three ingredients.

title: Honey Lemonade
text: Combine 1 cup water and honey in a pot over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until well combined. Remove from heat and let cool, 15 to 20 minutes. Transfer cooled honey syrup to a pitcher and add remaining 2 1/2 cups water and lemon juice; stir to combine. Taste and adjust accordingly. 3.5 cups water, divided 1 cup honey 1.5 cups lemon juice Naturally sweetened with a homemade honey syrup, this easy, 3-ingredient honey lemonade is perfect for summer sipping with friends and family.

title: Watermelon Strawberry Mango Lemonade Smoothie
text: Blend watermelon, water, strawberries, mango, sugar, and lemon juice in a blender until smooth, about 5 minutes. 8 cups cubed seeded watermelon 2 cups water 1 cup strawberries 1 cup chopped mango 1 cup white sugar 0.5 cup lemon juice Watermelon, strawberries, and mango are blended a good amount of lemon juice creating a sweet and tasty on-the-go lemonade smoothie.

title: Hot Spiced Tea for the Holidays
text: Pour water into a pot; add cloves and cinnamon stick. Bring water to a boil; remove from heat. Add tea bags to water and set aside to steep until the tea is to your preferred strength, at least 5 minutes. Remove and discard cloves, cinnamon stick, and tea bags. Stir orange juice, sugar, pineapple juice, and lemon juice together in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Cook and stir the juice mixture until the sugar dissolves completely. Pour juice mixture into the spiced tea; serve hot. 6 cups water 1 teaspoon whole cloves 1 (1 inch) piece cinnamon stick 6 tea bags (such as Lipton®) 0.75 cup orange juice 0.5 cup white sugar 0.25 cup pineapple juice 2 tablespoons lemon juice This spiced tea recipe calls for tea to be brewed with cloves and cinnamon before being mixed with fruit juices for a comforting Christmas beverage.

title: Boston Iced Tea
text: Put water in large pot, and heat on high until boiling. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add teabags and let steep until desired strength is acquired. Stir in cranberry juice concentrate, and allow to cool. 1 gallon water 1 cup white sugar 15 tea bags 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen cranberry juice concentrate A big pot of tea flavored with cranberry juice. Delicious and refreshing!

title: Banana Peanut Butter Smoothie
text: Blend almond milk, banana, ice, peanut butter, cocoa powder, and cinnamon together in a blender until smooth. 1 cup unsweetened almond milk 1 frozen banana, sliced 0.5 cup ice, or as needed 2 tablespoons powdered peanut butter 1 tablespoon cocoa powder 1 teaspoon cinnamon This delicious banana peanut butter smoothie is made with powdered peanut butter, cocoa, and a touch of cinnamon.

title: Java Chip Frappe
text: Combine ice, coffee, Almond Breeze Original Almondmilk, Almond Breeze Vanilla Almondmilk Creamer, chocolate syrup and chocolate chips in a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve in glasses. 1½ cups Almond Breeze Original Almondmilk 2 Tbsp. Almond Breeze Vanilla Almondmilk Creamer 3 cups ice cubes 1½ cups strong brewed coffee, cooled ¼ cup chocolate syrup ½ cup semi-sweet chocolate chips Skip your regular cup of coffee and try this delicious and refreshing frappe blended with coffee and chocolate to kickstart your day.

title: Cranberry Wassail
text: In a large saucepan or pot, combine cider, cranberry juice, lemon juice, pineapple juice, orange slices, cloves, honey, sugar, and cinnamon sticks. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer; add nutmeg, ginger, and allspice. Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve warm and garnish each cup with mint and an orange slice. 0.5 gallon apple cider 0.5 gallon cranberry juice 1 cup lemon juice 1.25 cups pineapple juice 1 large orange, thinly sliced 24 whole cloves 0.25 cup clover honey 0.5 cup white sugar 4 cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg 1 teaspoon ground allspice 0.5 teaspoon ground ginger 12 fresh mint leaves 12 orange slices for garnish Wassail is a hot spiced punch often served for winter celebrations, with historic roots in Northern Europe. This version adds cranberry and pineapple to the traditional cider base for the wassail.

title: Iced Horchata Coffee
text: Combine rice, water, and almonds in a blender. Blend the mixture until well combined, about 2 minutes. The mixture will be coarse. Strain mixture through a fine sieve or cheesecloth into a pitcher; discard solids. Stir in cold brew concentrate and blue agave. Serve over ice. Garnish with cinnamon sticks. 1 cup uncooked white rice 2 cups water 0.5 cup raw almonds 16 ounces Gevalia® Cold Brew Concentrate - House Blend 1 tablespoon blue agave nectar ice cubes 4 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks Iced cold brew coffee with strained rice-almond water makes a delicious Mexican-inspired hot-weather beverage in this coffee horchata recipe with cinnamon.

title: Cocoa Tea Mix Recipe
text: Pour boiling water into a mug and steep tea bag, about 2 minutes. Remove tea bag; add milk, hot cocoa mix, and sugar. Stir until well-blended, about 20 seconds. 1.5 cups boiling water 1 Earl Grey tea bag 3 tablespoons milk 1.5 tablespoons hot cocoa mix 2 teaspoons white sugar Hot cocoa mix and milk are stirred into freshly brewed tea for a unique, comforting drink with earthy sweetness.

title: Instant Pot® Mulled Apple Cider
text: Combine apple cider, cinnamon sticks, lemon zest, cloves, nutmeg, and allspice in the inner pot of a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 1 minute. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 15 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Ladle mulled cider into cups and sweeten with honey. Garnish with lemon slices and additional cinnamon sticks. 4 cups apple cider 3 cinnamon sticks, plus more for garnish 0.5 lemon, zested 0.5 teaspoon whole cloves, or to taste 0.125 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.125 teaspoon ground allspice 1 tablespoon honey, or to taste 0.5 lemon, sliced Try this comforting mulled apple cider made in the Instant Pot® on a cool evening, when you want to wrap your hands around a warm, tasty cup.

title: Grandma's Apple Pie 'Ala Mode' Moonshine
text: Gather all ingredients. Place apple cider, apple juice, white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, and whole clove in a large pot over high heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool completely. Stir grain alcohol and vanilla vodka into the cooled mixture. Pour into clean bottles or jars; store in the refrigerator. Enjoy! 0.5 gallon apple cider 0.5 gallon apple juice 1 cup white sugar 1 cup brown sugar 4 cinnamon sticks 1 whole clove 3 cups 190 proof grain alcohol (such as Everclear®) 2 cups vanilla vodka Learn how to make apple pie moonshine with apple cider, apple juice, grain alcohol, vanilla vodka, and cinnamon — tastes just like apple pie à la mode!

title: Simple Avocado Milkshake
text: Place milk, avocado, banana, and honey in a blender; blend until smooth. 1 cup milk 1 ripe avocado, peeled and pitted 1 banana, cut into chunks 3 tablespoons honey This recipe uses avocado, milk, and banana to make a simple and delicious creamy milkshake sweetened with honey for a morning or afternoon treat.

title: Updated Mulled Cider
text: Peel the skin from the orange leaving the bitter white pith behind. Stick the cloves into the skin. Squeeze the juice from the orange and add to the 2-3/4 cups orange juice. Place all ingredients into a large nonreactive pan and bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat, cover and allow to stand at least 30 minutes to allow flavors to blend. Serve warm or cold. 1 large orange 3 whole cloves 2.75 cups fresh orange juice 8 cups apple juice 0.25 cup raisins 1 cinnamon stick This is great for trimming the tree. Serve cold or keep in a saucepan over very low heat or a slow cooker.

title: Pumpkin Spice Coffee Syrup
text: Mix water and sugar together in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring regularly, until sugar is completely dissolved completely, about 5 minutes. Stir 6 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling, cinnamon sticks, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, vanilla, and pumpkin pie spice into the sugar syrup; bring to a simmer. Cook until mixture is well spiced, 8 to 10 minutes. Strain mixture through a sheet of cheesecloth into a bowl. Return liquid to the saucepan over low heat. Stir condensed milk and remaining 2 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling into the spiced syrup. Cook, stirring regularly, until pumpkin dissolves into the liquid, about 5 minutes. 1.5 cups water 1.5 cups white sugar 8 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling, divided 4 cinnamon sticks 4 teaspoons freshly grated nutmeg 2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger 2 teaspoons whole cloves 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 0.5 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice 0.25 cup sweetened condensed milk Make your own pumpkin spice syrup with this copycat recipe using pumpkin pie filling, pumpkin pie spice, and other fall spices.

title: Alcohol-Free Mint Julep
text: In a small saucepan, combine the water, sugar and 1 tablespoon of chopped mint. Stir and bring to a boil. Cook until sugar has dissolved, then remove from heat and set aside to cool. After about an hour, strain out mint leaves. Fill 2 cups or frozen goblets with crushed ice. Pour 1/2 of the lemonade into each glass and top with a splash of the sugar syrup. Garnish each with a mint sprig and a straw. Serve on a silver platter. 0.25 cup water 0.25 cup white sugar 1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint leaves 2 cups crushed ice 0.5 cup prepared lemonade Fresh mint sprigs, for garnish An alcohol-free mint julep for you non-drinkers out there.... now you don't have to drink water and can enjoy the classic mint julep with a slight twist while watching the Kentucky Derby!

title: Flavored Latte
text: Pour milk into a steaming pitcher and heat to 145 degrees F to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand. Measure the flavored syrup into a large coffee mug. Brew espresso, then add to mug. Pour the steamed milk into the mug, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Spoon foam over the top. 1.25 cups 2% milk 2 tablespoons any flavor of flavored syrup 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brewed espresso Use this basic recipe to make your favorite flavored latte with a home espresso machine.

title: Strawberry Sangria
text: Combine wine, strawberry schnapps, and sugar in a large pitcher. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add sliced strawberries and refrigerate, 2 to 3 hours. Pour over ice and garnish with whole strawberries before serving. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle white wine 0.5 cup strawberry schnapps 0.25 cup white sugar 2 cups sliced strawberries ice 6 whole strawberries for garnish This refreshing sangria features white wine, strawberry schnapps, and fresh strawberries, making it the perfect summertime drink.

title: Gourmet Root Beer Float
text: Place 1 scoop of ice cream into each of two tall glasses. Pour root beer carefully over the ice cream. Add another scoop and repeat. If possible, repeat again. Top each with whipped cream and cherries. 0.5 pint vanilla ice cream 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle root beer 0.5 cup whipped cream 4 maraschino cherries Tall glasses overflowing with root beer and vanilla ice cream. Top with whipped cream and cherries for a touch of elegance.

title: Stout and Ale
text: Divide lager beer evenly between 2 tall beer glasses. Working with one glass at a time, place a large tablespoon, dome-side up, 1 inch or so above lager beer, with the tip of the spoon pointed slightly downward. Slowly pour 1/2 of the stout beer over the tablespoon so it gently pours down the side of the glass in a thick trickle. Allow to stand until 2 distinct layers of beer form, 3 to 5 seconds. Repeat with the remaining glass of beer. 1 (12 fluid ounce) bottle lager beer (such as Harp®) 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle Irish stout beer (such as Guinness®) This black and tan recipe is called a "half and half" in Ireland. A pint glass is filled halfway with lager on the bottom with a float of Guinness on top.

title: White Peach Sangria
text: Combine white wine, peach vodka, lemonade concentrate, and sugar in a large pitcher; stir until sugar is dissolved. Add sliced peaches, red grapes, and green grapes. Refrigerate sangria until well chilled and flavors have blended, at least 2 hours to overnight. Serve over ice, and use a slotted spoon to include sliced peaches and grapes with each serving. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry white wine 0.75 cup peach flavored vodka 6 tablespoons frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed 0.25 cup white sugar 1 pound white peaches, pitted and sliced 0.75 cup seedless red grapes, halved 0.75 cup seedless green grapes, halved This white peach sangria recipe combines peach vodka, white wine, peach slices, and grapes to make a refreshingly fruity punch that's sure to please!

title: Rico's Passionate Pink Honey Lemonade
text: In a saucepan, combine 1 cup water, strawberries, white sugar, brown sugar, and honey. Bring to a boil, and simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cool to room temperature, cover, and chill. In a large pitcher, mix together water, lemon juice, and orange slices. Stir in cooled syrup; chill. Serve in a tall glass over ice. 1 cup water 3 fresh strawberries, sliced 1 cup white sugar 0.5 cup brown sugar 1 teaspoon honey 7 cups water 1.75 cups fresh lemon juice 2 slices orange This recipe came to me one summer evening during a Hurricane...Please feel free to share the passion...and some feedback!

title: Adult Slushies
text: Mix vodka, brandy, orange and lemon juice concentrate, cherries and grapefruit soda together in a large plastic mixing bowl. Cover the mixture with a tight fitting lid. Freeze the mixture for one or two days. When you are ready to serve the drink, use an ice cream scoop and place one or two scoops of the mixture into glasses. Fill the rest of the glass with lemon/lime flavored soda pop. Stir and serve. 0.75 cup vodka 0.75 cup brandy 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 2 (10 ounce) jars maraschino cherries 32 ounces grapefruit flavored soda 67 fluid ounces lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage This citrusy vodka drink, blended with brandy, grapefruit-flavored soda and juice concentrates, packs a punch that's both sweet and subtle.

title: Delicious Vegan Hot Chocolate
text: Combine soy milk, sugar, cocoa, salt, vanilla, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper in a saucepan; bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Remove from heat and whisk until frothy. Serve hot. 2.5 cups soy milk 3 tablespoons white sugar 3 tablespoons cocoa powder 0.5 teaspoon salt 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 pinch ground cinnamon 1 pinch cayenne pepper Finally, a vegan hot cocoa recipe that actually tastes good! For best results, use plain soy milk.

title: Oreo Milkshake
text: Blend chocolate sandwich cookies, ice cream, and milk together in a blender until smooth. Pour into 2 glasses. 6 chocolate sandwich cookies (such as Oreo®) 3 scoops vanilla ice cream 0.75 cup milk A deliciously creamy Oreo milkshake made by blending milk, ice cream, and cookies together for a kid-pleasing chilled drink that's ready in minutes.

title: Basil Gimlet
text: Place coupe glass in the freezer while you are preparing the cocktail. Combine 6 basil leaves and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker and muddle until basil leaves are crushed. Add ice, lime juice, and gin. Cover and shake until chilled, 15 to 20 seconds. Strain cocktail into coupe glass and garnish with remaining basil leaf. 6 large fresh basil leaves 0.75 fluid ounce simple syrup 1 cup ice 0.75 fluid ounce fresh lime juice 2 fluid ounces gin 1 small basil leaf for garnish Try this recipe for basil gimlet for a variation on the classic cocktail.

title: Amazingly Good Eggnog
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine milk, cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, and cloves in a saucepan over the lowest heat setting; stir and heat for 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium-low and slowly bring to a boil. Remove from the heat. Whisk egg yolks in a large bowl until light yellow in color. Add sugar and whisk until light and fluffy. Pour some of the hot milk mixture into the egg yolk mixture, whisking quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs. Continue adding hot milk and whisking to combine until all milk is incorporated. Pour the mixture back into the saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thick, about 3 minutes; do not allow the mixture to boil. Strain to remove cloves and let cool for about 1 hour, then stir in cream, rum, remaining 2 teaspoons vanilla, and nutmeg. Refrigerate before serving, 8 hours to overnight. 4 cups milk 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 5 whole cloves 2.5 teaspoons vanilla extract, divided 12 large egg yolks 1.5 cups white sugar 4 cups light cream 2.5 cups light rum 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg This eggnog recipe makes the creamiest homemade eggnog thickened with tempered eggs and flavored with rum, cinnamon, vanilla, nutmeg, and cloves.

title: Watermelon Summertime Slush
text: Place ice in a blender and pour in coconut water; add cherries, watermelon cubes, and sweetener. Cover and blend until slushy, about 1 minute. Pour into 2 glasses to serve. 1 cup ice cubes 0.5 cup coconut water (liquid from inside coconut) 0.25 cup cherries, pitted 1 cup cubed, seeded watermelon 1 teaspoon granular sucralose sweetener (such as Splenda®) A crisp and refreshing fruit slushy with coconut water, cherries, and watermelon will cool you off on a hot summer day.

title: Mango Daiquiri
text: Place mangoes, rum, lime juice, and agave syrup in blender cup and blend until smooth. 1 cup mangoes, frozen 2 ounces light rum 2 ounces fresh squeezed lime juice 2 ounces agave syrup This mango daiquiri recipe begins with frozen mangoes, which eliminates the need for ice and will not water down the drink.

title: Rosé Wine and Berry Sangria
text: Stir together grapefruit juice and sugar in a pitcher until sugar dissolves. Add wine, raspberries, blackberries, lime slices, and brandy. Cover and chill until ready to serve, 1 to 24 hours. Gently stir in club soda before serving over ice.
