Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs. 0.5 cup grapefruit juice 3 tablespoons white sugar 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry rosé 1 cup fresh raspberries 0.5 cup fresh blackberries 2 medium limes, sliced 0.25 cup brandy 1.5 cups club soda 3 cups ice, or as needed 8 sprigs fresh rosemary This sangria recipe, featuring rosé wine, raspberries, blackberries, and limes, is easy to customize with different wines, fruit, and herbs. Perfect for summer entertaining!

title: Gingerbread Coffee
text: In a small bowl, mix together the molasses, brown sugar, baking soda, ginger and cinnamon until well blended. Cover and refrigerate for at least 10 minutes. Add about a 1/4 cup of coffee to each cup, then stir in about a tablespoon of the spice mixture until dissolved. Fill cup to within an inch of the top with coffee. Stir in half and half to taste, then garnish with whipped cream and a light dusting of cloves. 0.5 cup molasses 0.25 cup brown sugar 0.5 teaspoon baking soda 1 teaspoon ground ginger 0.75 teaspoon ground cinnamon 6 cups hot brewed coffee 1 cup half-and-half cream 1 teaspoon ground cloves 1.5 cups sweetened whipped cream Molasses and spices are stirred into hot coffee and topped off with a generous dollop of whipped cream and sprinkled with cloves.

title: Blueberry Liquor
text: Mash thawed blueberries in a bowl with a fork; transfer to a sterlized 1-quart jar. Add lemon zest and cloves, then pour in vodka. Seal the jar and let age in a cool, dark place for 3 months, shaking the jar gently every few days. After 3 months, strain and discard blueberries. Filter through cheesecloth into another sterilized 1-quart jar. Pour in simple syrup, seal the jar tightly with the lid, and shake until syrup has dissolved. Let age in a cool, dark place for at least 1 more month. Filter liquid through cheesecloth again. Pour into decorative bottles. 1 (12 ounce) package frozen blueberries, thawed 0.5 lemon, zested 3 whole cloves 1.5 cups vodka 0.75 cup simple syrup Combine blueberries, alcohol, lemon zest, and cloves in a sealed jar and after 4 months in a dark location, it will transform into a delicious blueberry liquor.

title: Pudding Shots
text: Whisk milk, Irish cream liqueur, vodka, and instant pudding mix together in a bowl until thoroughly combined, about 2 minutes. Spoon the pudding mixture into shot glasses or disposable party shot cups. Chill until set, about 30 minutes. The shots will have the consistency of mousse. 1 cup milk 0.5 cup Irish cream liqueur (eg. Bailey's®) 0.5 cup vodka (eg. Smirnoff®) 1 (3.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix Pudding shots are a great and tasty alternative to traditional gelatin shots. Use Bailey's and chocolate pudding mix to make easy, fun, boozy treats.

title: Eggnog Hot Chocolate
text: Melt milk with chocolate in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Remove from heat and let stand for 2 minutes. Whisk mixture until melted and smooth. Stir in eggnog. Heat gently over low heat until very warm but not boiling. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla and coffee liqueur. Pour into mugs. Serve topped with whipped cream and a cinnamon stick garnish. 2.5 cups milk 12 ounces bittersweet chocolate chips 4 cups eggnog 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.25 cup coffee flavored liqueur 0.5 cup whipped cream 8 cinnamon sticks, garnish Creamy, hot eggnog is combined with rich, dark hot chocolate and spiked with coffee liqueur.

title: How to Make a Cafe Latte
text: Heat milk in a saucepan set over medium-low heat. Whisk briskly with a wire whisk to create foam. Brew espresso and pour into four cups. Pour in milk, holding back the foam with a spoon. Spoon foam over the top. 2 cups milk 1.3300000429153 cups hot freshly brewed dark roast espresso coffee Learn how to make a cafe latte for a warm, delicious mug of steamy milk and bold espresso right at home. This is a great recipe for all coffee lovers.

title: Hot Mulled Cider
text: Place cloves, allspice berries, and cinnamon stick pieces in the center of a small piece of cheesecloth. Bring the ends of the cheesecloth together and tie securely with kitchen string. Combine cider, brown sugar, and spice bag in a large kettle over medium-high heat; bring to a simmer. Simmer for 5 minutes. Discard spice bag. Serve in mugs with a lemon slice in each cup. 9 whole cloves 9 whole allspice berries 4 (3 inch) pieces cinnamon stick, broken into pieces 1 gallon apple cider 1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar 2 lemons, thinly sliced Simmered with fragrant cloves, allspice, and cinnamon, this non-alcoholic hot mulled apple cider is the perfect beverage for guests of any age.

title: Healthy Blueberry Breakfast Smoothie
text: Blend blueberries, yogurt, orange juice, sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon together in a blender on low speed for 30 seconds; increase speed to high and blend until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add ice and blend on high until smooth, about 1 minute more. 1 cup fresh blueberries 0.5 cup Greek yogurt 0.25 cup orange juice 1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 pinch ground cinnamon, or to taste 3 ice cubes Wondering what to eat for your on-the-go breakfast? Make this healthy and delicious blueberry breakfast smoothie.

title: Chocolate Strawberry Banana Milkshake
text: In a blender combine milk, strawberries, banana, chocolate milk powder, vanilla, and sugar. Blend until smooth. 1 cup low-fat milk 0.5 cup frozen unsweetened strawberries 0.5 ripe banana 2 tablespoons powdered chocolate drink mix 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 teaspoons white sugar A wonderful milkshake that can easily be adapted for low-sugar diets. My mother got me started on this 20 years ago. I rarely add sugar or sweetener, but I realize that some people enjoy a bit more sweetness. You can substitute orange juice for milk if you like.

title: Watermelon Freeze
text: Place watermelon, bananas, and yogurt in a blender; pulse for 20 seconds and continuously blend until smooth, about 30 seconds. Add sugar and blend on low for 5 seconds. Add ice and blend for 20 seconds. Place mixture in freezer until semi-frozen, about 1 hour. 0.5 watermelon, cubed 3 bananas, sliced 3 (8 ounce) containers vanilla yogurt 2 tablespoons white sugar 1 tray ice cubes Watermelon and banana freeze made with vanilla yogurt is a creamy and refreshing drink for any time of the year.

title: Watermelon Lime Agua Fresca
text: Combine 1 cup water, watermelon, and sugar in a blender; process until smooth. Pour into a large pitcher; stir in lime juice and remaining 7 cups water. Taste; adjust sugar or lime juice. Refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour. 8 cups water, divided 5 cups peeled, cubed, and seeded watermelon 0.5 cup white sugar, or more to taste 0.33333334326744 cup lime juice, or more to taste This watermelon and lime agua fresca is a refreshing Mexican-style drink served in tall glasses over ice, perfect for a hot summer day.

title: Creamy Banana Milkshake
text: Combine milk, ice cream, banana, and cinnamon in a blender; blend on low speed until the mixture reaches the consistency of a thick milkshake. Pour milkshake into a cup and top with whipped cream and drizzled caramel. 1 cup milk 1 scoop vanilla ice cream 1 ripe banana 1 pinch ground cinnamon, or to taste 2 tablespoons whipped cream, or more to taste 1 tablespoon caramel topping Bananas, milk, and ice cream are the star ingredients in this creamy and rich banana shake recipe that is quick and easy to make for the whole family.

title: Coffee Flavored Liqueur III
text: In a saucepan over medium heat, combine water, sugar, vanilla and ground coffee. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Allow to cool, then remove grounds through a strainer. When cool, stir in vodka. Pour into a liquor bottle, and keep in a cool place. 2 cups water 1.25 cups white sugar 2 tablespoons vanilla extract 2 tablespoons fresh ground coffee beans 2.5 cups vodka This homemade liqueur is great sipped by itself, or used as a mixer in other drinks. It makes a great gift that is always well-received!

title: Green Monster Smoothie
text: Blend milk, yogurt, banana, peanut butter, spinach, and ice cubes until smooth. 1 cup fat-free milk 0.5 cup fat-free plain yogurt 1 banana, frozen and chunked 1 tablespoon natural peanut butter 2 cups fresh spinach 1 cup ice cubes Banana, spinach, and peanut butter blend with yogurt and milk for a power-packed smoothie.

title: Boozy Fresh Cranberry-Orange Sauce
text: Combine cranberries, sugar, water, orange zest, orange juice, orange-flavored liqueur, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook, stirring frequently, for about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Sauce with thicken as it cools, to a soft-preserves stage. Refrigerate until ready to serve. 2 cups whole fresh cranberries 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup water 0.5 large orange, zested and juiced 0.33333334326744 cup orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®) 0.125 teaspoon salt, or to taste This fresh cranberry-orange sauce is spiked with Cointreau® which gives the sauce an extra flavor boost. It's perfect with ham, chicken, or turkey, whether it's a holiday or not.

title: Raspberry Lime Rickey
text: Fill a tall glass with ice. Squeeze lime wedges into the glass, and drop them in. Fill glass nearly to the top with carbonated water, and top with raspberry syrup. 1 lime, quartered 8 fluid ounces carbonated water 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger raspberry syrup Customize the flavor of this lime rickey recipe by using any flavored syrup including lemon or orange. It makes an easy, refreshing bubbly drink.

title: Abbey's White Chocolate Latte
text: Combine milk and cream in a saucepan and whisk over high heat until hot and frothy. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and sugar. Whisk together hot espresso and white chocolate chips in a mug until smooth. If you are making two, pour half into another mug. Top with frothy hot milk and stir to blend in flavoring. 1.5 cups milk 1 tablespoon heavy cream 0.125 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 tablespoon white sugar 0.5 cup brewed espresso 0.25 cup white chocolate chips, chopped This delicious white chocolate latte recipe makes one very large, chocolaty, and extremely indulgent latte that could probably serve two people.

title: Apple Cider Margarita
text: Moisten the rim of two margarita glasses with honey. Stir cinnamon and sugar together on a plate. Lightly dip the moistened rim of each glass into cinnamon and sugar mixture. Fill a cocktail shaker with fresh ice. Add apple cider, tequila, cinnamon whiskey, and butterscotch schnapps. Squeeze 2 limes into the shaker. Cover and shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Fill 2 glasses with ice; strain mixture into glasses. Garnish with apple slices. 1/2 teaspoon honey, or as needed 2 teaspoons sugar 1 teaspoon cinnamon 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed ½ cup apple cider ½ cup tequila ¼ cup cinnamon whiskey, such as Fireball® Cinnamon Whisky 2 tablespoons butterscotch schnapps 2 limes 6 thin slices apple This apple cider margarita is a nice fall twist on traditional margaritas using apple cider, tequila, cinnamon whiskey, butterscotch schnapps, and lime.

title: Banana, Avocado, and Spinach Smoothie
text: Blend banana, avocado, spinach, milk, ice cubes, honey, and vanilla together in a blender until smooth. 1 banana, sliced 0.5 avocado, peeled and sliced 0.5 cup fresh spinach 0.5 cup 1% milk 6 ice cubes 2 teaspoons honey 1 teaspoon vanilla extract This banana, avocado, and spinach smoothie recipe makes a quick and easy breakfast or snack that is perfect for a healthy, delicious meal on-the-go.

title: Teddy Bear Juice
text: Mix apple juice, hot water, lemon juice, and honey in a mug; stir. Serve warm. 0.5 cup apple juice 0.5 cup hot water 1 teaspoon lemon juice 1 teaspoon honey A sweet, warm, and soothing drink made with apple juice and honey is perfect for anybody who is suffering a cold or who just wants an alternative to a cup of tea. Do not give honey to children under 1 year of age.

title: Vanilla Milkshake
text: Blend ice cream, milk, and vanilla extract together in a blender until smooth; pour into glasses and serve. 2 cups vanilla ice cream 1 cup whole milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract This vanilla milkshake recipe is so easy to make, you'll want to treat yourself all the time. Add chocolate, berries, or candy bits for a fun twist!

title: Raspberry Party Shots
text: Stir gelatin into boiling water until dissolved. Pour in ice water and vodka; mix well. Pour into party shot glasses. Chill in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours, until set. 1 (6 ounce) package raspberry flavored Jell-O® mix 2 cups boiling water 0.75 cup ice water 1.25 cups raspberry vodka These party shots made with raspberry vodka and raspberry gelatin make for a colorful, fun, and fruity cocktail for holiday parties.

title: Southern-Style Vanilla Lemonade
text: Cut the lemons in half and scoop the pulp into a blender. Add half of the rinds along with sugar, vanilla extract, and 2 cups of water. Blend until smooth, then strain into a serving pitcher and stir in the remaining water. 4 lemons 0.75 cup white sugar 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract 6 cups cold water This vanilla-scented lemonade provides a real lemon kick that's great for hot summer days! Serve over ice or frozen lemonade cubes.

title: Lemon Whiskey Slush
text: In the container of a blender, combine the Irish whiskey, sugar, lemon juice and ice cubes. Cover and blend until slushy, 15 to 30 seconds. Pour into glasses and serve. 0.5 cup Irish whiskey 3 tablespoons white sugar 0.5 cup fresh lemon juice 4 cups ice cubes Slushy, lemony and deceptively strong, this refreshing whiskey cocktail is great for a summer evening.

title: Coal Region Boilo
text: Pour water and honey into a large pot over medium heat; stir to combine. Stir in orange and lemon quarters, raisins, cinnamon sticks, caraway seeds, allspice berries, and cloves; bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes. Remove from heat, and strain liquid into a large pot. Allow to cool for a few minutes. Slowly pour the grain alcohol into the honey mixture, and stir to combine. Pour into bottles, and cap; refrigerate until use. Serve gently warmed in shot glasses. 4 cups water 4.5 pounds clover honey 4 oranges, quartered 3 lemons, quartered 1 cup raisins 6 cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon caraway seeds 0.5 teaspoon whole allspice berries 0.5 teaspoon whole cloves 0.5 gallon 190 proof grain alcohol Boilo is a warm mulled alcoholic Yuletide drink that's been served in the coal regions of Pennsylvania for over a hundred years. It will cure what ails you!

title: Mint and Melon Freeze
text: Blend cantaloupe, ice cubes, grapes, rice milk, and mint leaves together in a blender until smooth; pour into martini glasses and garnish each with a cantaloupe wedge. 2 cups cubed cantaloupe 1.5 cups ice cubes 1 cup red grapes 1 cup rice milk (such as Rice Dream®) 6 large mint leaves 4 small cantaloupe wedges Blend mint and melon together with ice and rice milk in this creamy and dairy-free drink to keep you cool in the summer.

title: Quarterback Attack Shooter
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add gin, vermouth, cherry juice, and bitters. Shake well and strain into 4 shot glasses. Add a cherry to each glass. ice cubes 4 fluid ounces gin 2 fluid ounces sweet vermouth 2 teaspoons maraschino cherry juice 2 dashes orange bitters 4 maraschino cherries This delicious gin shooter recipe combines two parts gin to one part sweet vermouth and gives you a slightly sweet cocktail that still packs a punch.

title: Easy Strawberry Lemonade
text: In a large pitcher, mix together lemonade concentrate and water. Stir in strawberries. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed 4.5 cups water 1 (10 ounce) package frozen strawberries, partially thawed Wondering how to make easy strawberry lemonade? This simple drink that is stirred with lemonade concentrate and frozen strawberries is a hoot.

title: Banana Juice
text: Blend milk, bananas, pistachios, and honey in a blender until smooth and frothy, about 2 minutes. 2 cups milk 2 large ripe bananas 2 tablespoons slivered shelled pistachios 1 tablespoon honey Bananas, pistachios, and milk are blended together creating a frothy banana juice delight.

title: Rhubarb-Raspberry Slush
text: Place rhubarb in a large saucepan with water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, reduce heat, and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Add fresh raspberries at the end of cooking for 1 to 2 minutes. Drain and reserve 3 cups liquid. Puree rhubarb and raspberries using an immersion blender. You can also mash fruit with a fork. Stir together rhubarb puree, reserved water, sugar, orange juice concentrate, lemonade concentrate, and vodka in a large container. Freeze until hard, about 4 hours. Scoop frozen mixture into serving glasses, and fill the rest of the glass with lemon-lime soda. 6 cups fresh rhubarb, chopped 0.5 cup white sugar 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed 6 ounces fresh raspberries 1 cup raspberry vodka 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage Try this rhubarb raspberry slush recipe whenever you have an abundance of rhubarb - feel free to spike it up with vodka for an adult version.

title: Throat Coat Tea
text: Heat water to near boiling in a kettle. Put lemon slices, tea leaves, and honey into a mug. Pour water into the mug. Steep tea until the flavor is to your liking, 3 to 5 minutes. water 2 (1/4-inch-thick) lemon slices 1 tablespoon loose-leaf jasmine green tea 1 teaspoon honey, or to taste This throat-soothing tea brings jasmine green tea, lemon, and honey together to help soothe a sore throat while providing a tasty hot beverage.

title: Orange Dream Punch
text: Place sherbet and frozen orange juice concentrate in a punch bowl. Allow to thaw for 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in ginger ale. 0.5 gallon orange sherbet 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (2 liter) bottle ginger ale This is the easiest punch recipe ever. It was a big hit at my sister's bridal shower. Simply pour ginger ale over orange sherbet and orange juice concentrate.

title: Dirty Snowball
text: In a shot glass, combine the coffee liqueur, creme de menthe, and Irish cream liqueur. Drink all at once. 0.33333334326744 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coffee flavored liqueur 0.33333334326744 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger creme de menthe liqueur 0.33333334326744 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur Coffee, creme de menthe and Irish cream mingle in this shot that tastes like a chocolate mint candy.

title: Homemade White Hot Chocolate Mix
text: Gather all ingredients. Mix milk powder and creamer together in a large bowl. Mix sugar and butter flavoring together in a small bowl until fully incorporated. Mix into milk powder mixture vigorously using hands to decrease lumps. Shred white chocolate using a small microplane or small shred side of a box grater; add to mixture. Stir lightly using a spoon to incorporate without melting chocolate. 2 cups skim milk powder 2 cups powdered non-dairy creamer 1 cup white sugar 0.5 teaspoon imitation butter flavoring 1 ounce white chocolate This homemade white hot chocolate mix makes a creamy, rich, and delicious drink, perfect for cold days or to give as a food gift for the holidays!

title: Refreshing Cucumber Lemonade
text: Gather all ingredients. Make the simple syrup: Combine water and sugar together in a saucepan over medium heat; heat until just about to boil and sugar has dissolved. Place in refrigerator until cool, about 30 minutes. Blend cucumber in a blender or food processor until mashed into a pulp. Pour cucumber pulp into a fine mesh strainer placed over a bowl; allow to sit until you have about 2/3 cup of cucumber juice in the bowl, about 15 minutes. Stir simple syrup, cucumber juice, and lemon juice together in a pitcher. Serve cold. 1 cup water 0.5 cup white sugar 1 cucumber, sliced 6 lemons, juiced Lemonade with cucumber juice is a unique way to serve this homemade summery drink. Serve cold or over ice garnished with lemon and cucumber slices.

title: Sparkling Peach Sangria
text: Early in the day, refrigerate prosecco. Combine peach slices, Cointreau, half of lime slices, mint leaves, and grated ginger in a container with a lid. Refrigerate at least 6 hours, making sure peaches are submerged in liquid. When ready to serve, pour peach mixture into a large serving pitcher and add prosecco. Stir briefly to combine. Place some of the fruit in each glass, add sangria, and top with 2 ounces sparkling water, or to taste. Garnish with reserved lime slices and additional mint leaves, if desired. 1 (750ml) bottle prosecco, well-chilled 2 peaches, thinly sliced 2 limes, thinly sliced, divided use 1 Tablespoon torn fresh mint leaves 1” knob of ginger, finely grated 1 cup Cointreau 12 ounces sparkling water, or to taste Additional mint leaves for optional garnish Sparkling peach sangria, made with prosecco, fresh peaches, mint, and ginger, make a refreshing, bubbly summer sip.

title: Kombucha Margarita
text: Fill a cocktail shaker half-full with ice. Add tequila, triple sec, and lime juice to the shaker. Seal and shake vigorously until outside is frosted, 10 to 15 seconds. Sprinkle salt onto a plate. Moisten the rim of a glass with the lime wedge. Press the moistened rim into the salt. Fill glass with ice. Strain margarita into the glass and top with kombucha. Stir gently and garnish with lime wedge, if desired. 2 cups ice 2 fluid ounces silver tequila 0.75 fluid ounce triple sec (orange-flavored liqueur) 0.75 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lime juice 1 tablespoon coarse salt, or as needed 1 lime wedge 3 ounces citrus flavored kombucha, or your favorite flavor This fizzy and tart margarita uses kombucha for a modern twist!

title: Brad's Killer Eggnog
text: Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until foamy. Add 1 cup sugar gradually, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whites will form sharp peaks. Beat egg yolks and remaining 1 cup sugar in a separate bowl until frothy and lightened in color. Fold egg whites into egg yolk mixture gently; pour into a large punch bowl or pitcher. Stir in rum, half-and-half, and milk. Top eggnog with nutmeg; serve with ice. 12 eggs, separated 2 cups white sugar, divided 1 quart rum 1 quart half-and-half 1 quart milk 1 pinch nutmeg ice cubes This delicious eggnog cocktail recipe uses real eggs, real cream, and plenty of rum for an oh-so-rich indulgence and extra holiday cheer.

title: Apple Pie Shot
text: Combine vodka and apple cider in a 2-ounce shot glass. Top with whipped cream and a pinch of cinnamon. 1 fluid ounce vodka 1 fluid ounce apple cider 1 tablespoon whipped cream 1 pinch ground cinnamon This apple pie shot made with vodka, apple cider, whipped cream, and cinnamon makes a scrumptious party drink that tastes just like apple pie!

title: Mock Champagne
text: To make Ice ring: Fill a ring-shaped cake pan to 1/2 with ginger ale. Freeze until partially frozen. At this stage you can place edible flowers, or pieces of fruit around the ring. Fill pan with ginger ale and freeze until solid. Place in punch bowl just before serving. In a large punch bowl, combine 1 bottle ginger ale, pineapple juice and white grape juice. 2 (2 liter) bottles ginger ale, chilled 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice, chilled 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle white grape juice, chilled A good baby-shower punch made with ginger ale, pineapple juice and white grape juice. It looks especially good when served with an ice ring.

title: Candie's Simply Great Punch
text: Pour chilled punch and soda into a punch bowl. Scoop out an entire half-gallon of ice cream and carefully slide into punch. 2 (46 fluid ounce) cans fruit punch 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 0.5 gallon French vanilla ice cream A quick and pleasing punch whipped together with two cans of punch, a bottle of lemon-lime soda, and a tub of ice cream.

title: Fruit and Yogurt Smoothie
text: Combine strawberries, banana, yogurt, pineapple juice, sugar, orange juice, and milk in a blender; blend until smooth. 1 cup strawberries 1 banana 0.5 cup yogurt 0.25 cup pineapple juice 1.5 teaspoons white sugar 1 teaspoon orange juice 1 teaspoon milk This yogurt smoothie recipe blends strawberries, banana, pineapple juice, orange juice, and plain yogurt together for a delicious, refreshing drink.

title: Lela's Protein Mango Smoothie
text: Blend mango, yogurt, almond milk, ice, protein powder, and honey together in a blender until smooth. 0.5 mango, chopped, or more to taste 0.5 cup low-fat vanilla yogurt 0.5 cup almond milk 0.5 cup ice 1 scoop vanilla whey protein powder 1 teaspoon honey, or to taste Whip up this high-protein vanilla mango smoothie when you need a quick-and-easy refreshing treat.

title: Xocolatl (Aztec Chocolate)
text: Bring 1 1/2 cup water to a boil in a pot; add the chili pepper, seeds included, to the boiling water and cook at a boil for 5 to 10 minutes. Strain the chili pepper and seeds from the water; return the water to the pot. Add 4 cups water to the chili pepper-infused water, reduce heat to medium-low, and bring to a slow boil. Stir the cocoa powder and vanilla extract into the boiling water; cook and stir until the powder dissolves completely, 5 to 10 minutes. 1.5 cups water 1 green chile pepper, sliced 4 cups water 0.25 cup unsweetened cocoa powder 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Try this bitter, spicy version of hot chocolate for an exotic treat.

title: Brandy Slush
text: Steep tea bags in 2 cups boiling water for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, place remaining 3 cups boiling water in a 9x13-inch pan. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Stir in brandy, lemonade concentrate, and orange juice concentrate until combined. Remove tea bags and stir tea into brandy mixture. Freeze 8 hours to overnight. To serve, scoop desired amount into a glass. Fill the glass with lemon-lime soda; stir. 4 (2 g) bags green tea 5 cups boiling water, divided 1 cup white sugar 2 cups brandy 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage This Wisconsin brandy slush is made with lemonade, orange juice, green tea, and lemon-lime soda for a yummy boozy punch at your next summer party.

title: Oolong, Orange, and Whiskey Punch
text: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Stir in sugar, cinnamon stick, and star anise. Remove from heat and add tea bags. Let steep for 3 minutes (or according to package directions for strongest tea). Remove tea bags. Let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour. Remove and discard cinnamon stick and star anise. Stir together tea mixture, orange juice, whiskey, and lemon juice in a punch bowl or pitcher. Chill until cold, about 2 hours or up to overnight. Garnish with tangerine slices and additional star anise. Ladle into ice-filled glasses. Top each with a tangerine slice. 3 cups water 3 tablespoons sugar 1 (2 inch) cinnamon stick 2 whole star anise 6 oolong tea bags 2.66 cups fresh orange juice 1.5 cups whiskey 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (from 1 lemon) large ice cubes tangerine, sectioned and seeded Balanced with orange and a light touch of spice, this punch is whiskey-forward without being overpowering.

title: Virginia Eggnog
text: Beat sugar and egg yolks together in a bowl using an electric mixer until very light in color. Mix milk and cream into yolk mixture. Beat egg whites in a separate bowl using an electric mixer until stiff peaks form, adding more sugar, if desired. Fold egg whites into milk mixture until eggnog is smooth. Stir rum and whisky into eggnog. Refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour. 1 cup white sugar, or more to taste 10 eggs, divided 1 quart milk 1 quart heavy whipping cream 0.25 cup rum 0.25 cup whisky Virginia eggnog takes classic eggnog and adds whisky and rum for an extra boozy drink for the holiday season.

title: Gelatinized Hot Chocolate
text: Mix water, cocoa powder, chocolate chips, sugar, and salt in a saucepan; cook over medium heat until chocolate chips have melted and sugar has dissolved, about 10 minutes. Stir in marshmallows and milk until evenly combined and marshmallows are melted, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla extract. 0.66666668653488 cup water 5 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder 0.25 cup chocolate chips 0.25 cup white sugar 0.25 teaspoon salt 3 large marshmallows 4 cups 2% milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Homemade hot chocolate gets simmered with marshmallows for an extra thick, hot drink for a cold winter's day.

title: Eggnog from Scratch
text: Beat egg yolks in a large mixing bowl. Gradually add sugar. Beat until mixture thickens. Stir in milk and rum. Pour into a large punch bowl and chill for 3 to 4 hours. Fold in lightly whipped heavy cream with vanilla before serving. 12 jumbo egg yolks 1 pound granulated sugar 1 quart whole milk 1 liter spiced rum 1 quart heavy cream, lightly whipped 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Make eggnog from scratch and you'll be amazed how great the real thing is. Mix egg with cream, sugar, rum, and more for a favorite holiday drink.

title: Singapore Sling Slush
text: Dissolve the sugar in the water in a gallon-sized, freezer-safe container. Stir in the grenadine, cherry juice, lemon juice, cherry brandy, gin, pineapple juice, and lemonade concentrate. Freeze for 24 hours, stirring at least twice during this time. To serve, place 1/4 cup of the slush in a a glass, and top with lemon-lime soda. Garnish with a cherry to serve. 0.5 cup white sugar 4 cups water 0.5 cup grenadine syrup 0.5 cup cherry juice 0.5 cup lemon juice 0.5 cup cherry brandy liqueur 2 cups gin 2.5 cups pineapple juice 1 (6 ounce) can frozen pink lemonade concentrate, thawed 2 (2 liter) bottles lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 46 maraschino cherries Cherry juice joins gin and cherry brandy in this refreshingly fruity cocktail.

title: Recharge-Style Strawberry Mango Smoothie
text: Add banana, mango, strawberries, juice, and coconut water to a blender. Blend until smooth, stopping to scrape sides as needed. Pour into a glass; garnish with fresh strawberry. 1 banana - peeled, sliced, and frozen 0.5 cup frozen mango cubes 0.5 cup frozen sliced strawberries 0.33 cup orange pineapple apple juice blend (such as Welch’s®) 0.33 cup unsweetened coconut water strawberry for garnish If you're in need of a vitamin boost- this recharge cafe copy cat smoothie with strawberry and mango will hit the spot!

title: Korean Banana Milk
text: Combine banana, milk, water, maple syrup and vanilla in the blender cup. Blend until smooth. Place ice cubes in glass (if using). Pour banana milk on top. 1 banana ½ cup whole milk ½ cup cold water 1 tbs pure maple syrup 1 tsp vanilla 4-5 ice cubes, optional Korean banana milk tastes delicious - it's made with bananas, milk, water, maple syrup, and vanilla and takes only minutes.

title: Honey Lemon Tea
text: Pour water into a mug. Add honey and heat in the microwave for 1 minute 30 seconds. Stir in lemon juice, mixing until honey is dissolved. Stir in sugar. 1 cup water 2 teaspoons honey 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice 1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste This lemon tea is a sweet and sour tea easily made in the microwave with honey, sugar, and fresh lemon juice that's great for soothing sore throats.

title: Grasshopper Cocktail
text: Combine creme de menthe, creme de cacao, cream, and ice in a cocktail shaker. Cover and shake until chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. 0.75 fluid ounce creme de menthe 0.75 fluid ounce white creme de cacao 0.25 fluid ounce heavy cream 1 cup ice This retro grasshopper drink is like an after-dinner mint in a glass. Enjoy this delicious chocolatey cocktail classic with, or instead of, dessert.

title: B-52
text: Stir together the Irish cream liqueur and coffee liqueur. Pour into two shot glasses. 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coffee flavored liqueur This yummy shot has the aftertaste of a chocolate chip cookie!

title: Blood Orange Margarita
text: Combine tequila, triple sec, sparkling water, blood orange juice, and lime juice in a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice . Shake well and strain into chilled margarita glasses. 0.5 fluid ounce tequila (such as Reposado®) 1.5 fluid ounces triple sec (orange-flavored liqueur) 2.5 fluid ounces blood orange sparkling water 1 blood orange, juiced 0.5 lime, juiced ice cubes The natural smokiness of the tequila combined with the bitter sweetness of the blood orange makes this a perfect margarita.

title: Kelly's Super Simple Shower Punch
text: Spoon the sorbet into the bottom of a punch bowl. Slowly pour the soda over the sorbet. Use the back of a spoon to soften the sorbet until combined. 1 pint raspberry sorbet 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime soda This is a fabulously simple and delicious punch. It has only 2 ingredients!

title: Easy Lemonade
text: In a large pan, combine water and sugar. Heat until the sugar just melts. Remove from heat and pour in lemon juice. Mix well and chill in refrigerator before serving. Garnish with lemon, lime or orange slices. 0.75 cup fresh lemon juice 2 quarts water 0.5 cup white sugar Juice, water, sugar...easy, breezy lemonade!

title: Homemade Tomato Juice Cocktail
text: Blend 2 cups water, tomato paste, lemon juice, sugar, and salt together in a blender until smooth; pour into a 1/2 gallon container. Stir 3 cups water into mixture. Refrigerate until thickened, about 1 hour. Add 1 more cup water if juice is too thick. 2 cups water 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste 2 tablespoons lemon juice 2 tablespoons white sugar 1 teaspoon salt, or to taste 3 cups water, more if needed Homemade tomato juice cocktail is ready with just 5 ingredients and is a fraction of the cost of store-purchased versions.

title: Budget Jungle Juice for a Crowd
text: Pour orange drink, pink lemonade, pineapple-orange juice blend, vodka, rum, and fruit punch into a large punch bowl or container; stir well. 2 gallons orange-flavored drink 4 quarts pink lemonade 4 quarts pineapple and orange juice blend 4 (750 milliliter) bottles vodka 2 (750 milliliter) bottles white rum 2 (46 fluid ounce) cans fruit punch This jungle juice recipe with vodka, rum, pink lemonade, and fruit juice makes a great alcoholic punch that will serve many on a limited budget.

title: Chai Tea Latte
text: Pour boiling water over chai tea bag in a mug; let steep 4 to 6 minutes. Remove and discard tea bag. Stir honey and sugar into tea to dissolve. Stir milk through tea to serve. 0.75 cup boiling water 1 chai tea bag 1.5 teaspoons honey 1 teaspoon white sugar 0.75 cup milk Make your own milky chai tea lattes with this homemade recipe that uses boiling water, milk, sugar, honey, and a chai tea bag. Delicious hot or iced!

title: Starbucks Caramel Frappuccino Copycat Recipe
text: Blend ice, coffee, milk, caramel sauce, and sugar together in a blender on high speed until smooth. Pour into two 16-ounce glasses. 2 cups ice 1 cup strongly brewed black coffee, cooled 1 cup low-fat milk 0.33333334326744 cup caramel sauce 3 tablespoons white sugar See how to make a caramel frappuccino at home by blending coffee with milk, caramel sauce, and ice. Top with whipped cream and even more caramel if desired!

title: Cranberry Rum Punch
text: In a medium-size punchbowl, stir cranberry juice and sugar together until the sugar dissolves. Mix in ginger ale, rum, and lemon and lime slices. Serve over ice. 1 (32 fluid ounce) bottle cranberry juice 0.25 cup white sugar 2 cups ginger ale 2.25 cups rum 8 slices lemon Ginger ale gives this potent punch a favorite fizz; a generous dose of white sugar sweetens up the mix.

title: Pineapple Sangria
text: Combine Sauvignon Blanc, pineapple juice, triple sec, and brandy in a large pitcher. Add lemon, pineapple, orange, and lime. Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight. Stir in lemon-lime soda before serving. 2 (750 milliliter) bottles Sauvignon Blanc 2 cups pineapple juice 1 cup triple sec 0.5 cup brandy 1 lemon, seeded and chopped 0.5 cup chopped fresh pineapple 0.5 cup chopped orange 0.25 cup chopped lime 2 cups lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage (such as 7-Up®) This pineapple sangria recipe is fruity and fizzy with white wine, pineapple juice, and citrus fruit for a great make-ahead drink.

title: Lavender Mint Tea
text: Place lavender petals and mint leaves into a saucepan, pour water over lavender and mint, and bring to a boil. Turn heat to low and simmer tea until flavor is your desired strength, 15 to 20 minutes. Strain out mint and lavender petals and serve tea hot. If you prefer, let strained tea cool serve over ice. 0.25 cup fresh lavender petals 1 cup fresh mint leaves 4 cups water This mood-boosting tea is delicious hot or iced. And fresh lavender and mint from the garden make it even more special!

title: Amaretto Eggnog
text: Pour eggnog into a microwave-safe mug. Heat in the microwave until warmed through, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Stir in amaretto liqueur. 1 cup eggnog 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger amaretto liqueur A shot of amaretto liqueur is stirred into a mug of eggnog in this quick and easy drink that's a perfect pick-me-up for the holiday season.

title: Eggnog Blend
text: In a saucepan over low heat, stir together the half-and-half and sugar. Whisk in egg yolks and cook until light custard forms; do not boil. Remove from heat and cool, then place in refrigerator and chill overnight. Into the chilled mixture, stir in vanilla, cream, dark rum, scotch, and vanilla ice cream. Serve cold. 4 cups half-and-half 1 cup white sugar 11 egg yolks, beaten 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 cups heavy cream 0.66666668653488 cup dark rum 0.5 cup Scotch whiskey 1 pint vanilla ice cream This homemade eggnog, spiked with rum and Scotch, will fill you with glee. Perfect for the holiday season!

title: Orange Cream Milkshake
text: In a blender combine milk, ice cream and orange juice concentrate. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses, garnish with an orange slice and serve. 0.5 cup milk 4 scoops vanilla ice cream 3 tablespoons frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed Our family loves milkshakes in the summer to cool off. The creamy orange flavor of this shake was a big hit.

title: Sarah's Spiked Raspberry Lemonade
text: Combine 3 raspberries, raspberry liqueur, and vodka in an old fashioned glass. Muddle raspberries, liqueur, and vodka together. Pour lemonade on top and stir to combine. Thread remaining raspberries onto a swizzle stick as garnish. Enjoy. 6 fresh raspberries, divided 1 tablespoon raspberry flavored liqueur 2 tablespoons vodka 0.75 cup lemonade All you need for this spiked raspberry lemonade are fresh raspberries, raspberry liqueur, vodka, and homemade or purchased lemonade.

title: Mocha
text: Pour milk into a steaming pitcher and heat to 145 degrees F to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand. Measure the chocolate syrup into a large coffee mug. Brew espresso, then add to mug. Pour the steamed milk into the mug, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Top with whipped cream. 1.25 cups 2% milk 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brewed espresso 1 tablespoon sweetened whipped cream This is a chocolate and coffee-lover's favorite! Using a home espresso machine, mix espresso, chocolate, and steamed milk--then top with whipped cream.

title: Kombucha Mule
text: Fill a copper mule mug with ice. Add lime juice and vodka; stir to combine. Top with ginger kombucha. Lightly stir again and garnish with lime slice. 1.5 cups ice 0.5 fluid ounce freshly squeezed lime juice 2 fluid ounces vodka 4 ounces ginger-flavored Kombucha (such as KeVita®Master Brew Ginger) 1 thin lime slice (optional) This tart and fizzy version of the Moscow Mule uses ginger-flavored kombucha instead of ginger beer for a less sweet alternative.

title: Sangria On The Light Side
text: In large pitcher or punch bowl, stir together juices, wine, and Sweet 'N Low until Sweet 'N Low dissolves; refrigerate until well chilled. Just before serving, add seltzer, orange wedges, lemon slices, and strawberry slices. 1 large Juice of 1 orange 1 large Juice of 1 lemon 0.25 cup lime juice 1 (1.5 liter) bottle Burgundy or other red wine 0.5 teaspoon Sweet'N Low granulated sugar substitute 3.5 cups seltzer 1 orange, chilled and cut into wedges 1 lemon, chilled and sliced 0.5 cup fresh strawberry slices Lots of citrus flavors and sliced fresh fruit make a refreshing red-wine sangria, and this recipe makes enough for a crowd.

title: Big Batch Freezer Dirty Martini
text: Pour 6 ounces of vodka from the bottle and set aside for another use. To the reserved vodka in the bottle, add vermouth, brine, and water. Put the top on the bottle and invert bottle to incorporate the ingredients. Place bottle in the freezer for at least 4 hours and up to 2 months. To serve, pour desired amount into chilled glass and garnish with olives. 1 liter vodka 4 fluid ounces vermouth 2 fluid ounces olive brine 2 fluid ounces water olives for garnish This big batch freezer recipe for dirty martini is perfect for entertaining.

title: PB & J Smoothie
text: Combine strawberries, milk, peanut butter, blue agave, and flax seeds in a blender and blend until well combined. 6 frozen strawberries, or more to taste 0.75 cup milk 1.5 tablespoons peanut butter 1 tablespoon blue agave nectar, or more to taste 1 tablespoon flax seeds A delicious peanut butter and jelly smoothie with strawberries, sweetened with blue agave and boosted with flax seeds.

title: Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie
text: Gather all ingredients. Place bananas, milk, peanut butter, honey, and ice cubes in a blender. Blend until smooth, about 30 seconds. Enjoy! 2 bananas, broken into chunks 2 cups milk 0.5 cup peanut butter 2 tablespoons honey, or to taste 2 cups ice cubes This peanut butter banana smoothie requires just 4 ingredients and a blender to prepare and enjoy for a sweet on-the-go breakfast or snack.

title: Sangria Barcelona Style
text: Place the lemon, orange, and brown sugar in a large pitcher. Pour in vodka, Cointreau, gin, orange soda, lemon-lime soda, pineapple juice, and orange juice. Add ice cubes and pour in red wine; stir well until the sugar has dissolved. 1 lemon, sliced 1 orange, sliced 3 tablespoons brown sugar 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vodka 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger cointreau or triple sec 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger gin 0.25 cup orange soda 0.25 cup lemon-lime soda 0.75 cup pineapple juice 0.75 cup orange juice 1 cup ice cubes 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry red wine This is sangria as seen in Barcelona; it only takes 15 minutes to make!

title: Strawberry Milkshake without Ice Cream
text: Combine milk, strawberries, and syrup in a blender cup and blend until smooth. 1 cup whole milk 0.5 cup frozen strawberries 1 tablespoon strawberry syrup (such as Torani®) This sweet strawberry milkshake without ice cream requires only 3 ingredients to prepare, making it a quick and easy choice for a summertime dessert.

title: Pressure Cooker Apple Cider
text: Place apples in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®). Spread brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, nutmeg, and cloves on top. Fill the rest of the pot up with water, up to the maximum line. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 60 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Remove cinnamon sticks. Mash apples with a potato masher or spoon. Return cinnamon sticks to the pot. Continue cooking on high pressure for another 60 minutes, allowing 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Repeat quick-release, about 5 minutes. Strain out cider using a strainer or cheesecloth; discard solids. Serve hot or cold. 8 apples, quartered 1 cup brown sugar 3 cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg 1 teaspoon ground cloves Fill your Instant Pot® with apples, brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, and other fall spices to make this crowd-pleasing homemade cider.

title: Homemade Liquors
text: In a saucepan, combine sugar and water. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Pour vodka and vanilla extract into the room temperature mixture. Pour the liquor into a sealable decanter; seal and store for at least two weeks before serving. 0.5 cup sugar 0.25 cup water 0.5 cup vodka 2 teaspoons vanilla extract This is an excellent base for homemade liquors. Substitute chocolate, coconut, or any flavoring desired for vanilla extract and you will have made a different flavor alcohol. Food coloring can also be added to the cooled mixture to add a bit of pizzazz to your alcohol drinks! Perfect for warming up parties during the winter holidays.

title: Iowa City Oatmeal Cookie (Cocktail)
text: Shake the butterscotch schnapps, Irish liqueur, and cinnamon schnapps in a cocktail shaker with crushed ice; strain into a small glass. 0.5 fluid ounce butterscotch schnapps 0.5 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur 0.5 fluid ounce cinnamon schnapps 0.25 cup crushed ice It's not a cookie, it's a cookie spice-flavored cocktail!

title: Sunset Sangria
text: Combine wine, pineapple juice, vodka, triple sec, and simple syrup in a large bowl or pitcher. Refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour. Stir the oranges, lemons, limes, and raspberries into the chilled sangria at least 30 minutes before serving. The longer the fruit marinates the better. Serve over ice. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle rose wine 1 cup pineapple juice 0.5 cup vodka 0.25 cup triple sec 0.5 cup simple syrup 1 orange, sliced into rounds 1 lemon, sliced into rounds 1 lime, sliced into rounds 1 (6 ounce) container fresh raspberries This sweet and refreshing punch makes a beautiful centerpiece for your next summer gathering. With sliced citrus fruit, raspberries, and pineapple juice, you may want to make a couple batches--just in case.

title: Apple Julep
text: In a large pitcher, stir together the apple juice, orange juice, pineapple juice and lemon juice. Mix and pour into glasses full of ice to serve. Garnish each serving with a mint leaf. 1 quart apple juice 1 cup orange juice 1 cup pineapple juice 0.25 cup lemon juice 1 sprig fresh mint leaves A great blend of juices that is tasty with breakfast or anytime.

title: Dark Chocolate Hot Cocoa
text: Heat milk in a saucepan over medium heat until just before boiling, 3 to 4 minutes. Add brown sugar and stir until dissolved, about 1 minute. Stir dark chocolate into milk until melted, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and stir cream and cinnamon into milk mixture. Serve hot. 1 cup whole milk 1.5 teaspoons brown sugar, or to taste 2 ounces dark chocolate (such as Moser Roth® 85% Dark Chocolate), or to taste 1 tablespoon heavy whipping cream, or more to taste 1 pinch ground cinnamon, or more to taste This dark hot chocolate drink is a quick and easy treat to make when you are having a chocolate craving. A dusting of cinnamon makes it a festive favorite.

title: Sex with an Alligator
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add pineapple juice, melon liqueur, and rum. Cover and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled rocks glass. Pour in raspberry liqueur and let it sink to the bottom, then carefully pour Jägermeister on top. 1 cup ice, or as needed 3 fluid ounces pineapple juice 0.75 fluid ounce melon liqueur 0.75 fluid ounce coconut rum 0.75 fluid ounce raspberry-flavored liqueur 0.75 fluid ounce Jagermeister liqueur A sex with an alligator cocktail is sweet and satisfying with coconut rum, melon liqueur, pineapple juice, raspberry liqueur, and Jägermeister.

title: White Sangria with Frozen Fruit
text: Pour wine and schnapps into a pitcher. Add sugar, peaches, mango, and raspberries and stir gently. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle white wine 0.5 cup peach schnapps 0.25 cup white sugar 0.25 cup frozen sliced peaches, or to taste 0.25 cup frozen sliced mango, or to taste 0.25 cup frozen raspberries, or to taste Made with frozen fruit and peach schnapps, this easy white sangria is perfect for summertime parties or gatherings.

title: Sangria! Sangria!
text: Gather all ingredients. Mix together red wine, brandy, triple sec, lemonade concentrate, orange juice, lemon juice, and sugar in a bowl. Add orange, lemon, and lime slices and maraschino cherries. Serve immediately over ice, or refrigerate 8 hours to overnight for best flavor. For a fizzy sangria, add club soda just before serving. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry red wine 0.5 cup brandy 0.5 cup triple sec 0.33333334326744 cup frozen lemonade concentrate 0.33333334326744 cup orange juice 0.25 cup lemon juice 0.25 cup white sugar 1 medium orange, sliced into rounds 1 medium lemon, sliced into rounds 1 medium lime, sliced into rounds 8 maraschino cherries 2 cups carbonated water This sangria recipe is easy to make with Spanish red wine, orange juice, brandy, and freshly chopped fruit for a super refreshing summer party drink.

title: Non-Alcoholic New Year's Eve Punch
text: Combine ginger ale and orange juice in a large punch bowl. Place sliced oranges and arrange the cherries on top of the orange slices. 3.5 liters ginger ale 2 quarts orange juice 2 oranges, sliced into rounds 20 maraschino cherries This New Year's Eve punch is a refreshing, bubbly bowl of ginger ale and orange juice. Float colorful slices of orange and maraschino cherries on top.

title: Yummy Strawberry Shake
text: In a blender combine strawberries, ice, milk, ice cream and sugar. Blend until smooth. 4 cups strawberries, hulled 2 cups ice cubes 2 cups milk 4 cups strawberry ice cream 2 teaspoons white sugar This strawberry shake is made with both fresh strawberries and strawberry ice cream, blended with milk, sugar and ice.

title: Mr. Big's White Sangria
text: Put orange slices, lemon slices, and lime slices in a large punch bowl. Pour sugar over the fruit; add tequila and mix gently with a wooden spoon. Let soak 6 hours to overnight. Put plenty of ice in the punch bowl. Pour white wine, champagne, and club soda over the ice. Stir and serve immediately. 3 oranges, thinly sliced 4 lemons, thinly sliced 4 limes, thinly sliced 1.5 cups white sugar 0.5 cup tequila 2 trays ice cubes, or as needed 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry white wine 1 (750 milliliter) bottle champagne 2 cups club soda This refreshing tequila-spiked punch is perfect for any summer gathering.

title: Boston Cooler
text: Combine the ginger ale and ice cream in a blender; blend until smooth. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle ginger ale 3 scoops vanilla ice cream Use your favorite ginger ale with your favorite vanilla ice cream to make this refreshing treat.

title: Red Wine and Orange Sangria
text: Stir orange juice and sugar together in a pitcher until sugar dissolves. Add wine, oranges, plums, strawberries, and brandy. Cover and chill until ready to serve, 1 to 24 hours. Gently stir in club soda before serving over ice. Garnish with fresh mint sprigs. 0.5 cup orange juice 3 tablespoons white sugar 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine 1 cup orange slices 0.5 cup sliced plums 0.5 cup sliced fresh strawberries 0.25 cup brandy 1.5 cups club soda 3 cups ice, or as needed 8 sprigs fresh mint This sangria recipe, featuring red wine, oranges, plums, and strawberries, is easy to customize with different wines, fruit, and herbs. Perfect for summer entertaining!

title: Mayan Hot Chocolate
text: Mix the hot chocolate mix, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper together in a mug. Pour the milk into a glass measuring cup; heat in microwave on High until it begins to boil, about 2 minutes. Slowly pour over the mixture in the mug, stirring with a small whisk as you pour. Enjoy immediately. 1 cup milk 3 tablespoons instant hot chocolate mix 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 pinch cayenne pepper Cayenne pepper and cinnamon are added to instant hot chocolate mix to make this Mayan-style hot chocolate.

title: Coffee Liqueur
text: Bring sugar and water to a boil in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in instant coffee, and allow to cool, 30 to 45 minutes. When cool, stir in vodka and vanilla extract. Pour into clean bottles. Close the bottles tightly and store in a cool dark place. 4 cups white sugar 4 cups water 0.75 cup instant coffee granules 4 cups vodka 2 tablespoons vanilla extract Try this simple coffee liqueur recipe made with sugar, vodka, and instant coffee granules, and serve up some homemade cordials after your next dinner party.

title: How to Make Cold Foam
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine milk and simple syrup in a small measuring cup. Submerge the end of a milk frother in the mixture. Froth until consistently foamy, 15 to 20 seconds for skim milk or 2 to 3 minutes for almond milk. Divide cold brew coffee between 2 glass mugs. Spoon cold foam over coffee. Sprinkle with nutmeg or cinnamon. 1/4 cup skim milk or almond milk 1 1/2 to 2 teaspoons Vanilla Simple Syrup or purchased vanilla-flavored syrup (optional) 2 cups cold brew coffee or iced coffee (ordesired amount) Freshly grated nutmeg or cinnamon (optional) Learn how to make cold foam by aerating skim milk until frothy for a thick and creamy topping that holds its shape on cold brew coffee or iced cappuccinos.

title: Sweet Lime Iced Tea
text: Pour boiling water into a gallon jar over tea bags. Allow to steep for 45 minutes. Remove and discard tea bags. Stir in sugar and lime juice until sugar has dissolved. Cool to room temperature; refrigerate until cold before serving. 1 gallon boiling water 6 black tea bags 1.5 cups white sugar 4 limes, juiced Not too sweet, not too bitter, this lime tea is just right!

title: Apple Milkshake
text: Place the apple, milk, ice cream, and sugar in a blender, and blend until smooth. Serve cold! 1 apple - peeled, cored, and chopped 1.5 cups milk 3 scoops vanilla ice cream 2 tablespoons white sugar This smooth, delicate shake is a great way to cool off during the hot, hot days of late summer. Any type of apple will work -- choose your favorite, or pick one from the back yard!

title: Bulletproof Hot Chocolate
text: Combine hot water, butter, MCT oil, cacao powder, cacao butter, vanilla powder, liquid stevia, and salt in a blender; blend until smooth. 11 fluid ounces hot water 2 tablespoons unsalted butter 1 tablespoon medium-chain triglyceride (MCT) oil 1 tablespoon cacao powder 1 tablespoon cacao butter 0.125 teaspoon vanilla powder 6 drops liquid stevia, or to taste 1 pinch salt Butter, MCT oil, and cacao powder are blended with water creating a Bulletproof hot chocolate, a chocolate version of the coffee drink.

title: Lavender Lemonade with Hibiscus
text: Mix 3 cups water and lemon juice in a large pitcher. Refrigerate until chilled. Bring remaining 3 cups water, sugar, lavender, and hibiscus petals to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Strain lavender and hibiscus from liquid and pour into pitcher with lemon water. Refrigerate until cold. 3 cups water 1.5 cups lemon juice 3 cups water 1.25 cups white sugar 2 tablespoons dried lavender flowers 1.5 teaspoons dried hibiscus petals Lavender and hibiscus give a sweet and floral fragrance to this traditional lemonade.

title: Irish Cream and Coffee
text: Pour hot brewed coffee into a glass mug. Stir in Irish cream liqueur. 1 cup strong brewed coffee 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Irish cream liqueur Irish cream coffee is a delicious after-dinner cocktail made with hot coffee and Irish cream liqueur. Try it over vanilla ice cream for a special dessert!

title: The Best Post-Workout Shake
text: Layer protein powder, flax meal, cocoa powder, and brown sugar in a blender. Add almond milk, frozen berries, banana, and peanut butter. Blend until smooth, about 1 minute. 1 scoop whey protein powder 1 tablespoon flax seed meal 1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder 1 teaspoon brown sugar 1 cup unsweetened almond milk 0.5 cup frozen mixed berries 1 medium banana 1 tablespoon smooth peanut butter This is the best post-workout protein shake. Made with almond milk, banana, whey protein powder, frozen berries, and peanut butter, it's a delicious treat.

title: Micheladas with Tajin
text: Rub lime juice around the rim of a glass and dip in chile-lime seasoning. Fill with ice. Combine tomato juice cocktail, chamoy, hot sauce, Worcestershire, soy sauce, and cayenne. Mix well and pour over ice. Fill the glass with beer. 1 lime, juiced 1 teaspoon chile-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®), or more to taste ice 0.5 cup tomato juice cocktail (such as Clamato®), chilled 1 tablespoon chamoy (Mexican chili fruit condiment) 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tapatio®) 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce 1 teaspoon soy sauce 0.25 teaspoon cayenne pepper 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle dark beer (such as Dos Equis XX Cerveza) Dark beer is added to a chilled spicy, zesty blend with chamoy to make these Mexican Micheladas with Tajin® that are perfect for entertaining.

title: Chef John's "Sunset" Michelada
text: Place cherry tomatoes, celery, and red bell pepper into a blender. Pulse a few times to get mixture moving. Blend on high until mixture has liquefied, a few more seconds. Place strainer over a bowl and strain mixture to remove seeds and skins. Push mixture through strainer with a spatula to extract the liquid. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle flake salt, black pepper, and chili pepper on a small plate. Rub rim of a glass with cut surface of a lime. Invert glass and dip rim into salt mixture. Fill glass with ice and add Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and soy sauce. Pour in the vegetable juice and juice of 1/2 lime. Fill the glass 3/4 of the way with ice-cold beer. Stir. Top off with more beer. Garnish with lime slice. 2 pints sweet cherry tomatoes 0.25 cup chopped celery 0.25 cup chopped red bell pepper salt and ground black pepper to taste 0.5 teaspoon flake sea salt (such as Maldon®) 1 pinch freshly ground black pepper 1 pinch dried red chile pepper 1 lime, halved ice cubes 0.5 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce 0.5 teaspoon hot pepper sauce 0.125 teaspoon soy sauce 1/4 cup homemade vegetable juice 0.5 (12 fluid ounce) bottle ice-cold Mexican lager Use homemade vegetable juice or store-bought tomato juice to make this Michelada: a spicy, savory, tangy, and amazingly refreshing beer cocktail.

title: Hot Chocolate Mix
text: Mix milk powder, sugar, cocoa, and salt together in a bowl. Transfer mix to an airtight container. 3 cups nonfat dry milk powder 0.75 cup white sugar 0.5 cup unsweetened cocoa powder 0.125 teaspoon salt Homemade hot chocolate mix is as simple as mixing four ingredients that are probably in your cupboard already. Add a scoop to hot water for a chocolaty treat.

title: Wassail
text: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Stud oranges with whole cloves and place in a baking pan. Add water to cover bottom of the pan. Bake in the preheated oven until oranges have softened, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, place apple cider and cinnamon sticks into a large saucepan; bring to a boil. Simmer, covered, for 5 minutes. Remove lid and add pineapple juice, honey, lemon juice, lemon zest, and ground nutmeg. Return to a simmer and cook for 5 more minutes. Pour into a punch bowl and float spiced oranges on top. 3 oranges 3 tablespoons whole cloves, or as needed water as needed 3 quarts apple cider 2 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks 5 cups pineapple juice 0.5 cup honey 0.33333334326744 cup lemon juice 2 teaspoons lemon zest 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg This non-alcoholic apple cider punch simmered with honey, pineapple juice, and lemon juice and flavored with clove-spiced oranges is perfect for the holidays or any fall gathering.

title: Watermelon Cooler Slushy
text: Place watermelon and ice into a blender. Pour in lime juice, sugar, and salt. Blend until smooth. 4 cups cubed seedless watermelon 10 ice cubes 0.33333334326744 cup fresh lime juice 0.25 cup white sugar 0.125 teaspoon salt This watermelon slushy is just perfect for hot summer days! Watermelon, ice, and a bit of lime juice are simply blended together in this quick treat.

title: Classic Bloody Mary
text: Gather all ingredients. Pour salt onto a small plate. Moisten the rim of a glass and press into the salt. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes; add vegetable juice cocktail, vodka, Worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, salt, and pepper. Cover and shake until the outside of shaker has frosted, about 20 seconds. Strain Bloody Mary into the prepared glass. Garnish with celery stalk and olives. Enjoy! 1 teaspoon sea salt, or as needed ice cubes, as needed 0.75 cup spicy tomato-vegetable juice cocktail (such as V8®) 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger vodka 2 dashes Worcestershire sauce 1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®) salt and ground black pepper to taste 1 stalk celery 2 garlic-stuffed green olives, threaded onto a toothpick A Bloody Mary is easy to make with vodka, tomato juice, and a few other simple ingredients. It's perfect for brunch or other afternoon gatherings.

title: Watermelon-Raspberry Lemonade
text: Combine 1/3 cup water and sugar in a small saucepan; bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves. Remove simple syrup from heat to cool. Place watermelon, raspberries, and remaining water together in a blender; pulse until smooth. Pour watermelon mixture into a frosted pitcher; stir in simple syrup and lime juice. Refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour. 1 cup water, divided 0.33333334326744 cup white sugar 6 cups cubed seedless watermelon 0.5 cup red raspberries 0.5 cup fresh lemon juice Made with fresh watermelon, raspberry, lemon juice, and simple syrup, this easy thirst-quenching lemonade is awesome on a hot summer day.

title: Blackberry Slushie
text: Combine blackberries and orange juice in a blender; blend until smooth. 1 cup frozen blackberries 0.33333334326744 cup cold orange juice, or as needed This is a super quick and easy dessert on a hot day with only 2 ingredients - orange juice and frozen blackberries.

title: Most Amazing Sangria Recipe Ever!
text: Stir red wine, ginger ale, orange juice, brandy, triple sec, sugar, cinnamon, and apple together in a large pitcher. Divide crushed ice evenly into six large wine glasses. Pour red wine mixture into each wine glass, making sure that each serving has a few pieces of apple. 4.5 cups red wine 0.75 cup ginger ale 0.5 cup orange juice 2 fluid ounces brandy 1 fluid ounce triple sec (orange-flavored liqueur) 1 teaspoon white sugar 1 pinch ground cinnamon 2 cups crushed ice 0.5 Granny Smith apple, diced Ginger ale adds a sparkling sweetness to this refreshing red wine punch.

title: Hippie Juice
text: Pour 2 1/2 cups raspberry lemonade out of the bottle into a glass measuring cup. Pour watermelon vodka, coconut-flavored rum, and triple sec into the bottle; stir to combine. Fill bottle back to the top with raspberry lemonade from the measuring cup. Refrigerate until serving. 1 (1.75 liter) bottle raspberry lemonade (such as Simply Lemonade®) 1.5 cups watermelon vodka 0.5 cup coconut-flavored rum (such as Malibu®) 0.5 cup triple sec This refreshing hippie juice blends raspberry lemonade, watermelon vodka, coconut rum, and triple sec for a fresh-tasting alcoholic punch.

title: Strawberry Milkshake
text: Blend strawberries, ice cream, milk, honey, and vanilla extract together in an electric blender. Blend in ice. Pour into glasses, squirt on whipped cream, and drizzle chocolate sauce on top. 13 fresh strawberries 4 scoops strawberry ice cream 1 cup milk 2 tablespoons honey 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.5 cup ice 2 tablespoons whipped cream, or to taste 2 teaspoons chocolate sauce, or to taste This homemade strawberry milkshake makes for a creamy, sweet treat to enjoy on those hot summer days!

title: Coffee Nudge
text: You will need 8 mugs or glass coffee cups. Pour 1 ounce of coffee liqueur into each mug, then add one ounce of brandy and 1/2 ounce of creme de cacao to each serving. Fill each mug with hot coffee, garnish with a dollop of whipped cream, and top with chocolate sprinkles; serve. 8 fluid ounces coffee flavored liqueur 8 fluid ounces brandy 4 fluid ounces creme de cacao 8 cups hot brewed coffee 2 cups whipped cream, garnish 2 tablespoons chocolate sprinkles Coffee nudge is a warm coffee cocktail made with brandy, creme de cacao, and coffee flavored liqueur that's topped with whipped cream and chocolate sprinkles.

title: Almond Tea
text: Mix sugar and instant tea powder together in a 1-gallon container. Pour in boiling water and lemonade concentrate; mix until well combined. Stir in vanilla and almond extracts, then fill the container with cold water. Stir to combine. Serve over ice or refrigerate until ready to serve. 1 cup white sugar 3 tablespoons instant iced tea powder 2 cups boiling water 1 (12 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 1 tablespoon almond extract 3 quarts cold water, or as needed Refreshing almond tea is a wonderful summer treat for parties or just to have on hand when you need an ice-cold beverage.

title: Coffee Liqueur II
text: In a 4 quart saucepan, bring to a boil the water, instant coffee and sugar. Simmer for 2 hours, then allow to cool. When cool, add vanilla and vodka. 6 cups water 0.5 cup instant coffee granules 6 cups white sugar 0.5 cup vanilla extract 0.5 gallon vodka Now you too can make this wonderful liqueur at home and give it to your friends for the holidays. This is so delicious with cream and over ice.

title: Jager Bomb
text: Pour energy drink into a pint glass. Pour Jagermeister into a shot glass. Make a toast and drop the shot into the pint glass. Down the hatch! 0.5 (8.3 ounce) can citrus flavored energy drink (e.g. Red Bull™) 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Jagermeister liqueur The infamous jager bomb — a popular combination of licorice-flavored Jagermeister and fan-favorite energy drink Red Bull. Here's how to make one.

title: Tiki Cooler
text: Place a few ice cubes in a pitcher; add pineapple juice, coconut milk, lime juice, and almond-flavored syrup and stir until chilled. Strain mixture and pour into 4 glasses. Top each glass with club soda; mocktail will foam up. Dust each mocktail with nutmeg. Garnish with a lime wheel, sprig of mint, and umbrella. ice cubes 1 (6 ounce) can pineapple juice 6 fluid ounces coconut milk 3 limes, juiced 2 tablespoons almond-flavored syrup (such as Torani®) 1 cup club soda, or as needed 4 pinches ground nutmeg 4 lime wheels 4 sprigs fresh mint cocktail umbrellas Coconut milk, lime juice, almond syrup, and pineapple juice are combined in this tiki cooler, a citrusy mocktail with a hint of sweetness.

title: Hawaiian Hot Chocolate
text: Whisk half-and-half, milk, sugar, and cocoa powder in a saucepan over medium-high heat until cocoa and sugar dissolve. Remove from heat when mixture begins to steam, 5 to 10 minutes. Whisk vanilla extract, coconut extract, and salt into cocoa mixture. Pour into glasses and top each with whipped cream and toasted coconut. 3 cups half-and-half 1 cup 2% milk 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup unsweetened cocoa powder 1 tablespoon vanilla extract 1 tablespoon coconut extract 0.5 teaspoon kosher salt 0.5 cup whipped cream, or more to taste 0.25 cup toasted, shredded coconut The flavors of Hawaii combine in this coconut-infused hot chocolate, perfect for a cool evening.

title: Eggnog (Spiked with Rum)
text: Mix egg yolks, 2 cups sugar, rum, and nutmeg together in a large bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 8 hours to overnight to "cure." Beat egg whites and remaining 1 cup sugar in a bowl using an electric mixer until firm peaks form. Fold in heavy cream. Fold in the egg yolk mixture. Beat in half-and-half until well combined. Pour into lidded jars or containers, refrigerate, and shake before serving. 12 eggs, separated 3 cups white sugar, divided 16 fluid ounces dark rum (such as Captain Morgan® Spiced Rum) 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg 2 cups heavy whipping cream 1 quart half-and-half To make the best spiked eggnog with rum for any holiday party, cure yolks in rum and sugar overnight before mixing in egg whites and cream.

title: Chai Tea Mix
text: Combine sugar, instant tea, milk powder, nondairy creamer, and vanilla-flavored creamer in a large bowl. Stir in ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom. Blend 1 cup at a time in a food processor or blender until a fine powder. Stir 2 heaping tablespoons chai tea mix into a mug of hot water for 1 serving. 2.5 cups white sugar 1.5 cups unsweetened instant tea 1 cup nonfat dry milk powder 1 cup powdered non-dairy creamer 1 cup French vanilla flavored powdered non-dairy creamer 2 teaspoons ground ginger 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon 1 teaspoon ground cloves 1 teaspoon ground cardamom A dry chai tea mix for instant hot lattes flavored with ginger, cinnamon, clove, and cardamom that you can keep on hand for those frequent cravings.

title: Basil Lemonade
text: Stir water, lemonade, sugar, and lime juice together in a pitcher. Add 1/2 cup basil leaves, stir to combine, cover the pitcher, and refrigerate until flavors combine, 8 hours to overnight. Remove basil leaves and discard. 12 cups cold water 1 (12 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed 0.33333334326744 cup white sugar 0.25 cup fresh lime juice 0.5 cup firmly packed torn basil leaves Give your lemonade a refreshing kick by adding fresh basil and a little lime.

title: Danny's Warm and Fuzzy Apple Cider
text: Combine the cider and brown sugar in a saucepan. Wrap the cinnamon sticks, allspice, cloves and lemon zest in cheesecloth and add to the cider mixture; bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Remove the spice bundle and stir in the rum and butterscotch schnapps. Serve warm in mugs. 7 cups apple cider 0.33333334326744 cup brown sugar 4 cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon whole allspice 1 teaspoon whole cloves 1 tablespoon lemon zest 1.5 cups dark rum 0.5 cup butterscotch schnapps This is a great beverage for cold afternoons and evenings. It also makes your house smell fabulous while it is simmering on the stove!

title: Hot Chocolate
text: Put milk into a microwave-safe container and cook on High in microwave for 2 minutes. Mix in chocolate, sugar, and cinnamon. In a small bowl, whisk an egg until smooth, then mix it into the chocolate mixture. Return to microwave and cook on High for 3 to 4 minutes or until foamy (be careful not to let it boil.) Whisk until smooth and pour into 3 mugs. Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon if desired. 3 cups milk 0.33300000429153 cup semisweet chocolate, grated 1 tablespoon white sugar 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 egg A blend of milk, chocolate, sugar, cinnamon and egg make a simple, sweet hot chocolate.

title: Creamy Vegan Hot Cocoa
text: Stir together coconut milk, vanilla extract, sugar, cocoa powder, and cinnamon in a large mug. Add boiling water and stir until the sugar has dissolved. 3 tablespoons canned coconut milk 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 3 tablespoons white sugar 4.5 teaspoons cocoa powder 1 dash ground cinnamon 1 cup boiling water This vegan hot chocolate has a bit of a tropical twist with a splash of coconut milk.

title: Spanish Gin and Tonic (Gin Tonica)
text: Fill a large red wine glass with fresh ice almost to the top. Add whole spices to the glass. These should be chosen to compliment the botanicals in the gin, and some common choices include juniper berries, peppercorns, star anise, cardamom pods, cloves, and cinnamon sticks. For a more pronounced flavor, whole spices can be “bruised” by pressing with your fingers, or the flat of a knife before adding.  Pour in gin. Then very slowly and gently pour in tonic, so as not to lose the carbonation. For best results, use a “Mediterranean style” tonic instead of the classic Indian style, since they tend to be less bitter, and often include flavors like rosemary and lemon. Add slices and/or zest from the citrus fruit(s) of your choice. Use a cocktail stirrer or spoon to gently poke the ingredients down, and mix the drink. Do not stir vigorously!  Push in the fresh herb sprigs. Common choices are basil, thyme, mint, rosemary, or tarragon. For a stronger, more fragrant effect, slap the herbs between your hands, or squeeze between your fingers to activate the essential oils. Serve 3 to 5 minutes after mixing to give drink time to chill thoroughly. star anise 2 ounces gin 4 to 6 ounces tonic water, or to taste sliced fresh lemon and/or citrus zest fresh thyme This Spanish gin and tonic, with citrus slices, whole spices, and fresh herbs, was invented by chefs from the Basque region of Spain, and is the most refreshing hot-weather cocktail ever. The whole idea is to add things to the glass to make things that already taste great in the gin taste even more amazing.

title: Rosemary-Infused Watermelon Lemonade
text: Bring the water and sugar to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat. Stir in the rosemary, and set aside to steep for 1 hour. Place half of the lemon juice, and half of the watermelon into a blender. Strain the rosemary syrup through a mesh strainer into the blender. Cover, and puree until smooth. Strain into a pitcher, then puree the remaining lemon juice and watermelon. Stir the lemonade before serving over ice. 2 cups water 0.75 cup white sugar 1 sprig rosemary, leaves stripped and chopped 2 cups lemon juice 12 cups cubed seeded watermelon 8 cups ice cubes This is a recipe I created in an effort to duplicate my favorite lemonade from a cafe in downtown L.A. called, well, 'Lemonade'. I don't like it too sweet, so if you want to add more sugar, cool. But I think that this recipe is perfect.

title: Homemade Creme Liqueur
text: Combine condensed milk, liqueur, cream, and eggs in a blender, and whip until smooth. Serve over ice, if desired. 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 cup coffee-flavored liqueur 1 cup heavy whipping cream 4 eggs Strictly for grown ups, this recipe smooth and creamy beverage is made with either almond or coffee liqueur.

title: Thin Mint Cocoa
text: Mix the sugar, cocoa mix, and salt into the water in a saucepan until completely dissolved. Bring the mixture to a boil; cook and stir at a boil for 2 minutes. Stir the milk, vanilla extract, and peppermint extract through the mixture. Continue cooking until hot, but do not bring to a boil. Serve hot. 0.5 cup white sugar 0.25 cup hot cocoa mix 1 dash salt 0.33333334326744 cup hot water 4 cups whole milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 teaspoon peppermint extract Peppermint and vanilla flavor this hot chocolate treat.

title: All-Fruit Smoothies
text: Pour pineapple juice into a blender and add banana, strawberries, and blueberries. Cover and blend until smooth, about 1 minute. Pour into 2 glasses. 1 cup pineapple juice 1 large banana, cut into chunks 1 cup frozen strawberries 1 cup frozen blueberries There's nothing in this smoothie except pineapple juice, banana, and frozen strawberries and blueberries. It's smooth, frosty, and dairy-free.

title: Indian Summer Raspberry Peach Sangria
text: Stir red wine, raspberry-flavored soda water, peach schnapps, pomegranate juice, and lemon juice together in a large pitcher or punch bowl; add raspberries, peach slices, lemon slices, and orange slices. Float ice cubes in the beverage to chill. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine 24 fluid ounces raspberry-flavored soda water 0.5 cup peach schnapps 0.5 cup pomegranate juice 0.5 cup fresh lemon juice 1 cup fresh raspberries 2 peaches, sliced 2 lemons, sliced 1 orange, sliced 4 cups ice cubes, or as desired Red wine, peach schnapps, and raspberry-flavored soda water are the primary ingredients in this sangria punch with fresh fruit and fruit juices.

title: Delicious, Healthy Strawberry Shake
text: Combine milk, strawberries, honey, and vanilla in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. 2 cups milk 1 cup frozen strawberries 1 tablespoon honey 1 teaspoon vanilla extract A strawberry shake recipe like mom used to make. Easy and refreshing, especially on hot days. Simply blend strawberries with milk, honey, and vanilla.

title: Easiest Eggnog
text: Blend together milk, eggs, sugar, vanilla, and nutmeg in a large pitcher until well combined. Chill in the refrigerator before serving. 2.3333332538605 cups low-fat milk 2 large eggs, beaten 3 tablespoons sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 dash ground nutmeg This easy homemade eggnog flavored with vanilla and a dash of nutmeg comes together in just 5 minutes with 5 simple ingredients for a festive drink.

title: White Sangria
text: Combine peach schnapps, cognac, sugar, sliced oranges, and sliced mangos in a pitcher; stir and chill for at least an hour. Pour fruit mixture into a large punch bowl. Stir in chilled white wine and ginger ale. Ladle into glasses with some of the sliced fruit. 0.5 cup peach schnapps 0.5 cup cognac 0.25 cup white sugar 4 oranges, sliced into rounds 2 mangos, peeled and sliced 4 (750 milliliter) bottles dry white wine, chilled 1 liter ginger ale, chilled This fruity white sangria is made with white wine, cognac, peach schnapps, ginger ale, mango, and orange for a sparkling and refreshing party drink.

title: Rickyrootbeer
text: Pour the vodka and Irish cream into a shot glass. Pour the root beer into a tumbler. Drop the entire shot glass into the root beer and drink immediately. 0.5 fluid ounce vanilla vodka 0.5 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur 4 fluid ounces root beer This is not your typical shot. Everyone loves it; it tastes like a root beer float!

title: Spinach and Banana Power Smoothie
text: Blend soy milk and spinach together in a blender until smooth. Add banana and pulse until thoroughly blended. 1 cup plain soy milk 0.75 cup packed fresh spinach leaves 1 large banana, sliced This vegan banana spinach smoothie provides a dairy-free and protein-rich pick-me-up that tastes delicious. It's easy to blend and take anywhere.

title: Refreshing Brazilian Lemonade
text: Combine water and limes in a blender; blend until smooth. Strain mixture through a strainer into a bowl; discard solids. Pour lime mixture into blender. Add condensed milk, ice, and sugar; blend until combined. 4.25 cups water 4 large limes, cut into wedges and seeded 0.5 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk ice cubes 5 tablespoons white sugar Made with fresh limes, condensed milk, and sugar, this Brazilian twist on lemonade is quick and easy and will be the hit at every summer party.

title: Kentucky Derby Bourbon Punch
text: Mix bourbon, orange juice concentrate, lemonade concentrate, lemon juice, and maraschino cherry juice together in a pitcher until base is well mixed. Pour base into a punch bowl; add club soda, lemon slices, and maraschino cherry halves. 34 fluid ounces bourbon 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed 0.25 cup lemon juice 0.25 cup maraschino cherry juice 1.5 liters club soda 1 lemon, sliced 0.5 cup maraschino cherries, halved Bourbon is the star ingredient in this Kentucky Derby punch that also includes orange juice and lemonade for a refreshing adult beverage.

title: Big Batch Berry Sangria
text: Mix wine, sodas, simple syrup, orange juice, and brandy together in a large pitcher. Drop in orange slices and some of the frozen berries. Place in the refrigerator for 3 hours. Pour into glasses and drop in remaining frozen berries instead of ice.
