Garnish with strawberries. 2 (750 milliliter) bottles sweet red wine 2 (12 ounce) cans lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite®) 2 (12 ounce) cans strawberry soda 3 cups simple syrup 3 cups orange juice 2 cups brandy 2 large oranges, sliced 4 ounces frozen mixed berries, divided 1 cup fresh strawberries Perfect for parties and celebrations, this big batch sangria is served with frozen mixed berries in place of ice cubes for a beautiful, fruity treat.

title: Blueberry Lemonade
text: Combine blueberries, sweetener, lemon juice, and 1 cup water together in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into a pitcher. Add remaining water and stir. 3 cups fresh blueberries 0.25 cup stevia sweetener (such as Truvia®), or more to taste 0.5 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice 9 cups water, or more as needed Blueberries add color and flavor to this low-calorie lemonade made from scratch from with fresh ingredients.

title: Sugar-Free Hot Chocolate Mix
text: Combine milk powder, creamer, cocoa powder, sweetener, and cinnamon in a bowl; mix until thoroughly blended. Transfer to a jar with a tight lid. 2 cups nonfat dry milk powder 0.5 cup low-fat powdered non-dairy creamer 0.5 cup unsweetened cocoa powder 1 tablespoon granular sweetener (such as Equal®) 0.75 teaspoon ground cinnamon This hot chocolate mix is sugar free and great for diabetics or those on a reduced-sugar diet. Keep in a jar and use whenever you fancy a hot sweet drink!

title: Strawberry Champagne Punch
text: In a large punch bowl, combine champagne, ginger ale and strawberries. Gently stir and serve. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle champagne 1 (2 liter) bottle ginger ale, chilled 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen strawberries, partially thawed A simple carbonated punch with champagne, ginger ale and frozen strawberries.

title: Pumpkin Pie Milkshake
text: Blend ice cream, milk, pumpkin pie filling, brown sugar, and pumpkin pie spice in a blender until smooth. 5 scoops vanilla ice cream 0.33333334326744 cup milk 3 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling 1 teaspoon brown sugar 0.5 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice Break out your blender for this pumpkin pie milkshake using vanilla ice cream and pumpkin pie filling and spices for a delicious holiday indulgence.

title: Banana Lassi
text: Blend bananas, yogurt, milk, ice cubes, and sugar together in a blender until smooth. 2 over-ripe bananas, broken into chunks 1.25 cups thick plain yogurt 0.33333334326744 cup milk, or more to taste 2 ice cubes 2 tablespoons white sugar If you don't have any mango on hand, why not substitute in a banana to make a creamy banana lassi to go with your Indian food?

title: Hibiscus Sangria
text: Bring water, hibiscus petals, honey, cinnamon sticks, and cardamom to a boil in a large pot. Remove from heat and allow to steep for 1 hour; strain. Stir wine, brandy, brown sugar, elderflower syrup, and triple sec into strained hibiscus water until sugar is dissolved. Add pineapple, apples, strawberries, oranges, and lemon. Refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. 6 cups water 0.75 cup dried hibiscus petals 0.5 cup honey 2 cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon ground cardamom 2 (750 milliliter) bottles rose wine 0.75 cup brandy 0.5 cup brown sugar 0.5 cup elderflower syrup 0.25 cup triple sec 0.5 fresh pineapple - peeled, cored, and cut into chunks 2 Granny Smith apples, cut into chunks 1 pint strawberries, cut into chunks 2 oranges, cut into small chunks 1 lemon, cut into small chunks This creative version of sangria is chock full of sweet and colorful fruit. Hibiscus petals and elderflower syrup add a unique floral flavor.

title: Passion Fruit Martini
text: Scoop ice into a shaker. Pour in gin, vermouth, and passion fruit juice. Cover shaker, and gently shake to mix. Strain drink into a martini glass. Serve. 3 fluid ounces gin 1 fluid ounce dry vermouth 1.5 fluid ounce passion fruit juice 1 cup ice A passion fruit martini is a classic martini with gin, and dry vermouth with the addition of passion fruit juice. Serve in a chilled martini glass and garnish with a lemon twist.

title: Pineapple Sunrise
text: Process lime, carrots, and pineapple through a juicer; serve over ice. 1 lime, halved 1 pound carrots, chopped 2 cups fresh pineapple chunks ice, as desired Pineapple juice recipe made by putting lime, some carrots, and pineapple through your juicer for a vitamin-packed morning drink.

title: Vodka Lemonade with Mint
text: Combine mint and sugar in a large bowl. Stir in vodka and lemon juice. Cover and refrigerate lemonade, 30 minutes to 2 hours. Strain lemonade into a pitcher. Fill six (6- to 8-ounce) glasses with crushed ice; pour lemonade over ice. 1 cup fresh mint leaves, chopped 0.66666668653488 cup white sugar 12 fluid ounces vodka 1 cup fresh lemon juice crushed ice Vodka, lemon, and mint make for a refreshing lemonade punch you can whip up for a crowd.

title: Grinch Punch
text: Scoop softened lime sherbet into the bottom of a large punch bowl. Pour the lemon-lime soda, Hawaiian Punch, and 2 cups pineapple juice over the sherbet and stir. Place red sanding sugar in a shallow dish, and some additional pineapple juice in a separate shallow dish. Dip the rims of your serving glasses in the pineapple juice, then in the sanding sugar to coat the rims generously. Ladle the punch into the prepared glasses. 2 quarts lime sherbet, sitting at room temperature for a few minutes to soften 1 liter chilled lemon-lime soda (such as Sprite) 8 cups (1/2 gallon) chilled Hawaiian Punch Green Berry Rush juice drink 2 cups chilled pineapple juice, plus more for coating the glass rims Red sanding sugar, for coating the glass rims This festive green Grinch punch is a wonderful, awful idea for a holiday party! It's so easy to make and your guests will enjoy it so much that your heart might just grow three sizes that day.

title: Easy Pumpkin Spice Latte
text: Mix half-and-half, sugar, and pumpkin pie spice together in a coffee mug. Pour coffee into mug; stir to blend. Heat in microwave until hot, about 15 seconds. Top with whipped cream. 2 tablespoons half-and-half 2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste 0.25 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice 1 cup coffee 1 tablespoon whipped cream topping, or to taste Make your own pumpkin-spice latte-style treat from brewed coffee with this recipe.

title: Best Strawberry Lemonade Ever
text: Mix strawberries and 1/4 cup sugar together in a bowl; set aside for juices to release from strawberries, 5 to 10 minutes. Bring 1 cup water to a boil in a small saucepan; add 3/4 cup sugar. Cook and stir sugar mixture until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and cool simple syrup to room temperature. Stir simple syrup, 6 cups water, lemon juice, and ice together in a pitcher. Add sweetened strawberries and stir. 12 fresh strawberries, hulled and quartered 0.25 cup white sugar 7 cups water, divided 0.75 cup white sugar 1 cup lemon juice 2 cups ice cubes Strawberry lemonade made with fresh strawberries and homemade simple syrup is a refreshing drink on hot summer days.

title: Watermelon Lemonade
text: Place the watermelon into a blender. Cover, and puree until smooth. Strain through a fine mesh sieve. Bring sugar and 1/2 cup water to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in 3 cups of cold water and the lemon juice. Divide the ice into 12 glasses, and scoop 2 to 3 tablespoons of watermelon puree over the ice, then top with the lemonade. Gently stir before serving. 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup water 4 cups cubed watermelon 3 cups cold water 0.5 cup fresh lemon juice 6 cups ice cubes Classic lemonade meets freshly pureed watermelon in this refreshing summer drink.

title: Karak Chai
text: Heat water in a small saucepan until bubbles start to form around the edges. Add tea bags. Reduce heat to a simmer. Lightly crush lump sugar, ginger, cinnamon, rose buds, and cardamom pods in a mortar. Stir into the pot. Simmer until the tea bags and spices have become saturated, about 3 minutes. Add evaporated milk. Stir and simmer, without boiling, until sugar has dissolved and tea reaches the desired strength, about 8 minutes for strong tea. Strain into mugs. 3 cups water 2 Assam tea bags 2 Ceylon tea bags 0.125 cup Chinese lump white sugar 1 (1/4 inch thick) slice fresh ginger 0.5 inch cinnamon stick 2 dried rose buds 3 pods green cardamom 2 pods black cardamom 1 cup evaporated milk Make a big batch of this lightly spiced Middle Eastern chai in the morning to sip on throughout the day.

title: Homemade Irish Cream
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine sweetened condensed milk, Irish whiskey, heavy cream, chocolate syrup, coffee granules, vanilla, and almond extract in a blender. Blend on high speed until incorporated, 20 to 30 seconds. Store in a tightly sealed container in the refrigerator. Shake well before serving. 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1.6666667461395 cups Irish whiskey 1 cup heavy cream 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup 1 teaspoon instant coffee granules 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 teaspoon almond extract Irish cream liqueur made with whiskey, condensed milk, cream, and sugar with hints of coffee, chocolate, and almond for a sweet, creamy homemade beverage.

title: Maple Rum Flip
text: Combine rum, orange liqueur, maple syrup, and egg in a cocktail shaker. Cover and shake until pressure builds and mixture starts to emulsify, about 45 seconds. Add ice and rosemary to shaker. Cover and shake until outside of shaker is frosted, about 30 seconds. Strain into a glass. Garnish with nutmeg. 1 1/2 ounces aged rum (such as Appleton Estate) 1/2 ounces orange liqueur (such as Cointreau) 1/2 ounces pure maple syrup 1 pasteurized whole egg Ice 1 sprig fresh rosemary Grated fresh nutmeg, for garnish A classic flip cocktail shakes together liquor (or fortified wine) with sugar and a whole egg. This fall version uses rum, maple, rosemary, and nutmeg.

title: Moscow Mule Cocktail
text: Pour vodka and lime juice into a mug; add ice cubes and ginger beer. Stir to combine. Drop a lime wedge into the mug for garnish. 1.5 fluid ounces vodka 0.5 fluid ounce lime juice ice cubes 0.5 cup ginger beer 1 lime wedge for garnish This classic Moscow mule recipe combines vodka, ginger beer, lime juice, and ice to create a refreshing and spicy festive drink or summer cooler!

title: Banana Smoothie I
text: In a blender, combine banana, milk, vanilla, egg and sugar. Blend until smooth. Pour into a tall glass and top with a pinch of cinnamon. 1 banana 1 cup milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 egg 2 tablespoons white sugar 1 pinch ground cinnamon A smooth drink that is a meal in itself. Banana, milk and a nice raw egg - all topped off with a pinch of cinnamon. This recipe contains raw eggs. We recommend that pregnant women, young children, the elderly and the infirm do not consume raw eggs.

title: Mangonada
text: Place 1 teaspoon chamoy on a plate. Place 1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning on another plate. Dip rim of glass first in chamoy, then in chili-lime seasoning. Set aside. Combine frozen mango, water, and lime juice in a blender; blend until smooth. Place 1/2 tablespoon chamoy in the bottom of the glass. Add 1/2 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning and 1/2 of the blended mangoes. Repeat layers and top with diced fresh mango. 1 teaspoon chamoy (Mexican chili fruit condiment) 1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®) 1 cup Mango chunks, frozen 0.75 cup water 0.5 medium lime, juiced 1 tablespoon chamoy (Mexican chili fruit condiment) 1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®) 2 tablespoons diced fresh mango Mangonadas are a layered Mexican mango smoothie that are sweet, salty, tart, and fruity. A definite cool-down drink for those hot summer days.

title: Brandy Slush II
text: In a large saucepan, boil the water. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Add tea bags, and let sit overnight at room temperature. In a large freezer proof container, combine mixture with orange juice concentrate, lemonade concentrate and apricot brandy. Cover tightly, and freeze, stirring every few hours, until frozen. 8 cups water 2 cups white sugar 4 tea bags 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans frozen orange juice concentrate 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans frozen lemonade concentrate 13 fluid ounces apricot brandy A delicious, cool drink on a hot day. Apricot brandy is mixed with tea, orange juice and lemonade concentrate, then frozen into slush. A hit at showers, garden parties or just to laze around drinking.

title: Brenda's Strawberry Slush Delight
text: In a saucepan, dissolve the sugar in the water by bringing it to a boil over medium-high heat. Turn off the heat and allow it to cool. Combine the sugar water with the pineapple juice, lemonade, orange juice and pureed strawberries in a 6-quart container. Mix in the rum to taste. Put the entire mixture into a large plastic ice cream pail and freeze overnight. To make the drinks to order, scoop 1/2 cup of the frozen mixture into an 8 oz glass. Fill the glass with lemon-lime soda and serve with a straw. Keeps well in freezer for up to one month. 3 cups sugar 6 cups water 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans frozen orange juice concentrate 1 quart strawberries (fresh or frozen) pureed in a blender 2 cups rum, or to taste 2 (2 liter) bottles chilled lemon-lime soda Cool and refreshing, this drink is perfect for weddings and showers.

title: Hot Buttered Rum Single Serving
text: Place butter, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and vanilla extract in the bottom of an Irish coffee glass. Pour in rum and hot water. Stir. 1 teaspoon butter 1 teaspoon brown sugar 1 pinch ground cinnamon 1 pinch ground nutmeg 1 pinch ground allspice 1 dash vanilla extract 2 ounces rum 1 cup boiling water, or as needed Nothing sets the mood on a cold winter day better than a roaring fire and a hot buttered rum. This is a single-serving recipe.

title: Mint Garden Tea Concentrate
text: Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add mint leaves and steep for 15 minutes. Remove tea leaves from water with a slotted spoon, squeezing leaves to extract any additional liquid; discard leaves. Stir sugar into steeped tea; return to a boil and cook until sugar is completely dissolved and flavors combined, about 10 minutes. Pour tea concentrate into freezer-safe containers and freeze. 4 quarts water 8 cups packed fresh mint leaves 4 cups white sugar This delicious iced tea is quick, easy, and hits the spot on a hot summer day!

title: Tom Collins Cocktail
text: Fill a Collins glass with 1 1/2 cups ice; set aside in the freezer. Combine gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker. Add 1 cup ice, cover, and shake until chilled. Strain into the chilled Collins glass. Top with club soda and garnish with lemon wedge. 2.5 cups ice, divided 2 fluid ounces gin 0.75 fluid ounce lemon juice 0.5 fluid ounce simple syrup 2 fluid ounces club soda 1 lemon wedge This Tom Collins recipe makes a classic gin cocktail that's tart thanks to lemon, sweet thanks to simple syrup, and fizzy thanks to club soda.

title: Pumpkin Spice Coffee
text: Mix the ground coffee, allspice, and cinnamon in a small bowl, and place into the filter of a drip coffee maker. Pour 4 cups of water into the coffee maker, and turn on the machine. When coffee has finished dripping, pour into 2 cups. Stir in cream and sugar to taste. 0.25 cup ground coffee 1 teaspoon ground allspice 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 4 cups water 2 teaspoons half-and-half cream, or to taste 1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste Give your cuppa joe a nice, warm spicy taste with allspice and cinnamon. Just add the spices to coffee in your drip machine.

title: Candy Cane Cocoa
text: In a saucepan, heat milk until hot, but not boiling. Whisk in the chocolate and crushed peppermint candies until melted and smooth. Pour hot cocoa into four mugs, and garnish with whipped cream. Serve each with a candy-cane stirring stick. 4 cups milk 3 (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate, chopped 4 peppermint candy canes, crushed 1 cup whipped cream 4 small peppermint candy canes Milk is heated with semisweet chocolate and crushed candy canes. Then each mug is garnished with whipped cream and a small candy cane.

title: Coffee Flavored Liqueur I
text: In a saucepan, combine brown sugar, water and instant coffee. Bring to a boil, then let simmer 15 minutes. Remove from heat, and cool completely. When coffee mixture is completely cool, stir in vanilla and vodka. Pour into dark colored bottles, and store in the refrigerator. 4 cups brown sugar 3.5 cups water 0.5 cup instant coffee granules 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 (750 milliliter) bottle vodka Vodka is flavored with coffee and vanilla, then sweetened with brown sugar. Excellent for sipping, and makes a nice gift!

title: Strawberry Milkshake Supreme
text: In the container of a blender, combine milk, strawberries, ice cream, and sugar. Blend until smooth, about 10 seconds. Pour into a glass and drink with a wide straw. 0.25 cup milk 7 strawberries, hulled and sliced 0.25 cup vanilla ice cream 0.25 cup white sugar Make this old-fashioned milkshake with vanilla ice cream, fresh strawberries, and milk for a refreshingly delicious way to cool down!

title: Orange Carrot Ginger Juice
text: Place a collection container under the exit spout of a juicer; turn the juicer on. Place orange halves into the feeding chute; insert the food pusher and gently guide orange halves down the chute. Repeat with carrot and ginger. Turn off the juicer. Pour lemon juice into the collection container and stir to combine. Pour over ice. 1 large orange, peeled and halved 1 large carrot, cut into 1-inch chunks 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled 0.25 cup lemon juice ice, or as needed This homemade orange-carrot-ginger juice is flavorful, nourishing, and easy to make in your juicer.

title: The Polar Express Creamy Hot Chocolate
text: Combine milk, chocolate chips, condensed milk, heavy cream, and vanilla in a slow cooker. Cook on Low, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 2 hours. Let cool until safe to drink, about 5 minutes. 6 cups milk 2 cups milk chocolate chips 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1.5 cups heavy whipping cream 1 teaspoon vanilla extract This Polar Express hot chocolate is made with milk chocolate chips, cream, and condensed milk simmered in a slow cooker for a wintertime beverage.

title: Brandy Simple Syrup
text: In a saucepan, combine water, sugar and lemon zest. Bring mixture to a boil and continue boiling for 5 minutes. Strain into a sealable container, removing the lemon zest. Allow to cool, then cover and store in refrigerator. When ready to use, mix in brandy. Brush onto cake layers before frosting. 2 cups water 1 cup white sugar 0.5 teaspoon grated lemon zest 0.25 cup brandy Simple Syrup is brushed on cakes for added moisture and flavor. This one can be flavored with brandy or rum.

title: Caribbean Sorrel Tea
text: Combine sorrel, ginger, dried orange zest, and clove in a bowl. Bring water to a boil in a saucepan or kettle; pour over sorrel mixture. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Let mixture steep at room temperature, 8 hours to overnight. Strain sorrel mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher; discard solids. Serve over ice. 9 ounces dried red sorrel buds 3 teaspoons grated ginger 3 strips dried orange zest 1 white clove 1 quart water 0.66666668653488 cup white sugar ice cubes Dried sorrel is steeped with ginger, orange zest, and clove then served over ice in this recipe for a unique tea drink from the Caribbean.

title: Carrot and Apple Juice
text: Run carrots, apples, and celery through a juicer (alternating carrot, apple, and celery) according to manufacturer's instructions. Add ginger to juicer and process. 4 carrots, trimmed 2 apples, quartered 2 stalks celery 1 (1/2 inch) piece fresh ginger Fresh carrot and apple juice with a hint of ginger is a refreshing and colorful way to start the day.

title: Peppermint Eggnog Milkshake
text: Combine eggnog, vanilla ice cream, and peppermint extract in a blender, blend until smooth. Pour milkshake into a glass and garnish with whipped cream and crushed peppermint. Serve immediately. 0.25 cup eggnog 1.75 cups vanilla ice cream 0.5 teaspoon peppermint extract whipped cream crushed peppermint (Optional) Use your holiday eggnog in this yummy milkshake flavored with peppermint extract.

title: Sliwkowka Czyli Nalewka ze Sliwek (Polish Purple Plum Liqueur)
text: Place plums in a glass carboy used for brewing. Pour in 2 cups plus 2 tablespoons rectified alcohol and 2 cups plus 2 tablespoons vodka. Seal and store in a cool, dark place for 5 weeks. Stir sugar into the carboy. Seal and store in a cool, dark place for 4 weeks. Strain liqueur through a sieve lined with muslin cloth. Pour liqueur into bottles, seal, and store in a cool, dark place for at least 3 months before using. 2 pounds plums, pitted and sliced 2 cups pure rectified alcohol (190 proof) 2 tablespoons pure rectified alcohol (190 proof) 2 cups vodka 2 tablespoons vodka 1.5 cups white sugar Purple plums and sugar are steeped in 190-proof rectified alcohol and vodka for more than 5 months to make this homemade Polish liqueur.

title: Washington Apple Cocktail
text: Combine whiskey, cranberry juice, apple schnapps, and agave in a cocktail shaker. Fill cocktail shaker with ice and shake well. Strain into frosted martini glasses and garnish with an apple slice. 2 fluid ounces whiskey 1.5 fluid ounces cranberry juice 1 fluid ounce sour apple schnapps (such as DeKuyper® Sour Apple Pucker) 1 teaspoon agave nectar ice cubes as needed 2 apple slices for garnish A delicious fall cocktail with whiskey and apple pucker.

title: Ultimate Cold Relief Home Remedy Tea
text: Combine water, vinegar, honey, cinnamon stick, and garlic in a small saucepan. Heat to 100 degrees F (38 degrees C); remove from heat and pour into a mug. 8 ounces water, or as needed 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar 1 tablespoon honey 1 cinnamon stick 1 clove garlic, peeled and smashed This steaming hot tea made with cider vinegar, garlic, honey, and cinnamon is perfect for when you feel a cold coming on.

title: Orange Creamsicle Shots
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Add Orange Vanilla Twist Rum, whipped vodka, and orange juice. Shake vigorously for 2 to 3 minutes. Pour into shot glasses. Top with whipped cream and sprinkles. 0.5 cup ice cubes 2 fluid ounces Orange Vanilla Twist Rum (such as Captain Morgan(R)) 1 fluid ounce whipped vodka 0.5 fluid ounce orange juice 1 (7 ounce) can whipped cream (such as Reddi Wip®) orange sprinkles for garnish (optional) Were you an orange creamsicle fan as a kid? Then try the flavors of your childhood ice cream in a shot!

title: Pineapple and Banana Smoothie
text: Gather all ingredients. Place ice cubes, pineapple, banana, and pineapple juice into the container of a blender. Purée on high until smooth. Enjoy! 4 ice cubes 0.25 fresh pineapple - peeled, cored and cubed 1 large banana, cut into chunks 1 cup pineapple or apple juice This pineapple smoothie with banana is quick, tropical, fruity goodness with just four ingredients. Easily blend together and your smoothie is served.

title: Pretty in Pink Sangria
text: Stir the strawberries, lemonade concentrate, rose wine, and pineapple juice in a punch bowl until combined. Stir in the ginger ale just before serving. 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen sliced strawberries, thawed 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed 2 (750 milliliter) bottles chilled rose wine, such as white Zinfandel 2 cups pineapple juice 1 liter ginger ale Frozen, sliced strawberries, lemonade concentrate, and ginger ale combine for a festive punch.

title: Holiday Mule Mocktail
text: Combine vinegar, water, and sugar in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add cranberries, cardamom pods, allspice berries, and cinnamon stick; bring to a boil. Stir and cover until cranberries begin to pop, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir again, being careful that cranberries do not burn you as they pop. Reduce heat and simmer until sugar has dissolved and cranberries have released their juice, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to steep for 15 minutes. Strain into a container, seal, and refrigerate. Discard pulp. Fill 2 highball glasses halfway with ice. Add 1 fluid ounce cranberry shrub, 4 fluid ounces ginger beer, and 1 fluid ounce club soda to each glass. Stir well. 1 cup white vinegar 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 1 cup fresh cranberries 2 pods cardamom, crushed 4 whole allspice berries, cracked 0.25 (1 inch) piece cinnamon stick ice cubes 8 fluid ounces ginger beer (such as Fentimans) 2 fluid ounces club soda Add your favorite fermented ginger beer to homemade spiced cranberry shrub for a non-alcoholic Moscow mule worth remembering.

title: Chai Latte
text: Place tea bag in a large mug and pour in boiling water. Let steep for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove tea bag. Stir in milk and sugar; garnish with cardamom. 1 chai tea bag 7 fluid ounces boiling water 1 fluid ounce goats milk 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 pinch ground cardamom Learn how to make a chai latte with this easy recipe sweetened with sugar and topped with cardamom. If you have an espresso machine, you can steam the goat milk first.

title: Copycat V8 Juice
text: Process tomatoes, onion, 3 tablespoons plus 1/2 teaspoon celery, carrot, beet, green bell pepper, and garlic through a juicer. Stir together vegetable juices, water, lemon juice, 1 1/4 teaspoons sugar, horseradish, Worcestershire sauce, and black pepper in a large pot. Bring to a boil and cook until flavors blend, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, sterilize the jar and lid in boiling water for at least 5 minutes. Ladle juice into the jar. Stir 1 tablespoon sugar and salt into juice. Wipe the rim of the jar with a moist paper towel to remove any residue. Top with the lid and screw on the ring. Process juice in a pressure canner at 10 pounds of pressure for 35 minutes. Remove the jar from the pressure canner and place onto a cloth-covered or wooden surface until cool. Press the center of the lid with a finger to ensure the lid does not move up or down. Remove the ring for storage and store in a cool, dark area. 1.5 pounds tomatoes, chopped 0.33333334326744 large onion, chopped 3 tablespoons chopped celery 0.375 carrot, chopped 0.25 beet 0.125 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped 0.33333334326744 clove garlic 2.3333332538605 cups water, or as needed 1.5 teaspoons lemon juice 1.25 teaspoons white sugar 0.25 teaspoon horseradish 0.25 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, or to taste 0.125 teaspoon ground black pepper 1 (1 quart) sterilized canning jar with lid and ring 1 tablespoon white sugar 1.25 teaspoons salt This V8 drink recipe is made with tomatoes, celery, onion, bell pepper, beet, carrot, and garlic juice flavored with Worcestershire and horseradish.

title: South Carolina Sweet Tea
text: Using an electric coffee maker, Place the 3 tea bags in the strainer basket (not in the pot). Brew the tea as you would coffee. Pour the sugar in a gallon pitcher. Pour in the hot tea. Continue to run coffee maker with the tea bags until you have enough tea to fill the pitcher. Allow to cool completely at room temperature, then refrigerate. 3 family size tea bags 2 cups white sugar Remember, this is the South, where simplicity is the secret to most recipes. Follow this to the 'T' and you will have sweet tea, Sand Lapper (South Carolina) style.

title: Tropical Sangria
text: Combine pineapple, mango, and papaya in a large pitcher. Pour rum over the fruit. Add wine, then pineapple juice, passion fruit juice, guava juice. Refrigerate sangria before serving, 8 hours to overnight. 0.5 pound pineapple, cut into chunks 0.25 pound mango, cut into chunks 0.25 pound papaya, cut into chunks 0.5 cup white rum 1 (750 milliliter) bottle sweet white wine (such as Moscato) 2 cups pineapple juice 1 cup passion fruit juice 1 cup guava juice Sweet white wine joins white rum, juices, and fruit chunks to create this tropical sangria that's easy to prepare and chill overnight for summer parties.

title: Summer In A Cup Smoothie
text: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until creamy and smooth, scraping down sides as needed. Taste and adjust flavor as needed. Add more unsweetened original Almond Breeze or fruit juice if too thick. If not sweet enough, add more banana. 1.25 cups frozen unsweetened raspberries, thawed 1 large ripe banana, sliced and frozen 0.5 cup pomegranate juice 0.75 cup orange juice 0.75 cup Almond Breeze Unsweetened Original Almondmilk Bananas, raspberries, pomegranate, orange juice and almond milk combine in this smoothie to capture the best flavors of the summer in one delicious snack.

title: Blackberry Sangria
text: Combine wine, brandy, triple sec, orange juice, and sugar together in a pitcher or bowl; add blackberries, strawberries, pineapple, apple, and ice and mix well. Refrigerate for 8 hours to overnight. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Spanish red wine 12 fluid ounces blackberry brandy 0.5 cup triple sec 0.5 cup orange juice 0.25 cup white sugar 0.5 cup blackberries, or to taste 0.5 cup hulled strawberries, or to taste 0.5 cup chopped fresh pineapple 1 apple, chopped ice cubes Red wine and brandy are mixed with blackberries, strawberries, pineapple, and apple in this blackberry sangria recipe perfect for summer.

title: Beergarita
text: Pour beers into a large pitcher. Add limeade; stir to combine. Use limeade can to measure out tequila; pour into pitcher and stir to combine. Serve over ice. 6 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles beer 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate (such as Minute Maid®) 12 fluid ounces tequila 6 cups ice cubes Beer is mixed with limeade and tequila in these refreshing margarita-inspired "beergaritas" perfect for your next cocktail party.

title: Chocolate Atole
text: Whisk water and masa harina together in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil. Add milk and cinnamon. Continue stirring until thick and bubbly. Add evaporated milk, chocolate, brown sugar, and vanilla extract. Cook and stir until chocolate and sugar are just melted, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and pour into mugs. Serve hot. 1 cup cold water 0.25 cup masa harina 1 cup milk 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.5 cup evaporated milk 1 (2 ounce) bar dark chocolate, chopped 2 tablespoons brown sugar 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract This recipe for chocolate atole, aka champurrado, uses key ingredients such as masa harina and evaporated milk to create a thick, rich hybrid of hot cocoa and pudding.

title: Mangonada Jell-O Shots
text: Heat water and gelatin in a small saucepan over medium-high heat; whisk until dissolved, about 5 minutes. Add mango purée, sugar, and lemon juice; whisk until dissolved, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat to cool slightly, about 5 minutes. Whisk vodka into cooled mango gelatin until combined. Add a few drops chamoy and a sprinkle Tajin to twenty (2-ounce) cups. Fill each cup evenly with mango gelatin and sprinkle with more Tajin. Let set in the refrigerator for 4 hours. 0.25 cup water 2 (.25 ounce) packages unflavored gelatin 2 cups mango puree 0.5 cup white sugar 1 tablespoon lemon juice 1 cup vodka 1 teaspoon chamoy sauce, or to taste 1 teaspoon chile-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®), or as needed If you like the popular Mexican mangonada treat, you'll love these shots made with vodka, chamoy, and Tajin.

title: Nutty Irishman
text: Pour hot, strong coffee into two mugs. Stir 1 ounce Irish cream liqueur, 1 ounce hazelnut liqueur, and 1 ounce Irish whiskey into each mug. Place a dollop of whipped cream in each mug; sprinkle whipped cream with nutmeg. 2 cups hot, strong coffee 2 fluid ounces Irish cream liqueur, divided 2 fluid ounces hazelnut liqueur (such as Frangelico®), divided 2 fluid ounces Irish whiskey, divided 0.25 cup whipped cream 2 pinches ground nutmeg This St. Patrick's Day-inspired drink will keep you warm and toasty with hot coffee, whiskey, and flavored liqueurs.

title: Cucumber Orange Carrot Juice
text: Peel orange and save a 1x1-inch piece of the peel. Place orange, orange peel piece, carrots, and cucumber in a blender; pour in water. Blend until desired consistency is reached; add sugar and lemon juice. Blend until smooth, 1 to 3 minutes. 1 large navel orange 2 carrots, roughly chopped 0.5 cucumber, roughly chopped 0.5 cup water, or as needed 0.25 cup white sugar, or to taste 1 teaspoon lemon juice This orange, cucumber, and carrot juice is a refreshing way to start the day and is ready in about 10 minutes.

title: Big-Batch Pineapple-Basil Vodka Sours
text: For pineapple-basil vodka, put pineapple in a 1-quart jar. Top with vodka, cover, and let stand until vodka is infused with pineapple flavor, 1 to 3 days. Add basil, cover, and infuse for 1 to 2 hours; strain.   Meanwhile for the DIY sour mix, combine sugar and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat; let cool. Add lime juice and lemon juice. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to 1 week. In a pitcher, stir together pineapple-basil vodka and DIY sour mix. Serve in rocks glasses over ice. Top with club soda (if using); garnish with pineapple wedges, fronds, and additional basil. Pineapple-Basil Vodka 11/2 cups chopped fresh pineapple 1 (750-ml) bottle vodka 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves, plus more forgarnish DIY Sour Mix 1 cup sugar 1 cup water 1 cup freshly squeezed lime juice (about 8limes) 1 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (about 6lemons) Additional Ice Club soda (optional) Fresh pineapple wedges and fronds, for garnish Channel your inner mixologist with infused vodka and homemade sour mix, then shake them together for a sweet-tart sipper you can call your own.

title: Moose Milk
text: Combine ice cream, milk, rum, coffee liqueur, and vodka in a large punch bowl; whisk until frothy and liquified. Ladle into punch glasses and garnish with nutmeg. 1 gallon vanilla ice cream, softened 1 gallon milk 4.75 cups dark rum 4.75 cups coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) 4.75 cups vodka 1 pinch ground nutmeg, or to taste Try this moose milk recipe for a creamy punch flavored with dark rum and coffee liqueur. It goes down sweet and smooth like a milkshake and packs a wallop.

title: Irish Cream Liqueur I
text: Pour all ingredients into a blender and blend on high until mixed. Pour into a sealable container and store in the refrigerator. Serve in shot glasses. 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 0.25 cup liquid non-dairy creamer 3 eggs 1 drop vanilla extract 1.5 tablespoons chocolate syrup 1 cup whiskey A version of Irish cream made with whiskey, sweetened condensed milk, raw eggs, vanilla extract and chocolate syrup.

title: Vanilla Milkshakes without Ice Cream
text: Place ice, milk, sugar, and vanilla extract into a blender; blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. 12 ice cubes 2 cups milk 0.75 cup white sugar 1 dash vanilla extract, or to taste This milkshake without ice cream is simply made with milk, sugar, vanilla, and ice. It's super quick, easy, and tastes just like the real deal!

title: Raspberry Syrup for Drinks
text: Bring water and sugar to a boil in a small saucepan, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in raspberries, and mash with a potato masher or fork. Let steep for at least 1 hour. Drain mixture through a fine mesh strainer, pressing raspberry pulp with a spatula to extract as much liquid as possible. Discard solids and store syrup in a sealed container in the refrigerator. 0.66666668653488 cup water 0.66666668653488 cup white sugar 1 cup raspberries This raspberry syrup recipe uses 3 simple ingredients to quickly make a sweet, fruit-forward flavor and color enhancer for teas, cocktails, or sodas.

title: Spiced Honey Vodka
text: Bring 1 cup honey and water to a boil in a saucepan while stirring. Immediately reduce heat to low once boiling. Scrape the vanilla bean contents into the mixture and add the pod. Stir in ginger. Add orange zest, lemon zest, mint, nutmeg, cloves, peppercorns, star anise, and cardamom. Cook over low heat, stirring, 5 to 8 minutes. Pour mixture into a wide-mouth, sealable bottle. Add 1 liter vodka and seal. Allow ingredients to steep together for 3 weeks, agitating occasionally. Pour vodka through a strainer or cheesecloth and taste for sweetness. Add more honey or vodka to acquire the right level of sweetness (it should taste quite sweet, but everyone has their own personal preference.) Serve neat at room temperature. 1 cup honey, or to taste 0.25 cup water 1 (1 inch) piece vanilla bean 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger, thinly sliced 2 medium oranges, zested 1 medium lemon, zested 1 small bunch fresh mint 1.5 teaspoons ground nutmeg 0.5 teaspoon whole cloves 0.5 teaspoon whole black peppercorns 2 pods star anise 2 pods cardamom 1 liter vodka, or to taste This spiced honey vodka is similar in flavor to Polish Krupnik, making it a great option to gift to friends over the holidays, or to enjoy yourself.

title: Spanish-Style Hot Chocolate
text: Break up chocolate into small pieces and set aside. Add milk, sugar, salt, and cornstarch to a saucepan, and whisk thoroughly. Place over medium to medium-high heat, and cook stirring until the milk just starts to simmer. Remove milk from heat, and quickly whisk in chocolate until completely melted and emulsified. Serve immediately in hot cups, garnished with a pinch of cayenne on top if desired. Cook's Notes: This is the thinner, drinkable version of Spanish-Style Hot Chocolate. For the thicker, richer version, used for dipping churros, increase the cornstarch from 1/2 teaspoon to 1 teaspoon, and increase the chocolate amount from 4 ounces to 6 ounces. If semi-sweet chocolate is used instead of dark, bittersweet chocolate, the white sugar amount may need to be reduced, according to taste. 4 ounces dark chocolate (70% cacao), broken or cut into 1/2-inch pieces  2 1/4 cups milk 2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste  pinch salt 1/2 teaspoon cornstarch cayenne pepper to garnish top This rich and decadent version of hot chocolate has a silky texture and hint of spice from the garnish of cayenne pepper.

title: Charred Lemon Paper Plane
text: Halve lemon and sprinkle cut sides with sugar. Preheat an outdoor grill to medium heat (350 degrees F to 375 degrees F (175 degrees C to 190 degrees C)) or preheat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill lemon, cut sides down, until lightly charred, about 5 minutes. Let cool; juice lemon to yield 3/4 ounce juice. Fill a cocktail shaker half full with ice. Add bourbon, Aperol, amaro, and lemon juice. Cover and shake until outside of shaker is frosted, 30 seconds. Strain into a glass. Garnish with a lemon twist. 1 lemon Pinch of sugar Ice 3/4 ounces bourbon 3/4 ounces Aperol 3/4 ounces amaro (such as Cardamaro) Charred lemon twist, for garnish Grilled lemon gives this amaro-based cocktail serious campfire vibes. Serve with a scorched citrus twist or go for the more traditional mini paper airplane garnish.

title: Easy Whiskey Slush
text: Stir pineapple juice, whiskey, and maraschino cherries with their juice in a large freezer-safe container with a lid. Cover container tightly and freeze slush overnight. Scoop the whiskey slush into old-fashioned glasses, making sure each glass contains a cherry or two. Top with lemon-lime soda. 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 1 (750 milliliter) bottle whiskey 1 (10 ounce) jar maraschino cherries with juice 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime soda Start freezing this refreshing cocktail the night before. It's a sweet, slushy combination of pineapple juice and whiskey, topped with a little lemon-lime soda, and served with a cherry.

title: Peppermint Coffee Syrup
text: Bring water and sugar to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium; stir 4 to 5 minutes. Add peppermint extract and remove from heat. Cool syrup for 5 minutes; pour into glass jar with tight-fitting lid. 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 1 teaspoon peppermint extract This peppermint syrup is a snap to prepare and gives a minty kick to your holiday drinks. Try it with eggnog, hot cocoa, or caffe latte.

title: Hot and Spicy Himalayan Tea (Chai Tea)
text: Combine water, brown sugar, ginger, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves, bay leaves, fennel seeds, and peppercorns together in a pot; cover and boil for 20 minutes. Remove from the heat, add tea leaves, and allow to steep for 10 minutes. Stir milk into tea mixture and bring to a boil. Strain tea into tea cups. 7 cups water 6 tablespoons light brown sugar 1.25 inch piece fresh ginger root, peeled and chopped 1 cinnamon stick 6 green cardamom pods 12 whole cloves 2 bay leaves 1 tablespoon fennel seeds 0.5 teaspoon black peppercorns 2 tablespoons Darjeeling tea leaves 1 cup milk Skip the specialty coffee shop and make a steaming hot cup of chai tea at home with warming spices, ginger, milk, brown sugar, and tea leaves.

title: Pink Brain Shooter
text: Lightly grease a brain-shaped gelatin mold. Stir peach gelatin mix with 3 cups boiling water in a bowl until gelatin is dissolved. Allow to cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes. Mix in evaporated milk and peach schnapps; pour into the prepared mold. Refrigerate until set, 4 to 6 hours. Dip the mold in warm water to loosen; don't let water enter the top of the mold. Invert the mold onto a serving platter and lift to release the brain. Mix blue and red food coloring in a small bowl with 2 teaspoons water. Use a small, clean paintbrush to paint coloring into the grooves of the brain. Place the brain into the refrigerator until color sets. Serve cold. cooking spray 1 brain-shaped gelatin mold 4 (3 ounce) packages peach flavored Jell-O® mix 3 cups boiling water 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 1.5 cups peach schnapps 4 drops blue food coloring 2 drops red food coloring 2 teaspoons water A pinkish-white brain with painted veins, made of peach gelatin and peach schnapps, makes the creepiest shooter ever.

title: Baileys Flat White Martini
text: Gather all ingredients. Pour Baileys into a cocktail shaker. Pour vodka into the cocktail shaker. Pour espresso into the cocktail shaker. Add ice into the cocktail shaker; shake well. Strain into a martini glass. Enjoy! 2 ounces Baileys® Original Irish Cream 1 ounce vodka 1 ounce brewed espresso ice cubes This espresso martini with Baileys Original Irish Cream is as easy as 1, 2, 3. Impress your guests with this fancy cocktail at your next dinner party!

title: Instant Russian Tea Mix
text: In a large bowl, combine orange drink mix, sugar, tea powder, cinnamon and cloves. Mix well and store in an airtight container. To serve, put 3 teaspoons of mix in a mug. Stir in 1 cup boiling water. Adjust to taste. 2 cups orange-flavored drink mix (e.g. Tang) 2 cups white sugar 0.25 cup instant tea powder 0.75 cup lemon-flavored instant tea powder 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 teaspoon ground cloves A citrus and spiced dry tea mix that can be given as gifts.

title: Limoncello II
text: Combine the lemon zest and vodka in a 2-gallon jar. Cover, and let stand 3 to 4 days at room temperature. Remove and discard the lemon zest. Stir in the sugar and water until the sugar has dissolved. Pour into bottles or other containers, and store in the freezer. 2 pounds lemons, zested 35 fluid ounces vodka 2 pounds white sugar 35 fluid ounces water Lemon zest-infused vodka is sweetened with sugar in this refreshing Italian aperitif.

title: Whiskey Sidecar Slush with Broiled Lemon Juice
text: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Place lemon halves, cut-side up, on a baking sheet. Broil until lemon halves are blackened on the cut side, about 10 minutes. Allow lemons to cool enough to handle. Squeeze juice from the lemons into a measuring cup. Measure out 1 fluid ounce broiled lemon juice, reserving the rest for another use. Combine whiskey, orange liqueur, simple syrup, and 1 fluid ounce broiled lemon juice in a blender and add ice; cover and blend until slushy consistency. Pour drinks into glasses. 1 lemon, halved 3 fluid ounces whiskey 1.5 fluid ounces orange liqueur 0.75 fluid ounce simple syrup 2 cups lightly crushed ice Broiled lemons are juiced and blended with whiskey, orange liqueur, and ice in this makeover of the whiskey sidecar perfect for hot nights.

title: Bahama Mama
text: Combine crushed ice, orange juice, pineapple juice, regular rum, coconut-flavored rum, and grenadine in a blender. Blend until the drink's consistency is slushy. 1 cup crushed ice 1 fluid ounce orange juice 1 fluid ounce pineapple juice 0.5 fluid ounce rum 0.5 fluid ounce coconut-flavored rum 0.5 fluid ounce grenadine syrup Whip up this Bahama Mama cocktail made with two types of rum, orange and pineapple juice, and crushed ice for a refreshingly tropical adult drink.

title: Strawberry-Lime Slushie
text: Place strawberry and lime sorbets, lime juice, strawberries, orange juice, and ice cubes in a blender and puree until smooth. 2 cups strawberry sorbet 1 cup lime sorbet 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice 0.25 cup sliced strawberries 0.25 cup orange juice 2 cups ice cubes Lime and strawberry sorbets are blended with lime and orange juices, strawberries, and ice to make a cold and refreshing beverage.

title: Party Punch IV
text: In a punch bowl, combine pineapple juice concentrate, orange juice concentrate and vodka. Pour in lemon-lime soda. Float cherries and orange slices on top. Add ice before serving. 1 (16 ounce) can frozen pineapple juice concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 12 fluid ounces vodka 2 (2 liter) bottles lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage, chilled 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries 4 oranges, sliced into rounds 2 trays ice cubes Vodka mixed with pineapple juice, orange juice and lemon-lime soda has a great tasting, fruity flavor. A real crowd pleaser.

title: Homemade Eggnog
text: Cream egg yolks and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Set aside. Combine milk, whipping cream, and nutmeg in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture just begins to simmer with 1 to 2 bubbles every 2 to 3 seconds, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Add a very small amount of hot milk mixture into egg yolk mixture while constantly whisking eggs. Continue adding small amounts of milk mixture, whisking until all has been added; transfer eggnog back into saucepan. Continue to cook over medium heat, constantly whisking, until liquid reaches 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Pour eggnog into a large pitcher, cover, and refrigerate 6 hours to overnight. Blend cooled eggnog with an immersion blender until no lumps remain, about 1 minute. Ladle into 7 cups and top each with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon. 12 large egg yolks 1 cup white sugar 4 cups whole milk 2 cups heavy whipping cream 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 7 tablespoons whipped cream, or to taste 7 pinches ground cinnamon This creamy, non-alcoholic homemade eggnog is made with cooked egg yolks. It's so delicious, even folks who don't like eggnog will be asking for seconds.

title: Apple Pie Liquor
text: Mix water, apple cider, apple juice concentrate, white sugar, brown sugar, and cinnamon sticks together in a large saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until mixture is reduced, about 45 minutes. Remove from heat and cool for 15 minutes. Stir grain alcohol into mixture until evenly combined. Cool apple pie liquor completely. Pour apple pie liquor and 1 cinnamon stick into a jar or container. 18 cups water 1 gallon apple cider 6 (6 ounce) cans frozen apple juice concentrate, thawed 4 cups white sugar 4 cups brown sugar 7 cinnamon sticks 1 (750 milliliter) bottle 190 proof grain alcohol (such as Everclear®) This apple pie liquor will help you keep warm during the holiday season made with grain alcohol mixed with a spiced apple juice-based syrup.

title: Habanero Simple Syrup
text: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Slowly stir sugar into boiling water until sugar is dissolved, 2 to 3 minutes. Add habanero peppers to sugar-water mixture, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until syrup is thickened and pepper has slightly colored the syrup, about 15 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and let syrup cool, about 1 hour. Remove peppers from syrup and store syrup in a glass jar. 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 2 habanero peppers, quartered Simple syrup infused with habanero peppers is a spicy and colorful addition to tequila-based cocktails or even lemonade.

title: Christmas Morning Hot Chocolate
text: Heat milk in a saucepan over medium heat for 3 minutes. Pour in condensed milk, hot chocolate, sugar, and vanilla extract; stir constantly until the mixture is warmed through and the sugar is dissolved, about 3 minutes. 4 cups milk 0.5 cup sweetened condensed milk 0.25 cup instant hot cocoa mix 2 tablespoons white sugar 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Stir up this quick and easy hot chocolate recipe for a cozy hot drink sweetened with sugar and condensed milk on Christmas morning.

title: Tornado Twist
text: In a pitcher, mix cranberry-raspberry juice with lemon-lime soda. Pour over ice and serve. 12 fluid ounces cranberry-raspberry juice 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage Cranberry-raspberry juice is softened with the sparkle of lemon-lime soda.

title: Ultimate Frozen Strawberry Margarita
text: Gather ingredients and fill a blender with ice cubes. Pulse until ice is crushed. Pour in tequila and triple sec, then add strawberries and limeade concentrate. Blend until smooth, about 30 seconds. Pour into four margarita glasses and serve immediately. Enjoy! 2 cups ice cubes, or as needed 6 fluid ounces tequila 2 fluid ounces triple sec 8 ounces frozen sliced strawberries in syrup 4 fluid ounces frozen limeade concentrate A strawberry margarita is a refreshing cocktail for a hot summer day. Ready in minutes, this one's made with frozen berries and limeade concentrate.

title: Blended Mocha Drink
text: Stir espresso and sweetened condensed milk together in a bowl. Add milk and stir; pour into a blender. Add ice and chocolate syrup to the espresso mixture. Blend until smooth. 0.75 cup brewed espresso 0.25 cup sweetened condensed milk 1 cup whole milk 10 ice cubes, or as needed 3 tablespoons chocolate syrup, or more to taste Make your own blended mocha at home with brewed espresso, sweetened condensed milk, whole milk, and chocolate syrup.

title: Vieux Carre Cocktail
text: Put ice in a cocktail glass. Pour in rye, cognac, vermouth, and Benedictine. Shake in Angostura and Peychaud's bitters. Stir, then strain into a short cocktail glass, and garnish with a twist of lemon peel. 1.5 cups ice 1 fluid ounce rye whiskey 1 fluid ounce cognac 1 ounce sweet vermouth 0.125 ounce Benedictine® liqueur 1 dash Angostura bitters 1 dash Peychaud bitters 1 lemon twist A complex, complex rye whiskey and cognac cocktail named after a hotel in the Old Quarter of New Orleans.

title: Satisfying Eggnog
text: Whisk together the nonfat milk, evaporated milk, sucralose sweetener, nutmeg, and egg yolks in a heavy saucepan. Warm over very low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), about 10 minutes. Pour the eggnog through a strainer. Stir in vanilla extract. Refrigerate until chilled, about 2 hours. Just before serving, stir in dark rum, if using. 6 cups nonfat milk 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 1 cup granular sucralose sweetener (such as Splenda®) 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg 5 egg yolks 2 tablespoons vanilla extract 1 cup dark rum, or to taste This eggnog uses rich egg yolks, nutmeg, and vanilla extract for traditional flavor, but calls for nonfat milk and sugar substitute to keep things on the lighter side.

title: Spicy Watermelon Margarita
text: Puree watermelon in a blender. Wipe the rim of a margarita glass with a lime wedge; dip rim in salt. In a cocktail shaker half-filled with ice, add tequila, orange liqueur, lime juice, jalapeño, and 2 ounces of the watermelon puree. Shake until very cold. Strain into prepared glass. Garnish with watermelon wedge and jalapeño slice. 2 cups seedless watermelon cubes 1 lime wedge 1 pinch kosher salt ice cubes 1.5 fluid ounces silver tequila 0.75 fluid ounce orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®) 0.75 fluid ounce lime juice 1 thin slice jalapeno slice, plus more for garnish 1 watermelon wedge This spicy watermelon margarita made with seedless watermelon, silver tequila, lime juice, and jalapeño slices is sure to fire up any cocktail party!

title: Old-Fashioned Pink Lemonade
text: Combine water, sugar, lemon juice, and cranberry juice in a large pitcher; stir until sugar dissolves. Serve in tall glasses over ice. 9 cups water 2 cups white sugar 2 cups fresh lemon juice 1 cup cranberry juice, chilled ice as needed Pink lemonade is made with fresh lemon juice, sugar, water, and cranberry juice for a pretty pink drink that's sure to be a hit all summer long!

title: Tom and Jerry
text: Separate the eggs. In a large bowl beat the egg whites until frothy. Whisk in 3/4 cup of the confectioners' sugar and beat until stiff peaks are formed. Beat the egg yolks with the remaining 1/2 cup of confectioners' sugar and about 4 to 5 tablespoons of the brandy until light and lemon colored. Fold the egg whites into the egg yolks and refrigerate. In a large stock pot heat the milk until hot but do not boil. Reduce heat and keep milk hot. To each mug add 2 tablespoons brandy (or more to taste) and 1 large heaping tablespoon of egg mixture. Stir and fill mug with hot milk. Place another tablespoon of egg mixture on top and sprinkle with nutmeg. 12 eggs 1.25 cups confectioners' sugar 20 fluid ounces brandy 24 cups milk 1 pinch ground nutmeg Almost like eggnog, but warm and creamy. We have an annual Christmas Tom & Jerry Party and this is the recipe we've perfected.

title: Whiskey Sidecar Slush
text: Pour whisky, orange liqueur, lemon juice, and simple syrup in a blender; add ice, cover, and blend until slushy consistency. 3 fluid ounces whiskey 1.5 fluid ounces orange liqueur 1 fluid ounce lemon juice 0.75 fluid ounce simple syrup 2 cups lightly crushed ice All the fixings for whiskey sidecar (whiskey, orange liqueur, and lemon juice) are blended with ice in this sidecar slush perfect for summer.

title: Amaretto Coffee Creamer
text: Combine condensed milk, nonfat milk, almond extract, and cinnamon in a glass Mason jar; cover and shake well. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Shake before using, as condensed milk will settle to the bottom. 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1.5 cups nonfat milk 1 teaspoon almond extract 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon Make amaretto coffee creamer from condensed milk, nonfat milk, and almond extract using this quick and easy recipe.

title: Watermelon Pink Lemonade
text: Combine water, lemon juice, sugar, and watermelon in a blender. Blend until smooth. 1 cup water 2 tablespoons lemon juice 4 teaspoons white sugar 1 small slice (0.5 oz) watermelon This refreshing pink lemonade is a quick and easy blend of watermelon and lemon juice and the perfect beverage to bring to a summer picnic.

title: Frozen Hot Chocolate with Evaporated Milk
text: Place semisweet chocolate chips, milk chocolate chips, sugar, hot chocolate mix, and butter into the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate chips start to melt, about 5 minutes. Stir evaporated milk slowly into the chocolate mixture until chocolate chips are halfway melted, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat; continue stirring sauce is until smooth and velvety, about 2 minutes more. Mix in vanilla extract. Let sauce cool to room temperature, at least 20 minutes. Place 1 cup chocolate sauce, 4 cups ice, and 1 cup milk in a blender. Cover and blend until smooth; pour into 2 individual glasses. Refrigerate the remaining sauce. 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips 1 (12 ounce) package milk chocolate chips 0.75 cup white sugar 0.75 cup instant hot chocolate mix 3 tablespoons butter 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans evaporated milk 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 4 cups ice 1 cup cold milk A sweet, frozen delight, this iced hot chocolate blends milk and ice with a double chocolate sauce combining evaporated milk and cocoa mix.

title: Strawberry Frose (Frozen Rose Slushy)
text: Place strawberries, sugar, and water into blender and blend until the mixture is smooth. Pour mixture into a 9x13-inch baking pan; stir in the wine. Freeze, stirring once about halfway through, until mixture is slushy, 4 1/2 to 5 hours. Remove from freezer and stir to breakup the larger frozen clumps. 1 pound strawberries, hulled 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup water 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Malbec red wine This frozen rose slushy is a refreshing summer cocktail made by combining Malbec wine and strawberries then freezing.

title: Pumpkin Spice Hot Chocolate
text: Whisk milk, cream, chocolate chips, and cocoa powder together in a saucepan over medium heat until chocolate chips are melted and hot chocolate is smooth, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in pumpkin puree and pumpkin pie spice until fully incorporated. Pour hot chocolate into 2 mugs. Top with whipped cream; sprinkle cinnamon and nutmeg over whipped cream. 0.5 cup milk 0.33333334326744 cup heavy whipping cream 0.25 cup milk chocolate chips 1 teaspoon cocoa powder 1.5 teaspoons pumpkin puree 0.25 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice 0.25 cup whipped cream 1 pinch ground cinnamon 1 pinch ground nutmeg Rich and creamy pumpkin spice hot chocolate is a great treat for a fall day, quiet evening, or to share with friends and family!

title: The Perfect Peanut Butter Milkshake
text: Combine ice cream, milk, and peanut butter in a blender; blend until smooth, about 45 seconds. 2 cups vanilla ice cream 0.25 cup milk 2 tablespoons creamy peanut butter Learn how to make a peanut butter milkshake by simply combining vanilla ice cream, milk, and creamy peanut butter for a deliciously nutty treat!

title: Hot Mocha
text: In a small mug or coffee cup, mix cocoa and granulated sugar substitute together. Add a few tablespoons of coffee and stir until cocoa is completely dissolved. Pour in remaining coffee. Foam milk. Spoon a generous amount over hot mocha. Garnish with a pinch of cocoa powder, if desired. 1 tablespoon unsweetened Dutch-processed cocoa powder 1 packet Sweet'N Low granulated sugar substitute, or to taste 1 cup hot coffee 0.5 cup Skim milk 0.5 teaspoon Cocoa powder, for garnish Discover how to make this hot mocha recipe that uses skim milk to make a deceptively lean, yet rich topping and can be enjoyed anytime of the day.

title: Kamikaze
text: In a cocktail shaker full of ice combine vodka, triple sec, fresh lime juice and bottled lime juice. Shake, don't stir and strain into a chilled glass. 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers vodka 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers triple sec liqueur 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger fresh lime juice 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger bottled lime juice This citrusy shooter is made with vodka, triple sec and lime juice.

title: Strawberry Banana Protein Shake
text: Layer milk, protein powder, ice, strawberries, banana, and peanut butter in a blender in this order; blend until creamy and smooth. 1 cup skim milk 1 scoop vanilla-flavored whey protein powder 2 cups ice 1 cup strawberries 1 large banana 1 tablespoon natural peanut butter This strawberry banana protein powder shake is made with skim milk and natural peanut butter for a great post-workout meal or on-the-go breakfast.

title: Salted Caramel Apple Shots
text: Reserve 2 teaspoons caramel sauce. Dip one side of the rim of each shot glass in remaining caramel  and sprinkle each with about 1/8 teaspoon salt. Fill cocktail shaker half way with ice.  Add vodka, apple cider, lemon juice, cinnamon, and remaining caramel sauce. Shake well and pour into prepared shot glasses.  Garnish with a small apple slice if desired. 2 tablespoons caramel sauce, divided 1/2 teaspoon flaky sea salt, such as Maldon Sea Salt 3 ounces vodka 4 ounces apple cider 1 teaspoon fresh squeezed lemon juice 1/8 teaspoon cinnamon green apple slices for garnish Salted caramel apple shots capture the flavors of fall in a glass. They are delightfully sweet and boozy.

title: Watermelon and Strawberry Lemonade
text: Combine watermelon, strawberries, lemon juice, sugar, and water in a blender. Blend until smooth. 8 cups cubed seeded watermelon 1 cup fresh strawberries, halved 0.5 cup fresh lemon juice 1 cup white sugar 2 cups water This strawberry and watermelon lemonade is easy to make for a refreshingly fruity drink that'll cool you down on a hot summer's day.

title: Amaretto
text: Bring water and both sugars to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat. Reduce the heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until both sugars are dissolved. Remove from the heat and let cool for 10 minutes. Stir in vodka, almond extract, and vanilla. Store in a sealed bottle. 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 0.5 cup brown sugar 2 cups vodka 2 tablespoons almond extract 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Sweet amaretto made with vodka, vanilla, almond extract, and white and brown sugars. Anyone who tries it will think you had shipped from Italy!

title: Mexican Hot Chocolate Atole Champurrado
text: Combine 2 cups water and cinnamon in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil; let boil for 7 minutes. Drop in chocolate tablet and stir until dissolved, 5 to 6 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 2 minutes more. Combine cornstarch and cold water in a small container with a lid; shake until mixed well. Stir evaporated milk and sugar into the chocolate mixture in the saucepan. Add cornstarch mixture and stir well. Increase heat to a simmer and cook until slightly thickened, about 3 minutes. 2 cups water 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon 1 Mexican hot chocolate drink tablet (such as Nestle® Abuelita®) 0.5 cup cold water 2 tablespoons cornstarch 0.5 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 0.5 cup white sugar, or to taste Mexican hot chocolate, or atole champurrado, is a uniquely thick, rich, and cinnamon-flavored version of the familiar cold-weather beverage.

title: Strawberry Shooters
text: Pour amaretto liqueur into each strawberry and top with whipped cream. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle amaretto liqueur 1 (1 pound) fresh strawberries, hulled and cored 1 (7 ounce) can whipped cream (such as Reddi-Whip®) Hulled strawberries are filled with amaretto liqueur and topped with whipped cream for a fruity and messy treat as seen at country music festivals.

title: Refreshing Summer Cucumber Lemonade
text: Stir hot water and sugar together in a large pitcher until sugar is dissolved. Stir in lemon juice concentrate, lemon juice, and sliced cucumbers. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until ready to serve. Pour lemon-lime soda into pitcher. Serve lemonade over ice and garnished with lemon slices and halved cucumber slices. 2 cups hot water 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup lemon juice from concentrate 1 lemon, juiced 0.5 large cucumber, sliced 3 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles lemon-lime flavored soda 2 cups ice cubes, or as needed 1 lemon, thinly sliced 0.5 large cucumber, sliced and then halved Fresh cucumbers, the tangy brightness of lemon, and effervescent lemon-lime soda combine for a delicious thirst-quenching Southern summer ade.

title: Berry Refresher
text: Place the apple juice, orange juice, milk, honey, strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, and ice cubes in a blender. Blend until slushy. Serve cold. 1 cup apple juice 1 cup orange juice 0.33333334326744 cup milk 1 tablespoon honey 2 frozen strawberries, thawed 0.33333334326744 cup frozen raspberries, thawed 0.66666668653488 cup frozen blueberries, thawed 3 cubes ice This recipe is a perfect refresher for a hot summer day or to quench a raging thirst! Absolutely delicious! To make it thick, simply use berries frozen!

title: Kiwi Strawberry Smoothie
text: Place juice blend, frozen yogurt, banana, strawberries, and kiwi into a blender. Blend until smooth and pour into 2 glasses. 0.75 cup pineapple and orange juice blend 0.5 cup vanilla frozen yogurt 1 banana 6 strawberries 1 kiwi This kiwi strawberry smoothie is easy to make with pineapple and orange juice, vanilla frozen yogurt, and banana for a tropical, fruity quencher.

title: Peppermint White Hot Chocolate
text: Bring cream and milk to a simmer in a large, heavy saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add white chocolate and stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in peppermint extract. Ladle hot chocolate into individual mugs and top with whipped cream and crushed candies. Garnish each mug with a small candy cane. 6 cups heavy cream 6 cups whole milk 9 ounces good-quality white chocolate, chopped 0.5 teaspoon peppermint extract, or to taste 0.5 cup whipped cream, or to taste 0.5 cup crushed peppermint candy canes 12 small peppermint candy canes White chocolate and peppermint bring Christmas-ready flavor to this easy hot chocolate recipe that makes enough to feed your crowd of guests at parties or potlucks.

title: Mai Tai
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Add pineapple juice, orange juice, spiced rum, coconut rum, and grenadine. Shake vigorously and strain into a glass full of ice. 1 cup ice cubes 3 fluid ounces pineapple juice 2 fluid ounces orange juice 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger spiced rum 0.5 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger coconut-flavored rum 1 teaspoon grenadine syrup This Mai Tai cocktail blends two rums, coconut and spiced, with pineapple juice, orange juice, and grenadine to make a tropical, fruity party drink.

title: Mexican Coffee Cocktail
text: Stir together coffee liqueur and tequila in a mug. Pour in hot coffee and top with whipped cream. 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) 0.5 fluid ounce tequila 5 fluid ounces hot coffee 2 tablespoons whipped cream This Mexican coffee cocktail is a simple-to-make, invigorating warm cocktail made with coffee liqueur, tequila, coffee, and topped with whipped cream.

title: Erin's Irish Creme Liqueur
text: Put chocolate chips and butter in a glass bowl; heat in microwave on high until chips are softened, about 30 seconds. Stir chocolate mixture until smooth, cooking in microwave another 15 seconds to assure chocolate is soft enough, if needed. Add Irish whiskey and stir until smooth. Dissolve coffee granules in hot water in a small pitcher. Pour the chocolate mixture, sweetened condensed milk, and cream into the pitcher and stir until smooth. Refrigerate mixture until completely chilled, at least 20 minutes. 0.25 cup milk chocolate chips 2 teaspoons butter 3.5 fluid ounces Irish whiskey, or more to taste 0.25 teaspoon instant coffee granules 1 teaspoon hot water 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1.5 cups heavy whipping cream Save a few dollars by making your own Irish creme liqueur at home using this DIY recipe, chocolate chips, cream, and Irish whiskey.

title: Wine Slushies (With Ice Cream Maker)
text: Combine wine, water, sugar, and lime juice together in a bowl until sugar is dissolved; transfer to an ice cream maker. Follow manufacturers' instructions for ice cream. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle sweet wine (such as Riesling) 0.5 cup water 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 lime, juiced Wine is combined with sugar and lime juice in an ice cream maker, creating boozy wine slushies for summertime barbeques.

title: POG Juice
text: Combine passion fruit juice, guava nectar, and orange juice in a large glass pitcher and stir well. Chill until ready to serve. 6 cups passion fruit juice (such as Welch's®) 6 cups guava nectar (such as Goya®) 3 cups fresh squeezed orange juice POG juice is an acronym for passion fruit juice, orange juice, and guava nectar combined into an amazingly refreshing tropical drink! Serve well chilled.

title: Oreo Cookie Gourmet Pudding Shots
text: Stir milk, vodka, and pudding mix together in a bowl until mixture thickens. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon into disposable shot cups and refrigerate until chilled, at least 30 minutes. 1 cup cold milk 0.75 cup cake-flavored vodka (such as UV®) 1 (4 ounce) package cookies and cream instant pudding mix (such as Jell-O® Oreo®) 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed Pudding shots are all grown up, thanks to these gourmet Oreo pudding shots that taste like cookies and cream.

title: Apple Smoothie
text: Place banana, apple, yogurt, apple juice, oats, almond butter, maple syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves into the cup of a high speed blender, and blend until smooth. If desired, add ice for a thicker smoothie, or add milk for a thinner consistency. 1 small banana, peeled and frozen 1 large Fuji apple, cored and sliced 3/4 cup whole milk plain Greek yogurt 1/4 cup unsweetened apple juice 3 tablespoons rolled oats 1 tablespoon almond butter 2 teaspoons maple syrup, or to taste Pinch of ground cinnamon Pinch of ground nutmeg Pinch of ground cloves This apple smoothie works well with any kind of apple—sweet, tart, or anything in between. With warm pie spices, Greek yogurt, banana, and almond butter, it's a great way to begin your day or liven up the afternoon.

title: Hot Cranberry Tea
text: In a large pot, combine water and cranberries. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 30 minutes. Add sugar, orange juice, lemon juice, cloves, and cinnamon sticks. Cover and steep for 1 hour. 3.5 quarts water 1 (12 ounce) package cranberries 2 cups white sugar 2 oranges, juiced 2 lemons, juiced 12 whole cloves 2 cinnamon sticks This cranberry tea recipe is a holiday tradition and it's a fun recipe to make with the kids! A slow cooker will keep it warm while serving.

title: Gluehwein (German Mulled Wine)
text: Pour wine into a large pot and set over medium heat. Let it warm up until steam rises from the surface, but do not allow it to boil. Add cinnamon sticks, cloves, lemon juice, and sugar; stir to dissolve sugar. Float orange slices on the surface. Warm over medium heat for 5 minutes, being careful not to let it boil. Remove from heat and let stand for 1 hour. Pour through a colander to remove orange slices and whole spices. Serve hot, or refrigerate and reheat gently just before serving. 1 gallon red wine 8 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks 12 whole cloves 0.75 cup white sugar 0.5 cup fresh-squeezed lemon juice 1 orange, sliced into rounds Glühwein (gluehwein) is a tasty mulled wine flavored with warm spices that's served at Christmas markets throughout Germany. It warms you right through!

title: Mint Simple Syrup
text: Combine water, sugar, and mint leaves in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Simmer for 1 minute; remove from heat and let syrup steep, about 30 minutes. Pour syrup into a sterilized glass jar through a mesh strainer to remove mint leaves; let cool. 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 1 cup fresh mint leaves This mint simple syrup is made with fresh mint leaves, sugar, and water to create a refreshing syrup to use in cocktails, glazes, and frozen desserts.

title: Super Immunity Boost Juice
text: Process ginger, turmeric, and oranges through a juicer in the order listed. Pour over ice and drink immediately. 1 (2 inch) piece fresh ginger root 2 (1 1/2 inch) pieces fresh turmeric 3 large naval oranges, peeled ice cubes Orange, ginger, and turmeric combine to make this immune-boosting juice loaded with Vitamin C, antioxidants, and anti-inflammatory properties.

title: Vanilla Italian Cream Soda
text: Place ice cubes into a glass; pour club soda over. Pour vanilla syrup on top, followed by half-and-half. Stir and serve. 3 cubes ice 0.5 cup club soda 3 tablespoons vanilla-flavored syrup (such as Torani®) 1 tablespoon half-and-half This homemade Italian cream soda is not only easy to make, but super sweet and delicious; perfect for entertaining or when craving a sweet treat for one.

title: Sara's Iced Coffee
text: Stir vanilla extract and sugar into boiling water until sugar has dissolved. Refrigerate until cool, about 30 minutes. Chill four glasses, if desired. Divide ice and chilled coffee evenly between four glasses. Stir in sugar mixture and cream to taste. 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.25 cup white sugar 0.25 cup boiling water 3 cups crushed ice 4 cups brewed coffee, chilled 0.5 cup cream A lightly sweetened, creamy iced coffee with just a hint of vanilla. Very refreshing and delicious on a hot summer day. Yum!

title: Brazilian Lemonade
text: Wash limes thoroughly. Cut off the ends and slice into eight wedges. Place limes in a blender with water, sugar, sweetened condensed milk, and ice; pulse 5 times, or until smooth. Strain through a fine mesh strainer to remove rinds. Serve over ice. 2 limes 3 cups water 0.5 cup sugar 3 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk ice cubes This Brazilian lemonade recipe actually uses limes and gets additional sweetness from sweetened condensed milk. Serve over ice for a refreshing treat!

title: Yummy Margaritas
text: In a blender combine limeade, beer and tequila. Fill blender to the top with ice. Blend until thick and smooth. Salt the rims of 2 large margarita glasses. To do so, pour salt onto a small plate, moisten the rims of the glasses on a damp towel and press them into the salt. Serve the margaritas in the salted glasses and garnish with slices of lime. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate 6 fluid ounces beer 6 fluid ounces tequila 4 cups ice 1 lime, sliced A twist on the classic, made with limeade, beer, ice, lime and THE margarita maker, tequila.

title: Healthy Hot Cocoa
text: Heat milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Add cacao powder, stevia powder, and vanilla extract; stir until hot, 2 to 3 minutes. 1 cup milk 2 teaspoons cacao powder 0.25 teaspoon stevia powder 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract Milk is heated with cacao powder, stevia, and vanilla extract for this simple and delicious cup of hot cocoa, done in less than 10 minutes.

title: Wassail Punch
text: In a slow-cooker or a large pot over low heat, combine apple cider, orange juice and lemon juice. Season with cloves, ginger and nutmeg. Bring to a simmer. If using a slow cooker, allow to simmer all day. Serve hot. 2 quarts apple cider 2 cups orange juice 0.5 cup lemon juice 12 whole cloves 4 cinnamon sticks 1 pinch ground ginger 1 pinch ground nutmeg A spicy apple cider served hot in the winter months.

title: Spiced Tea Mix
text: Combine iced tea mix, orange-flavored drink mix, cinnamon, and ground cloves. Store in an airtight container. To serve, stir 1 1/2 teaspoons mix into 1 cup hot water. 1 (3 ounce) package lemon-flavored ice tea mix 2 (1.8 ounce) packages orange-flavored drink mix (e.g. Tang) 1.3333333730698 tablespoons ground cinnamon 2 teaspoons ground cloves This delicious dry spiced tea mix can be packed in jars and given as gifts. It can also be prepared sugar-free using a sugar-free, orange-flavored drink mix and sugar-free iced tea mix.

title: Blue Hawaiian Cocktail
text: Combine crushed ice, pineapple juice, rum, blue Curacao, and cream of coconut in a blender. Blend on high speed until smooth. Pour into a chilled highball glass. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a maraschino cherry. 1 cup crushed ice 2 fluid ounces pineapple juice 1 fluid ounce light rum 1 fluid ounce blue Curacao liqueur 1 fluid ounce cream of coconut 1 pineapple slice 1 maraschino cherry The Blue Hawaiian is a classic tiki cocktail made with rum, cream of coconut, pineapple juice, and Curacao liqueur to create its signature blue color.

title: Peppermint Lemonade
text: Pour the lemonade concentrate into a large pitcher or cooler with a spout. Stir in enough water to make 1 gallon. Grate the zest from the lemon and add to the pitcher, then squeeze the lemon juice from the lemon into the pitcher. In a small bowl, crush the mint leaves into the sugar using a muddler or a wooden spoon. Stir into the lemonade. Cover and chill for several hours, then strain to remove the leaves and zest before serving. Serve over ice and garnish with a sprig of mint. 1 (12 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed 1 fresh lemon 1.25 cups white sugar 0.5 cup fresh mint leaves Cool, tingly, and oh so refreshing, this lemonade helps cool you off with the fresh taste of mint.

title: Stone-Cold Stinger
text: Gather all ingredients. Pour cinnamon schnapps, peppermint schnapps, and Jagermeister into a frozen shot glass. 0.5 fluid ounce cinnamon schnapps (i.e. Goldschlager™) 0.5 fluid ounce peppermint schnapps 0.5 fluid ounce Jagermeister liqueur This stone-cold stinger shot with Goldschlager, Jagermeister, and peppermint schnapps is sure to get the party started.

title: Watermelon Juice
text: Blend watermelon, water, and sugar in a blender until smooth. 2 cups diced seedless watermelon 2 cups water 1 tablespoon white sugar, or more to taste Blending fresh watermelon with water makes a refreshingly simple beverage.

title: Shirley Temple
text: Into a tall glass, pour soda and grenadine over ice. Add cherry and straw. 6 fluid ounces lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 1 dash grenadine syrup 1 maraschino cherry A favorite drink for little girls and party-goers alike. Some grenadines may have alcohol in it, so be sure to check for that before you make this for children.

title: Mexico Chiquito Punch
text: Mix pineapple juice, grenadine, sugar, lemon juice, and instant tea powder together in a 2-gallon container; stir to dissolve sugar and tea powder. Add enough water to fill the container; stir to combine. 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 1 (1 liter) bottle grenadine syrup 1 cup white sugar 0.25 cup lemon juice 1 (1 ounce) packet instant tea powder 5 quarts water, or as needed Mexico Chiquito's punch is popular at their chain of restaurants in Arkansas, and this copycat recipe comes as close to the original as you can get!

title: Peach Sangria
text: Blend peaches, hot water, brown sugar, and cinnamon in a blender or food processor until smooth. Transfer to a pitcher; stir in dry white wine and triple sec. Cover and chill in refrigerator for at least 4 hours. Strain peach mixture through a large cheesecloth-lined sieve; squeeze cloth to remove all the juices. Pour juice into a large pitcher; stir in sparkling white wine. 4 large fresh peaches - peeled, pitted, and sliced 1 cup hot water 0.5 cup light brown sugar 1 pinch ground cinnamon 2.5 cups dry white wine 0.5 cup triple sec liqueur 1 (750 milliliter) bottle sparkling white wine, chilled Pureed peaches are soaked in tart white wine and triple sec and topped with sparkling wine for a refreshing and fruity sangria.

title: Mexican Hot Chocolate
text: Split vanilla bean lengthwise with the tip of a sharp knife. Place Urfa biber in a tea infuser. Combine vanilla bean, Urfa biber, milk, and cinnamon stick in a pot. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until milk is steaming and small bubbles appear, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove Urfa biber. Reduce heat to low. Add chocolate and sugar; stir until chocolate is melted, about 2 minutes. Remove cinnamon stick and vanilla bean. Pour into cups and top with a dollop of whipped cream. Garnish with bittersweet chocolate. 1 vanilla bean 1 teaspoon Urfa biber (Turkish chile pepper) 6 cups milk 1 cinnamon stick 8 ounces bittersweet chocolate 2 tablespoons white sugar 0.5 cup whipped cream, or to taste 1 tablespoon grated bittersweet chocolate This Mexican-inspired hot chocolate spiced with vanilla, cinnamon, and a hint of chile is the perfect drink to warm you up on a cold night!

title: Easy Apple Cider
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine apple cider and cinnamon sticks in a slow cooker. Place allspice and cloves onto the center of an 8-inch square piece of cheesecloth.
