Gather edges of the cheesecloth together and tie to secure; place in the slow cooker. Stir in brown sugar. Cook on High, covered, until mixture is steaming and sugar has dissolved. Reduce heat to Low and keep warm. 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle apple cider 3 cinnamon sticks 1 teaspoon whole allspice 1 teaspoon whole cloves 0.33333334326744 cup brown sugar This easy apple cider recipe flavored with cinnamon, whole cloves, and allspice is made in a slow cooker to keep it warm for as long as it lasts!

title: Watermelon-Cucumber Agua Fresca
text: Place watermelon and 1 1/2 cups water in a blender, and process at high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Add cucumber, lime juice, and sugar; blend until smooth. Pour mixture through a fine mesh strainer and using a spatula, press to remove the pulp. Don't skip this step, it's important. Pour the strained mixture into a large pitcher, add remaining 1 cup water, and stir well. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or longer. Sprinkle some Tajin® (chili lime seasoning) onto a small plate. Run the lime wedge around the top of the glass, invert the glass, and dip the rim into the seasoning. Fill the glass with ice, pour in the agua fresca, garnish with watermelon slices or wedges, and lime slices. 4 cups cubed seeded watermelon 2.5 cups water, divided 1 cup peeled, chopped cucumber 0.25 cup freshly squeezed lime juice 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 teaspoon chili-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®) 1 wedge fresh lime ice as needed 4 slices watermelon 4 slices lime Make sure you pick a very sweet and juicy watermelon for this refreshing summer agua fresca with watermelon and lime.

title: Strawberry-Ginger-Mint Lemonade
text: Place strawberries, mint, lemon juice, 1 cup water, sugar, and ginger into an electric blender and blend well. Pour into a pitcher, add 5 cups water, and stir well. Refrigerate or serve immediately over crushed ice. 18 fresh strawberries, stemmed 1 bunch fresh mint leaves 2 cups freshly squeezed lemon juice 6 cups water, divided, or more as needed 0.25 cup white sugar 2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger root, or more to taste Fresh strawberries are blended with mint leaves, ginger, sugar, and lemon juice to produce this summer-ready, refreshing drink that's delicious as-is, or with alcohol added!

title: Vanilla Latte
text: Pour milk into a steaming pitcher and heat to 145 to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand of an espresso machine. Pour espresso over vanilla syrup in a large coffee mug. Pour steamed milk over espresso, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Spoon foam over top. 1.25 cups 2% milk 2 tablespoons vanilla flavored syrup 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brewed espresso Enjoy this vanilla latte without waiting in the drive-through line! Use your home espresso machine and steaming wand to get coffee shop results, at home.

title: Luau Punch
text: In an empty gallon milk jug or pitcher, pour pineapple juice and orange juice concentrate. Shake to mix and pour in the lemon-lime soda. You may need to let the fizz settle and then return to pouring. This will fill up the gallon. Freeze overnight. Let the punch start to thaw 2 hours before serving. Serve slushy. 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed 2 liters lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage Pineapple and orange juices with fizzy citrus soda.

title: Warm and Spicy Autumn Punch
text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Stud whole oranges with cloves, and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. In a large saucepan, combine apple juice and cinnamon stick. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium, and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in nutmeg, honey, lemon juice, and pineapple juice. Serve hot in a punch bowl with clove-studded baked oranges floating on top. 2 oranges 8 whole cloves 6 cups apple juice 1 cinnamon stick 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.25 cup honey 3 tablespoons lemon juice 2.25 cups pineapple juice The aroma of this fall punch recipe tells you that autumn is in the air. Hot apple cider is sweetened with pineapple juice and honey, and spiced with clove-studded oranges, cinnamon, and nutmeg.

title: State Fair Lemonade
text: Wash lemons and peel off all the zest using a vegetable peeler; set peeled lemons aside. Add lemon zest to a bowl and cover with sugar; toss to combine. Cover and let sit for a minimum of 2 hours, or up to overnight. Bring water to a boil in a pot over high heat; turn off heat and pour in lemon-sugar mixture. Stir and let sit until sugar is completely dissolved, about 5 minutes. Pour through a mesh strainer back into the same bowl and discard the zest. Let cool to room temperature, 20 to 30 minutes. Cut lemons in half and squeeze juice into the bowl. Pour lemonade into a serving pitcher; cover and chill thoroughly before serving over ice, at least 2 hours. 6 lemons 1.25 cups white sugar 5 cups cold water This lemonade recipe is for authentic lemonade, similar to what you get at state fairs; Chef John reveals his secret to making this refreshing drink.

title: Dublin Kiss (St. Patrick's Day Shot)
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in Irish whiskey, Irish cream liqueur, and crème de menthe. Cover and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a shot glass. ice cubes 1 fluid ounce Irish whiskey (such as Jameson®) 0.5 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®) 1 splash creme de menthe liqueur This creamy St. Patrick's Day shot has a kiss of mint with the addition of a splash of crème de menthe.

title: Vodka Slush
text: In a 6-quart pot combine sugar and 7 cups water; bring to a boil and stir until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and stir in tea powder while hot. Add orange juice concentrate, lemonade concentrate, and 2 cups cold water. Chill in the refrigerator. When cold mix in vodka. Pour into a plastic container leaving room on top for expansion. Freeze for 24 hours. To serve, scoop about 1 cup into a tall glass and quickly stir in 1/3 cup lemon-lime soda. 2 cups white sugar 7 cups water 2 tablespoons instant tea powder 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 2 cups cold water 2 cups vodka 1 liter lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage This frozen vodka slush is flavored with orange, lemonade, and tea. To serve, mix with lemon-lime soda. Great for parties!

title: Decadent Green Tea Slushie
text: Combine boiling water and green tea in a tea pot; cover pot and steep tea, at least 30 minutes. Strain tea and pour into ice cube trays; freeze until solid, 4 hours to overnight. Put 6 green tea ice cubes in a blender; pulse until mostly crushed. Add yogurt and sugar and blend until desired consistency is reached. 2 cups boiling water 1 tablespoon jasmine green tea 0.33333334326744 cup yogurt 0.25 cup white sugar Green tea is made into ice cubes and blended with yogurt and sugar creating a creamy and decadent green tea slushie for a fun treat.

title: Traditional Eggnog
text: Gather all ingredients. Beat eggs with an electric mixer on medium speed until very frothy, 2 to 3 minutes. Gradually beat in sugar, vanilla extract, and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg. Stir in cream, milk, brandy, and rum. Cover and chill before serving. Sprinkle individual servings with remaining nutmeg. 6 eggs 1 cup white sugar 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg, divided 2 cups whipping cream 2 cups milk 0.75 cup brandy, chilled 0.33333334326744 cup spiced rum (such as Captain Morgan's®) This traditional eggnog recipe blends frothy eggs with vanilla, brandy, rum, cream, and milk to make a rich festive drink that will please any crowd!

title: Holiday Sangria
text: Pour Rioja into a large pitcher. Add brandy and orange liqueur. Cut orange, grapefruit, and lemon into wedges. Squeeze juice into the pitcher. Toss in fruit with rinds. Refrigerate until flavors combine, 8 hours to overnight. Add pomander to the sangria several hours before serving. Strain liquid into chilled glasses of ice. Top with a splash of seltzer. Garnish with lime slices. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Rioja red wine 0.25 cup brandy 3 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®) 1 large orange 1 large grapefruit 1 large lemon 1 clove pomander ice cubes 1.5 cups lemon seltzer water 2 limes, sliced A clove pomander adds a festive touch to this red wine sangria made with brandy, orange liqueur, and fresh citrus.

title: Piña Colada Pudding Shots!
text: Whisk together milk, vodka, rum, and pudding mix in a large bowl until combined. Stir in whipped topping until a pudding-like consistency is reached. Spoon into shot glasses and refrigerate until set, at least 30 minutes. 0.5 cup milk 0.5 cup vodka (such as Smirnoff®) 0.5 cup pineapple rum (such as Malibu®) 1 (3.4 ounce) package instant coconut cream pie pudding mix 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed Piña colada shots are crowd-pleasing, quick-and-easy pudding treats to make for your next party.

title: Best Strawberry Daiquiri
text: Place frozen strawberries in a blender; add sugar, lemon juice, and lime juice. Pour in rum and lemon-lime beverage, then add ice. Blend until smooth. 4 ounces frozen strawberries 0.5 cup white sugar 0.5 cup lemon juice 0.125 cup lime juice 0.75 cup rum 0.25 cup lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 6 cups ice, or as needed These are the perfect strawberry daiquiris for a hot summer day. Made with fresh or frozen strawberries, these are so good you'll never buy a mix again.

title: Coconut Oil Coffee
text: Blend coffee, coconut oil, and butter together in a blender until oil and butter are melted and coffee is frothy. 2 cups hot coffee 2 tablespoons coconut oil 2 tablespoons unsalted butter Start your morning off right with this mind-blowing recipe for hot coffee with coconut oil and butter.

title: Healthy Berry and Spinach Smoothie
text: Blend berries, yogurt, orange juice, spinach, and strawberries together in a blender until smooth. 2 cups frozen berries 1 cup plain yogurt 0.5 cup orange juice 0.25 cup fresh spinach, or to taste 5 strawberries This spinach berry smoothie recipe gives kids and adults a hearty helping of vegetables and fruit. It's healthy, delicious, and easy to make.

title: Banana Slush
text: Mix pineapple juice, bananas, orange juice concentrate, and lemonade concentrate in a large bowl. Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Dissolve sugar in the water and bring again to a boil; pour over the juice mixture and stir. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and freeze until mixture is mushy, at least 4 hours. Mix equal parts slush and lemon-lime soda in cocktail glasses to serve. 4 cups pineapple juice 5 bananas, mashed 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed 6 cups water 4 cups white sugar 18 cups lemon-lime soda (such as 7-Up®), or as needed Orange juice and lemonade concentrates blend with a simple syrup, pineapple juice, and mashed bananas in the base for a tasty slush.

title: Basil Simple Syrup
text: Combine water, sugar, and basil leaves in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat and let syrup steep for 30 minutes. Drain syrup through a mesh strainer into a sterilized glass jar; discard basil leaves. Let cool, then cover and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 month. 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 1 cup fresh basil leaves This basil simple syrup is made with fresh basil leaves steeped in sugar water to create a sweet herbal base for summer cocktails and frozen treats.

title: Sangria Cocktail
text: Dissolve sugar in tap water in a large pitcher. Add orange slices, lime slices, and wine. Stir in ice cubes until cold. Top with sparkling water. Serve in red-wine glasses, with fresh berries in each glass. 0.75 cup superfine sugar 1 cup tap water 1 orange, sliced 1 lime, sliced 5 (750 milliliter) bottles red wine 12 cubes ice cubes 6 fluid ounces sparkling water 1 cup fresh raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, or halved strawberries Sangria is a Spanish wine punch that includes chopped fruit and sparkling water for a refreshing summertime cooler.

title: Berries and Cream Smoothie
text: Pour cream and half-and-half into an electric blender and blend on low speed until it begins to thicken. Add sugar and vanilla extract and mix for about 30 seconds. Add blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, and blackberries. Blend until smooth, adding milk if necessary to make blending easier. 1 cup heavy cream 0.75 cup half-and-half 0.25 cup white sugar 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 cup frozen blueberries 1 cup frozen strawberries 0.5 cup frozen raspberries 0.5 cup frozen blackberries 0.5 cup milk Sweet, thick, and a great alternative to dessert, this berries and cream smoothie is blended up in minutes to enjoy on-the-go.

title: Homemade Cranberry Liqueur
text: Pulse cranberries in a food processor just until roughly chopped; transfer to a clean glass container. Add vodka, simple syrup, lemon peel, orange peel, cinnamon stick, and allspice to cranberries; stir until well mixed. Seal container with a lid and store in a cool dark area, 3 to 5 days, stirring several times a day. Strain through a fine mesh strainer into a glass bottle and refrigerate. 2 (12 ounce) packages fresh cranberries 2.5 cups vodka 2.5 cups simple syrup 0.75 lemon, peeled 0.75 orange, peeled 1 cinnamon stick 0.125 teaspoon ground allspice Homemade cranberry liqueur is delicious on its own or mixed with sparkling wine for a cranberry cordial that's perfect for holiday cocktail parties.

title: Creamy Lemonade
text: Combine lemon juice, sweetened condensed milk, and 1 cup water in a blender. Blend until well combined. Pour into a pitcher and add remaining 2 cups water. Stir. Serve chilled and over ice. 1 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice 0.5 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 3 cups water, divided ice Sweetened condensed milk makes this homemade lemonade so creamy. Serve over ice for a refreshing summer drink.

title: Root Beer Eggnog
text: Beat eggs in a pitcher until light and fluffy. Add milk, sugar, coffee creamer, vanilla extract, and nutmeg to eggs; beat until smooth. Refrigerate until slightly chilled, at least 15 minutes. Stir root beer extract into egg mixture. 4 eggs, beaten 4.6666665077209 cups whole milk 7 tablespoons white sugar 0.25 cup French vanilla-flavored coffee creamer 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 2 pinches ground nutmeg 1 teaspoon root beer concentrate Eggnog gets a twist with this recipe that calls for root beer concentrate to be added to the classic Christmas beverage.

title: Beer Margaritas
text: Gather all ingredients. Pour limeade concentrate, tequila, water, and beer into a large pitcher. Stir until limeade has melted. Add plenty of ice to the pitcher and garnish with lime wedges. Adjust with additional water if needed. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate 12 fluid ounces tequila 12 fluid ounces water, or more as needed 12 fluid ounces beer ice 1 lime, cut into wedges This beerita recipe uses beer, tequila, water, and frozen limeade concentrate to make a quick and dirty margarita for your boozy loving friends.

title: Ultimate Sangria Margarita
text: Pour limeade into a blender. Use the limeade container to measure tequila and orange liqueur; pour into the blender. Fill the blender with ice. Blend on high until all ice is crushed and the margarita consistency is thick. Fill the base of each margarita glass with sangria. Top with margarita mixture. 8 fluid ounces limeade (such as Minute Maid®) 6 fluid ounces tequila (such as Jose Cuervo 1800®) 6 fluid ounces brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®) ice 1 cup sangria, or to taste Fill the base of your margarita glass with sangria and top off with a lime-orange margarita slush for the ultimate frozen cocktail.

title: Easy Frozen Hot Chocolate
text: Microwave chocolate in a small microwave-safe bowl, stirring every 30 seconds until melted, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in sugar, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract until blended. Whisk in 1/2 cup milk until combined; set aside to cool, about 5 minutes. Pour chocolate mixture, remaining milk, and ice into a blender; blend on high speed until mixture is creamy, about 1 to 3 minutes. 3 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped 2 tablespoons white sugar 2 teaspoons unsweetened cocoa powder 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1.5 cups milk, divided 3 cups ice This mouthwatering summer dessert blends semisweet chocolate and cocoa powder with milk and ice to create a delicious frozen hot chocolate.

title: Frozen Caramel Coffee
text: Place cold brew concentrate, milk, 2 tablespoons caramel ice cream syrup, and sugar in blender; blend until mixed, 5 to 10 seconds. Add ice cubes and blend well, about 5 seconds. Pour into a glass. Serve topped with whipped topping and a drizzle of caramel syrup. 0.5 cup Gevalia® Cold Brew Concentrate - Vanilla 0.5 cup whole milk 2 tablespoons caramel ice cream topping 2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste 8 ice cubes 1 tablespoon whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®) 2 teaspoons caramel ice cream topping, or to taste Cold brew coffee concentrate, milk, and caramel ice cream syrup are blended together and topped with whipped topping and a drizzle of caramel syrup.

title: Strawberry-Kiwi Slush
text: Blend ice, strawberries, grape juice, kiwi fruit, water, and lemon juice in a blender until it reaches an even slush consistency, 25 to 35 seconds. 2 cups crushed ice 0.75 pint fresh strawberries, hulled 0.75 cup grape juice (such as Welch's®) 1 large kiwi fruit, peeled 0.25 cup water 0.25 cup lemon juice This delicious strawberry kiwi slush recipe brings rich flavor and is a perfect alternative for a smoothie or other dairy dessert!

title: Warm Lemon, Honey, and Ginger Soother
text: Gather all ingredients. Boil water. Place honey, lemon juice, ginger, and cinnamon in a teapot or 4-cup glass measuring beaker with spout. Pour boiling water over mixture; stir until honey is dissolved. Cover the teapot and let steep for 5 minutes. The ginger should sink to the bottom but may be strained while pouring into a mug. 0.25 cup honey, or to taste 1 lemon, juiced 1 tablespoon finely grated ginger root 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon 3.5 cups boiling water This honey ginger lemon tea is a non-caffeinated hot beverage that's easy to make, great for soothing colds, and perfect for sipping on chilly days.

title: Homemade Sports Drink (aka Greaterade)
text: Pour 1 cup of the water into a large pot. Add honey, salt, calcium magnesium powder, and cayenne. Place pot over low heat and whisk until ingredients have dissolved. Remove from heat and allow to return to room temperature. Add juices to room temperature mixture in pot. Pour in remaining 7 cups water and whisk until well blended. 8 cups fresh cold water, divided 3 tablespoons honey 0.5 teaspoon fine Himalayan pink salt 0.75 teaspoon calcium magnesium powder 1 pinch cayenne pepper 0.75 cup freshly squeezed orange juice, strained 2 medium lemons, juiced 2 medium limes, juiced Make your own sports drink with just a few ingredients you probably already have, and adjust it to suit your own individual taste.

title: Banana Slush Punch
text: In a blender, combine bananas, sugar, and 3 cups water. Blend until smooth. Pour into a large bowl and stir in pineapple juice. Blend in orange juice concentrate, lemonade concentrate, and 3 cups water. Divide into 3 plastic containers and freeze until solid, 4 hours to overnight. Remove from freezer 3 to 4 hours before serving. Using one portion at a time, place slush in a punch bowl and pour in 1 liter of ginger ale for each. 4 ripe bananas 2 cups white sugar 3 cups water 1 (46 fluid ounce) can pineapple juice 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans frozen orange juice concentrate 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 3 cups water 3 liters ginger ale In this easy banana punch recipe, three portions of banana citrus slush are frozen, then served with ginger ale for a fun party drink!

title: Georgia Sunset
text: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; add brandy, peach schnapps, and grenadine. Cover and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a glass. 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brandy 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger peach schnapps 1 fluid ounce grenadine syrup 0.25 cup chilled lemon-lime soda Brandy and peach schnapps make a beautiful and deliciously fruity Georgia sunset cocktail.

title: Irish Slammer
text: Pour beer into a pint glass. Pour whiskey and cream liqueur into a shot glass. Drop the shot glass into the pint glass, and drink the entire contents at once. 6 fluid ounces Irish stout beer 0.75 fluid ounce Irish whiskey 0.75 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur An Irish slammer is similar to a boilermaker. Drop a shot glass full of Irish whiskey and Irish cream into a glass of stout beer, and drink it all at once!

title: Lemon Verbena Mint Detox Tea
text: Pour boiling water over verbena and mint sprigs; steep until desired flavor is reached, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in honey. 1 cup boiling water 1 sprig fresh lemon verbena (about 10 leaves) 1 sprig fresh mint (about 15 leaves) 1 teaspoon honey, or to taste This is a basic recipe for lemon verbena and mint tea, using fresh herb sprigs and a little honey for a simple herbal infusion.

title: Chocolate-Strawberry-Baileys® Pudding Shots
text: Pour chocolate pudding mix into a bowl. Add 1 cup milk and mix using a wire whisk until well combined. Stir in Irish cream liqueur. Fold in 4 ounces of whipped topping and mix well. Fill plastic shot cups halfway with chocolate mixture. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until chocolate pudding is set. Pour strawberry pudding mix into a bowl. Add remaining 1 cup milk and mix using a wire whisk until well combined. Stir in strawberries and cream liqueur. Fold in remaining 4 ounces of whipped topping and mix well. Spoon strawberry pudding mixture over chocolate pudding in the shot glasses, filling nearly to the top. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until pudding is set. Sprinkle set pudding shots with chocolate shavings. 1 (3 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix 2 cups cold milk, divided 0.5 cup Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®) 1 (8 ounce) container whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), divided 1 (3 ounce) package instant strawberry pudding mix 0.5 cup strawberries and cream liqueur (such as Baileys®) 1 tablespoon shaved dark chocolate, or to taste These creamy chocolate-strawberry pudding shots will disappear from your party table. Quick, easy, and ready in about 1 hour, they are perfect for St. Patrick's Day.

title: Alcohol-Free Mojitos
text: Combine 2 cups water and the sugar in a microwave-safe bowl; heat in microwave on High for 5 minutes. Stir the mint into the water; let stand for 5 minutes. Strain and discard the mint leaves from the syrup; set aside. Stir the lime sherbet, lime juice, and 1 cup water together in a large pitcher until well combined. Pour the mint-infused syrup into the mixture. Add club soda and stir. Serve over ice. Garnish with lime slices. 2 cups water 1.5 cups white sugar 2 cups mint leaves, chopped 2 cups lime sherbet, softened 1 cup lime juice 1 cup water 8 cups club soda lime slices for garnish These are great for the kids or for anyone who wants a refreshing alcohol-free drink.

title: Lithuanian Krupnikas
text: Crack cardamom seeds and nutmeg with a heavy skillet on a cutting board. Toss them into a saucepan; add caraway seed, cloves, allspice berries, cinnamon sticks, peppercorns, saffron, ginger, turmeric, orange zest and lemon zest. Pour in water and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer until liquid is reduced by half. Strain out spices and set liquid aside. Pour honey into a large pot and bring to a boil over medium heat. Skim off any foam from the top. Stir in strained liquid and vanilla. Remove from heat and place far from the stove to avoid flare-ups when adding grain alcohol. Slowly stir in grain alcohol. Place the pot back onto the burner over low heat and cover. Heat through, being careful not to boil or even simmer. Remove from heat and let stand overnight with the lid on. The following day, pour liquid into sterile bottles, seal, and allow to settle for 2 weeks. The longer you let it sit, the clearer it will become and the better it tastes. Serve warm. 10 cardamom seeds 0.5 nutmeg seed 2 teaspoons caraway seed 10 whole cloves 10 whole allspice berries 4 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks 2 teaspoons whole peppercorns 1 pinch crushed saffron threads 2 (1 inch) pieces fresh ginger root 2 (1 inch) pieces fresh turmeric (yellow ginger) 3 large strips of orange zest 3 large strips of lemon zest 4 cups water 2 pounds honey 1 tablespoon vanilla extract 1 quart 190 proof grain alcohol This krupnikas recipe for spiced honey liqueur is flavored with citrus, ginger, turmeric, cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg, caraway, allspice, and cloves.

title: Spiced Pear Old-Fashioned
text: Muddle chopped pear, 1 rosemary sprig, lemon twist, maple syrup, and bitters in a cocktail shaker with a muddler or the handle of a wooden spoon until pear is liquified. Add bourbon, ginger liqueur, and 1 cup ice to the cocktail shaker. Cover and shake until well chilled. Place large ice cube into the rocks glass and set a small fine sieve over the glass. Strain the drink through the cocktail shaker top and the sieve to catch any large pieces of pulp or rosemary. Top with club soda. Garnish with pear wedge and rosemary sprig. 0.25 pear, chopped 2 sprigs fresh rosemary, divided 1 lemon twist 1 teaspoon pure maple syrup 3 dashes cardamom bitters 1.5 fluid ounces bourbon 0.5 fluid ounce ginger liqueur (such as Domaine de Canton®) 1 cup ice cubes 3 ounces club soda, chilled 1 very large ice cube 1 pear wedge for garnish This old-fashioned with rosemary and pear is the perfect fall cocktail.

title: Vodka Blueberry Liqueur
text: In a 2-quart jar dissolve sugar in vodka. Pour in blueberries and cover the jar. Store in cool, dark place for 2 months (refrigerator is okay). Occasionally shake gently. Strain and serve in cordial glasses, or if you prefer, over ice. 1 cup white sugar 2 cups vodka 3 cups fresh blueberries Vodka, fresh blueberries and a li'l sugar go a long way in making this homemade liqueur.

title: Simple Syrup with Truvia® Natural Sweetener
text: Add Truvia® natural sweetener to 1/2 cup of warm water. Shake or blend until dissolved completely. Store refrigerated. For best results, use within a day of making. 3.5 tablespoons Truvia® natural sweetener spoonable* 0.5 cup warm water Simple syrup sweetened with Truvia® natural sweetener will provide a savings of 100 calories or 26 grams of sugar per serving compared to the sugar-sweetened version.

title: Peach Lemonade
text: Place sugar in a saucepan. Pour in 1 cup water. Turn heat to medium and stir continuously until sugar granules are dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool. Pour lemon juice into a pitcher. Pour in remaining 6 cups water. Place pitted peaches into a Vitamix® blender. Blend until smooth. Pour peach purée into the pitcher along with the simple syrup (dissolved sugar in saucepan). Stir to combine. Adjust to taste. Add garnish such as a slice of peach, ice, and serve. 1 cup white sugar 7 cups water, divided 1.25 cups freshly squeezed lemon juice 2 fresh peaches, peeled and pitted sliced peaches for garnish ice as needed This easy homemade peach lemonade provides a Southern-inspired twist to the favorite summertime drink.

title: Harissa-Pomegranate Mocktail
text: Combine tea, pomegranate juice, lemon juice, harissa simple syrup, aquafaba, and rose water in a cocktail shaker. Cover and shake until pressure builds and mixture starts to emulsify, about 45 seconds. Add ice to shaker. Cover and shake until outside of shaker is frosted, about 30 seconds. Strain into a glass. Garnish with pink peppercorns. 1 1/2 ounces brewed Lapsang souchong black tea, cooled 1 1/2 ounces pomegranate juice 3/4 ounce lemon juice 3/4 ounce Harissa Simple Syrup 1/2 ounce aquafaba (liquid from canned chickpeas) Dash of rose water Ice Pink peppercorns, for garnish This harrissa-pomegranate mocktail combines spicy harissa, Lapsang souchong tea, and rose water punch in a zero-proof drink. Aquafaba delivers a vegan-friendly froth.

title: Sangria with Frozen Berries
text: Mix wine, brandy, triple sec, lemonade concentrate, orange juice, lemon juice, and sugar together in a large pitcher or a bowl until sugar is dissolved. Add frozen berries. Refrigerate for 8 hours to overnight for best flavor. Add lemon-lime beverage just before serving. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry red wine 0.5 cup brandy 0.5 cup triple sec 0.33333334326744 cup frozen lemonade concentrate 0.33333334326744 cup freshly squeezed orange juice 0.25 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice 0.25 cup white sugar 2 (12 ounce) packages mixed frozen berries 2 cups lemon-lime carbonated beverage (such as 7Up®) Made with frozen mixed berries, this fruity sangria is a summer-friendly, refreshing drink that's great for entertaining.

title: Simple Coffee Drink
text: Mix milk, coffee, and sweetener together in a glass until sweetener is dissolved. 1 cup milk 0.5 cup cold brewed coffee 2 (1 gram) packets granular sucralose sweetener (such as Splenda®) Leftover coffee becomes a refreshing and sweet drink with the addition of milk and sweetener.

title: Coffee Cooler
text: In the container of a blender, combine the coffee, milk, hot cocoa mix, sugar, banana, vanilla and ice cubes. Cover and blend until smooth and frothy. Pour into glasses and serve immediately. 2 cups strong brewed coffee, room temperature 2 cups skim milk 1 (.55 ounce) package hot cocoa mix 2 tablespoons white sugar 1 banana, cut into chunks 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 10 ice cubes A low calorie milkshake that can be modified to produce a variety of flavors, and is a great use for leftover coffee. Use different flavors of hot cocoa mix to make different flavored milkshakes.

title: Baileys® and Coffee Jell-O® Shots
text: Sprinkle 1/2 package unflavored gelatin into a heat-resistant bowl and pour boiling water on top, stirring to dissolve. Add Irish cream liqueur and stir until well incorporated. Fill shot glasses halfway and refrigerate until set, 2 to 4 hours. Sprinkle remaining 1/2 package unflavored gelatin into a heat-resistant bowl and pour boiling coffee on top, stirring to dissolve. Add Irish cream liqueur and stir until well incorporated. Pour coffee mixture into the half-filled shot glasses on top of the previous layer. Return to the refrigerator and chill until set, 2 to 4 hours. 0.5 (1 ounce) package unflavored gelatin (such as Knox ®) 0.25 cup boiling water 0.25 cup Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®) 0.5 (1 ounce) package unflavored gelatin (such as Knox ®) 0.25 cup strong brewed coffee, boiling 0.25 cup Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®) If you like Baileys® Irish Cream and you like coffee, you will love these Jell-O® shots. Perfect for St. Paddy's Day or other Irish festivities!

title: Copycat Chick-fil-A Frosted Lemonade
text: Place ice cream, frozen lemonade concentrate, and lemon zest in the jar of a blender, and blend until smooth. Divide into 4 glasses, and serve immediately. 4 cups vanilla ice cream 1 (12 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 1 teaspoon lemon zest This copycat Chick-fil-A frosted lemonade recipe is a genius summertime treat, a sweet and tangy lemonade milkshake as refreshing as it is decadent.

title: Wenny's White Cake Shots
text: Fill a shaker with ice. Pour vanilla-flavored vodka and hazelnut liqueur into shaker; cover the shaker and shake until chilled. Strain into 4 shot glasses. ice 2 fluid ounces vanilla-flavored vodka 2 fluid ounces hazelnut liqueur These simple, delicious, and festive white cake shots taste just like a piece of cake!

title: Pineapple Lemonade
text: Core pineapple using a pineapple corer or slicer. Break up into chunks and measure out 2 cups. Save juices. Combine 2 cups pineapple and juices, 2 cups water, and lemon juice in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into a pitcher. Add remaining 2 cups water and sweetener. Stir and serve over ice. 1 fresh pineapple 4 cups water 0.5 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice 1 packet sweetener of your choice, or to taste 2 cups ice cubes A tropical and refreshing lemonade made with fresh pineapple, perfect for outdoor picnics or parties.

title: Pumpkin-Spice Latte Bombs
text: Break 4 ounces of the white chocolate into small pieces and place in a medium microwave-safe bowl; microwave on HIGH, stirring at 30-second intervals, until melted, about 1 1/2 minutes. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the melted chocolate into each of 6 (1 3/4-inch) silicone ball molds. Immediately flip mold over onto a cutting board or plate to allow chocolate to drip off and coat the mold. Let stand 2 minutes. Flip back over and use an offset spatula to scrape the tops of molds to clean them off, placing any dripped chocolate back into the bowl. Place silicone mold in freezer to set, about 5 minutes. Release chocolate "cups" from silicone molds; set aside. Repeat with another 4 ounces of chocolate. While the molds chill, stir together beverage mix and pumpkin pie spice in a small bowl. Spoon 2 teaspoons of the mixture into 6 of the "cups." Place the bowl of the leftover melted chocolate back in the microwave; microwave on HIGH until melted, about 30 seconds. Spoon or pour into a small zip-top plastic bag or piping bag and snip off 1/16-inch of the corner. Pipe a thin chocolate line along the edge of the 6 filled white chocolate cups. Place remaining 6 cups on top, using the white chocolate line as glue. Smooth out with your finger, and gently place in silicone mold; freeze until set, about 5 minutes. Remove the balls from freezer, and dip an offset spatula in very hot water; use it to smooth out edges of the chocolate ball seam. Set aside. Break remaining 2 ounces of chocolate into pieces, and place in a small microwave-safe bowl; microwave on HIGH until melted, about 30 seconds. Add food coloring, and stir to combine. Place in a separate ziplock bag and snip off 1/16-inch from a corner. Pipe in a zig-zag pattern on the balls. Freeze until set, about 5 minutes. To serve, brew an 8- to 10-ounce cup of your favorite coffee. Place a bomb in the hot cup of coffee and stir to melt. 10 ounces white chocolate, divided 3 tablespoons French vanilla instant coffee 1.5 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice 4 drops orange food coloring 6 cups hot brewed coffee Inspired by cocoa bombs, these white chocolate spheres contain instant coffee and pumpkin pie spice that meld into a hot cup of coffee turning it into your own pumpkin-spice latte at home.

title: Blueberry-Ginger Fizz
text: Bring blueberries, water, sugar, and ginger to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, crushing the blueberries occasionally with a masher. Remove from heat and let cool, about 10 minutes. Pass the mixture through a food mill or fine mesh sieve to remove the skins of the blueberries. Set aside 1/4 cup syrup and store the remainder in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. Place crushed ice in a glass. Add reserved blueberry-ginger syrup and orange juice. Top off with club soda and stir to combine. Garnish with orange slice. 1 pint blueberries 1 cup water 0.25 cup sugar 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger 0.25 cup crushed ice 2 tablespoons orange juice 0.25 cup club soda 1 slice orange Perfect for non-drinkers and people who are watching their waistlines, this "mocktail" is light and refreshing and a nice option for a holiday party.

title: Soursop Punch
text: Working in batches, press soursop pieces through a fine-mesh strainer with the back of a spoon into a bowl to remove the juice from the fruit. Whisk milk, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg into soursop juice until sugar is dissolved completely. Pour punch into a pitcher and refrigerate until chilled, at least 30 minutes. 1 soursop fruit, peeled and cut into chunks 1.5 cups milk, or to taste 2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg The popular tropical soursop fruit brings excellent flavor to this punch that's rounded out with milk, cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla.

title: Homemade Peach Tea
text: Make syrup: Mix together water, sugar, and peach slices in a small pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, crushing peach slices as you stir, until sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat, cover, and allow peaches to infuse syrup, about 30 minutes. Strain to remove peach slices. Make tea: Bring water to a boil in a medium pot. Remove from heat and add tea bags; cover and steep for about 5 minutes. Remove tea bags from the pot and pour in syrup. Cool to room temperature, then refrigerate until ready to serve. 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 2 slices fresh peach, or more to taste 6 cups water 3 tea bags This peach tea is an easy, elegant, fresh fruit-infused iced beverage sweetened with simple syrup for a delicious and refreshing summertime drink.

title: Blueberry Stevia Lemonade
text: Muddle blueberries with lemon juice in glass. Stir in thyme sprigs and Wholesome Organic Stevia. Top with sparkling water to taste. Garnish with additional blueberries and lemon wheel. 10 fresh organic blueberries, plus more for garnish 2 ounces fresh lemon juice 2 sprigs fresh thyme 2 packets Wholesome Organic Stevia, or more to taste Sparkling water to taste Lemon wheel for garnish A better-for-you spin on a classic recipe, sweetened with blueberries and organic stevia.

title: Sugar Free Eggnog
text: In a large mixing bowl, mix together sugar free vanilla pudding mix, nonfat milk, sweetener, ground cinnamon, dash of nutmeg , and rum extract. Mix these very well with a wire whisk for at least 2 minutes. If this is too thick, add more milk and sweetener. 1 (1 ounce) package sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix 5 cups nonfat milk 1 packet aspartame sweetener 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 pinch ground nutmeg 1 teaspoon rum flavored extract This is a sugar-free version of a Christmas favorite. It is best to make it just before serving.

title: Chef John's Homemade Eggnog
text: Place egg yolks in a saucepan. Whisk in sugar until well blended and creamy. Add milk and cream; whisk until blended. Place pan over medium heat; whisk frequently until mixture reaches a temperature of between 170 to 180 degrees F (75 to 80 degrees C) using an instant-read thermometer. Remove from heat. Stir in nutmeg and whiskey. Chill pan in cold water until cool. Transfer mixture to a container (a large pitcher is ideal). Cover and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, 2 to 3 hours. Place egg whites in a bowl and whisk until soft peaks form. Add sugar and continue whisking until egg whites hold a firmer peak. Whisk egg whites into custard base until thoroughly blended. Refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes. Whisk eggnog again just before serving and between each pour to ensure even distribution of the egg whites which tend to float to the top. Serve with a dusting of nutmeg. 4 egg yolks 0.33333334326744 cup white sugar 2 cups whole milk 1 cup heavy cream 0.75 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg 2 fluid ounces bourbon whiskey, or more to taste 4 egg whites 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 pinch freshly grated nutmeg Homemade eggnog is so superior to what you find in the store it's well worth the (minimal) effort to make it!

title: Perfect Vanilla Tea
text: Pour boiling water into a mug. Steep tea bag in water for 3 minutes; remove and discard. Stir milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon into the tea. 1 cup boiling water 1 orange pekoe tea bag 2 tablespoons milk 1 teaspoon white sugar 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon This is a delicious blend of plain tea, wonderful vanilla, and spices to create the perfect mug for late night, morning, or really any time of day at all!

title: Beer Shandies
text: Pour beer and lemon-lime beverage into a pint glass, then garnish with lemon slice. 0.75 cup beer 0.75 cup lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 1 slice lemon Refreshing, light, and perfect for those looking for a low-alcohol content treat, this beer cocktail formula prepares you for endless combinations and flavors!

title: Homemade Italian Cream Soda
text: Stir together club soda, heavy cream, and raspberry syrup in a pitcher. Fill 2 tall glasses with ice and pour cream mixture on top. 10 ounces club soda 4 ounces heavy cream 4 fluid ounces raspberry syrup 2 cups ice cubes, or as needed Try this homemade Italian cream soda that tastes just like the ones from your favorite Italian restaurant! You can use any flavored drink syrup for this recipe.

title: Strawberry Beer Margaritas
text: Put strawberry chunks in a bowl. Pour tequila over strawberries. Marinate in refrigerator for 2 hours. Blend strawberries and tequila in a blender until fully pureed; strain into a large pitcher to remove seeds. Stir strained berry mixture, soda, beer, and limeade concentrate together in a pitcher. Add ice cubes to chill. Rim glasses with salt before pouring margaritas. 1 pound fresh strawberries, hulled and cut into chunks 12 fluid ounces white tequila 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle light beer 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate, thawed ice, or as needed 1 teaspoon kosher salt for rimming glasses These beer margaritas get a flavorful twist with the addition of tequila-soaked strawberries!

title: Mexican-Style Coffee
text: Pour the coffee into a mug. Stir in the coffee liqueur and tequila. Garnish with whipped topping, cinnamon, and cocoa powder. 4 fluid ounces hot brewed coffee 1 fluid ounce coffee liqueur 1 fluid ounce tequila 1 tablespoon whipped topping 1 pinch ground cinnamon, for garnish 1 pinch cocoa powder, for garnish Mixing warm coffee with tequila and coffee liqueur makes for a perfect 'apres ski.'

title: Easy Berry Sangria
text: Mix wine, apple, strawberries, raspberries, cherries, blueberries, blackberries, and brandy together in a pitcher; refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Stir lemon-lime soda into wine mixture. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle chilled mild red wine (such as Lambrusco) 1 apple, cubed 1 cup sliced strawberries 1 cup raspberries 1 cup pitted and sliced cherries 1 cup blueberries 1 cup blackberries 0.75 cup brandy 2 cups lemon-lime soda Use all the varieties of summer berries in this easy berry sangria for a refreshing summer drink.

title: Raspberry Blackberry Smoothie
text: Place banana, blackberries, raspberries, yogurt, honey, and ice cubes into a blender. Blend until smooth. 1 small banana 0.5 cup blackberries 1 cup fresh raspberries 1 (6 ounce) container vanilla yogurt 1 tablespoon honey 4 ice cubes A quick and delicious smoothie made with raspberries, blackberries, bananas and yogurt.

title: Cape Cod
text: Place ice in a short tumbler or old fashioned glass; pour in vodka and cranberry juice. Squeeze lime wedge into drink, then add it to the glass. Serve. ice cubes 1.5 fluid ounces vodka 0.33333334326744 cup cranberry juice 1 wedge lime This Cape Cod drink is a classic East Coast cocktail made with vodka, cranberry, and lime. Perfect for summer but refreshing all year long.

title: Fruit Punch
text: Combine ginger ale, fruit punch, and pineapple juice together in a punch bowl; add scoops of sherbet into the punch. Wait for the sherbet to begin melting, approximately 10 minutes; stir gently and serve. 1 (2 liter) bottle ginger ale, chilled 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle fruit punch, chilled 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle unsweetened pineapple juice, chilled 0.5 gallon orange sherbet This fruit punch is refreshing, delicious, non-alcoholic, and easy to make with pineapple juice, ginger ale, orange sherbet, and bottled fruit punch.

title: Cioccolata Calda (Hot Chocolate Italian-Style)
text: Mix the cocoa powder and sugar together in a small saucepan. Stir the 1 1/2 cups milk into the saucepan until the sugar has dissolved. Place over low heat; slowly bring the mixture to a low simmer. Whisk 2 tablespoons of milk together with the cornstarch in a small cup; slowly whisk the cornstarch slurry into the cocoa mixture. Continue cooking, whisking continually, until the hot chocolate reaches a pudding-like thickness, 2 to 3 minutes. 3 tablespoons cocoa powder 1.5 tablespoons white sugar 1.5 cups milk 2 tablespoons milk 1 tablespoon cornstarch Hot chocolate made Italian-style is a pudding-like chocolate decadence!

title: Apple Cider Vinegar Tea
text: Stir hot water, lemon juice, cider vinegar, honey, and cinnamon together in a large mug. 12 fluid ounces hot water, or more as desired 2 tablespoons lemon juice 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar 1 tablespoon raw honey 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon A cup of apple cider vinegar tea with lemon juice, cinnamon, and honey is a refreshing way to start your day, and it's said it boosts your metabolism!

title: Malian Ginger Juice
text: Place ginger into a blender, cover with 1 1/2 cups water, and blend until ginger is thick and pasty. Strain and squeeze juice from ginger pulp into a 2-quart pitcher, squeezing ginger mixture as dry as possible. Stir lemon juice and sugar into ginger juice until sugar has dissolved. Pour 7 cups water into mixture, stir to combine, and serve garnished with crushed mint leaves. 0.33333334326744 pound fresh unpeeled ginger root, cut into 1/2-inch chunks 1.5 cups water, or as needed to cover 4 large lemons, juiced 1 cup white sugar 7 cups water, or as needed 16 leaves fresh mint, crushed A popular and refreshing ginger drink recipe from West Africa is just the drink to go with heavy or fried foods for a light and flavorful balance.

title: Summer Beer II
text: Place lemonade concentrate in a gallon pitcher. Measure water and vodka in the 12 ounce lemonade can and add to the pitcher. Pour in the beer, mix well and serve over ice. 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen pink lemonade concentrate, thawed 12 fluid ounces water 12 fluid ounces vodka 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer The summer is fun when pink lemonade is made hard with vodka and beer.

title: Apple Fall Spritz
text: Fill a glass with ice. Nestle apple and sage in glass. Pour hard cider and Aperol into glass, then top with club soda. Ice 2 apple or pear slices 1 fresh sage leaf 3 ounces dry hard apple or pear cider 2 ounces Aperol Splash of club soda Hard cider replaces prosecco in this fall-flavor spritz. To temper the bitterness, top with more club soda.

title: Coffee Shake
text: Combine the instant coffee, milk, vanilla extract, sugar, ice, and chocolate syrup in a blender; blend until smooth. 1 teaspoon instant coffee granules 0.75 cup milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste 6 ice cubes 2 teaspoons chocolate syrup This is a blended-coffee treat much like an iced cappuccino you might buy at a restaurant. You can make it non-dairy by using soy milk.

title: Monkey C Juice
text: Place juice and banana in blender. Blend on high until smooth and frothy. about 30 seconds. Serve immediately. 8 fluid ounces freshly-squeezed orange juice 1 medium ripe banana, peeled and quartered This 2-ingredient juice recipe is a great boost of Vitamin C and potassium. Make sure you use freshly-squeezed orange juice.

title: Kale and Banana Smoothie
text: Gather all ingredients. Place kale, banana, soy milk, flax seeds, and maple syrup into a blender. Cover and purée until smooth. Serve over ice. 2 cups chopped kale 1 banana 0.5 cup light unsweetened soy milk 1 tablespoon flax seeds 1 teaspoon maple syrup This kale smoothie with banana is perfect to help get your daily fruits and veggies. Nutrient-rich kale is mixed in with this tasty, easy smoothie.

title: Homemade Strawberry Nectar
text: Combine the strawberries and apple juice in a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth, then blend in water to your desired thickness. 2 cups fresh sliced strawberries 0.25 cup unsweetened apple juice, or to taste 2 tablespoons water, or as needed They don't sell Strawberry Nectar in my town, so I make my own.

title: Delicious Chocolate Shake
text: Combine ice cream, drink mix powder, and milk in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. 2 scoops chocolate ice cream 2 tablespoons powdered chocolate drink mix 1 cup milk This quick, easy choco shake recipe makes a creamy, luscious chocolate shake!

title: Honey Milk Tea - Hong Kong Style
text: Steep the tea bags in hot water until the color turns dark red, about 3 to 5 minutes. Discard the tea bags and let the tea cool. Combine the ice cubes, sweetened condensed milk, and honey in a glass or cocktail shaker. Pour in the tea and mix well. (If the tea is still warm, the ice may melt; add more ice if desired.) A strong, flavorful milk tea is ready for you to enjoy. 2 orange pekoe tea bags 1 cup boiling water 5 ice cubes 4 teaspoons sweetened condensed milk 3 teaspoons honey This sweet milky iced tea is just like what you'd find in a Hong Kong tea shop.

title: Frozen Virgin Strawberry Daiquiri
text: Place strawberries, ice cubes, sweet and sour mix and grenadine in a blender. Blend until smooth. Add more ice or less depending on your taste. 3.5 ounces frozen strawberries 0.125 cup ice 0.5 fluid ounce sweet and sour mix 1 dash grenadine syrup Grenadine, sweet-and-sour mix, plus a handful of ripe, ripe berries puts this "safe" cocktail in the pink.

title: Orange Banana Smoothie
text: Combine milk, yogurt, sugar, and salt in a blender. Add oranges and banana and blend for about 1 minute. Add ice and blend until smooth. 1 cup cold milk 0.5 cup vanilla fat-free yogurt 0.25 cup sugar 1 pinch salt 2 medium oranges, peeled and segmented 1 medium banana 4 cubes ice This orange and banana smoothie with fat-free vanilla yogurt is a delightful way to start the day. It's filling enough to have for breakfast!

title: Tainted Fruit Shots
text: Stir together boiling water and gelatin in a large bowl until gelatin dissolves. Stir in chilled vodka and cold water. Pour into plastic shot glasses and chill in the refrigerator until set, about 1 hour. 2 cups boiling water 1 (6 ounce) package fruit flavored Jell-O® mix 1.25 cups vodka, chilled 0.75 cup cold water This Jell-O vodka shot recipe is easy to make with fruit-flavored gelatin for fun and colorful single-serving party cocktails that set up in an hour.

title: Lemon Verbena Simple Syrup
text: Combine water, sugar, and lemon verbena leaves in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves. Simmer for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and let syrup steep for 30 minutes. Pour syrup through a mesh strainer into a sterilized glass jar to remove lemon verbena leaves; let cool. 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 0.25 cup fresh lemon verbena leaves This simple lemon verbena syrup combines citrus, floral, and woody notes. Mix it into cocktails and mocktails, or drizzle it over a bowl of sorbet.

title: Hot Toddy
text: Pour boiling water, whiskey, and honey into a mug. Add cloves, cinnamon, and lemon slice. Let mixture stand for 5 minutes so flavors can mingle, then sprinkle with a pinch of nutmeg before serving. 2 fluid ounces boiling water 1.5 fluid ounces whiskey 1 teaspoon honey 3 whole cloves 1 cinnamon stick 1 slice lemon 1 pinch ground nutmeg This classic hot toddy recipe is easy to make with whiskey, hot water, honey, cloves, and lemon; serve with a cinnamon stick for a comforting cold weather drink.

title: Strawberry Orange Banana Smoothie
text: Blend strawberries, orange juice, banana, and ice in a blender until smooth and frothy. 1 cup fresh strawberries 0.75 cup orange juice 1 ripe banana 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed This orange juice smoothie with strawberries and banana is a delicious source of antioxidants, fiber, potassium, and vitamin C, ready in 5 minutes.

title: Berry Cordial
text: Pour the sugar into a 1 quart jar. Fill the remaining space with berries, but do not pack down. Fill the jar with vodka so that the berries are completely covered. Seal the jar. Let the jar stand for 2 months, shaking the jar every week. The sugar should dissolve, and the vodka will become colored. Strain the liquid through a metal sieve, and then through a coffee filter to remove the fruit. Pour into pretty bottles. Drink as a cordial, or use it to flavor lemonade or iced tea. 1 cup sugar 1 quart blackberries 1 quart vodka This is an easy way to make cordial and it's good for gifts! Other berries such as raspberries, strawberries or blueberries may be used in place of blackberries, and rum or brandy may be used in place of the vodka.

title: 2-Ingredient Pineapple Whip
text: Combine frozen pineapple and sparkling water in a blender; blend until icy and frothy, 1 to 2 minutes. 1 cup fresh frozen pineapple 1 cup coconut-pineapple sparkling water This 2-ingredient pineapple whip is quick, easy, delicious, and low in calories! Reminiscent of the one served at Disneyland®.

title: Beer Margarita
text: Empty lemonade concentrate into pitcher (do not add water!). Pour in vodka and beer. Serve over ice. 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 8 fluid ounces vodka 3 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles beer Margarita, vodka, beer - never thought they'd share a glass, but in this case, they do.

title: 3-Minute Mochaccino
text: Blend milk, ice cubes, sugar, instant coffee granules, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract in a blender until smooth. Lightly coat the inside of a glass with chocolate syrup. Pour the coffee mixture into the glass. Top with whipped cream to serve. 0.75 cup milk 6 ice cubes 1 tablespoon white sugar 1 teaspoon instant coffee granules 1 teaspoon cocoa powder, or more to taste 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract, or more to taste 1 tablespoon chocolate syrup 1 tablespoon whipped cream Instant coffee granules and cocoa powder can help deliver a delicious cold beverage from your blender in a matter of minutes.

title: Pumpkin Pie Eggnog
text: Place egg yolks in a large bowl and beat using an electric blender until pale yellow, about 5 minutes. Add whipping cream and vanilla extract; mix until well combined. Combine pumpkin puree, brown sugar, white sugar, maple syrup, evaporated milk, pumpkin pie spice, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until sugars are dissolved, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Stir in milk and mix until well combined. Slowly pour pumpkin mixture into the egg mixture and stir together until well combined. Pour eggnog through a wire-mesh strainer into a container and refrigerate overnight. Pour 1 tablespoon brandy into each cup of eggnog. 12 egg yolks 2 cups heavy whipping cream 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 (15 ounce) can pumpkin puree 0.5 cup light brown sugar 0.5 cup white sugar 0.25 cup maple syrup 0.25 cup evaporated milk 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 pinch salt 2 cups milk 1 tablespoon brandy, or as needed Have you ever had pumpkin pie-flavored eggnog? Try making this delicious holiday version of the popular drink for Thanksgiving or Christmas.

title: Fresh, Homemade Apple Juice
text: Combine water with apple peels and cores in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the apple flavor and color have permeated the water, about 30 minutes. Strain apple juice into a mixing bowl; discard all solids. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Allow to cool for 30 minutes before drinking. 5 cups water 3 peels and cores from red apples - seeds removed 0.25 cup white sugar Try this homemade apple juice recipe made with apple peels and cores, water, and sugar for a low-budget way to use up leftover apple scraps.

title: Mimosa Mocktail
text: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice; add orange juice and club soda. Cover and shake until the outside of shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled champagne flute. Stir in sugar and serve immediately. 1 cup ice, or as needed 0.5 cup orange juice 0.25 cup club soda, or to taste 1 teaspoon white sugar Shake up a mimosa mocktail with just four simple ingredients-ice, orange juice, club soda, and sugar-for an all-ages version of the classic brunch drink.

title: Simplest Hot Chocolate (with Maple Syrup and No Refined Sugar)
text: Pour milk into a microwave-safe measuring cup. Heat in the microwave until hot, about 1 minute and 30 seconds. Place maple syrup, cocoa, and vanilla into a mug. Pour in 1/3 of the hot milk and stir well. Add remaining hot milk. 1 cup whole milk 1 tablespoon maple syrup 1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract This simplest hot chocolate recipe contains zero refined sugar; instead, you will taste the naturally sweet maple syrup and vanilla extract.

title: Dalgona Coffee (Whipped Coffee)
text: Whisk boiling water, instant coffee, and sugar together until coffee is dissolved. Continue to whisk until mixture becomes thick and forms a peak, 2 to 3 minutes. Pour milk into a glass. Pour the frothy coffee on top of the milk. 2 tablespoons boiling water 2 tablespoons instant coffee 2 tablespoons white sugar 1 cup whole milk Make your own light and creamy whipped coffee to serve over milk when you can't get to a cafe or coffee shop.

title: Almond Milk Frappuccino
text: Blend ice, almond milk, espresso, and honey in a blender until smooth. 1 cup ice 1 cup vanilla-flavored almond milk 2 shots brewed espresso, chilled 1 teaspoon honey, or to taste This almond milk frappuccino tastes just like Starbucks. Use 4 simple ingredients to make a homemade version of the coffee shop favorite.

title: Blueberry, Banana, and Peanut Butter Smoothie
text: Put flaxseed meal into a blender to grind and further break down. Place banana, milk, blueberries, yogurt, peanut butter, and honey into the blender. Cover and purée until smooth. Pour into glasses to serve. 1 tablespoon flaxseed meal 1 banana 1 cup milk 0.5 cup frozen blueberries 0.5 cup plain yogurt 1 tablespoon peanut butter 1 teaspoon honey This is a perfect peanut butter and berry smoothie to start your day or enjoy as a snack. Flax gives a boost to this recipe. It's kid-friendly too!

title: The Red-Headed Step Child
text: Pour one pint glass of beer. Measure a shot of whiskey, and pour in. Top with 1/2 shot of grenadine. 1 pint beer 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger whiskey 0.5 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger grenadine syrup My friends and I came up with this drink about four years ago. We have had it at every party or BBQ ever since. A glass of beer is spiked with whiskey, then topped with grenadine.

title: Red Headed Sl*t
text: Pour the Jagermeister, peach schnapps, and cranberry juice into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into shot glasses to serve. 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger Jagermeister liqueur 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger peach schnapps 2 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers cranberry juice This shot seems to be a favorite among bar patrons.

title: Genmai-cha
text: Put rice in a small skillet and toast over medium-low heat until it turns dark in spots. Move to a small saucepan. Pour in water and bring to a boil. Immediately reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 1 minute. Remove from heat and allow to steep 3 minutes more. Add tea and let it steep another 3 minutes. Strain and discard rice and tea leaves from liquid. Serve tea hot. 2 tablespoons brown rice 4 cups water 4 teaspoons green tea leaves Toasted brown rice adds a delicious flavor to green tea in this traditional Japanese preparation.

title: Coconut Hot Cocoa
text: Stir coconut milk beverage, cocoa powder, sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon together in a saucepan over medium heat until cocoa and sugar are completely dissolved and mixture is heated through, 5 to 10 minutes. Pour hot cocoa into a mug. 1 cup vanilla-flavored coconut milk beverage (such as Silk®) 2 tablespoons cocoa powder 1 tablespoon white sugar 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon This homemade hot chocolate is made with coconut milk and cocoa with hints of vanilla and cinnamon; perfect to warm you up on a cold day.

title: Caribbean Rum Punch
text: In a pitcher, combine lime juice, simple syrup, rum and orange juice. Add a few dashes of bitters and some grated nutmeg to taste. Serve chilled over ice. 1 cup fresh lime juice 2 cups simple syrup 3 cups amber rum 4 cups orange juice 4 dashes bitters freshly grated nutmeg This delicious concoction is the traditional rum punch recipe used in the West Indies, passed down for years. The old rhyme goes, 'One of sour, two of sweet, three of strong, four of weak.'

title: Eggnog Extreme
text: In a large bowl, combine egg yolks, 2 cups sugar and rum. Mix well, cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Stir half-and-half into cooled yolk mixture. In a large bowl, whip the heavy cream until soft peaks form; set aside. In a separate clean bowl, with a clean whisk, whip egg whites until thick, then gradually add sugar and whip until peaks form. Fold the whipped cream into the egg whites, then fold into the yolks mixture. Sprinkle top with nutmeg. 12 egg yolks 2 cups white sugar 1 (750 milliliter) bottle white rum 1 quart half-and-half cream 1 quart heavy cream 12 egg whites 1 cup white sugar 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg An extremely rich holiday drink made with eggs and rum. Whipped cream and whipped egg whites folded in for a melt-in-your-mouth smoothness.

title: Irish Cream Liqueur
text: Pour a small amount of whiskey into a large bowl. In the top of a double boiler, melt chocolate, stirring constantly until smooth. Mix melted chocolate with whiskey in the bowl. Gradually stir in sweetened condensed milk and evaporated milk. Stir in cream, instant coffee granules, and remaining whiskey. Pour mixture into three 750-milliliter bottles, seal, and store in the refrigerator. Best if kept at least 1 month before use. To serve: shake the bottle well; serve in small glasses over crushed ice. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Irish whiskey 8.75 ounces milk chocolate 2 (14 ounce) cans sweetened condensed milk 2 (12 fluid ounce) cans evaporated milk 2.5 cups heavy cream 0.25 teaspoon instant coffee granules This is better than the commercial Irish cream liqueurs and is very popular with family and friends. Will store for several weeks in the fridge, just serve over ice.

title: Jack Daniel's Very Merry Eggnog
text: Mix sugar, rum, bourbon, brandy, vanilla, nutmeg, and salt in a blender on medium speed until combined. Transfer to a large bowl. Pour half-and-half, cream, and eggs into the blender; mix on low speed until combined. Carefully pour into the liquor mixture and stir to combine. Ladle combined mixture back into the blender in batches; blend on low speed. Transfer blended eggnog to a punch bowl or pitcher. Refrigerate eggnog until cold, 1 to 2 hours, before serving. 1.25 cups white sugar 1 cup dark rum 1 cup bourbon 1 cup brandy 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 pinch ground nutmeg, or to taste 1 pinch salt 1 quart half-and-half 1 pint heavy whipping cream 5 large eggs Don't wait for December to enjoy this Jack Daniel's eggnog! Make Thanksgiving festive with this deliciously potent, quick and easy, homemade eggnog recipe.

title: Crazy Cinnamon Milkshake
text: Combine milk, sugar, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and ice in a blender; blend on high until smooth. Pour milkshake into a glass. 1 cup milk 3 tablespoons white sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon 8 ice cubes The regular homemade vanilla milkshake gets crazy and delicious when you add cinnamon to the mix. Your family and friends will love it.

title: Hot Banana Milkshake
text: Mash bananas and brown sugar together in a bowl. Transfer to a small saucepan, place over medium heat and cook until bananas begin to brown, about 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually mix 1 cup of milk into bananas and heat until mixture begins to steam. Stir honey and cinnamon into mixture until honey has dissolved. Pour banana mixture into a blender no more than half full. Cover and hold the lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend. Purée until smooth. Blend remaining 1/2 cup of milk into mixture until creamy. 2 small ripe bananas, chopped 0.25 teaspoon brown sugar 1.5 cups milk, divided 1 tablespoon honey 0.125 teaspoon ground cinnamon An easy banana smoothie sweetened with honey and served hot makes a nice alternative to hot chocolate.

title: Amaretto Sweet and Sour
text: Fill a glass with ice. Pour in amaretto, orange juice, and sweet and sour mix. Stir together and serve. 1.5 fluid ounces amaretto liqueur 2 fluid ounces orange juice 2 fluid ounces sweet and sour mix Amaretto, orange juice, and sour mix combine in this perfect happy hour or after dinner cocktail. It has a beautiful color and balance of flavors.

title: Clover Club
text: In a cocktail shaker, muddle raspberries and thyme. Add gin, egg white, simple syrup, and lemon juice. Shake until mixture no longer sounds sloshy and you feel a lot of pressure. Add ice to fill shaker half-full. Shake again until very cold. Strain into a coupe or cocktail glass. Dust top with cinnamon, or garnish with lemon zest curl or additional thyme. 5 fresh raspberries 1 sprig fresh thyme 1.5 ounces gin 1 pasteurized egg white 0.75 fluid ounce simple syrup 0.75 fluid ounce lemon juice ice cubes 1 pinch ground cinnamon 1 lemon zest curl 1 sprig fresh thyme Muddled raspberries and thyme are shaken with gin and lemon juice to make this elegant cocktail topped with an egg white.

title: My Mango Lassi
text: Combine mangos, yogurt, milk, cream, confectioners' sugar, and cardamom in a blender; blend until smooth and frothy. Pour into glasses and serve immediately. 1.5 cups mangos - peeled, seeded, chopped, and chilled 1.5 cups plain yogurt 0.5 cup cold milk 2 tablespoons heavy cream 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar 0.5 teaspoon ground cardamom Mango lassi is very rich and luxurious drink with yogurt and mangoes. It is the perfect summer drink when served chilled.

title: Lavender Simple Syrup
text: Combine water, sugar, and lavender blossoms in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat and let syrup steep for about 30 minutes. Pour syrup into a sterilized glass jar through a mesh strainer to remove blossoms; let cool. 1 cup water 1 cup white sugar 1 tablespoon fresh lavender blossoms Make lavender syrup at home with fresh lavender blossoms steeped in simple syrup to create a sweet and aromatic flavoring for beverages and desserts.

title: Nectarine Sunshine Smoothie
text: Place the nectarines, frozen banana chunks, orange, vanilla yogurt, orange juice, and honey into a blender, and blend until smooth. 2 large nectarines, pitted and quartered 1 banana, cut into pieces and frozen 1 large orange, peeled and quartered 1 cup vanilla yogurt 1 cup orange juice 1 tablespoon honey Enjoy the brief, sweet season of fresh nectarines with this delicious smoothie.

title: Spiked Lemonade
text: Place sugar in warm water, stirring until sugar is completely dissolved. Add lemon juice, cold water, and coconut rum. Stir until completely incorporated. Fill 2 glasses with ice cubes and divide lemon juice mixture amongst both glasses. 0.5 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice 0.25 cup warm water 0.25 cup white sugar 0.5 cup cold water 3 (1.5 fluid ounce) jiggers coconut-flavored rum ice cubes, as needed Homemade lemonade spiked with coconut-flavored rum - the perfect tropical cooler on a hot day.

title: Ultimate One-Cup-Only Eggnog
text: Beat egg yolks and sugar together in a large bowl until pale yellow; stir in cream, rum, cognac, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves. Refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour. 12 egg yolks 1.75 cups white sugar 2 quarts heavy whipping cream 0.5 cup dark rum (such as Bacardi®) 0.5 cup cognac 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon 2 teaspoons ground nutmeg 1 teaspoon ground cloves This ultimate eggnog recipe is so strong and creamy it was titled 'one-cup-only eggnog'. Serve with a warning label at your next party!

title: Rhubarb Slush
text: Place rhubarb in a large saucepan with water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook until tender. Drain; mash or purée in a blender. Stir together rhubarb purée, sugar, orange juice concentrate, lemonade concentrate, gin, and water. Freeze. Place scoops of the frozen mixture into serving glasses and fill the rest of the glass with lemon-lime soda. 6 cups fresh rhubarb, chopped 2 cups white sugar 1 (6 ounce) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed 1 cup gin 3 cups water 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage, chilled This easy rhubarb slush is a refreshing springtime beverage with delicious ingredients. It is also a great way to use up all that fresh rhubarb.

title: Early American Eggnog
text: Pour the brandy, sherry, rum, and whiskey into a bowl. Place the egg yolks and egg whites into two separate, large mixing bowls. Set the egg whites aside. Beat the egg yolks until light and frothy. Gradually beat in the sugar until the egg mixture is light colored. Slowly beat in the liquor mixture. With the mixer still running, pour in the milk and heavy cream until thoroughly blended. Using a clean beater, beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Gently fold the egg whites into the milk mixture. Pour into two clean, gallon-size plastic milk containers. Refrigerate at least 5 days, or 10 days for an even smoother taste. Shake the container occasionally to keep the alcohol from separating. To serve, pour the eggnog into a punch bowl. Whisk to blend milk mixture, add the quart of vanilla ice cream, and garnish with nutmeg. 1 cup brandy 0.5 cup sherry wine 0.5 cup Jamaican rum 0.5 cup whiskey 12 eggs, separated 0.75 cup white sugar 1 quart whole milk 1 quart heavy cream 1 quart vanilla ice cream, for serving 1 tablespoon freshly grated ground nutmeg, for garnish This traditional version of classic eggnog is suspected of having roots dating to George Washington's era, but it certainly pulls out all the stops. A creamy blend of egg yolks, egg whites, heavy cream, milk, rum, brandy, and sherry, it requires aging at least 5 to 10 days to achieve its remarkable mellow taste.

title: Mexican Mocha
text: Combine powdered sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, and chili powder in the bottom of a mug. Pour hot coffee on top and stir until dissolved. Pour in half-and-half creamer and stir. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with cinnamon, if desired. 2 tablespoons powdered sugar 1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.25 teaspoon chili powder 1 cup hot coffee 0.25 cup half-and-half creamer whipped cream for topping (optional) cinnamon for sprinkling (optional) Mexican mocha is a wonderful hot drink with cocoa powder, chili, cinnamon, and coffee.

title: Strawberry Raspberry Smoothie
text: Blend strawberries, raspberries, milk, yogurt, honey, and vanilla together in a blender until smooth. 1 cup hulled fresh strawberries 0.5 cup frozen raspberries 0.5 cup lowfat milk 0.5 cup vanilla yogurt 1 tablespoon honey 1 teaspoon vanilla extract This strawberry and raspberry smoothie recipe is easy and filling. Fruit is blended with yogurt, creating a probiotic-enhanced breakfast treat.

title: Mango Orange Slush
text: Blend mango, ice, orange juice, water, lime juice, ginger juice, and brown sugar together in a blender until slushy, 2 to 3 minutes. 1 large mango - peeled, seeded, and cut into chunks 10 ice cubes 1 cup orange juice 1 cup sparkling water 2 tablespoons lime juice 1 tablespoon ginger juice 1 tablespoon brown sugar Enjoy this mango orange slush with a touch of ginger and lime on a hot summer day.

title: Slippery Nipples
text: Pour butterscotch schnapps into a shot glass, then top with Irish cream liqueur. 0.75 fluid ounce butterscotch schnapps 0.75 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur This slippery nipple shot is a layered cocktail shooter with equal parts butterscotch schnapps and Irish cream for a sweet, buttery, boozy drink.

title: Chocolate Bar Hot Chocolate
text: Gather all ingredients. Place chocolate pieces in a saucepan over medium-low heat; add milk and whisk constantly until chocolate is melted and well blended, about 5 minutes. Whisk in cinnamon. Remove from heat; add more milk if desired. Serve in a mug. 1 (1.55 ounce) bar milk chocolate, chopped 0.66666668653488 cup milk, or more to taste 1 pinch ground cinnamon Leftover Halloween chocolate bars can be transformed into hot chocolate with the addition of milk and cinnamon in this simple and easy recipe.

title: Ginger Lemonade
text: In an 8-quart saucepan combine sugar, water and ginger root. Heat to boiling, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Cool 15 minutes. Remove ginger. Refrigerate lemonade at least 1 hour, or until chilled. Serve over ice, and garnish with lemon slices. 3 cups white sugar 4 quarts water 14 slices fresh ginger root 4 cups fresh lemon juice 2 lemons, sliced What a great twist on lemonade. Freeze some of this into ice cubes to use in the drinks, so it won't be diluted!

title: Sparkling Mango Pineapple Sangria
text: Stir pineapple juice, mango juice, pineapple rum, mango rum, chunked pineapple, and mango slices together in a large pitcher. Chill for 2 to 4 hours. Add Prosecco before serving. Stir and serve cold. ½ cup pineapple juice ½ cup mango juice ½ cup pineapple rum ½ cup mango rum ½ fresh pineapple - peeled, cored, and cut into chunks 2 mangos - peeled, seeded, and sliced 1 (750mL) bottle Prosecco sparkling wine Make your summer sangria extra fun with bubbles and tropical fruit. This sparkling mango and pineapple sangria with Prosecco will make you want to sit in the sunshine and enjoy.

title: Party Punch
text: Gather all ingredients. Combine fruit punch and orange juice in a punch bowl. Slowly pour ginger ale down the side of the bowl to retain carbonation. Ready to serve. Enjoy! 1 (2 liter) bottle fruit punch, chilled 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle orange juice, chilled 1 (2 liter) bottle ginger ale, chilled Learn how easy it is to make party punch with this 3-ingredient recipe that's ready in minutes. Perfect for weddings, birthdays, and family gatherings.

title: Adeni Tea
text: Cut tea bags open and empty into a small bowl; discard tea bags. Bring water to a boil in a saucepan; add loose tea. Boil tea until water becomes dark red, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir sugar into tea. Grind cardamom seeds in an electric grinder or using a mortar and pestle. Stir ground cardamom, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger into tea; boil until flavors are infused, about 10 minutes. Stir milk into tea and bring back to a boil for about 2 minutes. Pour tea through a sieve to separate out solids. Serve hot. 3 orange pekoe tea bags 3 cups water 0.25 cup white sugar 10 cardamom seeds, or to taste 0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg 0.5 teaspoon ground ginger 1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk Adeni tea is a spiced tea drink from Aden, Yemen, that is sweet and rich and perfect for winter days.

title: Baby Guinness
text: Fill a shot glass almost to the top with coffee liqueur. Top off with Irish cream; it will float on top, making the shot's ''head." 2 fluid ounces coffee flavored liqueur 0.5 fluid ounce Irish cream liqueur A baby Guinness shot is made with coffee liqueur and Irish cream for a delicious St. Patrick's day shooter that looks like a mini-pint of Guinness.

title: Strawberry Lemonade Slushie
text: Stir water and lemonade mix together in a cup until the mix dissolves. Combine ice cubes and strawberries in a blender. Pour lemonade mixture into the blender. Blend on high for 10 seconds. Stop blender and stir with a spoon. Blend again until smooth, about 5 seconds more. 0.5 cup water 0.33333334326744 cup dry lemonade-flavored drink mix 3 cups ice cubes 1 cup strawberries You can make these refreshingly delightful slushies with just lemonade-flavored drink mix, strawberries, water, and ice.

title: Creamy Hot Chocolate
text: Combine sweetened condensed milk, cocoa, vanilla, and salt in a large saucepan over medium heat; mix well. Slowly stir in hot water; cook until heated through, stirring occasionally. Do not boil. Top with marshmallows. Store covered in the refrigerator. 1 (14 ounce) can EAGLE BRAND® Sweetened Condensed Milk 0.5 cup unsweetened cocoa 1.5 teaspoons vanilla extract 0.125 teaspoon salt 6.5 cups hot water 3 Mini marshmallows This hot chocolate with sweetened condensed milk, cocoa, and vanilla is a comforting beverage to have on hand to warm up with on cold winter days.

title: Cha Cha Cha Sangria
text: Combine the sugar, white wine, and red wine in a large bowl and stir for several minutes until the sugar is dissolved. Stir in the sliced orange and lemon. Cover and refrigerate for 4 to 6 hours or overnight. Stir the mixture and divide it into pitchers. Add the sliced fruit and serve the sangria over ice. 1 cup white sugar 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry white wine 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry red wine 1 orange, sliced 1 lemon, sliced 1 cup sliced fresh peaches 1 cup sliced fresh strawberries 1 cup seedless red grapes, halved This recipe comes from a Caribbean restaurant (the Cha Cha Cha Restaurant) on Haight Street in San Francisco renowned for its sangria. Enjoy!

title: Sex on the Beach Jell-O Shots
text: Mix cranberry and orange gelatin together in a heat-proof bowl. Add boiling water and stir until dissolved. Add vodka and peach schnapps and stir. Pour mixture into little cups and chill until set, about 4 hours. 1 (3 ounce) package cranberry-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) 1 (3 ounce) package orange-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) 1.5 cups boiling water 6 fluid ounces vodka 6 fluid ounces peach schnapps It's not a party without these easy, peachy Sex on the Beach Jell-O shots made with cranberry and orange gelatin, vodka, and peach schnapps.

title: Vietnamese Coffee
text: Pour some boiling water in a glass. Let sit to warm the glass, about 1 minute. Pour out water. Pour condensed milk into the warmed glass. Top with coffee. Stir in creamer and hot cocoa mix. 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk, or more to taste 0.66666668653488 cup strong brewed coffee 1 teaspoon non-dairy creamer (such as Coffee-Mate®), or more to taste 1 teaspoon hot cocoa mix (such as Godiva®), or more to taste Hot cocoa and non-dairy creamer add rich chocolaty goodness to this traditional Vietnamese drink made with condensed milk and strong coffee.

title: Hot Mulled Wine
text: Stir water and sugar together in a saucepan until sugar dissolves. Add lemon, cloves, and cinnamon stick; bring mixture to a boil and cook until flavors combine, about 10 minutes. Strain and return water mixture to the saucepan; discard lemon, cloves, and cinnamon stick. Stir wine into water mixture; heat until hot but not boiling, 5 to 10 minutes. Serve flecked with nutmeg if desired. 1.5 cups boiling water 0.5 cup white sugar 0.25 lemon 8 whole cloves 1 (3 inch) cinnamon stick 1 (750 milliliter) bottle claret wine 1 pinch ground nutmeg This mulled wine recipe warms a full-bodied red wine with fragrant whole cloves, a cinnamon stick, and lemon for a cozy drink perfect for the holiday season.

title: Frozen Caramel Latte
text: Place the espresso, caramel sauce, and sugar into a blender pitcher. Blend on high until the caramel and sugar dissolve into the espresso. Pour in the milk and add the ice; continue blending until smooth and frothy. Top with whipped cream to serve. 3 fluid ounces brewed espresso 1 tablespoon caramel sauce 2 tablespoons white sugar 0.75 cup milk 1.5 cups ice cubes 2 tablespoons whipped cream This frothy, blended espresso drink will wake you up and make you happy any time of day.
