Sweetened with caramel sauce and topped with whipped cream, this is one delicious frozen latte.

title: Tea Punch
text: In a pitcher, combine sugar and tea. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Stir in orange juice, pineapple juice and lemonade. Chill in refrigerator for 4 hours. Just before serving, pour chilled juice mixture into a punch bowl and stir in ginger ale. 1 cup white sugar 1 cup strong brewed black tea 4 cups orange juice 4 cups pineapple juice 4 cups prepared lemonade 1 (2 liter) bottle ginger ale, chilled A different twist to a standard punch. Brewed tea is mixed with orange juice, pineapple juice, lemonade and ginger ale.

title: Healthy Green Juice
text: Gather all ingredients. Process kale, celery, green apples, cucumber, lemon, and ginger through a juicer. Serve immediately or store in a glass jar in the fridge for up to a day; shake before drinking. 6 leaves kale 4 stalks celery, leaves removed 2 green apples, halved 1 cucumber 0.5 lemon, peeled 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger This green juice recipe is easy to make in a juicer for a delicious detox drink made with kale, cucumber, celery, apples, fresh ginger, and lemon.

title: Margaret's Hot Mulled Wine
text: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan; dissolve sugar in water. Stir in lemon quarter, cloves, and cinnamon into water; boil for 10 minutes. Strain and return to saucepan. Stir red wine into water-sugar mixture; heat until piping hot, but not boiling, about 5 minutes. 1.5 cups boiling water 0.5 cup white sugar 0.25 lemon 8 whole cloves 1 (3 inch) cinnamon stick 1 (1.5 liter) bottle red wine An entertaining favorite, this mulled red wine is the perfect beverage for cold, blustery, rainy days.

title: Jim Beam® Yule Nog
text: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a dusting of fresh ground nutmeg. 2 parts Jim Beam® Bourbon 1 part DeKuyper® Buttershots® Schnapps 4 parts Eggnog Fresh Ground Nutmeg Ice Rich, creamy eggnog is the base of this tasty yule log cocktail that tastes just like the holidays made with Jim Beam®.

title: Kamikaze Shots for a Crowd
text: Pour the vodka, lime juice, and triple sec into a cocktail shaker over ice. Cover, and shake until the outside of the shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled shot glasses to serve. 6 fluid ounces vodka 3 fluid ounces lime juice 3 fluid ounces triple sec Make this crowd-pleasing basic kamikaze shooter recipe with vodka, lime, and triple sec, when you are entertaining a group!

title: Traditional Italian Limoncello
text: Zest lemons, making sure to get the outermost part of the skin and avoid the white pith. Place lemon zest in a glass bowl and cover with alcohol. Cover and let infuse at room temperature until yellowish in color, about 7 days. Bring water and sugar to the boil in a saucepan, stirring until sugar dissolves. Remove syrup from heat and let cool, about 10 minutes. Pour alcohol into the syrup through a fine-mesh strainer; discard lemon zest. Stir well. Pour limoncello into thick, freezer-safe glass bottles. Store in the freezer for at least 2 weeks before serving. 10 lemons 1 quart 95% alcohol (190 proof) 6 cups water 4 cups white sugar The zest of 10 lemons is steeped in 190-proof alcohol for 1 week then mixed with simple syrup to make this traditional Italian limoncello.

title: The Brunch Box
text: Mix amaro and grapefruit juice together in a chilled Collins glass; top with beer. 1 fluid ounce Montenegro amaro liqueur 1 fluid ounce freshly squeezed grapefruit juice 5 fluid ounces lager beer, chilled Amaro is mixed with grapefruit juice and beer in this Italian-inspired beer cocktail with a refreshing finish. Serve as a digestif.

title: Tart Lemon Drop Jelly Shots
text: Heat water, lemon wedges, and white sugar in a large saucepan over medium heat. Simmer until sugar is dissolved, mashing lemons often to release juice and oils. Cook and stir lemon mixture for 5 minutes more, then remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Strain lemon pieces from saucepan. Sprinkle gelatin into saucepan. Heat syrup and gelatin mixture over low heat until gelatin dissolves, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 15 minutes. Pour lemon vodka into gelatin mixture and stir well. Pour mixture into a 9x13-inch baking pan; refrigerate until set, at least 6 hours. Run a sharp knife under hot water; cut gelatin into cubes with knife and sprinkle cubes with turbinado sugar before serving. 4 cups water 8 large lemons, cut into 8 wedges each 3.5 cups white sugar 8 (.25 ounce) packages unflavored gelatin 4 cups lemon vodka 1 tablespoon turbinado sugar These tart gelatin shooters are made with a sweet, fresh lemon syrup and lemon-flavored vodka for a tasty 21-and-over treat.

title: Buttery Nipple Gourmet Pudding Shots
text: Stir milk, schnapps, Irish cream liqueur, vodka, and coffee-flavored liqueur together in a pitcher. Add pudding mix and blend thoroughly. Pour mixture into disposable shot cups and refrigerate until chilled, at least 30 minutes. 1.75 cups cold milk 2 fluid ounces butterscotch schnapps 2 fluid ounces Irish cream liqueur (such as Bailey's®) 1 fluid ounce vodka 1 fluid ounce coffee-flavored liqueur (such as Kahlua®) 1 (3.4 ounce) package instant butterscotch pudding mix Butterscotch pudding shots are all grown up, thanks to these gourmet buttery nipple pudding shots that taste like butterscotch candies.

title: Sugar Cookie Martini
text: Rim martini glass with icing and sprinkles; set aside. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice; pour in rum cream, vodka, and amaretto. Cover and shake until the outside of shaker has frosted. Strain into a chilled glass. Vanilla icing, for rim Sprinkles, for rim 1 cup ice cubes 3 fluid ounces rum cream liqueur (such as RumChata®) 1.5 fluid ounce vanilla vodka 0.25 fluid ounce amaretto This sugar cookie martini is like your favorite holiday sugar cookie in a cocktail, with just the cookie flavor you are hoping for. Not only is it festive, it's easy, too, with just a few ingredients.

title: Viryta (Lithuanian Honey Liqueur)
text: Peel orange and lemon in a circular motion in a large strip. Place peels in a warm, dry area to dry for 24 hours. Stir honey, 1 cup water, sugar, caraway seeds, cloves, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and ground nutmeg together in a large pot; bring to a rolling boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 45 minutes. Add dried orange and lemon peels to honey mixture; continue to simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat; discard fruit peels. Stir grain alcohol and remaining 2 1/2 cups water into honey mixture. Transfer mixture to a glass container and tightly cover with a lid. Place in a cool location out of direct sunlight and let set, gently swirling container every few days, for 1 week. Strain mixture through double-layered cheesecloth to remove sediment. Pour liqueur into bottles or decanters and seal. 1 lemon 1 orange 1 pound honey 3.5 cups bottled water 3 cups white sugar 3 tablespoons caraway seeds 25 whole cloves 1 tablespoon vanilla extract 4 teaspoons ground cinnamon 2 teaspoons ground nutmeg 2 pints 190 proof grain alcohol A Lithuanian honey liqueur, Viryta recipes are handed down from generation to generation and are shrouded in secrecy.

title: Sangria by the Pros
text: Slice orange, lemon, and lime into thin rounds. Place the sliced citrus in a pitcher with apples, cherries, and pineapple. Pour in brandy and refrigerate for 2 hours or more. Chill the bottle of red wine, lemon-lime soda, and orange juice at the same time. Gently crush the fruits with a spoon, then stir in red wine, lemon-lime soda, and orange juice. Add additional brandy or orange juice to taste. 1 orange 1 lemon 1 lime 1 medium all purpose apples, pared, cored and sliced 1 cup pitted cherries 1 cup fresh pineapple chunks 0.75 cup brandy 1 (750 milliliter) bottle dry red wine 1 (12 ounce) can lemon-lime soda to taste 1 cup orange juice to taste Make sangria like a professional with brandy, red wine, soda, juice, and lots of fruit. This recipe is from a bartender with 20 years of experience.

title: Coffee Liqueur III
text: Put white sugar, water, instant coffee, and vanilla extract in a 2 quart saucepan and bring to a boil. Simmer 5 minutes. Put coffee mixture in fridge to cool. When cool, skim off scum and add vodka, stir and pour into bottles. 1.5 cups white sugar 1 cup water 2 tablespoons instant coffee powder 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 20 fluid ounces vodka This coffee liqueur will warm you and yours next to a fire during the winter season.

title: Mango Lemonade
text: Combine sugar and water in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil and stir until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Mango Lemonade Combine mango and 1 cup water in a food processor until smooth. Pour mango through a strainer into a pitcher. Stir in lemon juice and simple syrup. Mix well. Add ice to the pitcher and serve. 1 cup sugar 1 cup water 2 cups chopped mango 1 cup water 1 cup lemon juice 2 cups ice Mango, simple syrup, and lemon juice is all you need for this delicious mango lemonade.

title: French Press Cold Brew
text: Pour ground coffee into a French press container and add water. Place plunger lid on top and press the plunger down 1 to 2 inches to make sure all coffee grounds are fully submerged; do not press all the way down. Let coffee steep at room temperature for 16 to 18 hours. Strain coffee through a coffee filter in a small strainer. Transfer to an airtight bottle or jar and keep in the refrigerator for up to a week. 4 ounces coarsely ground coffee beans 2 cups filtered water, at room temperature Perfect French press cold brew with a coffee-to-water ratio that is just right. Learn how to make cold brew coffee at home with this easy recipe.

title: Blueberry Banana Milkshake
text: Place vanilla ice cream and milk in a blender; blend until smooth. Add blueberries, banana, sugar, and vanilla extract; blend until evenly mixed. 2 cups vanilla ice cream 1 cup milk 1.5 cups blueberries 1 banana 0.25 cup white sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract This banana blueberry milkshake recipe is easy to prepare and will have your whole family asking for more.

title: Hawaiian Punch Slush for Adults
text: In a plastic container combine cream of coconut, lemonade concentrate, pineapple juice and vodka. Mix well and store overnight in the freezer. To serve, place 2 scoops in a glass, then fill the glass with lemon-lime soda. 2 (14 ounce) cans cream of coconut 3 (6 ounce) cans frozen lemonade concentrate 1 (46 fluid ounce) can unsweetened pineapple juice 1 (750 milliliter) bottle vodka 2 liters lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage Cream of coconut blended with lemonade, pineapple juice and vodka - frozen and served with citrus soda.

title: Juli's Easy Freezer Slushies
text: Puree cherries, peaches, vodka, brown sugar, water, lime juice, and amaretto in a blender. Divide among 4 (1-quart) resealable bags. Label and freeze at least 8 hours. To serve, massage bags to soften and add 1/2 cup lemon-lime soda to each bag. 2 cups frozen pitted cherries 2 cups chopped peaches 0.75 cup vodka 3 tablespoons brown sugar 3 tablespoons water 3 tablespoons lime juice 2 tablespoons amaretto liqueur 2 cups lemon-lime flavored soda By using a simple formula you can create these summer-ready cherry-peach slushies in no time--or use any fruit and additions you like!

title: Warm Spiced Wine
text: Combine merlot, sugar, orange peels, lemon peels, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and nutmeg in a saucepan over medium heat; simmer until sugar is dissolved and flavors have blended, 10 to 15 minutes. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle merlot wine 3 tablespoons white sugar 4 (3 inch) orange peel strips 4 (3 inch) lemon peel strips 2 cinnamon sticks 2 whole cloves 1 whole nutmeg Warm your holiday dinner guests with nicely spiced wine served in your favorite holiday mugs.

title: Refreshing Summer Rhubarb Slushy
text: Combine rhubarb, 1/4 cup water, and salt in a food processor or blender; blend until rhubarb is finely chopped. Place a cheesecloth onto a jug and pour the blended rhubarb onto it. Tie the cheesecloth and squeeze all the juice out of the rhubarb. Discard the pulp. Pour maple syrup into the jug and mix well until all the maple syrup has dissolved. Squeeze limes into the jug and mix well. Add ice cold water and mix everything together with a large wooden spoon. Taste and adjust sweetness if necessary. Refrigerate rhubarb limeade in the refrigerator until ready to use. To make slushies: For each serving, place 3/4 cup of rhubarb limeade into the blender with about 1 cup ice; blend until desired consistency. 2 cups chopped rhubarb 0.5 cup water, divided 1 pinch salt 3 medium limes, halved 0.5 cup maple syrup, or more to taste 5 cups ice cold water, or as needed ice as needed This naturally sweetened summer rhubarb slushy is so refreshing that it will become your go-to drink every summer. Good for kids as-is or add a shot of alcohol for adults.

title: St. Patrick's Day Jell-O Shots
text: Place shot glasses in a mini muffin tin at an angle. Pour lime gelatin mix into a bowl. Add 1/2 cup boiling water and stir until dissolved. Add Irish whiskey and stir until well incorporated. Pour mixture carefully into each shot glass, filling to near the top of the slanted glasses. Refrigerate until set, about 4 hours. Pour unflavored gelatin into a bowl. Add 1/2 cup boiling water and stir until dissolved. Let rest 3 to 5 minutes. Add strawberry cream liqueur and stir until well incorporated. Remove glasses from muffin tin and place upright. Top with strawberry mixture. Return glasses to the refrigerator and chill until set, about 4 hours more. 0.5 (3 ounce) package lime-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) 0.5 cup boiling water 0.5 cup Irish whiskey (such as Jameson®) 1 (1 ounce) package unflavored gelatin (such as Knox®) 0.5 cup boiling water 0.5 cup strawberry cream liqueur (such as Baileys®) A fun and tasty way of keeping your Jell-O shots Irish. Just layer Jameson Irish whiskey and Baileys Strawberries & Cream Liqueur in your shot glasses.

title: Eggnog Latte
text: Pour milk and eggnog into a steaming pitcher and heat to between 145 degrees F to 165 degrees F (65 to 70 degrees C) using the steaming wand. Brew a shot of espresso; pour into a mug. Pour steamed milk and eggnog into the mug, using a spoon to hold back the foam. Spoon foam over the top. Sprinkle nutmeg on top of foam. 0.33333334326744 cup 2% milk 0.66666668653488 cup eggnog 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger brewed espresso 1 pinch ground nutmeg This eggnog latte is easy to make with espresso, eggnog, milk, and a pinch of nutmeg for a creamy and delicious coffee drink over the holidays.

title: Quick Hot Chocolate
text: Heat water and chocolate in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth, about 5 minutes. Stir sugar and salt into chocolate mixture. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved and flavors combine, about 4 minutes. Pour milk into chocolate mixture and cook until hot. Beat with a whisk until foamy or stir until smooth. 1.5 cups water 3 ounces unsweetened baking chocolate 0.33333334326744 cup white sugar 1 pinch salt 4.5 cups milk Enjoy this rich, creamy hot chocolate topped with marshmallows and chocolate and caramel syrup.

title: Halloween Jell-O Shots
text: Make the yellow layer: Pour boiling water into a small bowl. Add lemon gelatin mix and stir until dissolved. Pour vodka into a 2-cup liquid measure; add enough ice to make 1 1/4 cups. Pour into lemon gelatin mixture and stir until slightly thickened; remove any unmelted ice. Pour mixture into 16 tall shot glasses, filling each 1/3 full. Refrigerate until lemon gelatin is set, at least 1 1/2 hours. When lemon gelatin is set, make the orange layer: Pour boiling water into a small bowl. Add orange gelatin mix and stir until dissolved. Pour vodka into a 2-cup liquid measure; add enough ice to make 1 1/4 cups. Pour into orange gelatin mixture and stir until slightly thickened; remove any unmelted ice. Pour into shot glasses over lemon gelatin. Refrigerate until orange gelatin is set, at least 1 1/2 hours. When orange gelatin is set, make the white layer: Stir warm water and unflavored gelatin together in a bowl until gelatin is dissolved. Stir in condensed milk and rum. Pour into shot glasses over orange gelatin. Refrigerate until set, at least 30 minutes. 0.75 cup boiling water 1 (3 ounce) package lemon-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) 1 cup vodka 3 ice cubes, or as needed 0.75 cup boiling water 1 (3 ounce) package orange-flavored gelatin mix (such as Jell-O®) 3 ice cubes, or as needed 1 cup vodka 2 tablespoons warm water 1 (.25 ounce) envelope unflavored gelatin 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 0.5 cup light rum Delicious Halloween jello shots that look like candy corn, made with layers of orange and lemon vodka gelatin topped with rum-infused condensed milk.

title: Grenade Launcher
text: In a shot glass, combine peach schnapps and rum. Drain entire contents into your mouth, and swallow. 0.75 fluid ounce peach schnapps 0.5 fluid ounce 151 proof rum Peach schnapps, and 151 rum shot directly into your throat. To help put that extra BANG into your night!

title: Game Day Sangria
text: Combine lemon juice, orange juice, and sugar in a pitcher; stir until sugar has dissolved completely. Add red wine, club soda, and brandy to the pitcher. Serve in glasses with ice. 2 cups lemon juice 2 cups orange juice 2 cups white sugar 4 cups red wine 4 cups club soda 2 cups brandy ice cubes, for serving This sangria recipe can be made quickly with lemon and orange juices, sugar, brandy, red wine, and club soda.

title: Eggless Vanilla Eggnog
text: In a medium bowl combine 2 cups milk and pudding mixture; stir well until thickened. To the pudding add remaining 2 cups milk and egg substitute; mix well. Stir in vanilla extract, salt and nutmeg until well blended and coats a spoon. Refrigerate overnight. 4 cups skim milk, divided 1 (1 ounce) package instant sugar-free vanilla pudding mix 1 cup egg substitute 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 0.25 teaspoon salt 0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg Skim milk, instant pudding mix, egg substitute, vanilla extract and nutmeg create this all-time favorite holiday drink It's best when refrigerated overnight.

title: Sangria (Red)
text: Stir rum and sugar together in a large pitcher to dissolve the sugar; add apple slices, orange slices, lemon slices, and lime slices. Crush fruit slightly against the bottom of the pitcher to squeeze some juice into the rum mixture. Pour wine and orange juice into the pitcher; stir. Add lemon-lime soda and stir just before serving. 0.75 cup rum 0.33333334326744 cup white sugar 1 green apple, cored and sliced 1 orange, sliced 1 lemon, sliced 1 lime, sliced 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine 1 cup orange juice 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage Wine, orange juice, and rum are the base of this fruit-soaked Spanish wine punch, perfect for refreshing summertime outdoor drinking.

title: Peanut Butter Strawberry Smoothie
text: Blend strawberries, yogurt, milk, peanut butter, and brown sugar together in a blender for 2 minutes; let rest for 10 seconds. Blend until smooth, another 2 minutes. 8 strawberries, sliced 0.5 cup plain yogurt 0.25 cup milk 2 tablespoons smooth peanut butter 1 teaspoon brown sugar This simple smoothie pairs strawberries and peanut butter with yogurt and milk.

title: Chef John's Watermelon Agua Fresca
text: Scoop flesh from watermelon half and transfer to a blender with 2 cups cold water. Place a folded towel on the blender lid and blend until liquefied, about 1 minute. Strain through a fine mesh strainer into a large bowl to remove fibers. Discard fibers left in the strainer. Skim and discard excess foam from the juice if desired. Place sugar and 1/2 cup water into a saucepan over medium heat; stir until water is hot and sugar has dissolved. Turn off the heat and let simple syrup cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes. Stir simple syrup into watermelon juice to taste. Pour drink into a 2-quart pitcher and refrigerate until cold, at least 30 minutes. To serve, fill tall glasses with ice cubes and pour agua fresca drink over ice. Serve with straws. 0.5 seedless watermelon 2 cups cold water 0.5 cup white sugar, or to taste 0.5 cup water ice, as needed Chef John's watermelon agua fresca is refreshing, revitalizing, and restorative on a hot and humid summer day. It's one of life's drinkable pleasures!

title: Negroni Sbagliato for a Crowd
text: Combine Campari and vermouth in a pitcher. Chill for at least 1 hour and up to 24 hours. Just before serving, add prosecco to the pitcher. Pour into coupe glasses and garnish each cocktail with an orange twist. 11 /2 cups Campari 11/2 cups sweet vermouth 1 (750-ml) bottle prosecco or other sparkling wine, chilled 12 orange twists A classic Negroni is a triad of equal parts gin, Campari, and sweet vermouth. The sbagliato—Italian for “mistaken”—subs prosecco for the gin for a balanced, pleasantly bitter spritzer.

title: Rosé Sangria
text: Cut strawberries in half and watermelon into chunks, or use a melon baller. Combine strawberries, watermelon, and raspberries in a large bowl. Pour rosé, vermouth, and honey into a large pitcher and stir until honey dissolves. Add 1/2 of the fruit and basil. Place pitcher and remaining fruit in a refrigerator for at least 6 hours. Scoop a large spoonful of cold fruit into the bottom of glasses; add sangria and sparkling cucumber water to taste. 1 pound fresh strawberries 1 pound seedless watermelon 1 (12 ounce) package fresh raspberries 2 (750 milliliter) bottles rosé wine 0.75 cup white vermouth 0.25 cup honey 1 sprig fresh basil leaves 3 (12 fluid ounce) cans chilled cucumber-flavored sparkling water, or to taste Fresh berries and watermelon give a summer-inspired twist to this rosé sangria that's made ahead and chilled for an easy party staple.

title: Ube Milkshake
text: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer. Bring water to a boil. Add ube, cover, and steam until tender, about 20 minutes. Cool until easily handled, then cut into cubes. Combine 1/4 cup cubed ube, milk, and vanilla ice cream in a blender; blend until smooth. 0.5 ube (purple yam), peeled 0.5 cup milk 1 scoop vanilla ice cream Make yourself a tasty purple milkshake with the addition of ube, aka purple yam, which gives this ube drink a great flavor and fun color.

title: Coffee Milkshake
text: Pour cooled espresso shot and milk into a high-powered blender, such as a Vitamix. Add the malted milk powder and ice cream. Secure lid; blend on High until smooth, about 45 seconds. Drizzle syrup on the inside of a glass. Pour milkshake into glass. Add whipped topping. 1 shot espresso, cooled 4 ounces milk 3 tablespoon  malted milk powder 1 3/4 cup coffee flavored ice cream 1 tablespoon Torani dark chocolate syrup (optional) 2 tablespoons whipped cream (optional) Here's the recipe for the ultimate malted milkshake—coffee, malt powder, and chocolate are a winning combination.

title: Refreshing Watermelon Lemonade Slush
text: Place the watermelon pieces onto a plastic-wrapped baking sheet, and freeze until solid, about 45 minutes. Place the frozen watermelon, water, and strawberry lemonade drink mix in a blender; blend until slushy. 1 cup cubed seeded watermelon 1.25 cups water 3 tablespoons sweetened strawberry lemonade drink mix This simple and refreshing watermelon slushy drink is so easy, a kid can make it. Just blend frozen watermelon, water, and lemonade drink mix, and serve.

title: Homemade Limoncello
text: Zest lemons, and place zest into a large glass bottle or jar. Pour vodka into the bottle. Cover loosely and let infuse for 1 week at room temperature. After 1 week, combine sugar and water in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil; do not stir. Boil for 15 minutes, then remove from the heat and allow syrup to cool to room temperature. Stir vodka mixture into the syrup. Strain into glass bottles, then seal each bottle with a cork. Let age at room temperature for 2 weeks. Store bottled limoncello in the freezer until icy cold. Serve in chilled vodka glasses or shot glasses. 10 lemons 1 liter vodka 3 cups white sugar 4 cups water Limoncello is an Italian lemon-flavored liqueur that's easy to make at home by steeping lemon zest in vodka with simple syrup for a refreshing drink!

title: Homestyle Hot Cocoa
text: Whisk together sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan; stir in boiling water. Whisk until sugar is dissolved. Bring cocoa mixture to a simmer over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, about 2 minutes; stir milk and 1/2 cup half-and-half into water mixture. Cook and stir just until hot, about 2 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat; stir in remaining half-and-half and vanilla extract. Divide cocoa into mugs, top with marshmallows, and serve. 0.5 cup white sugar 0.33333334326744 cup unsweetened cocoa powder 0.125 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 pinch salt 0.33333334326744 cup boiling water 3 cups milk 1 cup half-and-half, divided 0.75 teaspoon vanilla extract 8 large marshmallows It's nice to know how to make a creamy homestyle hot chocolate from scratch, a delicious and comforting drink after outdoor activities in cold weather.

title: Avocado Smoothie
text: Place milk, avocado, yogurt, and honey into a blender; add ice cubes and blend until smooth. 1 cup milk 1 ripe avocado, halved and pitted 0.5 cup vanilla yogurt 3 tablespoons honey 8 ice cubes This avocado smoothie is rich and creamy thanks to a combination of vanilla yogurt, avocado, and honey. Perfect for a refreshing on-the-go breakfast.

title: Watermelon Agua Fresca
text: Purée watermelon and water in a blender until smooth. Add sugar to taste. Cut lime slices in half. Place a half lime slice into each of 8 glasses along with 3 mint leaves. Crush with a cocktail muddler, then fill each glass with 1 cup ice. Pour in watermelon agua fresca, and stir before serving. 4 cups cubed seeded watermelon 0.5 cup water 0.5 cup white sugar, or to taste 4 slices lime 24 fresh mint leaves 8 cups ice, or as needed This watermelon agua fresca is a drink served throughout Mexico. It is refreshing and tasty, made with watermelon, lime, and mint. Perfect for summer.

title: Galliano
text: Place the cloves and ginger in a small jar and add enough vodka to cover. Seal and soak for 3 days. NO MORE! Strain the liquid, discarding the solids. Measure the sugar into a gallon container. Add the peppermint, vanilla and anise extracts as well as the food coloring. Pour in the vodka, the strained vodka and yellow food coloring. Cover tightly and shake until the sugar dissolves. Age for one week MINIMUM. 8 whole cloves 1 teaspoon chopped crystallized ginger 4 cups white sugar 12 drops peppermint extract 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 1 teaspoon anise extract 15 drops yellow food coloring 2 (750 milliliter) bottles vodka An old favorite, this recipe is based on vodka and flavored with anise, cloves, peppermint and ginger.

title: Bisschopswijn
text: In a large saucepan on medium-low heat, combine wine, sugar, and cinnamon. Cut the orange in half, push the cloves into the outside of the orange halves, and place them into the wine. Heat slowly on low heat for about 30 minutes or until steaming; do not let it boil. Heat your glasses in warm water before serving. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle red wine 0.5 cup white sugar 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 orange 8 whole cloves A hot spiced wine that is popular during the winter holidays.

title: Coffee Syrup
text: Combine sugar, water, and ground coffee in a pot over medium heat. Cook, stirring often, until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to a rolling boil, about 10 minutes. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool, about 30 minutes. Place a fine sieve on top of a lidded container and pour syrup through to strain out any coffee grinds if desired. Cover with lid and store in the refrigerator. 1 cup white sugar 1 cup water 3 tablespoons ground coffee This coffee syrup is simple to make and so versatile---pour it over your pancakes, add it into a glass of milk or a cocktail, or mix it into your favorite baked goods recipe.

title: Homemade Brown Sugar Bubble Tea
text: Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a small saucepan. Add tapioca pearls and stir gently until they begin floating to the top. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until softened and dark, about 25 minutes. Remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, bring 2 cups water to a boil. Remove from heat and add tea leaves. Let steep for 15 minutes. Strain out tea leaves and refrigerate tea. Drain pearls. Bring 1/4 cup water to a boil in the empty saucepan. Stir in brown sugar until dissolved. Immerse pearls in syrup and let sit until room temperature, about 15 minutes Divide pearls and desired amount of syrup between 2 tall glasses. Pour in tea. Add ice, milk, and sweetened condensed milk to both glasses. Stir before drinking. 4.25 cups water, divided 0.25 cup white tapioca pearls (boba) 2 tablespoons black tea leaves 0.25 cup brown sugar 1 cup ice cubes 0.25 cup milk 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk, or to taste Cook up dried tapioca pearls (boba) to make this homemade black sugar bubble milk tea sweetened with brown sugar syrup.

title: Beer Floats
text: Version 1: Pour stout into a British pint glass and scoop coffee ice cream on top. Garnish with a dusting of cocoa powder. Version 2: Pour raspberry beer into a pint glass; top with vanilla ice cream. Add a straw to each float and serve with spoons alongside. 1 cup chocolate stout beer 1 scoop coffee ice cream 1 pinch unsweetened cocoa powder 1 cup Belgian-style raspberry sour beer 1 scoop vanilla ice cream Beer floats are the next best drink you've never had. Play around with Chef John's two winning combos: stout with coffee ice cream and raspberry sour with vanilla.

title: Hop, Skip, and Go Naked
text: In a gallon container, combine beer, lemonade concentrate and whiskey. Stir and serve over ice. 6 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles beer 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate 1 pint whiskey Lemonade made hard with the addition of beer and whiskey.

title: Mint Tea Punch
text: Place the tea bags and mint sprigs into a large pitcher. Pour boiling water over them, and allow to steep for about 8 minutes. Remove and discard the tea bags and mint leaves, squeezing out excess liquid. Stir in sugar until dissolved, then stir in the orange juice and lemon juice. Pour in the cold water. Serve over ice cubes, garnished with orange or lemon slices. 3 cups boiling water 12 sprigs fresh mint 4 tea bags 1 cup white sugar 1 cup orange juice 0.25 cup lemon juice 5 cups cold water 3 orange slices for garnish 3 lemon slices for garnish Tea, mint, sugar, orange and lemon juices make this a quick and easy, refreshingly delicious drink on a hot summer's day, given to me by a true Southern lady. Goes great with Cajun or spicy foods too. Every time I serve this someone asks me for the recipe!

title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Iced Coffee
text: Pour coffee into an ice cube tray; freeze until coffee ice cubes form, 1 to 2 hours. Combine coffee ice cubes, soy milk, chocolate syrup, peanut butter, vanilla extract, and no-calorie sweetener in a blender. Cover and blend until frothy. 1 cup brewed coffee 0.5 cup soy milk 2 tablespoons chocolate syrup 1 tablespoon peanut butter 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 packet granular no-calorie sucralose sweetener (such as Splenda®) Get ready for a spring in your step with this creamy peanut butter coffee made with soy milk, chocolate syrup, and homemade coffee ice cubes.

title: Orange Fizz
text: Fill a glass with ice cubes. Pour in the orange juice, tonic water and lemon juice. Stir and serve. ice cubes 1 cup orange juice 0.33333334326744 cup tonic water 1 teaspoon lemon juice Make boring orange juice tangy and fizzy with this delicious blend!

title: White Hot Chocolate with Marshmallows
text: Combine 1/2 cup milk, almond bark, sugar, 2 marshmallows, and vanilla extract in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring often, until boiling. Reduce heat; add remaining 3 1/2 cups milk and stir until heated through, about 5 minutes. Add remaining 4 marshmallows. Divide hot chocolate among four 6-ounce mugs, placing 1 marshmallow in each. Garnish with red and green sprinkles. 4 cups 2% milk, divided 2 ounces white almond bark 0.25 cup white sugar 6 large marshmallows, divided 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 tablespoon red and green sprinkles, or to taste This creamy, sweet white hot chocolate with marshmallows, vanilla, and sprinkles will keep you nice and warm during those cold winter days.

title: Cran-Dandy Cooler
text: In a gallon pitcher combine cranberry juice, pineapple juice, orange juice, cherry juice and lemon juice. Just before serving, slowly add ginger ale; stir to blend. Serve over ice in cups or glasses. Garnish with cherry and orange slices. 2 cups cranberry juice 1 cup pineapple juice 1 cup orange juice 1 (4 ounce) jar maraschino cherries 2 tablespoons lemon juice 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle ginger ale 1 orange, sliced in rounds A carbonated cranberry and pineapple refreshing cooler.

title: Mint Julep
text: Make the simple syrup ahead of when you plan to serve: Bring water, sugar, and chopped mint to a boil over high heat in a small saucepan. Cook, stirring occasionally, until sugar is completely dissolved, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool . Pour syrup through a strainer to remove mint leaves. To make the mint juleps: Fill eight glasses with crushed ice; pour 4 ounces bourbon and 1/4 cup mint syrup into each cup. (Add extra syrup for anyone with a sweet tooth.) Top each drink with a mint sprig. 2 cups water 2 cups white sugar 0.5 cup roughly chopped fresh mint leaves 8 cups crushed ice, or as needed 32 fluid ounces Kentucky bourbon 8 sprigs fresh mint for garnish A mint julep is made with Kentucky bourbon, sweetened with simple syrup, and served chilled with fresh mint for a classic and refreshing cocktail.

title: Turmeric Coffee Latte
text: Combine coconut milk, vanilla extract, stevia sweetener, turmeric, ginger, and cinnamon in a saucepan. Heat over medium heat until warm, about 5 minutes. Remove the saucepan from heat. Blend until frothy using an immersion blender. Pour espresso into a serving mug. Top off with frothed milk mixture. 1 cup coconut milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 packets stevia sweetener (such as Truvia®) 0.5 teaspoon ground turmeric 0.25 teaspoon ground ginger 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 fluid ounce brewed espresso Coconut milk is spiced with turmeric and ginger, frothed, and layered over espresso to create a dairy-free latte that will warm you up!

title: Vintage Lemonade
text: Peel the rinds from the 5 lemons and cut them into 1/2 inch slices. Set the lemons aside. Place the rinds in a bowl and sprinkle the sugar over them. Let this stand for about one hour, so that the sugar begins to soak up the oils from the lemons. Bring water to a boil in a covered saucepan and then pour the hot water over the sugared lemon rinds. Allow this mixture to cool for 20 minutes and then remove the rinds. Squeeze the lemons into another bowl. Pour the juice through a strainer into the sugar mixture. Stir well, pour into pitcher and pop it in the fridge! Serve with ice cubes. 5 lemons 1.25 cups white sugar 1.25 quarts water Lemons, sugar, and water--in a process that has been handed down since the 19th century. A true classic of a lemonade recipe.

title: Maple Bacon Milkshake
text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, covering the edges completely. Place a baking rack on top of the foil and spray the rack with cooking spray. Place 1/2 of the bacon slices onto the prepared rack. Using a pastry brush, coat one side of the slices with about 1 tablespoon maple syrup. Take the ends of each strip and twist in opposite directions until the syrup-glazed side is twisted into the interior and the bacon is coiled tight. Place toothpicks in each end of the bacon strips to hold in place. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and brush another 1 tablespoon maple syrup over the slices. Continue baking until cooked through and crispy, about 5 more minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool. Cook remaining bacon in a skillet over medium heat, flipping occasionally, until crispy, about 5 minutes. Transfer bacon slices from the skillet to a saucepan, then pour in about 1 tablespoon bacon grease. Add remaining 6 tablespoons maple syrup to the saucepan. Cook and stir over medium heat until flavors have combined, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from the heat and cool, allowing the bacon flavor to infuse into the syrup, about 10 minutes. Transfer bacon from the skillet to a cutting board; chop into bits. Combine bacon-infused maple syrup and milk in a blender; blend on low speed until combined. Add ice cream and blend on medium until mixed but still thick. Add most of the bacon bits and stir until incorporated into the milkshake. Pour milkshake into four glasses and top each with 1 tablespoon whipped cream. Sprinkle remaining bacon bits over whipped cream and garnish each with a bacon twist. cooking spray 8 slices bacon, divided 0.5 cup pure maple syrup, divided 1 cup milk 4 cups French vanilla ice cream 0.5 cup whipped cream, or to taste This maple and bacon milkshake is a deliciously rich breakfast treat to have when you feel you deserve a little something special to start your day.

title: Very Popular Bubble Tea
text: In a small saucepan, bring 2 cups water to a boil. Stir in 1 teaspoon sugar until it dissolves. Toss in the pearl tapioca. Cook for about 20 minutes. Rinse, drain, and refrigerate until chilled. Pour tea, milk, and 4 teaspoons sugar into a cocktail shaker. Stir until the sugar has dissolved and the milk is well mixed in. Add the ice cubes, and shake so the whole drink can get cold. Pour into a glass, and add tapioca. 1 teaspoon white sugar 0.33333334326744 cup pearl tapioca 1 cup brewed black tea 2 tablespoons milk 4 teaspoons white sugar 1 cup ice cubes Bubble tea is very popular, especially to Asians, but now, more and more people from different backgrounds like the taste of it. I'm no expert at this, but I do know how to make it. It's simple but some of the ingredients may be a little tough to find. Just be patient and look for them in Chinese grocery stores. It is worth the trouble!

title: Apple, Strawberry, and Banana Smoothie
text: Place almond milk, apple, strawberries, banana, and yogurt in a blender, being sure the milk goes in first. Process until smooth, occasionally scraping down the sides of the blender with a rubber spatula, if necessary. Pour into serving glasses and serve immediately. 3/4 cup vanilla almond milk 1 apple - peeled, cored, and cubed 1 cup halved frozen strawberries 1 frozen banana, peeled and cubed 1/4 cup vanilla Greek yogurt (such as Cabot® 2%) Start your day off right with a quick and nutritious apple smoothie, ready in minutes. This breakfast smoothie has a nice combination of fruit and is slightly sweet, creamy, and satisfying.

title: Watermelon and Bell Pepper Slush
text: Place the watermelon, red bell pepper, and ice in a blender, and blend until the ice is crushed and the drink is slushy. Pour into glasses, and garnish with fresh mint leaves. Can be stored in refrigerator up to 2 days. 3 cups cubed seeded watermelon 0.5 red bell pepper, seeded and coarsely chopped 3 cups ice 1 sprig fresh mint This refreshing slushy drink has an unexpected but delicious flavor combination of watermelon with sweet red pepper.

title: Vanilla Coffee Creamer
text: Combine half-and-half, sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla extract together in a container with a lid; cover container and shake vigorously until creamer is smooth. 2 cups half-and-half 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Homemade vanilla coffee creamer can be made easily with 3 simple ingredients for a tasty addition to your morning coffee.

title: White Sangria with Berries
text: Mix wine, brandy, and schnapps together in a large pitcher. Slice strawberries, raspberries, and peaches into medium chunks. Add to the wine mixture. Chill for a minimum of 3 to 4 hours. Pour in seltzer just prior to serving. Serve over ice with fruit added from the pitcher. 1 (750 milliliter) bottle Spanish white wine 0.33333334326744 cup brandy 0.25 cup berry-flavored schnapps 1 pint fresh strawberries 1 pint fresh raspberries 2 fresh peaches 0.5 cup raspberry-flavored seltzer ice as needed This white sangria made with berries and fresh peaches is an easy, summer-ready drink for any party or gathering.

title: Starbucks Cotton Candy Frappuccino
text: Blend ice, milk, vanilla powder, and raspberry syrup in a blender until ice is crushed. 1.5 cups ice 0.5 cup milk 0.25 cup vanilla bean powder 0.75 tablespoon raspberry syrup This blended mixture of ice, milk, vanilla bean powder, and raspberry syrup is intended to mimic a 'Starbucks Secret Menu' item.

title: Monica's Baptist Sangria
text: Pour the lemon-lime soda into a punch bowl, and stir in the instant iced tea mix. Float the orange and lemon slices in the punch, and add ice. Serve immediately. 1 (2 liter) bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage 3 tablespoons lemon iced tea mix 2 oranges, sliced into rounds 1 lemon, sliced into rounds 3 cups ice This fresh, sweet nonalcoholic drink is beautiful in a punch bowl and will have your guests coming back for more and more!

title: Holiday Cider
text: Stir apple cider, cranberry juice, amaretto, and cinnamon together in a large pot over medium-low heat to heat through and let flavors meld, about 10 minutes. 1 gallon apple cider 1 (64 fluid ounce) bottle cranberry juice cocktail 1 (750 milliliter) bottle amaretto liqueur 4 cinnamon sticks, or more to taste Warm, easy to make, and full of holiday flavor, this cider recipe is the perfect cocktail for Christmas gatherings.

title: Mulled White Wine
text: Combine white wine, apple juice, lemon zest, ginger, sugar, and cinnamon stick in a saucepan over medium-low heat and slowly heat, but do not boil. Keep hot on low heat without simmering for 1 hour to infuse the wine. Strain hot mulled wine through a small sieve into heatproof glasses. Add 1 tablespoon rum to each glass. 4 cups dry white wine 2.25 cups apple juice 1 lemon, zest cut off in a spiral 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root, sliced 0.25 cup white sugar 1 cinnamon stick 6 tablespoons rum Making mulled wine with white wine gives a smoother flavor and tastes great at Christmas. This recipe has a little rum added at the end for a bit of a kick!

title: Cocoa, Banana, and Peanut Butter Smoothie
text: Blend together milk, frozen banana, peanut butter, cocoa powder, and honey in a blender until smooth. 1 cup milk 0.5 chopped frozen banana, or more to taste 2 tablespoons peanut butter 2 teaspoons unsweetened cocoa powder 1 teaspoon honey This banana chocolate smoothie made with cocoa powder, honey, milk, and peanut butter is loaded with protein for a great post-workout drink.
